column6: Looks like they have a few locations so must have something about it. The shumai were my jam. The pork ribs also was solid but not my favorite. The cold carp fish dish wasn't my thing but I love to try authentic dishes. The reason you come here is the dumplings and the soup dumplings were delicious. The bread type pork dumplings were my favorite. I think they were pan-fried and lovely. This place is in the 4 star range and like I mentioned... come for the dumplings and enjoy!
Has the flavor of Shanghai dish but I was disappointed since the duck still has feather roots! Looks bad! And the eel dish has too much more onions 90% than eel 10%!
The food was good but the portions were tiny for the price. The food didn't look very appetizing but the flavor was good. I'd order again but would double my order of pork and string beans

The food here is DELICIOUS!!!! The food has always been fresh and tasty! However, it might take a little extra effort to make and changes and/confirm your order because of the food being so AUTHENTIC...it is a language barrier. The staff was sweet and patient. Although we could hear someone yelling in the kitchen every now & then.. All we were greeted with were smiles! Â enjoy the meal!

We were a party of 3 and it was super quiet on a Sunday. We ordered the Shanghai soup dumplings and the pan fried shanghai soup dumplings. I'm used to getting 6 or 8 in a portion so it was strange to me that it was only 4 for a portion. The pan fried soup dumplings were something I never tried before, so my group was excited to order it. The bottom was crispy, but the filling was unfortunately lukewarm at best and the dough was thicker than one would expect for Shanghai dumplings. The steamed soup dumplings were hot and flavorful, but again the dumpling exterior was more doughy and not the expected light and thin exterior so that threw me off.

Yesterday evening my husband and I decided to come here for dinner and drinks. We chose this place since we were in the area. We wanted to try a new restaurant that wasn't too busy. When we walked in, there were about 3 or 4 small groups dining. The other half of the restaurant was empty, and that's where we were asked to sit. One of the female employees immediately handed us our menus and served us water. The other female employee was taking table orders and chatting with customers. After about 5 minutes, we were ready to order. We waited and waited, and waited some more. We looked around, made eye contact with both employees, but no one ever came over. After a few minutes, the employee who had served us water approached our table only to refill our glasses and walk away. We decided to give the staff additional time so I went to the restroom in the meantime. When I came back, I learned that the server still had not come to our table. We had waited a total of 25 MINUTES before deciding to leave. In addition to service being is terrible, the restroom smelled very filthy. This lack of cleanliness was definitely the deal breaker. That's when we decided that we needed to leave. All of this was a definite sign that we were not meant to eat there. Having two customers wait that amount of time shows how inconsiderate and unfriendly the staff can be towards their customers. Don't come here. There are better places with better service in the area.
Not authentic Chinese. Food was so bland. The dumpling had raw meat. Overall wasn't what I expected at all. Don't understand the reviews here.

We made a reservation and they didn't honor it. Showed up on time and they gave out table away. 30 minutes later and still haven't sat down. I'll let you know if I ever get a table! Pray for me! Go to Chinatown for this instead, many more restaurants and they honor reservations and save tables

Wow at this price it's pretty good. Only downside is that chicken was kinda soggy. I'm not gonna call it diarrhea chicken like the other restaurant I went to cuz the flavor was just right. Added additional star cuz it had healthy balance of broccoli
Good food, tasty and affordable. Portions are generous. Not a fancy or trendy place, but clean and cozy. I would go back!

Recommended by a local when I asked for somewhere yummy to eat. We went at prime dinner time and was still able to get a seat no problem. The food took a little bit to get to us but it was delicious and my bf and I both agreed we would eat here again if we were in NY!
It took them forever to finish a takeout. Not to mention I preordered already.... I waited for more than 25 minutes to get my lunch. How on earth is this possible?
I ordered an take out on Jan 12, 2022. The service guy mistype my order, and refuse to do anything to fix it. Never come back again!
Really great little spot by Washington square park. Xiao long bao (both steamed and pan fried) are flavorful - more so than your standard. Noodles with pork were good too. Would definitely go back!

It might be the specific day, it might be just me, but the food here just isn't meeting the expectations of an established West Village Chinese restaurant. The sauce on the ribs were a little off, the soup dumplings were nothing special, the scallion pancakes were meh, and the noodle dishes weren't up to par.

We randomly stopped in here one Sunday afternoon after seeing a sign advertising their pork xiao long bao (pork soup dumplings), which is a treat I can rarely pass up. Of course we ordered a few sets of the dumplings along with the Shanghai salted meat with vegetable rice and the dry-fried green beans with pork. We later ordered the crab soup dumplings just because we could! Each dish was delicious. Next time I plan to try the other signature dishes. I have a feeling you can't go wrong ordering from here and this is your chance to get a taste of cuisine from the Jiangnan region of China (the menu mentions several cities in the region including Shanghai and Wuxi). They offer other more well-known dishes like kung pao chicken and orange beef, which I'm sure are very tasty, but I think before I went for those I'd like to try the Wuxi Pork Ribs and the West Lake Fish. The place had a relaxed, casual feel and seemed to welcome people there for any occasion. We saw a couple groups of four to six people and a few couples.

I don't recommend. Waited for 30 minutes for my take out order, they told me after 30 minutes they could not make it and I had to cancel through the ordering app. I asked if we could come back later to pick it up? No, they can't make it. When I asked why didn't you cancel it before, they said they can't do it on their app. So don't waste your time, they can't handle a 2 person order at peak time...

Cute little gem with simple but well executed eats. Cozy atmosphere and attentive staff. Easy to walk by and get and indoor or patio table. The spring noodle soup and ribs were standouts. The spring noodle soup had a delicious mushroomy broth and amazing noodles. The ribs had fall of the bone meat in delicious sauce. Would come back here in a heartbeat.

Ok despite spending an inordinate amount of time asking for the soup to not have bacon Â it arrives a very long time after( not the promised 15 minutes) Â replete with BACON. Â The shrimp cooked in their shell were so small that it was ludicrous to try to peel them Â  Â Topped this off with some of the worst peanut noodles in nyc. Â The dumplings were great but not enough to ever have me deal with this restaurant again
Bad service. The owner (lady) was so mean for no reason. Ordered to go and asked for chopsticks and she seemed so annoyed by that
Low price Taste very Chinese Very good China Â South food I will come AgainBeef Noodle Soup
Simple Chinese food. Good noodles, fast service, what's not to like? Would recommend others here.

Zero integrity as a business, canceled my order at the time it is supposed to be delivered and tell me they are closing the kitchen in one hour?? Seriously? You can't cancel an order when it is placed?????

Used a puls'd voucher and portions were tiny, looked smaller than the pictures on yelp reviews, and served on different plates than other tables were getting. Maybe they do something differently for dishes on puls'd vouchers?
Terrible service and a shithole. I wouldn't recommend to my worst enemy. The food was bad.

AMAZING FOOD!!!! There's something for everyone. The decoration is so chic and updated. You would not believe how affordable this place is. Beef noodle soup was my favorite and the soup has been cooking for hours. 10/10 would take my family here!
Best Asian food I've had in years! I had the general tso chicken, and their soup dumplings. Great service as well.

we missed this hidden jewel in the past. It brought memories of family gathering dishes especially for celebration of Chinese New Year back home. Shredded Bean curd with bacon and Dan jiao, wuxi xiaolong.... OMG, we just cannot believe what we found. We definitely will visit again next time. The whole environment is nice and cozy. I bet it would be great just go for afternoon tea. Message to owner:. Please don't change the menu. Â We loved it.

Tipsy Shanghai is the New York sibling of a restaurant in Shanghai that was started in 1905. So with that history you would expect amazing flavors and unique Shanghai dishes. Unfortunately, the food at Tipsy Shanghai can only be described as bland and some of their menu items are more American Chinese (shrimp with lobster sauce, sweet & sour chicken, etc) than truly Chinese. The restaurant itself is very nice and the service is good, but the food is simply bland. We were hoping for something special and left being disappointed.

A few friends have recommended this place to us, and we finally decided to order a delivery for dinner tonight. However it was actually a disappointment. The noodles taste ok but we waited one and half hour for the delivery(which is also annoying), so as you can imagine, all noodles stick together and became a soggy pancake. The ribs and zongzi are both very disappointing. Sour taste. Feels like they are spoiled. Our favorite is the sweet sticky rice. It has the right amount of sugar and well balanced with red bean paste. Everything with the sticky rice is just good, opposite of the other dishes unfortunately.

They do make authentic shanghainese dishes but it is going to be on the salty side so beware. I like some of their dishes such as marinated bean curd and tofu but others such as their XLB and beef noodle soup to be underwhelming.

After my first time here I can say the food was indeed quite delicious and that's alone did it for me. The service however was honestly really not that great and i like to think I'm a patient person who's worked in the industry. Upon arrival there was only one woman working the whole restaurant and other than my party of two was a table of 4, 2 and another 2. We were seated at 6:30 and didn't receive even our drinks until 7:48! We asked for two beers and two glasses of water and only got the beers, the food took over about to come out and it all come out at once, delivery orders were going out before the tables were taken care of and other tables were being served before us despite ordering after. I would come back for the food 100% I just have to make sure I don't have plans closely after dinner.
The food is not disappointing but the male manager is extremely unfriendly acting like someone owes him.
Great service and very nice staff. Lots of NYU students come here. Highlights of the meal were the xiaolongbao and the eggplant!

This place offers great and authentic food from Suhang area of China, which is quite unique among the Chinese restaurant in Manhattan, which is dominated by Szechuan food and Cantonese food. Most importantly, the taste and service are all good. I lived in this community, I always like to eat here.
Average food but terrible service. Staff was impolite towards our whole table. Expected better but won't be going back.
Delicious food! A bit pricey. No lunch specials . The soup dumplings are to die for. The slices pork is also very good
Came here for the pulsd deal. Sooo good!!! Their ribs are some of the best I've ever had, and a great value for the money. Interior is really trendy too!
Check what's in the bag when you pick up the order. I ordered pork & bamboo soup but was given this sour and spicy rice noodles. I cannot eat spicy food at all so I have to throw it away.
The dishes are tasteless, the service was not good. Our server talked too fast, and she is defensive. I was born in Shanghai, this food does not represent Shanghai cuisine.
I really likes West Lake Beef soup. It's really nice to have it in a rainy day. I'd love to visit again!!!
My friend and I went for outdoor dining and both got kung pao chicken - delicious! Also the waitress was hilarious, an awesome bonus!

While spending the cold afternoon in the village, I was heavily craving spicy noodles or soup, and Tipsy Shanghai appeared to be the right restaurant to satisfy my craving. I'm so happy I found this restaurant, and will definitely visit it again the next time I'm con the area! The only unfortunate drawback is the minimal options for vegetarian and vegan diets. Nevertheless, our server was very helpful and the kitchen altered a couple of items into vegetarian dishes. The stir fry green beans are absolutely fantastic and spicy, with that "kissed by the wok" flavor essential to this dish. Plenty of outdoor seating, very clean, and 100% in accordance to Covid regulations.

Came here with a friend for dinner because we were craving for Shanghainese food and many online reviews told us Tipsy Shanghai is one of the best in the area. But aside from an interesting retro decor, good service and having many authentic items, the food tasted very bland and lacked any serious flavor. Both the pan fried xiaolongbao and the shredded bean curds (tasted pre-frozen?) in chicken and shrimp broth didn't really hit home for me and were very unimpressive. The pork ribs were just okay because many of them are the tough, dry pieces of meat not attached to the rib bones. The presentation of each dish, however, made them slightly more appealing but the taste is very average for Shanghainese food.

I ordered to-go and picked up once. The restaurant looked clean and has a lot of spaces. They packed their food pretty well, and the food was amazing. I ordered beef noodle soup, xiaolong bao, osmanthus salted duck, pan-fried dumplings and xiaolong bao with crab meat. They also gave us a free desert. I am not a big fan with the crab one, but I love all other food. Their bao are so juicy and flavorful. The staff was friendly too. I will def come back!! Highly recommend!!
Good Chinese food in the heart Greenwich, definitely satisfies the cravings! Recommend the Â boiled shredded dry bean curd, very umami.
This place has awesome decoration, great for friends hangout. Food is great! Comes with smaller servings so we get to try more dishes at very reasonable price.
Their food is nasty.the cold appetizers they put in refrigerator too long. It taste so bad. Noodle they made is so messed up won't go here again.

The food here tastes good and I like it very much. I like the drunk chicken here. The taste is very similar to the local ones in China. And then there's the shrimp, which is just so delicious that you can almost eat it with the shell. And pickled cabbage fish. It's delicious. This is my second visit. I'll be back again.
Authentic Zhejiang/Shanghai food! It's really a good place to dine in if you are craving for home food, or just wanna try some real Chinese food. Easy location, friendly staff and great environment

Came here with my girlfriend and another couple on a Friday night. Â Food was just fine for authentic Shanghai cuisine. Â The vegetable dishes were pretty good but when it came to the meat dishes we were a little disappointed. Â All in all probably won't return.
This is my first time coming to Tipsy Shanghai, a century old restaurant from China. We have a wonderful dinner here. The foods are extremely delicious. I really love yam duo soup. Fantastic!

My daughter and I stumbled on to this place and were not disappointed. From the first bite of the dumplings to the last bite of perfectly steamed broccoli used to mop up the orange chicken sauce, we had a delicious evening.
Came here for quick dinner with friends, and we enjoyed the food very much. We especially liked the General Tso's chicken.
Great vibe and super friendly service! Highly recommend the Wuxi ribs! The pan fried buns are very juicy but a bit on the sweeter side. Overall a solid Shanghainese restaurant!
Best orange beef on the planet, hands down! Over a year and a half later, I still dream of this meal.

Overall very solid dinner choice. Came at around 6pm on a Sunday night and the restaurant was full but there was no wait line to get a seat. I love the interior decor with old photos and auspicious red colors. The xiaolongbao was soooooo yummy, and you could see how freshly steamed and made it was. The signature dish, Wuxi pork ribs was good and the meat was so tender it fell off the bone, but the only downside was that it was not completely flavorful throughout the entire piece. The string beans were cooked to perfection just the way I like it. But the main star would definitely be the beef noodle soup. The beef was so tender and the soup was light and broth and the noodles were chewy but soft. Portions are just right, but not huge, so we ordered 4 dishes for 2 people which was just right, and we finished everything. Would definitely recommend this restaurant!

Very authentic Shanghainese restaurant near school. They have a great lunch special where it's $12.95 for a noodle soup, xiao long bao, and your choice of a beverage. They have delicious xiao long bao where the skin is very thin and there is a lot of soup. The interior design is a good combination of modern and traditional and all the food is quite aesthetic and well-seasoned.
The soup dumplings are really authentic from Wuxi area which a little bit on the sweet side. Only pork option. Strongly recommend the fried soup dumplings! 10% off if you pay cash

The food here is pretty gross. I ordered via Uber Eats and ordered the pan fried pork xiao long Bao, the spicy roast beef, and sweet and sour chicken. The spicy roast beef had absolutely no flavor and the sweet and sour chicken was undercooked (I bit into raw chicken). The best dish was easily the pan friend pork xiao long bao, but it wasn't good enough to make up for the failings of the other dishes. Perhaps it's better if you go to the restaurant but I'm not too confident...

The moment I step into the restaurant, I was attracted by the oriental decoration, which is tastefully designed. Food is amazing! We had their signature dishes Wuxi Pork Ribs, Â Pan Fried Pork Bao, smoked fish noodle. Yummy! The best in the village!

Really love this place! I grew up in Wuxi and have been craving for my hometown food for a long time, and I have found THE spot in NYC! Every dish here reminds me of what I used to eat growing up. I came here for my birthday with my friends, and was welcomed by Chef Liu, who gave me a discount and personally prepared birthday noodles for me, which warmed my heart. In addition, the signature dishes such as Wuxi Xiao Long Bao and Wuxi style ribs are so authentic, the most authentic you will ever find in NYC. The ambiance is so cozy and intimate. I will be back!!

This place is one of the few places near NYU that offers authentic Chinese food. There are truly plenty of options, though most of the preferred ones land on the meat side (the Wuxi Pork Ribs are the absolute must try). I've come here plenty of times with friends and we've never been disappointed. They also offer a lunch menu with two options (one smaller option and one larger option)- the smaller option comes with a choice of dumplings and a choice of a noodle dish, while the larger option comes with comes with everything in the smaller option as well as a choice of a meat dish. The prices here are quite reasonable for the most part (lunch menu is probably the most worth it). The staff here are friendly overall and the interior of the place is kept neat and clean. In terms of the customers, most are Asian.
The environment and service is good. We ordered one pork ribs, one pork and one noodle. They are all great! Very traditional Chinese cuisine!

Came here for lunch with two giant tables and a guy who was local to the part of Shanghai that this place is from. The food and service was great. It's got a few dishes which aren't on the standard Shanghai restaurants that already exist. The soup dumplings are adequate but woefully overpriced. Their rent is probably a lot higher than the Chinatown Shanghai restos though. It's definitely worth a try!
Great authentic food from the land of fish and rice. Dishes are made with quality and the taste is spot on.
Came here once with friends. The service is great and their xiaolongbao is delicious. I also enjoyed their noodles. Would come here again!
Recommend by a friends and it is very authentic! Definitely recommend the Wuxi braised pork;)

Very good authentic Shanghainese food. The waitresses are super nice. Strongly recommend Wuxi pork ribs, pan fried pork bao, lion heads in brown sauce, sliced fish in wine sauce, shredded dry bean curd. All tasty!
2nd star cuz the food kinda hit, but micro aggressive as fuck... like the staff def treated us a certain way (point being, if you Black maybe hit up the Go Go Curry across the street)

I caught up with a friend over lunch at Tipsy Shanghai. The lunch menu allows diners to add a half order of an appetizer and comes with a drink. Very convenient. Food was good and filling. I rarely have noodle soup with fish, but enjoyed the aozao noodles. Service was nice and courteous but not very attentive. It took a while for the staff to bring check, to pick up payment, and to return with CC receipt. Great if you want to stay and chat, but not those with tight lunches.
The food is delicious, waitress are very friendly. I like the Wuxi pork rib and Xihu beef soup! If you add a little bit white pepper, that'd be perfect!
Good, traditional shanghainese food. Got the soup dumplings, shrimp with crab meat and ribs. So delicious!

The Tipsy Shanghai is truly a joyful surprise! I grew up eating Wuxi pork ribs. It reminds me about my hometown. The rib is very tender and juicy. Steamed pork xiaolongbao and its pan fried version are both delicious. Also very impressed by the beautiful deco inside. Tks for bringing a nice authentic Chinese restaurant in West Village!
Very authentic Chinese comfort food from the south!!! Every time I come I would order different dishes and they are all so delicious....reminding me of the good food in childhood in China.
Service is good and fast. Very authentic taste! We had a good time indoor dining here Saturday night!
Our waitress Vanilla was awesome. Incredible service and great food. Good outdoor option too.
The taste and service are really good but the portion is pretty small. I really like the smoked fish, pretty authentic
I have to come here at least 1-2 times a week. addicted to the food. And, The staff and boss there are soooooooo nice.
They check id here. For the underage, this is not truly "tipsy" Shanghai. If you are under 21, beware of false advertising. Other than that, one of the better places near NYU. A

One of the best and non pretentious Chinese food in Manhattan. Founded in 1905, everything was delicious. The hot and sour soup, the dumplings. Exquisite, really good. Hidden jewel. A great surprise in the area.
We're regulars here and really love every item on the menu. Really nice Chinese style restaurant in the backyard of NYU. Our favorites are the drunken chicken and zha jiang noodles.
The best place to have a Hangzhou style meal. Authentic Hangzhou food. Fulfilled my expectations.

Service is awful. They can't be bothered, seriously!! Â Soup dumplings had a sweetness to them not a fan. Food is mediocre Â  General Tso chicken was okay. The cold duck appetizer was okay. Â Best dish we had was the cold noodles. Disappointment.
Good Shanghai food. Â Note that like tapas, you can spend a lot if you are hungry, but reasonable for those with more modest appetites.

This restaurant offers various unique Shanghai style dishes. I enjoyed their spring noodles, marinated Â bran dough with peanut. Most of their food are unique and disqinshed from typical Chinese food in US. Â I am satisfied with their food.

Ok, this is the last time I will dine here. I already give this restaurant many chances. (Current location and previous location). The food quality and the service is just below average. Some dishes look authentic on the menu but in reality it's just not flavorful with smaller portions. By the way, they are so lazy, they tried to get people use Chinese WeChat to order food. Come on.

shredded pork with garlic source is the worst so far. Never order, not worth it. It's such small portion and it is so messy packaged. It tasted so fish which means they probably didn't wash the pan in between cooking different dishes. Omg, sucks.

We wanted to like this place, and it was nice to be out for dinner, but the food really wasn't good enough. It was a pleasant street to sit on and we enjoyed our evening out, but the dumplings were not very good, and the only thing we ate that really was good was the shredded pork with garlic sauce.
The food here is very authentic. The environment is comfy and cozy, nice place if you want to hang out with friends, chat and maybe discuss things.
The food tastes very good. Very nice lunch place. It's very close to NYU and is very quite. The membership card gives 10% off, great.
Food is tasty, service is extraordinary nice! Would recommend going here for a bit of taste of a real Chinese food
I came tipsy Shanghai with my friends for dinner. The server is really friendly, the Shanghai food is authentic, it's taste like home. I think Xiao long Bao is the best dish here.

Very good restaurant and good food. We ordered the bao, cabbage and stirred fired rice. Tho it is kind of hard to find the location. It is located in the basement and it is a bright and clean place to go on weekends.

Have been coming to Tipsy Shanghai since their opening. Probably most authentic Shanghainese and Hangzhou food in the village. Delicious, hearty and always remind me of home cooking. Staff doing their very best to offer the best service during COVID.
Food was okay, not the best in NYC area but good enough if you want to have some food not too american style.

Looking forward to a Chinese restaurant specializing in cusine from Jiangsu for a long long time...Delicious cusine from my hometown! Especially fried rice....taste exactly same as i had in my home town.
Pretty average to be honest small portion reasonable prices Â  not many plp but i like the music they are playing
I'm very impressed with how authentic their dish is. I've came here for 4 times and the food still amazed me. I especially recommend their fried.
This is the most authentic Chinese restaurant I have Â had in NYC so far. Literally any dish I ordered saitisfied my picky flavor. I will definitely come back again.
This restaurant serves very authentic shanghainese food. As an international student, it satisfies my cravings.
Really nice place and Shanghai atmosphere. I ordered sweet and sour ribs, assorted gluten, fried green beans and pan fried xiaolongbaoï¼å°æ¨ççï¼. And I highly recommend the fried xiaolongbao.
The restaurant offers very authentic Shanghai food at a reasonable price. I like the fried rice with sautÃ©ed meat and Yanduxian. Definitely will recommend to my friends.
Very authentic shanghai food. Decent dining environment and friendly staff. I dined in this time but their delivery is really good as well.

One of my go-to Chinese eateries in the town, reasonable cost with great nourishment. Normally the hold up isn't excessively long and the administration is neighborly. Suggest for an easygoing lunch or supper

TS offers the best pan-fried pork buns in the city - though not exactly the same as the ones in Shanghai, it is way better than China Blue, Shanghai Heping Restaurant which only serve fakers. I have to admit that not every course here is perfect, but the style is typical shanghai. All the mains - buns, fried rice, noodles are strongly recommended! Ribs are fine but I have reservation regarding veggie courses.

Came in on a Thursday night around 6:30pm and it was PACKED, but luckily we were able to get seats. Right off the bat, the place looked really cool. It was colorful and bright and the design felt thoughtful and appropriate for the cuisine. The menu was a bit of a mess to navigate, but we found the dishes we wanted. We got soup dumplings, salted duck, pork rib soup with radish, bok choy with tofu skin and osmanthus flower with rice ball dessert. The price of the food is way more than I would normally pay at a restaurant in Chinatown, but the flavor and service at the restaurant made up for it. The soup dumplings were hot and juicy and had a hint of sweetness to the soup. The duck was clean and easy to eat, minimal mess with the bones. The rib soup was just like how mom makes it, so extra points there and the bok choy with tofu skin was fresh and clean too. Our waitresses were also on top of the water, warm lemon water, perfect for the cold day outside. We finished it off with the rice ball soup which was slightly sweet and very warm, a very refreshing dessert. It was a good experience, definitely a good date spot, but personally not the kind of restaurant I would visit regularly.
The place is fantastic. Very traditional Shanghai food vs. everywhere else only serving Sichuan food... they have outdoor seating which feels safe. Friendly staff

Came back tonight with my friends for party of 6. We ordered Wuxi rips, Xiaolong Bao, Pan fried soup dumplings, boiled green vegetables, dry-fried green beans, salted meat and vegetable rice, famous assorted soup, and a desert with alcohol! We were so full and satisfied! Best dinner party ever! Wish they had more dessert options (owner said dessert menu was not completely ready at the moment). Average price per dish was under $10! The boiled green vegetable was recommended by the waitress. They used chicken broth with Ceder nuts. It was so delicious and a delightful surprise. The Wuxi Rips and Xiaolong Bao were as great as the first time. We were fighting for the rips! Will come back with more friends when school starts.

Very authentic Shanghai cuisine, not expensive but have good decorations and flavors. Would recommend to people who are interested in authentic Shanghai food. Their Wax Ribs are absolutely the must-try.

I don't normally leave reviews on Yelp, but when we found this place to have no wait, we decided we would try it. I lived in Taiwan for two years (non-consecutively) so I'm a picky person when it come to Xiao Long Bao. I was honestly blown away by the flavor of the steamed XLB. Yes, I suppose it might be a bit sweeter than others' but the flavor of the soup in these dumplings is bar none. I enjoyed them so much I ordered a second batch. Absolutely delicious, and I will be coming here for all my XLB in NYC for the future!!!

It's a nice little restaurant. Service was better than average Chinese restaurant. As for the food, it's just average for someone who are from Shanghai or surrounding regions, but it is better than average Shanghai restaurants in US. We had the crabmeat soup dumpling. The fillings were ok but the covers were too thick. The wu xi pork rib was not sweet enough. And the soup in the ao zao soup noodle lack in flavor.

My boyfriend, two friends, and I came here for a nice traditional Christmas meal, and we were astounded by the high quality of the food. My favorite was the delectable, sweet, and savory Wuxi pork. I also loved the juicy soup dumplings, and I even tried a sour fish soup with pickles that turned out to be excellent. The service was good, too. Overall, we had a great time!! Merry Christmas!

The Wuxi and Shanghai food here are so authentic and delicious. As a girl whose hometown is in Jiangsu province, this place really amazed me. Recommend: Drunken chicken Suzhou, west lake fish, SautÃ© shelled shrimps.

The food was really good here! Delicious ribs, soup dumplings and general tsos chicken. Attentive & friendly service, nice atmosphere and decently priced. This is during the soft opening so I can imagine it will only get better from here!
Best and most authentic Chinese food from Zhejiang/Jiangsu region love the place so much that brings me back to my hometown

Tipsy Shanghai is an authentic Chinese restaurant. It is a clichÃ© that an indication of a Chinese restaurant's authenticity is the proportion of Asian patrons. This restaurant is popular with Chinese customers. The cuisine and service are excellent; prices are moderate. The music is pleasant and at a low volume (important factors for me). I particularly recommend the "signature dishes," such as the steamed dumpling appetizer, which are called Steamed Pork Xiaolongbao, and the Wuxi Pork Ribs entree. The wait staff are friendly, courteous and helpful. I highly recommend Tipsy Shanghai.
Loved eating here today. Clean, excellent tasting food. Only issue is not too much pork free items. Would otherwise come back.

One of the best experiences I have had for Chinese food in the city. The restaurant was clean and the decor was beautiful, and the food traditional with a modern twist--exactly what I was looking for. I highly recommend the orange beef, garlic eggplant, and fried rice. The waiters were also great and very accommodating....all in all, a must-go for Chinese food in NY!
Love this place!!! My friend is a regular here and he loves this place so much. Love their spare ribs and soup dumplings. Definitely get these.
The food is four stars, above average. The pricing is okay for what they serve. Would be better if the staff would be more professional.
This is the best æ±æµè in Manhattan! I really love it and am glad to find this spot so that I don't have to go to Flushing for good food!

Tipsy Shanghai is one of my defacto places for Chinese food in the Village. They have a large selection of Chinese soups (with the pork and daikon soup being my favorite). They also excel at less healthy options, including General Tso's chicken (deliciously crispy) and fried, meaty dumplings (which I prefer over their oddly sweet xiao long baos).

So freaking good. In terms of authentic Chinese food in Manhattan, I'd say this place is definitely top 10. They've put a ton of thought into both the decor and menu, making this restaurant and its offering easily accessible by all. There was another location in FiDi but this location just recently opened up and I highly recommend it.

My friend and I ordered beef noodles, pan fried buns, and wonton soup. They are all so delicious. They use thin noodles for the beef noodles, and the noodles have a great texture: not too soft and they stay chewy for the entire course of the meal. The pan fried buns are the best! The meat inside is so juicy and delicious. The soup for the wonton soup is chicken broth, which has great flavor. Overall, a great experience!
The food taste really delicious. The service is really nice. Waitress Jimmy is really nice and friendly

Very authentic Shanghainese cuisine. Service is attentive and welcoming and food is top-notch. Not a fan of how sweet the soup dumpling is but everything else make up for it. Get the Wuxi Pork Rib, it's sooo good! Have been coming back at least a handful of times since I discovered this little gem so close to WSP and will definitely be coming back more.

The food here is delicious. I first came here couple days ago for a beef stew noodle and a Pan Fried Xiaolongbao, they were absolutely amazing. The Pan fried Xiaolongbao was savory and juicy every bite. And now I brought my friends back here again, and enjoyed it once again. I would definitely recommend this place.

This restaurant has some of the best dumplings I've ever had. The soup dumplings were to die for, and their signature Wuxi ribs were fantastic too! I definitely recommend this restaurant, they have a friendly staff and comfortable ambiance.
Ordered drunken chicken, gluten, red cooking pork. very authentic.

Probably the best shanghainese place in New York. Can't really go wrong with anything here...try their Wuxi rib, soup dumplings, bok choy, and spicy beef..everything is light on oil and sugar etc but tastes so good..
Very nice and authentic Chinese food. The portion sizes were pretty good for lunch time too. The dumplings were a little sweeter than I would have expected but overall very tasty!!
Very authentic Shanghainess food, would recommend Wuxi pork ribs, my favorite dish. had a great time hanging out with my friends

I like the noodle here. It's very authentic and home style. The taste is gentle and comfortable. I feel like I am returning my hometown. Especially the price is pretty reasonable comparing other Chinese cuisine restaurants in NYC.

As someone born and raised in Nanjing, I have to say: this place is so delicious and authentic. Every signature dish was made on point and tasted just like home. Thank you so much for bringing legit Huai Yang cuisine to New York.

Amazing food and excellent location! It should be the best choice to enjoy Chinese food, especially Shanghai style food for NYU students and faculty. I really love the Aozao noodles. The soup dumplings are quite amazing because it is a little bit sweet which makes it different from soup dumplings from other restaurants. The best Chinese noodles and soup dumplings in NYC! Next time I would like to try Wuxi rib and Dongpo pork which looks so good. And thanks for the opening discount!

It is a great restaurant that I usually went to when I was working at Wall Street. After they move to the new place, I tried it again today. They are still great with good quality food, delicious favor and very friendly welcome . Will definitely come back again.
I come to this restaurant all the time. The food is authentic and the service is very warm too. Usually no wait and they have good lunch specials.

Beautiful decor and excellent service. But the food was not authentic... it felt like they were trying to make the pan-Shanghai style food with a Cantonese chef. We had a good experience there, but probably wouldn't come back.
Really enjoyed this new discovery. Great xiao lum bao, hot and sour, babao la jiang and great service
I really like this place, the have my hometown food æ¬å·ç®å¹²ä¸ãI always come with friends and family!

Came here with a friend for lunch, for the lunch special (Monday-Friday 11:30am-3:00pm). Â Very affordable and you get a solid variety of food for the amount of money you pay. Â If I recall correctly the two options are: appetizer, entree, and dumplings or appetizer, entree, dumplings, and veggies. Â The dumplings were very delicious, but the noodles were a little underwhelming. Â Overall a pretty solid experience, very cozy atmosphere and good service. Â The interior is very pretty and pleasant. Â If you are looking for a quick bite of chinese food around Washington Square Park this place will fullfill your needs.
This is a really good restaurant! The food is authentically Shanghainese restaurant. I feels like going back to Shanghai and eating the food that grandma cooks for me. Hahahahahahahahaha
This is my favorite Shanghai restaurant in town. We love the braise ball soup. It is so delicious reminds of my childhood memory.....

I'd say this is my favorite Shangainese/Zhejiang/Jiangsu restaurant in New York among a few restaurants that market themselves as such. I especially love their wonton soup and stir-fry rice cakes -- taste close to what it's supposed to be. Just avoid all the fish dishes.

Food is quite authentic Southeasten Chinese Style. If you are looking for Shanghai or Jiangsu cuisines, I would recommend this restaurant. The seasonal dishes are highly recommended because of the fresh vegetables they are using.

Wonderful food! Ordered braised chopped pork ball in vegetable soup, boiled shredded dry bean curd w/ chicken and shrimp, and pan fried pork xiaolongbao. They use high quality pork and the flavor is very authentic!
Been coming here for nearly two years now while a student, really great food! Love the xiao longbaos most of all.
Good Chinese place at a convenient location. One of the most close-to-genuine Shanghai cuisines.
great experience, food is reallly good. I really like their buns, and soup is light good for health guy
Dishes are not so good as Little Valley and China Blue, where you can get really typical Shanghai food. The service is good though.
Very authentic Shanghai cuisine. Healthy and delicious, make me homesick. I can come here and eat every single meal, lol
Great place to get real Chinese food. I come here frequently. Their lunch special menu is great value. I recommend the XiaoLongBao here.
The rice cake and the Shanghai dumpling are super good, we like them a lot. And the service here is good, the people here are very nice. The environment here is good too. Recommend it!

To start with, this place's interior decoration is on point, making the restaurant very expensive looking. Surprisingly, the price is very reasonable and the portion is good. Everything we ordered was authentic and delicious. The service is really good and the restaurant provide complimentary dessert for the mid-autumn festival! Highly recommend this place to people who are looking for shanghaiese cuisine!!
Juice dumplings are in good flavor. Clean and friendly. Â Will come back again. It is in low level of building but it is still easy to find.
The braised pork belly is bit on the sweeter side, and a bit too fatty for my liking. This being said, the service is good and the food is decent overall. Definitely a place that worths coming back.

Three star for good Shanghai food. But, the offering amount is so small.... Just like sushi offering. I won't be here again because $30/person is not full. But $30 spending could have equal or better value meals in same level restaurant.

The steamed soup buns here are to die for! Hands down the best soup dumplings I've ever had in NYC. The decorations were peculiar and very interesting to look at. There were even USB wall outlets everywhere which made it easy for me to charge my phone, plus the staff were super friendly. Can't wait to come back and order more xiao long baos. I totally recommend trying the food here!
Very authentic Shanghainese food place and their price is very reasonable. Visited 3+ times already
Very delicious!! I like the Chinese food here and the environment is great! A great place to hang out with friends!

Tasty Shanghai cuisine. Never close during Christmas. If you wish to visit them often, register a membership and they will offer you a 10% discount from the second order. About $25 per person. Recommend: å°ç± åãé½æ¥éºµãæ°´æ¶è¦ä»ãå·¦å®æ£ éãå¥§ç¶é¢. One bad thing: å°æ¥çç is very different with the ones I had in Shanghai.
Authentic Chinese food! The fishes with pickled cabbage Â is super delicious
You must try it. The most authentic shanghai food in Manhattan. Must try the xiaolong bao

I really like the food here. They have great Chinese traditional food. The restaurant looks great inside. The decoration is very fancy. If you like Chinese food, you should come here often! I ordered Yangzhou fried rice and it tasted amazing
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants in NY. Very cozy environment, nice service. Pretty authentic Wuxi dishes offered. The price is also very reasonable.
Went to restaurant for a friend's birthday and it was really tasty!!! We had the rice cakes and Shanghai dumplings. Those were our favorites! Tasty restaurant and good price! :)

I passed by this restaurant last week and thought it might be a nice place for me and my sister to try for our hang out today. However, we order the noodle soup with the salty duck and the vegetables (can't remember the name of the veggies). My sister was quite satisfied with her noodle except the salty duck. It wants what we expected. The meat that cut down was all the bad part of the duck. We will not recommend this place to our friends next time.
First time here for a group party. Elegant environment, delicious foods, especially the fish and ribs!!
Love the famous Assorted Soup, the pork belly is not greasy, meat ball with tofu skin is good too! Â  Â Very authentic
The wontons are really good. Service is great and the environment is really good. Price is also fair. Near to NYU. Good place to have lunch.
Absolutely awesome food and the decor is so nice too. Right in the heart of NYU. Real authentic Shanghai regional food.
I especially like Yuxiangrousi. The food is delicious and tasty. Also, it is affordable. Highly recommend!
Absolutely stunning. The wu xi pai gu was exquisite and made me feel like I was ascending to Â another spiritual plane. Who needs a girlfriend when you have wu xi pai gu?!??
Just have a dinner with friends. Pleasant atmosphere, friendly people. Quick service. Food is delicious and mild since I ordered a lot veges. But they serve you with small plates.
This is my third time here. Good here is Very delicious. Very authentic shanghai cuisine. Will come back again.

I came across this restaurant while visiting family at NYU and was truly amazed by the quality of the food. The food was very authentic and service was very friendly. The çæ°´é¸­ and é¸èé±¼ were Â especially good and better than most restaurants I've visited in China. Overall, highly recommend this place!
Went there for a lunch. The food was not so special but the xiaolongbao was decent. The cons is that the service is very slow.
Good ambience and service. The food was tasty, but people should understand this is not a place for salty and spicy food.
Traditional Su Hang food. Didn't really find anything spicy. The rib soup is pretty good.

Pretty good place, recommend it shen-jian and hong-shao-rou. The price is reasonable as well. They also have private dinning room, which is good for party and people who value private of their conversation.
Delicious orange beef, yummy vermicelli noodles, and tasty dessert! Â The service is excellent and it's such a great way to spend a relaxing evening in the city! WOW

Terrible restaurant and service. Â Speaking about Â delivery only. Â Ordered food at 8:30 PM. Â There were no updates for over 2 hours and had the delivery cancelled on me at 11PM. Â This is not the way a restaurant should conduct business. Â The worst service, and there are better establishments in the neighborhood.

This modern authentic Chinese restaurant has great food and decor. Walking by I was worried about the prices, but their dishes are all reasonably priced for the high quality and authentic Shanghai flavored meal. We had the Xiao long bao, eggplant with mushrooms, and beef noodle soup that came within 5-10 mins. Wait staff were extremely courteous. Would definitely recommend to a friend!
This is the most amazing Shanghai food I have met in New York! You must not miss the baozi and noodle here! I will definitely come back again!

I ordered Crucian with scallion and osmanthus flowers with rice ball soup. It was fresh and delicious. I enjoyed the environment, and the waitress (Vicky) was friendly and able to help with my questions about the menu. Highly recommend you try them out.
Delicious, healthy dishes. The waitress taught me to use my soup spoon to catch the juice that escapes the yummy dumplings when you bite into them.
Must-go shanghai food in Manhattan! Friendly and quick service. Food really authentic and tasty. Sometimes they offer seasonal menu. Must try crystal shrimp(æ°´æ¶è¾ä»).
Great restaurant, very authentic. I'm Shanghainese and I definitely feel like home whenever I come here. Really recommend all the dishes
Great dishes, reasonable price and good service. Not too loud inside with good decor. Would come back.
Easy to find, good environment, delicious food. Wuxi pork ribs pan fried xiaolongbao are my favorites! definitely will come back again!

This is one of my favorite place to eat out around NYU. When I don't know what to eat, I always like to Â go there. Both the food and service are excellent. Definitely try the restaurant if you like Chinese food.
Very good shanghai restaurant with nice staff and tasty dish. I recommend this place!

y'all... I've lived in Hong Kong all my life and have spent a summer in Shanghai studying abroad, the waiters here are the absolute sweetest and this restaurant has the menu that makes my heart so full for food back home. Their soup dumplings are a STEAL for $5.95 and is probably the best broth I've had in New York City. Yes, it's a little sweet, and the skin is a little thick, but if you want "high class perfect Chinese soup dumplings" just go to a éæ¨ in midtown or the soup dumplings place on St Mark's that'll give you that with the appropriate higher price tag. Tipsy Shanghai though is so homey. Will become a regular here for the rest of the time I'm here in NYC.
The food was so good! Love the baozi!!!!!!!!!!!! I brought my bf here today to celebrate his birthday and they offered him a free bill on his part!
Overpriced! No rice! Small amount of food! Purchased $23.24, but I'm not full. Won't order again!
Very good experience here! The food is great and I'd definitely come again. I highly recommend the soup dumplings and pork ribs for anyone coming.
Food was quite good! I got quite a few things and not having paid an arm and a leg for it. It's reasonably priced for New York standards. The location is nice, and its a nice decor as well.
Super disappointed with the xlb here as it tastes way too sugary like a dessert. Definitely a bad recipe here. Besides that the noodles were really small portioned. Overall not worth.
The home made spicy souse tastes really good. I like the yangchun noodle and xiaoyang shengjian.
Super yummy! Reminds me of the real, good Chinese food in China! Chinatown ones mostly are just like fast-food version chinese food(lame). This restaurant is aweeeeeeeesome!
I have never been to Chinese restaurant that serves with such small portion. Also the dishes are bit too sweet. I am from Hangzhou, this place's food is not a good representation of my hometown food.
This is my third time here. Perfect place to hang out with friends. Delicious authentic Chinese food but also laowai friendly. The vibe is great and decor is nice.
The food is amazingly authentic! Feeling at home back in China! Location is good, very close to W4 and NYU. If you are a big fan of southern Chinese food, I highly recommend you to come here!

An authentic Shanghainese place. We ordered a couple of Shanghainese dishes, such as the braised pork ribs, braised fish and fried pork buns. All of them taste good. I guess I will come back and try more
First time being here, and the food tasted great! Service was fast and friendly and all of the food was reasonably priced. Definitely coming back soon.

Tried today but it's really disappointing. The one star is for the nice decor but that's about it. Food is very salty. The waitress was rude. We two only ordered one entree to share because we were too full. The waitress gave us the usual Shanghai attitude of looking down on u because we only ordered one entree. "Dog eyes looking down on people."

Came here on a Tuesday night with my boyfriend for dinner after seeing this place on Instagram. Ordered the fried pork soup dumplings, auntie fish stew, and the shredded pork. Overall was very impressed with the freshness, flavor, and price! Would definitely come again
Great Shanghainese restaurant with classic vibes. Would definitely come back with friends!
It's hard to find authentic Shanghainese food in Manhattan. Glad that I found this place. Waitress are all very friendly. I'll definitely come back.
Delicious food and excellent service. Will come back again soon! Make sure to get the soup dumplings.
Very traditional Shanghai food. I love their pan fried pork buns drunken chicken and sweet sour ribs

Coming from the region that represents this cuisine, all dishes taste really good, especially the Wuxi Pork Chops and the Dongpo Pork. We wanted to get the stir-fried shrimp but they ran out of stock today. Guess that dish is pretty popular too.
The food is so authentic and delicious. I highly recommend this restaurant. The noodles the soup and xiaolongbao are so good. The food is healthy for sure!
delicate and authentic south east Chinese dishes. highly recommend rice wine and ask them help you warm it.
One of my favorite Chinese restaurants! One of my favorites is the pork rib and fish. Salted duck is also very delicious. The environment is faltering and quite. Good place for date.
One of my favorite Chinese places downtown. I come here weekly since they have more authentic flavors compare to other Chinese places. Highly recommended if u are looking for real Chinese food.

column3: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: I feel like I'm addicted to the place. The Wuxi pork rib lives up to the expectation. They made the noodle themselves in the spring noodle, so it's also super good!

This place has very good service. The decoration is Â nice. The food is authentic. I have been here multiple times. The most amazing thing is that they have Yin Er Gen and Cai Fan (cooked in real Shanghai style!), which is not available in many Shanghainese restaurant. I will give this restaurant five star.

The ribs was very tender however a bit costly, the wine chicken was not a lot of wine compared to others I've tasted but still good, the soup dumplings soup had a nice tad of sweet, the noodles soup was homey but I don't prefer the noodles they use, the hot and sour soup was hearty and good.
The food here is amazing. Very authentic Southern Chinese dishes. Try the shrimp and pork rib!
I went for a meal alone and the waiters were super friendly! It was also very nice and quiet
Foods are very mediocre. The dumplings are even not good as good as those I got from Trader Joe's. Service is not good either. I don't get any reason of giving higher rating.

Cute little place with great decor and ambiance. We split two types of soup dumpling (try the crab!!), short ribs, and beef noodle soup. Would be a great place for a group to come and split a bunch of things as well

Stumbled upon this Chinese restaurant near my apartment and I am so glad that I did!!! It's hands down the best Chinese restaurant in the area and maybe in the entire city. The food is delicious, authentic, and super affordable. The service is amazing as well. Can't ask for much else from Tipsy Shanghai...I'm definitely going to be a regular here.

We ordered Spring Noodles, braised beef noodles, Wuxi pork ribs and crab dumplings. The noodles dishes were very tasty, the broths were flavorful and the noodles had a nice texture. Would go back for the noodles. Our waiter Jimmy was very attentive and friendly.

I live in the neighborhood and was so happy to see this place open up. I feel like most Chinese restaurants are Cantonese or Sichuan so it's nice to have somewhere that serves traditional Shanghainese food. So far I've tried the pan fried pork buns, the minced pork noodles, sauteed string beans, and a few other specials - all of them tasting very authentic. Definitely recommend!

The exquisite fitments was impress me, the interval of tables are just right .We order the wuxi rids, they was totally surprise me. Some of dishes are not exactly look like what we see in the menu, but the food still tasty.
First time here, food is delicious here and authentic, good place to go with friends!
Great food, I had the Spring noodles and it was very tasty and comforting. Price is on par with other restaurants in the area. Would definitely come back!
Tiny portions, inattentive service, mediocre taste. No real reason to come here when there are options in Chinatown which are much better value.

Probably one of the best "real" Chinese cuisine since Joe's Shanghai, everything we ordered were spot on, they didn't adjust any flavor into any kinds of western styles, the soup dumplings and tofu are my favorites, we hope that we can ordered one more fried dumplings but we were full, definitely will come back really soon!

Had a late lunch and it was quite tasty Shanghainese regional food. My wife had a chicken broth noodle soup dish and we shared had several appetizers (xiao long boa soup dumplings, deep fried dumplings, and the Wuxi spare ribs). All were pretty good/decent (be prepared that the dumplings are really hot and can burn your tongue though). My favorite is the Wuxi spare ribs which are very sweet and tender. For those familiar with Shanghainese cuisine, it's similar to hongshao rou but better, IMO.
this place is bombï¼if u want to experience authentic Chinese food definitely come here

this place deserves 5 stars because i felt that you really get beyond what you pay for. so affordable for large quantities of quality flavors and spices. tried the curry puffs, the fried fish cakes, pad see ew and green curry. pad see ew stole the show. amazing flavor, great texture of noodles. must keep in mind this place is VERY spicy! then i think the fish cakes were in second place. the curry puff was like an empanada and a samosa had a baby so didn't feel that it was particularly worth getting. thai green curry was also really delicious. perfect amount of sweetness to it. limited seating but honestly a cute vibe nonethless.

I visited recently and was underwhelmed. The restaurant is small, and does not have a restroom for customers. I ordered a Pad See Ew Â medium spice with chicken. The food was spicy but lacked flavor. The chicken was bland and tasteless. I will not be returning :/
Great service, food is very good and authentic. Great ambiance for a casual dinning with friends.

Came here on a Saturday around 5:30 pm, surprisingly the restaurant is very empty. We ordered pork bun, boat blood noodles and pork and crab noodles. Their boat blood noodle is the BEST! You should definitely give it a try, if you like your food spicy. Make sure you ask them to make it spicy, because they CAN. The pork bun we got is also very delicious. The crab and pork noodle is dry noodle but has a lot of flavor as well.

Loved the pad see ew and perfect Thai iced Thai. The Thai iced tea is super sweet and creamy and tastes just like the kinds I've tried in Thailand. I love that the pad see ew wasn't overly sweet like many others I've tried in NYC.

Not too much seating area, especially indoors, so we were lucky that a party was leaving just as we arrived. The food here is a bit expensive, especially for the portion sizes, but it's also quite good. They have some unique spins on classic favorites, such as noodles in some of their curries. I really liked their mock duck as well. Definitely worth a try, but I don't know how often I'll go back.

This is right next to our new home & I just really have nothing bad to say about this place. The food is really affordable (especially with their lunch deals) & the Garlic Tofu with Rice dish I ordered was super flavorful. The tofu was amazingly crispy, and while I wish they gave more vegetables in the dish, it wasn't too bad. The place is also BYOB which is cool for a NYC restaurant. I just got great vibes from this crowded, but not overdone restaurant and will certainly come back!

We decided to check out this Thai spot via DoorDash for takeout. Delivery took about 1 hour or so. We ordered the popcorn chicken bun, mock duck panang curry and chicken pad kee mao (spicy). The food was amazing - very authentic including the spice level. One suggestion for the chef, perhaps stir fry the chicken of the pad kee mao? The smoky/stir fry taste of the chicken would really take this dish to the next level. Please note "spicy" is really hot and you should not order if you cannot handle the heat.

Overall the food here is solid. I was impressed by the flavor and texture of the crispy watercress salad. We also order the home made cured sausages which were a tad too sour for my liking. The fish cakes were tasty and I also enjoyed the bamee poo moo dang. Would definitely order here again.
Great food! Not necessarily set up for dining in, but food comes first. The fried snapper is super yummy!

Super solid Thai food and they do not mess around with the spice. The papaya salad (northern somtum) was definitely one of the better ones I've had. Curry puffs were good too as were the noodle dishes we tried. Went out of our typical order here as they had some fun dishes like Bangkok tom yum and did not disappoint. Small place but seemed like most people were able to find a spot to sit and eat if they wanted to, indoors or out.

Got the Kha Moo ("18 hour simmered pork knuckle") for takeout tonight. The pork was so tender and deliciously seasoned, and went well with the pickled mustard greens and soft boiled egg on the side. I've been to fancier places around the city this trip, and so far this Kha Moo is my favorite dish.

I know my Thai food and this is one of the closest restaurant serving authentic Thai food in the area. Khao Soy was missing more broth, and I would make it more watery since it is a soup not a bowl of curry. Popcorn chicken was good and the noodles were excellent. Friendly staff, and good price/portion ratio.

How terrible my order was. I still can not believe what they sent as laab salad. A hot minced pork meal full of grease, nothing close to a salad or anything about it is refreshing. The mint leaves are cooked, dark green. No scallion or any other toppings. The restaurant claims it is good. It was like a joke. I was not gonna leave a bad review but I have to warn other Thai food lovers...

I used to love this place, but I hated my food today. The chicken was weird and destroyed my stomach. I waited outside to get my to-do order, the restaurant is small, and they have only outdoor seating, which is a horrible setup for winter. Inside, I saw some plates on the floor nearby the kitchen, and the last time I visited, they were using an electric stove for their broths which was also again placed on the floor. It made me question the cleaning level.
Ordered 2 mins before closing last night. Delivered under 20 minutes. I was very excited to eat the food but it was kind of dry and there was a strand of hair in my food.

I'm obsessed with this spot in my neighborhood. Really delicious Som Tum papaya salad and I always get the Bangkok Tom Yum soup. I like that you can request different levels of spiciness even when ordering online. This is my go-to spot for takeout on repeat.

I had the pork knuckle, boat noodle and watercress salad. It was very good, but man the wait was long. We placed our order at 8pm and It took over 1.5 hours to get our food order. I hope they can work on better time management. The really foods authentic and I'd love more people to come check it out!
It's hard to find good Thai food in the area but this place is incredible! Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. Staff is friendly and the vibes feel home-y!

One of the better thai places that I've had! I ordered the papaya salad (definitely on the spicer side - for me at least), green curry with noodles and the tom yum noodle soup. Everything was delicious and authentic - the curry noodles were my favorite and there was good balance of all the spices. In regards of space, it is on the smaller end and there are around 4-5 tables outside. It's a bonus that they accept venmo as a form of payment! I can't wait to come back and try more of their dishes.
Never had more flavorless Thai food; ordered the pad ki mao and pad see ew, both were rubbery, oily and flavorless.

Got the take out chiang mai khal soi with tofu. The dish itself is very decadent and rich and delicious and the tart picked cabbage perfectly cuts through the creaminess of the curry. It is, however, a little bit sweet for me, and I wish there was more acid to balance that out (I added a lot of lime juice and some sriracha). This dish has a lot of similarities with the curry laksa from Malaysia. The dining establishment itself is very cute, with some outdoor seating available. For payment, currently they take either cash or venmo
Just look at the photo. Need I say more?! Delicious Thai food with a cozy outdoor hut. Lots of vegan options. Mostly no single use disposables when dining in except for chopsticks

Delicious ! I am giving 4 stars only because I have only been there once but might change to 5 once I go there again . The food is some of the best Thai I have had in NYC . So delicious and flavorful and spiced right! I am dreaming of it right now. Go eat there ;) yummy
It is really good food. Way better than any Thai I've had in the neighborhood. I got blood soup Thai spicy and it was MIND-BLOWING. They were very fast and friendly. (I did pickup)

This restaurant is a tiny little gem with a clever name. The service is super friendly and really efficient. We had the Springs Rolls, Gang Gai Khai Kem, and the Bamee Poo Moo Dang. Everything was exceptionally delicious!
It was all good. We could've done without the popcorn chicken. Pad Thai was on point!

Ordered delivery from here and was not disappointed. We tried the papaya salad and pork dumplings to start. Both were great - the papaya salad was very fresh and bright. We went simple with mains - pad see yew with tofu was flavorful and tasty, though the tofu wasn't great. The drunken noodles were on point and made even better with the delicious mock duck. Can't wait to try this place again.

Obsessed with their Tom Yum... and basically their whole menu. Â Sometimes you just want a great Tom Yum soup and it can be surprisingly hard to find. Â This place has it nailed. Â Their method of delivering that delicate balance of sweet and savoriness... is tough to match and has set the bar on Tom Yum for me. Â My one complaint is that I now can't find great Tom Yum anywhere else and I'm all the way up in Manhattan. Â I LOVE Thai food (I have Thai family members) and can soundly say that this spot is generally one of my favs. Â Delish!
Excellent food. The kao soi was particularly good. Ordered for pickup on their own site rather than an app. Be aware that the spice level is serious here!

I wish I can give them more stars but something need to be improve. My friend and I found the restaurant on yelp and their menu seems to attract us to go try their food. We know that now they only do take out because of the lockdown but they also have some seat outside for customers to eat. We don't mind self service during this time but the fact that they didn't see that we gave them over 20% tips because I just put it in their tip box instead of giving them in front of their face. So when they thought they didn't get the tips they treated my friend kind of bad. She went inside asking for a trash and napkin and the cashier made unhappy face and answer my friend with an attitude. I wondering WILL THEY ONLY TREAT CUSTOMER depend on how much TIPS? Should they love what they do and treat everyone equally? Good tips come from good service so in this case we gave so much tips and got trashy service because they thought we didn't give them any tip.
I docked it a star because a Sunday evening delivery took more than 1.5 hrs to arrive, not to the fault of the driver it seemed, but the veggie buns were very much torrid flames. Would eat in.
Food was ok. Service was um ok. It is far in Brooklyn and very quiet. Not a lot of seat but pick up is good. Hope they improve it. Everything.

I'm sorry, but I'm perplexed that Noods n Chill gets 4 1/2 stars. Â  It is honestly the worst Thai I've ever had. This is my third try and pad Thai is flavorless with out any vegetables. Â Just a big lump of noodles. Â First time I tried their pad Thai is had frozen broccoli throw in. Â  The papaya salad tasted like dish detergent fell in. Â I'm writing this in hopes that they will improve their dishes.
Everything is terrific. Get the big family style fish dish, a noodle and an appetizer or salad and go to town with your main squeeze.

Such a cute little space with big flavors! Got the boat noodles (Thai spicy) and it was salty, sweet, spicy, sour-- all things good about Thai food. I went during lunch time and it wasn't that busy. The Thai tea was sweet and creamy. Will definitely be back to try more of the menu!

Tbh my bf and I came because it had such a cute name. It's a very small restaurant that fills up SUPER quickly. We came around 5 and it was probably filled by 5:30. Things were pretty cheap and it was self serve when it comes to utensils and whatnot. Definitely a place to visit at least once

BEWARE: This restaurant states multiple items on the menu are gluten free that are not. I have celiac disease and became very, very ill. Although the restaurant acknowledged their mistake, they refused to refund my order in full. I would not trust this restaurant if you have any kind of food allergy. But even if you don't have a food allergy, this restaurant takes so little care with the health and safety of their customers, I would not trust their kitchen to follow other basic health and safety practices.

My husband and I went to this small cute spot for a weeknight dinner (during covid) and had a really nice experience. I ordered the Khao Soy (14.95$) and my husband ordered the Bamee Poo Moo Dang (15.95$). We sat outside where it was 65 degrees and really nice out. My dish was very flavorful and came with a chicken leg, noodles, and fried noodles all on top of a soup-like curry. My husband's dish was a little more low key but still really good. It was a dry noodle dish with beef and we added a soft boiled egg for 1$ extra. Overall a nice experience, it is just a little too expensive for us - hence the 4 stars and not 5. We will come back but most likely if we are really craving it or if our friends suggest it.

New spot in Willyb by Plant Love House fam... this one is more fun and creative. Felt a lil hipster-ish, very tiny place more like fast casual spot for quick lunch or dinner. Love the fact that there is finally a place that we don't even have to spare extra for tipping and experience is still there. Don't miss their Thai-Chinese brunch on weekend 11-4. I loved the condensed milk hot Thai coffee and pork floss with chili paste.... nom nom cheap and fun!

This spot is fire! I repeat, it's fire! The khao soi is amazing especially since I can't go to Uncle Boons for theirs. Â And their mock duck curry is also a hitter. Check this spot out, surprisingly the delivery is very good.

Authentic spicy Thai noodles. Casual quick noodle catch up spot. All self service, you order inside and pay. If you are eating in their outdoor seating, then they will let you know to how long till you come back in to get your noodles. Again, noodles has heat even if it's mild! You will need to prepare yourself with some water.

This is my first yelp review--I eat thai frequently and am usually satisfied but not impressed. Noods n' Chill is IMPRESSIVE. I ordered through Caviar--I imagine eating at the restaurant is even better. The Guay Tiao Tom Yum was out of this world and quite spicy. No skimping on broth or meat. My boyfriend had to reach for some milk but it was perfect for me. We also ordered the Bamee Poo Moo Dang, which wasn't spicy--a very helpful balance to the soup. The crab and pork were plentiful in this dish too. Overall great value for the price. So excited to eat here again.
So lovely! Finally a delicious Thai take out restaurant in Williamsburg. The Pad Thai is fabulous and is the strongest thing on the menu. The neighborhood needed this place. Thank you!

I live right next to this place so I come here fairly often. At first i thought the food was ok and conveniently close so I went often. Recently I went to make a pickup and the hostess forgot to to make my order so I had to wait an extra 30 minutes and on top of that she tried to autotip herself 20% on a take out order. I thought it was a pretty shady move and don't plan on coming back.

We ordered pickup a couple of weeks ago. It was the first time trying this place and we were blown away. The order was done within 10 minutes of placing it on Caviar. We ordered pad Thai, popcorn chicken, spring rolls and the roti side with curry. It was all very flavorful and delicious. Looking forward to trying more dishes on the menu!

Went to this small interesting place a while back. Great authentic dishes served by friendly knowledgeable staff. Had the Chiangmai Khao Soy at his recommendation. It was delicious. Wonderfully spicy and flavorful! I know Ill be back for more.

Food is A+. I think the flavors are spot on and the best I've had outside of Thailand. Â I'm sure they must be importing all the necessary spices to make the taste the same! Â The only knock is that the place is tiny, 11 total capacity?

I've been waiting and longing and hoping for a good Thai place to open in Williamsburg, and it finally happened! Got takeout today, khao soy noodle soup with tofu. So tasty. Â It had pickled vegetables and a lovely, deep flavor. Â Then the green curry--always my personal benchmark for a go-to Thai restaurant--was fantastic! The perfect level of spice, creamy delicious coconut broth and soft rice noodles that really soaked in the flavor of the broth. Â Just lovely. Â You should go.

I've had delivery at least 4 times. This place deserves props for bringing thai spicy to williamsburg. The soups are great too. Ignore the cringey name and get some of this ASAP. Call them directly(don't use the apps) and place your order so they make some damn money and stick around.
Yooooo I haven't had this good of Thai Â food since Bangkok. Loved it. Got the lunch special.
Incredible! So tasty and spicy. Legit Thai food with complex flavours. Might be my favourite Thai in NYC. Well priced and great vibe... even in Covid times!
I've been waiting for this cute little spot to open and it did not disappoint! Great portions, delightful flavors. Will definitely be goin going back.
Fantastic little restaurant. Only has 8-10 seats in the whole place. Some of my favorite Thai food in NYC and definitely the best Thai in Williamsburg.

I'd been crazy excited to try this place and finally did last night but was super bummed. The order was half an hour later than the latest delivery time which I could let slide as it was a Friday night but both dishes were inedibly sweet. My bf will eat anything and he even couldn't do it. Tasted like a cup of sugar syrup was in each serving. The fish cake buns were tasty but they were just the app everything else we tried to eat but ended up throwing out and having toast for dinner. :( Some sweetness is expected in Thai and we eat it often but this was just bonkers.

This is simply the best Thai food I've had since Thailand. Â The spice level is on point - delivery efficient and good prices. Â I tried the standard pad see mao (sp) with Shrimp at Spicy level... it was fantastic. Â The spring rolls were also great / not your standard bland ones from most every other Thai place (I swear they all buy the same spring rolls). Â Highly recommend. Â I went conservative on my first order so looking forward to trying more items. Â Note I am not averse to spice but I would downgrade my spice level to medium next time.
Holy shit this place is good. You get to pick your spice level... enough said. Got it to go and still amazing, eat here

Food is very yummy and affordable here, would def come back! Just don't order Thai spicy if you don't wanna burn your stomach, it's super super spicy even for a person who grow up with eating spicy food every week.

I'd not want to write a bad review for any restaurants at the moment due to the fact that the pandemic is already damaging for most of them. But my latest experience prompted me to share it since diners should be treated better even during the tough time. My husband and I ordered from here 4 times and the food here tended to be too sweet although they weren't supposed to and their crab fried rice had little amount of crab and veggies. There aren't many good Thai choices where we live and so we ordered different things from them each time hoping the new items would be better but unfortunately they weren't. The last time we ordered from Seamless makes it the last time we will order from this place since they accused us of lying when we said there was no choice of proteins on the seamless app we used and so we had to make a note about the protein when ordering. Then the additional price was added to the order without informing us first and so I had to call them. Why would I waste my time calling them if I could see and select the protein choice properly myself? The overall food was ok (with my notes saying "not sweet please"). Their pricing is on the expensive side but the quality isn't as high as the price. The green curry got no coconut milk flavors and was barely edible. The Isan sausage was the only item that was good. My husband had no complaints about his basil dish (also with a not sweet request).

Ordered a huge order last night for myself and my husband, and it was amazing! As someone who has traveled Thailand and other south East Asian countries, Â this place is legit. There were a lot of vegan options, all exceptional. Highly recommend. Great addition to the neighborhood!

With a name like "noods n' chill" our expectations were already set at a lofty height... and for our viewing pleasure, so were the noods they served us. From start to finish this place truly delivered. fake flowers on the table, a NOW 2007 cd on loop, all in perfect harmony with some of their special teas, soups, noods, rice. Done.
Really really good curry. Highly recommend! Can't wait to order more off the menu and visit in person because the setting looks so cute
Was really excited to try this place and it did not disappoint. The food was soooo good!!! I definitely will be going here again :)

Consistently our favorite delivery spot. Food comes hot, fresh and quickly every time. We've eaten about half the menu at this point and never been disappointed. The bao are not to be missed Highly highly recommend this spot
Too good, every thing is great. Get the pork knuckle and chive pancake and pretty much anything at all. Welcome addition to the area. Hopefully
I've eaten from here a couple times since it opened and everything I've had was wonderful. Â I'm so excited to keep going back and trying every menu item!! Fresh yet comforting flavors.

The first time my bf and ordered the food was bomb. We couldn't wait to get it again. So we did the other week and it was... just... bad. I couldn't believe it was the same place! We got the exact same things too. Pad Thai, chicken wings, Khoa Soi, dumplings. Consistency is key for me, so the stark difference in taste was a big turn off. Rather not chance it when spending $60 on take out.
They may be fine if you go in person but they TAKE forever with the food. ALMOST TWO HOURS until I got my food delivered.

Food was incredibly salty, sweet and flavorless. The chicken was not edible. Unfortunately had to throw out my entire order as none of it was appetizing. I think if I actually ate it I would have been sick. Very disappointed based on the reviews below. Lots of better Thai options In williamsburg.

The reviews and pictures all looked so great so I was coming in with high expectations. This fell incredibly short of those expectations.
