The two dishes we ordered were just super bland and the chicken we ordered had a rubbery texture. It might be because we went at a busy Friday night so they were rushing to get the orders out... I'm not sure. I don't really want to come back to this neighborhood at least definitely not for Thai. I honestly and sincerely don't know there were so many 5 star reviews or what the allure is. Maybe it's that "only 7 seats, small hole in the wall" hipster feel that makes everyone give good reviews. I'm sorry, I go purely by service and taste. There's so many great Thai places in NYC and so many mediocre ones, sorry to say this is not even mediocre, it's just thoughtless ingredients thrown together without care and incredibly bland, especially for Thai food. I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 because it came somewhat quickly to not waste TOO much of my time.
Probably better for takeout than dine-in because it's so small. I ordered pad Thai and it was very solid. The service was good and the food came out super fast!
We just got back from Thailand and found the food authentic and fresh. Glad this opened in the neighborhood

Excellent restaurant. Had a really chill vibe to it. One of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. The food was the bomb. They made the food to cater it towards how I wanted it, especially with the spice because I didn't know how spicy I wanted it. The Thai Ice Tea was super good you have to try it. Would always recommend eating at the restaurant.

Absolutely delicious! Ordered takeout this week and tried the tamarind popcorn chicken, pad see ew with chicken, and tofu with ginger sauce and mushrooms. The pad see ew was some of the best I've had in Brooklyn. We will be back!

Would ideally give this a 3.5. Was slightly disappointed that the food was a little too sweet. Every dish seemed to have too much sugar including the som tum and the khao soy. Flavors were good but could have used way less sugar

The decorations of this place gives a vintage feel. It's a small place but it's cozy. The food here is delicious. Every dish I ordered is seasoned perfectly. The staff is also very friendly. Service was good as I got my food rather quickly.

Walking past it, it looks like a small place with not much besides your typical noodles. But, make no mistake their food is AMAZING!! If you like spicy, authentic Thai food with good customer service; this should be your next stop!

My favorite burger place!! Very close to 7th st burger in manhattan. The flavors blend amazingly with garlic sauce, the mountain of cheese, and very crispy pickles!! The pita is also very very fluffy but wasn't soggy. The service is very nice and they clean up after you!

This was a stop for us to get lunch! There was a long line - we had one person getting a table and the other two waited on line. We ordered a few things to share- chicken in pita and such. Good for salad and french fries in it too. Food is delicious but very messy. You need your wet naps! It's "street food" so this is the way to roll! It's in the Chelsea Market!
Amazing place. Staff was incredibly friendly. Â  Â Middle East music creates a fun upbeat atmosphere. Food was top notch. Recommend the Mushroom Pita. Save room for the fries banana nuttela pita!
The food, the service, the place, all so good! Best pita bread I think I've ever had and the chicken had so much flavor. Will definitely stop in again on my next visit.
Truly shocked that baby cauliflower can be so delicious. The sauces and side peppers and pita also on point!

Still dreaming about this Rib-eye Minute Steak pita sandwich 24 hours later... this is a must-try in Chelsea Market! The meat was juicy and tender and the pita was fresh and soft. Packed with lots of flavor from the pickles, tomato salsa, and tahini. So good!

Pricey for a small portion , YES. Packed with insane amount of flavor, YES. I have always been a fan of Eyal Shani and Miznon delivers. The menu you see out front is not the exact menu of the day so I would ask what is the menu for that day. I got the mushroom pita but instead of sour cream I opted for non dairy tahini! Definitely recommend!! It was packed when I came but it was prime tourist season so the line was a bit outrageous and you can tell the service was overwhelmed but the food came out quick.

In a city overtaken by the humble cauliflower, I expected a little more from an establishment that prides itself on its rendition of the same. Don't get me wrong: it was perfectly tender without being overly mushy, and I have no complains about texture. But somehow I felt the tahini and cilantro chutney served on the side failed to bring out the best in its flavors. Perhaps it would do better with a squeeze of lime and sea salt, as works wonders on tempura?

Great energy in a spot with great food choices. Ordered a lamb kabob and got back a very filling, generous portion of perfectly cooked meat with soft bread and sauce with bite. Price point was very good, as well.

Yummy! Pita bread is fresh and soft, the meat so yummy and perfectly seasoned. Love that this make it fresh to order. There's usually a line at this place and it's also super popular. Great taste, and super casual. Would highly recommend checking this place out if you're in the area!
Ordered a rolled cheese burger and steak and egg and they were extremely delicious. Love to go to other miznon locations.

Such a cute little place inside Chelsea Market. Â I didn't expect much when I placed our order but was pleasantly surprised. Â We ordered the "Fish and Chips" pita and let me tell you, this was one of the tastiest fish I've had in a while. Â Super fresh and the mix of the potatoes and pickles all wrapped in the warm pita worked together beautifully. Â A must-try to sure.
Folded cheeseburger was great. Think crispy grilled cheese meets a smash burger. Fun twist on food. The falafel was also great. Crispy and moist.

I was pleasantly surprised by the modern take on Israeli street food. I ordered the cheeseburger pita, which was a delicious combination of spiced meat, cheese, aioli, etc. The pita was also super fresh. Service was quick. Wasn't a huge fan of the ambiance or layout of the dining area, but this wouldn't stop me from returning.

Huge line at Miznon even in the middle of the afternoon on a Saturday. I had the Mediterranean chicken pita and the thing is huge (I swear there was half a chicken in it). It was great, but not sure it was worth standing in a long line for. I'd definitely come back, but would probably try some other places in Chelsea market first. Note that you can ask for a bag of the cut pita for free as they otherwise just toss it.
Interesting menu. Â Pita stuffed with grilled mushrooms was delicious. Â It's in Chelsea Market.

Updating my review as I returned today and the food was even better! Ordered the cauliflower, bag of green beans, and falafel burger and wow, everything was incredible. On top of that, the staff is what pushed this to a 5 star review. They ran out of water cups and the guy who took our order (manager?) told us to grab some water bottles instead. The waitresses were also attentive and very nice!

So good. Located in Chelsea market, the cauliflower is a must try- they have tons of vegetarian options; the FALAFEL burger is truly out of this world. So so so good and very filling. Service is wonderful. Enjoy!!

Sooo good. Favorite was definitely fish and chips (not pictured). Fish and chips is a lot lighter than you would expect with the potatoes, lamb flavor is good but it was slightly undercooked in the center - wish they could break it up a bit so it would be better distributed throughout the pita. Cheeseburger pretty good too but there was a lot of the burger sticking out that you had to eat on its own. Pita was super soft!!
The falafel burger is amazing! The line moves pretty fast. Not a lot of seating. I wish there were sides that came with the entrees.

Do not sleep on Miznon! It's the best place for a delicious meal when you're not in the mood for a regular restaurant or you don't have reservations or you just need a quick bite to eat. It's the best place to take tourists because I guarantee they've never had Israeli food like this. The minute steak is the best pita and if you've never had the cauliflower it's a must for first timers.
can be a bit busy but food is so good! got the fish and chips and it was so so good, highly recommend if you're looking for a place to eat in chelsea market

Wow! I got the folding burger and it was packed with flavor! Stuffing the green pepper in the burger added such a nice spicy kick and the way they made their cheese crispy was such a unique touch and added I nice crunch to it. This is probably my new favorite place to get a burger! Also the workers are high energy and super welcoming.
I really enjoyed their falafel pita. The meal was very good and the atmosphere was fun inside the market!

Absolutely delicious food at this spot! Chelsea market prices are expected, but the rotisserie chicken pit I had was worth every cent. We sat at the counter by the kitchen and the owner/operator interacted with us a few times, even offering us a complimentary mini-dessert! Lovely experience and great food

The baby cauliflower and the intimate plate are the best dishes on the menu in my opinion! I love the green beans in a bag as well. They are all low carb and prepared to absolute perfection. My tip is to always order in advance on the website. You can eat inside if you'd like to, after receiving your order. It is noisy and bustling because it's an excellent restaurant in the middle of a very popular tourist destination, but that's all to be expected. I am a repeat customer at this point and I don't see myself stopping anytime soon!

Got the grilled lamb kebab in-a-pita and it was truly delish. Included on the side were 2 grilled green chili peppers. Lamb is often my go to order anywhere, I love the gamey taste and it comes through in this wrap. Tahini sauce pairs very well. The only knock was I found small bits of undercooked pink lamb meat so check your bites. Definitely need to try other items on the menu, like the cauliflower, but I would certainly order the lamb again
Very long line. Got falafel sandwich and ratatouille in pita. Very interesting taste of eggplant and egg in ratatouille. Pita soft and fluffy with flavor packed sauces.

Miznon's rib eye minute steak pita sandwich is my favorite food item in Chelsea Market so far! I was blown away by how tender and flavorful the sliced rib eye was. The sauces and other garnishes mixed together so well too. The pita was soft and fluffy too. A ton of juices collected at the bottom so it got a little messy. Grab some extra napkins! I'm glad we got to the restaurant shortly after opening on a weekend because the line got pretty long.
Ordered brisket in pita bread. Pita bread was delicious as well as the tiny piece of brisket that was in the pita, all the rest was a huge blob of fat :(
Everything is absolutely delicious! Â Folded cheeseburger. Steak sandwich. All super fresh and amazing!
Wow five stars!!! The food was amazing and fresh. Staff seemed happy to be there and very lively. Overall amazing atmosphere and even better food.

I had the Lamb Kebab Pita and it was absolutely phenomenal! It brought me back to my childhood church picnics. My only complaint is that I wish I'd ordered more. I think their website/menu would benefit from more appetizing word choice (e.g., describing pitas as "a womb" almost made me lose my appetite) but you cannot fault the end product.

Lively venue, friendly service, with interesting and flavorful dishes, but even with current economic inflation, the prices are not justifiable. I'll spend $45 for a good branzino but not for a small poorly filleted specimen or $16 for a small piece of babka - on the UWS?! Â Not good value, But the place was full so...
Delicious, tasty food. I come here every time I visit New York and it never disappoints, always satisfies.

Very good! We popped in, very casual place, had a glass of red that was surprisingly good and the cheese burger in the pita was super tasty! My friend got the lamb and I think that was better, but both were very good!

I have eaten at bith the Chelsea location as well as the UWS location and always enjoyed our meals. Today was the first time I ever walked out of a restaurant. The nasty girl taking orders at the Chelsea location needs to learn about customer service. Her eye rolling and apathy was a bit too much

This place is pure joy. I ended up getting the burger which was probably the best burger I've ever had in my life I swear I'm salivating thinking about it right now! The staff are so awesome and the ambience is very relaxed and hip. Â  Â  Â  I could truly go here every day!!!!!!
Lamb Kabob was super delicious. Beers are limited, but it's a good refresh for a hot summer.

Staff was so kind and attentive, but food was disappointing. Pita was very soggy and cold and just looked unappetizing. Overpriced of course but that's New York. My friend had the falafel and hers was better.

The vibe inside Chelsea market was lit as usual. This was my fourth stop after the dounuttery and very fresh Noodles ( best Taiwanese dan dan and mock duck I've had in the city ) and I have to say , their world famous cauliflower did not disappoint - And this is coming from a typical cauliflower . hater. Somehow it was perfectly charred and perfectly salted and oiled while maintaining an aura of light Mediterranean healthiness
Yum! Nice chill place for a quick lunch/dinner. Inside Chelsea Market and is quite open. They have seating for large groups too.
My falafel burger was SO tasty! I love falafel and this was done so well. So flavorful, a neat twist, and very moist. The place is fun and the employees look like they're enjoying themselves!
Sandwiches are pretty good but the green beans are out of this world. Wow. Order to stay, grab a table, soak in the vibes and enjoy your bag of green beans. Incredible.
I have visited their paris location for years and the new york location has the same best cauliflower, pita bread and tahini!! The falafel is also good but the cauliflower is just the best thing ever
Everyone should go here if they want a juicy meal! Wow it's so tasty. For sure one of the best I've had
The prices are a little steep considering the portions aren't particularly substantial (again, for the price) but the food is excellent and exciting and the staff are nice.
Pretty decent food, but they lack customer service very rushy and rude counter person

This place just hits. We came here on a rainy day because we were in town and finally decided to try this place out after hearing about it everywhere. They actually had the lamb kebab crossed off because they thought they had sold out, but I politely asked about it and the employee said they had one left! I had been wanting to try this exact pita for so long so that was great news. The pits itself was extremely soft and chewy and the kebab meat was perfectly cooked. Together the whole pita was an incredible ensemble and man I'll definitely be coming back here next time I'm in town.

At lunch time, there was a short line and plenty of open seats. I ordered the minute rib eye and while it looked like I may need a second one, it was deceptively filling. The pita was soft and fluffy and the flavor of the meat and sauces was great. The employees are all friendly too and the food came out quickly.

Amazing place for Mediterranean food in Chelsea Market -- already thinking about the next time I can come back! I ordered the lamb kebab in a pita. The pita was the fluffiest, softest pita I've ever had and the lamb was so flavorful and tender -- cooked perfectly! The tahini within the pita also really complimented the lamb. The service was fast and the food was so well priced for NYC (under 20). I'm excited to try more on their menu.

Tried out this place since i like Mediterranean food and was so let down. I got the lavon and the cauliflower was cold inside. My friend got the folded cheese burger which was so raw it didn't look like it was cooked enough. Maybe it was just an off day? Was very disappointed.

OMG! I've tried every burger that's high in ratings in NYC, you name it we've tried (stood in more lines than I'd care to admit), and this has to be too 3 without question. The folded burger is off the chain...granted it's 14$ and has no side, but the blend they use is unreal and the cheese (griddled) makes a huge difference. Perfect meat to bread (pita) and the aioli makes the burger. Please don't miss this place
Amazing food! Great value for money and each dish has a unique twist to it that adds flavor in a mouth watering way...

Wow wow WOW! This place was sooooo good! I found them on YouTube review food show and it went beyond my expectation!!! My friends and I got the folded cheese burger and I HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!! I want to come back here all the time now

Doesn't matter if the food is good (and it's not as good as the hype) this operation is such a mess it could never be worth returning. I was told my food would be 8 minutes and I waited for 40 minutes. Nothing was organized or knew what was going on. The staff was also very rude instead of apologetic for the wait.

On Christmas Eve day, we descended upon one of MY favorite places in NYC... Chelsea Market. Â I just love that place, and no matter how little time we have in the Big Apple, I always make sure we make a return trip to see what's new...... and something IS always new there. Â They are forever changing eateries and shops. Â One could NEVER get bored at this NY institution. Â So, speaking of new (at least to me from the last time I was here in 2016), we tried Miznon for a quick snack. Â It was lunchtime, but we had plans for a big dinner, so we thought we'd share a sandwich instead of us each ordering something. Â I'm glad that's what we did so as to not ruin our appetites for dinner, but I'm sorry we did that in the sense that what we ate was so good, I wanted more. Â Anyway, we got a FALAFEL BURGER (served on Tuesdays and Fridays ONLY), which included the falafel, tomato, pickles, sour cream, and green chili peppers, and it was divine. Â The falafel was fried just prior to placing in the warm pita, and the flavors melded together like a harmonious symphony. Â Between my husband and I, we gobbled it up in what felt like seconds. Â Again, I was just sorry we couldn't eat more. Â I guess we'll just have to return SOON to NY and to Miznon and eat more of their food next time. Â Yummmm.

We walked by this place so many times when going to Chelsea Market, finally decided to get it for our valentine dinner and it was the best decision ever. Hubby got the minute beef and I got the rotisserie chicken in pita. First of all, haven't heard my hubby said amazing or so good to food in a while. His minute beef was tender and juicy, the sauce was delicious that he literally finished the sandwich less than 3mins and he normally takes his sweet time eating while playing games on his phone. My rotisserie chicken was moist and juicy, the sauce made it 10 times better. However, it does get a little salty toward the end but still good. We don't normally eat chives but with this sauce, we ate every bit of it!!!!!
The best food at Chelsea Market. Israeli street food. The service is amazing. Thank you Kevin for making us feel welcome and enjoy our family time!!!
3.5 Liked it didn't love it. Tucked away inside Chelsea Market. It is a tad pricey but overall decent spot. My friend really enjoyed his meal, so maybe I just had an off day.
Highly recommend the inside out cheeseburger and the rotisserie chicken pitas! The staff was helpful and gave great recommendations!
All sauce and no substance. The bread was hot and the sauce was lavish enough to camouflage the meat but the meat had zero taste n I might as well have been eating rubber

Saturday at lunch and no surprise it is packed but we score a table in front for 4. Â With this luck it is a sign to try Miznon as its reputation precedes them. We try the baby cauliflower which is simple but very tasty and I go with the roasted chicken. Others go with the folded burger which is filled with gooey cheese, the rib eye, and The ratatouille. The consensus is everything tastes awesome. The meats are all fresh and juicy with the various sauces, pickles, etc adding good texture and flavor. Â Miznon did not disappoint...
If you're in the mood for greasy junk wraps, this might be for you. Very low quality ingredients and very greasy. Think Waffle House.

The baked cauliflower was everything it was hyped up to be. Such a cool spot, dominated by millennials but not too hipster. Because it's a popular spot, that just opened, the service isn't the best. A host is shouting names throughout the restaurant, trying to find the correct person to give their order to and chaos ensues. Still, I'd recommend it because the service is swift. It's all the rage in Israel and we are fortunate to have a place to experience the cauliflower in the states.

Wow, what an awesome spot in Chelsea Market! This unassuming casual eatery is loaded with delight! It's so rare to actually experience food that you actually witness being cooked with love. And all that love shines through in some of the most delectable and thoughtful flavors! The pulled rotisserie sandwich explodes with gentle spiciness in your mouth, the beef stew which has cooked for over 7 hours literally melts served with warm and sultry doughy bread. The banana with chocolate at the end is savory and dreamy...it is hard to believe this is counter dining. However definitely take a seat at the kitchen counter and witness the beautiful men preparing your dishes with love while they sing...a quintessential and unique New York experience and a must on anyone's list!

The cauliflower wasn't bad but $9 is a bit much. I got the hake pita sandwich and although the pita bread was good, there was way too much tahini and the hake was over cooked (and also lacked flavor). Also left pretty hungry. Probably won't come back again, unfortunately.
This place is great. Tasty food, friendly staff and Chef Kelvin is the man.

The ribeye from Miznon is super thinly sliced it practically just fell apart in your mouth. The addition of pickles and sour cream make this Israeli sandwich perfect. Follow us on Instagram: Bigfoodie.littlefoodie
Servers were super polite. They clean up after you pretty quick. Great energy. great food! lamb kebab, bag of beans, and cauliflower were all delicious

Good pitas for sure. The bread stands out and the ingredients are good but not sure it lives up to the hype. Definitely expensive for what it is. If I was in the area and the pitas were under $10 I might try something other than the steak, but won't be running back .

Serving size was smaller than expected, especially for the price. I ordered the Folded Cheeseburger Pita. For 15 dollars, I was still left craving more. The texture of the pita was soft and floppy, which was disappointing to say the least. The only reason I am giving this 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the texture of the cheese and the flavors paired well. They also made us do this pointless sign in, even though we were already standing in the restaurant while they were preparing our meal. Would not come back here again.

The food here is delicious, to be sure. I got the rib eye roast beef. The sandwich overall is well balanced and absolutely scrumptious. Do I wish there was a little more meat in it for that price point? Sure. But that won't stop me from coming back and trying other items.
Miznon is pretty good, great quality and okay service. I tried the falafel as well as the cauliflower and was pleased. Next time I'll probably try the folded cheeseburger!
I will try more than the cauliflower next time. Â Their Mediterranean peppers were superb! Â Spicy too.
The roast cauliflower is one of the best dish I have tried in NY, but also the sandwich was amazing. By sure I would come back happy to try other sandwiches

This place was amazingggg!! (Though so so SO heavy). I had the folded cheeseburger, and my sister and Mom had the minute steak. Both sandwiches were delicious, and though we were concerned with portions at first glance, we ended up each barely able to finish our one sandwich, much less consider ordering more than one each!! In other words, the portions were generous. I wasn't even able to consider getting ice cream after like I'd originally wanted to. This restaurant is definitely a must-try if you hadn't yet tried it!

As a previous poster noted there were delayed customers, incorrect orders, and mild chaos, well actually total chaos and overall bad attitudes on behalf of several counter order takers and servers. The manager was particularity New York angry when confronted with our order being lost in the shuffle with a wait time of nearly 45 minutes. When you're confronted with your mess-up look at me not at the wall. Two stars because the food was okay, i.e. just okay . . . barely.
Wow! A tasty burger with a soft, delicious falafel. Most burgers are not that flavorful. Will be back before the crowds return. Great customer service.

Not very Mediterranean food like, the food was very good but it didn't have the taste of Mediterranean food. The wrap I got was a pita wrap stuffed with avocado and boiled eggs it tasted like a breakfast wrap it was very good and we also got a mushroom pita wrap stuffed with veggies and a spicy sauce. Wasn't very mediterranean food but it was delicious.
My 2nd time back! Awesome Mediterranean style street food in the Chelsea Market! I had the folded Cheeseburger and charred Cauliflower? A must when visiting NYC!
Got the Lamb pita. Very very good sandwich but I do not thing it was worth more than $10. I do still recommend trying out on of their pita sandwiches though!
Their farafel burger (like a pita sandwich) was amazingly delicious! It was super crowded during lunch time. It was worth the wait!!

Awesome spot. Came for brunch on a Friday, we waited a few minutes but then found a seat. Even though many people are at the place they move fast so you get your order quick, I really appreciated that. The food was incredible, I got the Cauliflower, the omelet in pita, the burger, and the falafel sandwich. Everything was incredible, honestly. Bread was soft and warm. Everything was flavored great. I'll definitely be back. Located in the heart of meatpacking in the Chelsea market. Five stars all the way, especially if you've got the itch for israel / Mediterranean food!
Pretty expensive and had to wait in a long line, but it was definitely worth it. Had the folded cheeseburger which was excellent

1 July 21 - Lunch - This location is in the Hudson Yards mall so seating is in the mall which can get noisy. Â The Old City Mezze ($22) and the Rib Eye Minute Steak ($15.75) were very good. Â Will go back to try something different on the daily menu. Â This
I bought a steak and egg pita sandwich and there was nothing special about it. I was still left hungry after eating and it was $12. This meal was nothing more than fuel.

I have been wanting to come to this place forever. I came here on a Saturday evening, I got the cauliflower pita and a soda. My favorite things - the fried chili and the soft pita. Not so favorite - cauliflower though delicious, was just super salty. I couldn't eat the whole thing and I usually like salt! They get an additional star for just being such a cool place, I'll definitely come back, but may request to go easy on the salt.

Sooo good!! The folded cheeseburger is outrageous and the baby cauliflower is fire roasted to perfection, a little tricky to eat without a knife - they are knife free but it's cool. I will be back to try the meatball, eat another cauliflower, bring some spicy peppers home!

Poor service here - multiple missing items in our order, and this location is too busy to pick up the phone when we called about the problem. The sandwiches were ok on flavor / spices but also quite soggy like I see other people mentioning. Even the plain pitas arrived soggy. The cauliflower was the only thing worth re-ordering.
Yummy broken chicken pita sandwich and minute steak sandwich. Both delicious and spicy at the same time and so satisfying. Would recommend eating here again.

I was really sad to have such a poor experience ordering food for takeout from Miznon during COVID. We ordered the dinner bundle and everything about it was wrong - the pitas were not included in the order, the sauces were watery, the cauliflower was unseasoned and bland, and the green beans were overcooked. Sorry to have this be my first experience at such a highly reviewed restaurant, but I don't think I will be returning.

Mediterranean food is fye. First time eating hake and absolutely loved this fish dish. The sauce was so flavorful and it's enough for two people. Needed more pita bc one small bag was def not enough. This restaurant in Chelsea Market had cool seating and the staff was really helpful in food recommendations.
I tired the roasted cauliflower and I do not understand what all the hype is about. It's ok and it's bit salty too.
This place is incredible. My favorites are the lavan and the mushroom sandwiches, but I've never gone wrong with any of them.

I would say 4.5 stars. Â Only reason not a "5" is that the green beans, though delicious, were pretty overcooked like canned green beans consistency. Â Also, love their cauliflower (but same too mushy problem) and have also been to Miznon Paris. Â The Paris location doesn't cook it mushy, it is cooked perfectly. Â ***Chelsea, PLEASE find out from Paris what they do, as their cauliflower consistency is better than yours!*** Â However, had the cauliflower pita, delicous. Â Lamb pita also delicous.

Solid place to grab a quick bite in Chelsea Market. I got the mushroom pita, and the mushrooms are delicious! The pita is also the fluffiest pita I may have ever had, and it had a really delicious sauce inside.
Super slow service. Chaotic. For two pitas without meat or falafel took 40 mins and order wasn't correct.

Really large space for a Chelsea shop. I came here with some coworkers for lunch, and we managed to grab a table with 8 seats. They have an innovative menu with creative names, and it's Mediterranean food with a twist. A few of my coworkers got the folded cheeseburger which looked interesting, and I got the lamb kebab. The lamb wasn't particularly special nor juicy nor flavorful, and honestly it was quite mediocre. The redeeming quality was the pita, which was soft and chewy. The portions were tiny for the high price; my lamb kebab pita was $12.50 pre-tax.
Cool vibes good Food 5 Â star. In my Book the kabob is One of my Favorite followed by the folded cheese burger

I came by to try their cauliflower and picked up a falafel sandwich to try as well, which is only available on Tuesdays and Fridays. It was definitely way easier to find this place coming from the 15th st entrance instead of winging my way inside Chelsea Market. I was luckily only second in line to order and finished ordering before a big lunch group cake but I still had to wait a bit for the cauliflower to come out. The falafel sandwich was already ready and I guess that is a clue to how the cauliflower was really very good and the falafel sandwich was just ok to me. It's just one large falafel ball in the middle with a pickle and some hummus. I do feel It could be more flavorful though it did satisfy me. Come for the cauliflower, which is popular for a reason!

Oh God this is soooo goood. So yummmy. And guys are so cool. Cooking team and all staff is amazingly cool. The food is amazing. So far one of the best Israeli places I tried in NYC. All pitas are amazing. Cauliflower is must try. And sometimes they give small desert hot banana with Nutella in a pita. Sooooo gooood! I'm waiting all day on Sunday usually not eating to come here to eat.
Rude staff, slow service, ended up with cold and salty sandwich. At least everyone else's food turned out ok.

column3: West Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
column6: Was waiting for this place all day to eat but was disappointed they don't have the chicken liver in the pita bread. Â  Beside that everything was delicious. Amit the manager was cool. Fast, tasty, and you get what you get for....
The most delicious cauliflower in a pita I have ever eaten! Music, seating and a very nice menu if Israeli street food. All with a smile!

The cheeseburger pita was delicious! Very savory and juicy. Friendly service too. They gave us their famous cauliflower on the house and while I honestly couldn't differentiate it from other roasted cauliflower I've had, it was very tasty and I was very happy to have ate it.

The roasted cauliflower was as good as people say -- perfectly cooked till soft without being mushy, with a bit of a charred top to add some crispness. Â The pita was also the best pita I've ever had...so fluffy and airy. Â I'll never be able to have store-bought pita again. Â I only tried the mushroom pita sandwich so far because I was sharing with a vegetarian friend, but I will definitely be back to try the other sandwiches.

This place is a Tel Aviv transplant and super yummy. I tried both the Rib-eye Minute steak and the Lamb Kebab, liking them both. I didn't want to pay $9 for a head of fried cauliflower; that's just ridiculous. I'll make that at home, thanks. Minute steak is very simple, crispy, good greasy in a meaty way. The lamb was succulent and I loved the mint/tahini sauce, elevated the experience. I wish they had another NYC location where it's not so expensive and touristy as Chelsea Market. As much as I loved it, I wouldn't pay that price again when there are other great M.E. options in the city. Was great trying it though.

As a person who grew up in Israel I strongly recommend anyone whonhasnt been to go to Miznon. The food here is very humble but the flavors will blow your mind! I recommend the steak and egg pita and the cauliflower. Absolutely delicious!

Amazingly good. Factoring in the price - ridiculously great. New York hasn't seen anything like this. Ingredients are clearly superb. I've never had anything even close to this good stuffing a pita - and there's plenty of choice in this city. And the whole roasted cauliflower... is just heavenly.

I love this place! I actually been there few times but yesterday I go with my husband and my 6 year old boy first time. First of all the location in Chelsea market is perfect. We come it was alot of people (saterday) my husband order the kabab it was so good that he order one more. I order omlet with something and my boy same. Becouse ig was so many people and it take forever they didnt charge us for my boy food and give him ice cream on the house. The staff was very nice as well the place full of life Iove the music and my boy have fun. I think if it so many people they can add another grill man becouse its look like he overwhelmed and he by himself lk f on the grill or too add another grill area.

Great loud music, fast service. Open kitchen everyone looks happy and I feel that's important! I had the wild mushroom wrap. Exceeded my expectations. Super yummy. They also have falafel and a fried cauliflower dish as vegetarian options. Excellent spot in the Chelsea Market.

While we were disappointed that they ran out of the cauliflower (we went back for it and they ran out again), we were thoroughly impressed by the folded cheese burger in a pita. The pita itself was incredibly fresh, it had high quality meat and perfect meat to cheese ratio. Highly recommend it. Will be back to try the cauliflower.

My god this place is so good. I've eaten here a few times already and I sometimes sit at work wishing I could have Miznon for lunch. I've actually ordered this place via postmates once but it turns out to be very expensive plus cold by the time they got to me. The minute steak is absolutely delightful and the cauliflower is very yummy. Their tahini sauce is one of the best I've ever had. I cant wait to go back and try more things off their menu!
Excellent food. Excellent service. Found this little gem after my Covid vaccine and couldn't have been happier. Thank you to Samuel for the excellent recommendations and service

Cute little shop inside Chelsea Market. You order at the counter and seat yourself, perfect for grabbing a quick bite. The steak and egg pita had great flavor, especially in the bread. Would have loved the pitas to have a few more ingredients but tasty nonetheless.
Delicious quick spot for yummy pita! Can vouch for the rotisserie broken chicken pita

Miznon's food is excellent but the in-person ordering process and space was chaotic at best. Long waits, staff poorly estimating how long things would take to come out etc. Some of their prices are outrageous. $18 for a bowl of hummus? $32 for 1/2 a chicken? Really enjoy their food but rarely stop in to eat. However, we've been picking up takeout since they reopened post-COVID and the food is always nicely packed and the employees are efficient. A nice change from home cooking and the quality of the menu remains quite good. They've really stepped up their game.

Scrawled on the wrap-around chalkboard that decorates the restaurant are the words, "Dreams do come true." Â Based on the buoyant, sexy vibe that emanates from the staff behind the counter, this must be the case for the newly opened Chelsea Miznon. Â The excitement is palpable. Â  Â But did the lamb pita make my dreams come true? Â For the most part, yes. Â My favorite thing about the sandwich was the way the fat fluffiness of the pita absorbed all the juices from the lamb, tomatoes and onions. Â The ground lamb was well seasoned and juicy, though it really needed a sprinkling of salt. Â All of the ingredients tasted really fresh, like someone prepared them for you at their home. Â Though I doubt I will crave this particular sandwich again, it was good enough to warrant me coming back to try the minute steak and roast beef.

This is a must try. The chef is famous in Israel and the ingredients all come from the Chelsea Market. The pita here is on a whole other level. It's in its own league. It is too good I can't even put it into words, you just have to try it. I got the ribeye pita and a roasted cauliflower and had some complimentary roasted peppers. Everything was so fresh and amazing.

Terrible service, rude and violent manager. After ordering my food to go, I step aside close to the exit, I am on my own and while waiting for my food, I removed my mask momentarily. Immediately, the manager (woman) comes and orders me in a rude way to put the mask back on. I replied I am waiting for my food to go, and I point out that most of the employees are not wearing a mask, Including herself. She gets mad and she says they are vaccinated and if I don't like it I can get my money back and leave. I agree to get my money back and leave. When I give back to her the can of soda I just bought (still unopened), she freaks out and throws it against the wall and tells me she doesn't give a fu*k about the can of soda. She made me wait several minutes and then finally gives my money back. Very unfortunate incident. I am not coming back there (or the Chelsea Market) again. Not surprised the place was empty.

Miznon in Chelsea Market is a fun experience. They are famous for their "baby cauliflower" for very good reason - it's a must try. Also recommend the sweet potatoes, known as "batata." Lots of meat on the menu, but a fish option, too. My only criticism is the music - way too loud! I know the chef is famous for his party atmosphere, but everyone screaming at each other over the music takes away from the fun.
Great cauliflower falafel. I think they add leak. Maybe a bit on the salty side. It's pricey though. Mealpal made this affordable.

Ever since i got Back from Tel Aviv I have been craving israeli street food. I found this place on accident after walking the Highline and I'm so glad I did!! I had the minute steak pita and the cauliflower side dish, both were amazing. The flavor of the cauliflower was out of this world, soft but roasted at the same time. I also ordered the Mojito with arak, amazing as well! The DJ was awesome too!

My Israeli husband loves Chef Eyal Shani, so we came on opening day. Â We both tried the minute steak pita, Reuben, and the cauliflower. Â Cauliflower was a whole head and was incredibly soft. Â The meats in the steak and Reuben pitas tasted like they were of very good quality, but there wasn't much filling in the pitas - which was my biggest complaint. Â The food didn't have as much Mediterranean flavor as I'm used to, which seems intentional. Â Call me boring, but this didn't do it for me. Â The food seemed confused to me. Â For example, I didn't think the flavors in the Reuben worked well together - instead of sauerkraut/cheese, it came with an avocado/aioli type sauce. Â I enjoyed it enough to come back and try different things, but not enough to eat on a consistent basis because the pitas just aren't filling.
Amazing! The best and easiest grab in NYC- I'm definitely going back again with my friends next time. Already drooling thinking about this amazing Israeli street food.

The rib eye minute steak pita sandwich was delicious - juicy and very flavorful. I could probably made the steak at home by buying those really thin steak slices from Japanese groceries (those used to cook sukiyaki dish) but I won't be able to replicate the pita at home. The pita was warm and tender with some great sauces inside - I tasted some oil and tahini with tomatoes and pickles. Would love to come back try other pitas and side dishes! A bit of a wait but not bad - a good place for grab and go kinda meal.

Amazing food, expect to wait in line but it goes by fast and definitely worth it!! I tried their cheeseburger in pita and lamb kabob in pita and they were both delicious. Must try it when visiting Chelsea Market

My colleague who ate at their Israel location brought me and I have been forever changed. The best pita lunch I've ever had. Need to go back and try it all. Friendly service, fun vibe, incredible eats.
Good Mediterranean food spot inside Chelsea Market. Will return to try every item on the menu. So good!
Delicious. Highly recommend the Ratatouille. We also tried the cauliflower which was flavorful.

One of the best food I had in ny it's like you hugging the pitta and making love with the food the place very authentic can see the kitchen very clean the service it's very good it is best food is delicious fresh ingredients and lovely energy..

We were expecting to take a bite of that baby cauliflower again after almost a year of waiting. Last year, we tried this restaurant for the first time in Tel Aviv and the taste of the food is just so unique and unforgettable. Luckily they open one in NYC. I think I will visit there quite often
The flavors are outstanding. People who complain about the pita must not understand what true pita tastes like. This is a special import from Tel Aviv, I could not recommend it more highly.

Visited during the first week the Miznon branch opened in Chelsea Market in NYC. Definitely a good place to go to sample high quality fast food in a pita. The cauliflower met our expectations was fresh, tasty high quality fast food, so does the wild mushroom. Nonetheless is worth the visit and the ambiance with Mediterranean music is vibrant. Wait was not too long on that day as well.

Disappointed... have a high expectation but their pita is cold... will be better if they made hot to serve. And the minute steak is kinda cold too... need more acidity to balance the flavor otherwise is too oily. But I love their service! Employee cares about their customers and everyone smiles:) just hope the flavor can be improved!

The miznon dinner for 2 is GAME CHANGING during covid. Such a good deal and the green beans, cauliflower, fluffy pita, zatar chicken and hummus is so delicious. Will continue to order from here on a daily basis because they have this package deal!

We were recommended by the cashier to as "newbies" to try the baby cauliflower and I'm glad we did as I found it kind of savory inside of it. I love getting my veggie fix if I can tolerate it haha. It has like this buttery flavor inside and so it is safe to say I am the one who finished most of it. I also had the Folded cheeseburger and that was a good try. It just tasted like the patty was cooked with egg omelet style. My sister had the falafel sandwich which was pretty good actually; and I am not a fan of falafel. She described it as being "fresh". This is a good lunch spot for Chelsea Market. I also love how even if all the tables are used that you can just use the stadium like benches on the side by the wall.

Disappointing Experience... nothing like the original one in Tel-Aviv. We had the baby cauliflower, falafel burger, steak pita and the Laban pita. Everything was lacking flavor and ingredients... you're basically eating a good Pita bread with steak, falafel or cauliflower with no other flavors.

The music was the best part of the meal. We were super excited to try this Israeli spot... we got seated right below the blazing B sign.. yes, beware this place received a B rating for their cleanliness. That was enough to make me walk out immediately. When you live in NYC, there are countless restaurants. Why choose a B when you can go to an A? A member of my party was adamant that we stay and try. All that fuss and I didn't even think the meal was that exciting. So OK food and poor cleanliness. I was so sad that miznon didn't live up to the hype.

I have been to the flagship location in Tel Aviv and have also met chef Eyal Shani. So I was excited for this location to open near my place. The location is in Chelsea Market and the place was hopping. Service was good but the food was not even close to the flagship location. The pita bread was dry and it was tasteless. No flavours. I will come back next weekend and try it again
Cauliflower is good. This restaurant used to have pepper for you to grab, but no longer any more.

Had the ribeye pita. Â It was good but I suspect Ill be hungry again in about 37 minutes. Â  Was most excited about the grilled pepper. Â Asked the lady taking the order if our order came with peppers. Â Yes they do. Â Awesome. Â Food comes, no peppers. Â  Asked the same lady where the peppers at. Â She said they're being grilled but don't worry she'll bring them over. Â Sweet. Â Ate our food, drank beer, waited for a while, no pepper. Â Guess the pepper wasnt meant to be. Â Maybe its a NYC thing and being an SD guy, the whole place was just too...frenetic. Â  But again, food was good and if you dont care about the pepper and the chaotic vibe, youll probably like it.
Great! Best pita ever. The ratatouille is awesome, so is the okra. I'm more into vegetarian, but my wife adores the meats as much.
the food is mediocre and pretty bland, and isn't worth the price imo -- definitely not enough for a full meal. on top of that, the service was really rude. wouldn't eat here again.

Not the same as Miznon Paris. Ordered the lamb kebab and pita, cauliflower, and sweet potato. Food was cold and underwhelming. The pita was dense and doughy. Had two glasses of wine and it all came out to about $82 with tip and tax. $82 can be better spent elsewhere in NY.

Very cool spot in Chelsea Market. Â I had the mushroom sandwich in a pita and the whole cauliflower (pictured below). Â Food was brought over hot and tasted very fresh/unique. Make sure you try the roasted hot peppers, hot sauce and tehina (all complimentary with your order).
Rib eye minute steak pita is to die for! The pita is soft and fluffy and the meat melts in your mouth. The pepper on the side is also a very nice addition.

OMG. Can I say More? Â Best pita with ANYTHING Ive had. And the Cauliflower...wow. Â At 1st I frowned upon the cauli (it gets u gassy as hell). Thus Not recod for a hot date. So I leave my honey at home. Get him jealous as hell. And its less expensive.

Great pita sandwiches! Order, get a number and go sit kind of place but the food was superior! Loved the minute steak! Nibbled on the poblano that comes on the tray. Hot but very tasty! Saw some sides come out from the open kitchen. Wished I would have seen them on the menu. Everyone was very friendly, including the cook staff (open kitchen).
Great addition to the neighborhood. Â I have been here many times. Food is excellent and fresh ! Â Service has been very good every time too.

Awful experience. I'm an Israeli and took a couple of friends from out of town to dinner tonight. First I had to wait 5 minutes before any of the staff even acknowledged me as I was trying to say we had a reservation. Then there were a bunch of loud Israelis at the bar and one of them started loudly mocking me in Hebrew saying I had a fat ass. I informed her I spoke Hebrew. Didn't apologize. She and her friends proceeded to yell and be rude to other costumers throughout our entire dinner with the staff not saying a word to them. The bartender saw we were uncomfortable and annoyed and all he did was offer us free ice cream which we refused since we just wanted to get out of there. The bartender pretended he didn't know them when it was obvious they were regulars. Never coming back again. Do better. Your cauliflower isn't worth it.

I ordered the lamb, it was fabulous! Along Arak which they served with mint, it was absolutely delicious!! I also had the lemonade which was refreshing! Definitely a place I would come back to. Also, I saw many inhale the roasted cauliflower, which I'm curious to try next time. In addition, the owner gave a plate of stew that someone didn't order, and then they began passing around the place roasted Â pita chips seasoned with herbs in the house.
The folded cheeseburger is a religious experience. I come here every Sunday when my hungover ass needs recovery.

EAT HERE!!! Food was so good! We shared a baked cauliflower which was made to perfection with olive oil and salt. We each had the pita sandwich with steak. Â Very similar to a gyro but better quality with thinly sliced steak and fresh veggies with homemade sauce. Can't wait to come again and try other menu items.
terrible i dont even know what they serve me Â is this really the thing i ordered lol Â  Â Portion size terrible Â  Taste average Â what a joke Â  This thing looks like shit

Exceptional middle eastern chain from Tel Aviv and Paris, now open at the Chelsea Market in New York City. Food is excellent, with option for vegetarians and meat lovers. A must try is the folded cheeseburger and cauliflower dish is very good too.

It was my first time here even though I've been in and out of Chelsea market for months now and the food seem to be decently priced for the sizes they come in. I personally got the Batata which was just three baked sweet potatoes. I ordered this on my lunch break and considering potatoes in general take about 30-40 min at a decent temperature, they were done pretty quickly. I was supposed to get sour cream with my Batata but I think I was in too much of a rush to remember so I guess I will have to try this again some other time. The serving staff was nice enough and the place was clean. So for right now this is getting just 3 stars.

The food was really really good. We got the lamb kebab pitas and they were full of different flavors. The lamb was cooked perfectly and spiced really well. Service was also great. My only issue was that there were not many drink options, but I did have a pretty good mojito.

Wow. There are no other words. This place is fresh and delicious. The menu seems a bit adventurous but everything is delicious. There are amazingly yummy vegan options for those that are plant based. I had the lavan which is a vegan option. It is a pita filled with cauliflower, scallions, tomatoes, and a delectable sauce. It was simply amazing. Staff is awesome as well. This place is a must try if you find yourself in Chelsea market.

The falafel is good but the space sucks. Music is blasting, there is no clear line, there is no space to wait while they prepare the order... every time I go i have to wait 15mins in this stressful space and I deeply regret it.

Been to the original Miznon in Israel and this place is NOTHING like it. From the set up to music to seating to complete lack of free condiments that Miznon does provide. Simple one single pita took 40 min to arrive and the best part - restaurant ran out of their signature dish - cauliflower mid day on Sunday. We didn't even get "sorry we are out" , just "no, we don't have it". How, just how do you manage to run out of your main dish on weekend while you proudly advertise that the products are purchased from Chelsea Market itself? If that's the case -go across and hallway and buy more! Customer service - impressive zero. Bye Miznon - not coming back ever again.

We came here before the pandemic, so everything was running normally. Â I lived in Israel and love love love good Israeli food but this was nothing more than mediocre. Â We were very disappointed. Â There are many better choices in Manhattan, let alone NYC, especially for falafel.

My wife and I came from NJ to enjoy the famous cauliflower from this Israeli master chef. I went up to order while my wife sat at our table and I ordered the cauliflower. Sorry we're out. Okay I'll have the ratatouille. Sorry we're out. Okay I'll have your IPA beer. Sorry we're out. I imagine the next "out" will be "Sorry we're Out of Business!!"

I had heard about Miznon and love Middle Eastern food generally so figured I'd try it. It was quite good; I ordered the lamb pita, which was pretty traditional (cucumbers, yogurt, etc.) compared to the other options (e.g., cheeseburger pita). I wish the lamb had a stronger flavor, and that there was more of it; if you're hungry, you can easily eat two of these. Â But it was still one of the better pita sandwiches I've had in the city (granted, the competition isn't exactly fierce).

Tried the falafel pita here and I loved it!! The pita was one of the softest that I have ever had and the yogurt that they use for the filling isn't as overpowering as yogurt that I've had at other Mediterranean restaurants. The falafel stuffing was nicely seasoned and one pita is a pretty good serving for one person. There is also more seating here than in most places so it was actually quite easy to find a place to sit, a nice surprise.
Overrated. So many better Israeli spots in the city. The food is not fresh, it's just ehh.
Simple menu and delicious foods. Miznon is always a favorite of mine when I'm visiting Chelsea Market. The atmosphere is laid-back but the service is always wonderful!
Loved the wild mushroom dish the pita is like a cloud! So wow & perfect. The little cauliflower was nice but needed some sauce. Great vibe & space
It absolutely lived up to the hype! Everything we had was delicious...the folded cheese burger, the lamb kebab, and the stew pita. We'll be back!

Mmmm a little disappointing. The service was fantastic but the food just ok. I got the minute steak, which was flavorful but more pita than filling. I got the "world famous " cauliflower, which I kept hacking at, expecting the next bite to be amazing, but it was just....cauliflower. I thought there would be a spice or a sauce and I kept looking for it but, Â no. Lame. Also, the staff kept barking while I was there. Literally barking, like dogs. Kinda annoying. One less bookmark on my Yelp list.
Great vegetarian options! I had friends in town who needed to eat vegetarian so we tried it and they really enjoyed it.

We got to Miznon very excited to try the food. We arrived around 7:05pm for dinner. As we were trying to walk in, we were rudely approached by a guy bussing tables and were told that they were closed. Â I couldn't quit understand the reason but I think he said it was because they were running out of food. My husband went in anyway to read the menu and the same guy was giving my husband dirty looks and tailing him. The restaurant was supposed to open until 9 PM. This is just bad business, rude and ridiculous. Â Order the right amount of food. Stay open until your published time. Sell your food. It's not that hard. Wish I could give this place zero stars for total incompetence.

Disappointed service. It's suppose to be a fast food, but it's been incredible 40 minutes and I didn't get my burger !!! Just my cauliflower, which was good, but at the end of the day, I won't be Â coming back unfortunately. One of the waitress, The young lady with long hair, Â not only didn't help with my order but also said "um sorry, but in the system shows that you already had your burger". Seriously guys ??? That's the best you can do ? TERRIBLE.

We made a reservation through Resy which was great. The food would have been good but unfortunately it was served cold and felt like it had been sitting around. Not what I would expect for having a reservation and paying $75+ for a casual dining experience. Probably won't be back.

A BIG NO on the potatoes. We were told to order it and it was literally a smashed potato with some kind of tsatsiki sauce. I must say the sandwiches were great. We ordered the rib eye sandwich and the burger was my favorite. Other than the disappointment on the potatoes the sandwiches are good.
Everyone was friendly. Cool atmosphere. Fast service. Delicious food. Reasonable prices. The falafel burger was amazing.
Good food, casual ambience. We got the falafel and wild mushroom sandwiches, liked the falafel better. Â Prices are good, $9 for a sandwich.

Ok I've been to the Miznon in Paris and legit, this place can't compare to the French location, but by itself, this place is still pretty good. Between me and a friend, we shared a cauliflower and I got the avo/egg salad pita. The cauliflower is a hugeeee beautiful burnt, salty cauliflower and it has the perfect taste of singed saltiness/juiciness. I loveeeeee the cauliflower and always get it. The avo/egg salad howeverrrrrrr I didn't like much... it was literally 75% tart, tasteless avocado with a lotttttt of egg. It just wasn't unique and didn't get me excited. It felt like random flavors smushed together... I was not into it. I would definitely recommend trying the meat options over the vegetarian options if you're not a veggie. Would be down to give it another chance though....
Hard to be disappointed here! You have to try the baby cauliflower. Â There are many vegetarian options but if you eat meat, then try the folded cheeseburger!!!
Prices just keep skyrocketing... it's not like inflation causes a $3 price hike on everything within one year. Â The portions just stay the same... I'm waiting for my cauliflower pita to become $15

Delicious Israeli street food! They have a menu of items that come in a pita and side dishes. The pita options come either as vegetarian or with meat/fish. The food really was freshly made and delicious! I ordered the wild mushroom in pita.. YUM! You could taste the smokiness from the grill on the mushrooms and veggies. My mom got the cauliflower in the pita. I tried a bite and it was also amazing! The prices are very much decent - ranging from $8-$14. There is seating inside of the restaurant and in the Chelsea Market area. The only thing I really wish they had that would make it an ultimate Israeli experience is if they had hummus and babaganush. I was craving that as a side to my pita dish, but I was so full after my meal that maybe it was a good thing they didn't have anything extra for me to buy. The food was delicious and right off the grill. Definitely recommended especially if you're an Israeli food lover!
I went there for lunch with my coworker persuasion we had the folded cheese burger in a pita & wow i must say it was delicious!!
Great food, great atmosphere, wow wow wow. don't miss the burger! Probably the best I had in my life. AMAZING

Had the lamb kebab. Very authentic. Loved the pepper it came with. Extra spicy. The price was pretty high though, but I'd say it's good to try every now and then. Israelis can make a good kebab! It tasted and looked very similar to an Adana kebab from Turkish cuisine, in a pita bread.

Love this place. My husband loves the cauliflower, and usually doesn't eat such things. I loved the steak and egg - which was perfectly contained in a perfect soft, spongy pita. My husband enjoyed the his platter. And my son who is incredibly picky was thrilled to find a cheeseburger there (special - with a pita too). We were happy to help him eat some of the cheese that had cooked over into a yummy crispness. The music and atmosphere were great, and it was perfect to find so many dessert options in the same location at Chelsea Market! Â Tough to decide between the nearby doughnuts and crepes. Will definitely go back again!!
Best Steak and Egg Sandwich! So good that I had to go back and order it twice! Pita quality on point, everything tasted fresh and yummy

The service was absolutely amazing. The minute my friend and I sat down at the bar, they served us a shot and really welcomed us in. Were extremely attentive and were passing around samples of their amazing food. We even stayed until close and they gave us amazing pita bread to take home with us. Thank you Kirk & crew for the amazing night!
Food is amazing. AMAZING. Will get back here next time at chelsea market. They have wine and beer
Delicious! Come on an off time to avoid lines. It's delicious, flavorful, fresh. Highly recommended.

Love the lamb kebab we ordered -very flavorful, fresh ingredients, pita was also freshly made. Â The line was very long, almost looks intimidating. Â But the servers are very efficient, Â things move along quickly. Â  Would stop by again next time I visit Chelsea Market

I ordered the rib eye minute steak in the pita and it was very underwhelming. The steak was very fatty but it didn't have much of a steak flavor. I felt like the whole pita sandwich was a little bland even though I tried to drench it with their hot sauce to oomph it up. Still, it could not be savored. Perhaps I did not get much of the tahini sauce or salsa...

This place had the best sandwich I have ever had in my life. I wish that the minute steak shawarma sandwich could be delivered to chefs all across the globe, so they can learn how to make an amazing sandwich. They should take one of these sandwich's and preserve it and place it at the metropolitan museum of art, because it is seriously a master piece. Full of flavor and such tender and succulent meat. The tahini sauce flows throughout and dresses the lettuce and tomatoes, but not to much to be over bearing... After I ate my sandwich, I wanted to throw it up so I can go buy another one and eat it again. Definitely 5 stars. Would recommend.

Delicious food. Fresh and tasty. Full of flavor. All items bought from the market or made in house. Amit, the manager, and Alberto (Tito) the bartender were very hospitable and made the experience great

This is the Perfect place to get a quick bite while in Chelsea Market! Â Like most places in Chelsea Market, this place has a very casual vibe. You order at the counter and your food is brought to your table. The menu is perfect for those who are vegetarian or vegan. I would recommend getting the famous whole cauliflower.
Delicious cheeseburger pita melted in my mouth. Light and airy. The dish is one of the best sandwiches I have had in awhile. Â Creative.

Just had this stuff, what a disrespect to my culture and the nation of Israel. Where is the falafel? You give baby amounts of meat in the pita I was not impressed. Not one Israeli in sight with heart and soul that represents Israeli cuisine. I asked my self if the meat was even kosher and what the owner was thinking in this concept. The most positive thing I must say is that the pita bread is authentic which is the only thing legit. If you want Israeli or Mediterranean style food this is just not it or even gonna scratch the surface.

This place was great! On my next visit I might have to try the roasted cauliflower which looked really good. I ate the eggplant pita which was pretty good! Wish they could open this place in the bay area!

I adore their ratatouille sandwich -- which is really just their spin on the sabich. Bring a friend and split their baby cauliflower! It's buttery, crispy, and salty. Only warning: the cauliflower runs out fast, and sometimes can be inconsistent.

Super delicious and fast. Not super familiar with Mediterranean food but I chose a minute steak ribeye pita and it was delicious. Staff very polite and efficient. Even got to chat with owner of biz! Everyone was lovely. Will be coming back!

We came here after seeing and reading all the hype. Totally overrated and not good. Under seasoned, unsalted, and just bland. The pita itself was fluffy but didn't hold up well under the ingredients. The "famous" baby cauliflower was a bit over cooked and need some seasoning. After the crunchy outside, it was too soft and bland. Even the outside needed more salt. They were also inflexible I'm adding avocado to one of the pitas.
If the staff wasn't so focused on dancing and playing ridiculously loud music they could pay attention to the orders placed and deliver the food correctly.
Heavenly food! simple food but full of flavours, textures and colors!
Awesome Israeli food. Fast pace and very nice. Everything is delicious and if Israelis love it means it's an authentic place.

Found myself near Chelsea market at lunch today so stopped in to try this hot new place. Great service, delicious pita, yummy filling but it's 2 hrs later and I need to eat again. Small portions for price.

Giving this 4 stars instead of 5 only because I've only been here once and just got cauliflower and green beans. Both were tasty, well seasoned, and minimally processed which I appreciate. But what I really want to give them props for (and may sound strange) is the packaging for takeout. They seem to completely avoid plastic! It was all brown/recycled paper based with bamboo cutlery, amazing! This might be the only place I've seen really do sustainable packaging right. Keep it up!

Been back several times trying to like this place as I love the ones in Paris and Tel Aviv so much. Again, the service is very disorganized and at times rude. The food doesn't come out at the same time (one time had to wait ten minutes after we had finished our pita for a sweet potato, and the food runner was annoyed at us for asking about the sides). The flavors are ok, but still something missing. Sorry Miznon NYC- you need to rethink your structure and retrain employees to be helpful.

So far so good. I had the mushroom pita which was delicious. I can't wait to come again and try something else. The service was great and really friendly too. It's really nice to go to a place where everyone seems human and the food is great too.
The food here is unbelievably good. I had the rib eye pita pocket. The pita bread was perfect in its texture, the veggie mix was just right, and the rib eye melts the moment it touches your mouth.
So so yummy- kind service. The cauliflower is huge and cool and special. The pita is chewy and delectable.

Saw the chef featured on TV and made a note to try it while we were in Manhattan. Â We were not disappointed. Glad we got there early. Chelsea Market was busy on a holiday weekend. Ordered at the register and servers delivered food to our table. We shared the lamb kebab (served in a pita) and the bag of green beans. They brought the G'beans out immediately. Served cold...they were surprising but delicious. Â Lemon, olive oil, salt for sure...not sure if anything else contributed to there deliciousness. Â Pita bread was somehow both soft and chewy. Combination of veggies and lamb burger was delicious. Â Ambience and service were acceptable but not notable. People watching was great though.

column3: Central West End, Saint Louis, MO
column6: This was probably my best ever pita joint. The fillings were creative and out of the box. Must try the cauliflower. The stark pita's are to die for. Can't wait to come back and try the rest of the menu.

Walked in because we saw the bar and decided to have a drink. While drinking we were amazed by watching the kitchen staff make the food so we decided to split a lamb kebab pita. It was so good we decided to take some food to go! Staff was good and you could tell everyone is having fun!

Really really wonderful. Â The food is creative and delicious, the menu is varied widely, the staff is very friendly. Â I watched the cook while I waited for my falafel. Â He was so caring in how he treated the food, even placing some eggs gently and thoughtfully on the grill. Â Very very impressive from entry to eating.

Delicious food. This place is crowded and after eating there I can see why. My husband and I shared their steak pita and it was so flavorful and good. They have a dessert pita with chocolate spread that I am dying to try.

Bottom line this is haute cuisine food pushed into a wonderful Pita bread. It's a little confusing because it's supposed to be fast casual and is very affordable, but it's actually subversive - most NYC fancy restaurants charge 5X for far inferior food. Don't forget to go there Friday when they have the Falafel Burger. Pure genius.
Wonderful and authentic Israeli cuisine. The best I've had in the US. Their pitas are GREAT!

The minute steak is excellent, the Lamb Kebab is beyond great, but you really should pick a day (how the hell do you know?) when they serve their version of Falafel - absolutely F legendary. This spot is awesome but they should really do something about the long lines at lunch.
Great food but almost every time I've showed up they "closed early". Â No way to run a business... I'll be going elsewhere from now on where they actually stay open the hours they advertise

Absolutely incredible. Pita was so warm and soft. Ribeye was cooked perfectly and very flavorful. The way it was filled you got all the flavors in each bite. Counter people were very friendly. Next trip I try the cauliflower.

I've been here many times and also in Â Israel, please don't say you're trying to represent different cities etc, I call BS. A lamb kebab in a pita that has zero flavor and a single index finger sized kebab for 13.65? Complete and utter joke, you're taking advantage of people and what you're doing is dishonest. You want Kebabs and shawarma? Please goto ZYARA on Rivington street in the LES, tell Khalil I sent you. Not only the most delicious, this man has fucking passion which is what Miznon lacks. Good luck.

Painfully Loud (so by definition authentic) Israeli spot with deliciously overpriced/ non generously portioned bites. Was disappointed coming here for dinner. Although the quality and flavor was on point, $50 was not enough to get a filling meal for two. Do not go if you're on a budget or looking for a full meal. Do go for a snack if you don't mind Spending a few extra bucks on smaller portions. The pita was incredible, the minute steak was amazing, the "flattened potato" SUCKED! Â Weird and cold, for 7$? Oy vey! I'm Chetzi chetzi on this place at best. Such a shame, I'd been hearing about it for MONTHS.

The staff who bring food to tables handle trash extensively between table trips and handle food after without washing hands or using gloves at any point. Completely disgusting and against restaurant hygiene rules.

I came here for a casual dinner to celebrate my birthday with one close friend. I made a reservation just to be sure we could get seats--heads up, only high top tables are available to reserve in advance (normal tables are for walk in guests), but if they have room when you arrive you can sit where you like. We sat at the kitchen counter so we could see the action, and I'm glad we did. Somehow I think I ended up with more free nibbles than food we actually paid for. There was fresh fluffy pita aplenty--the best I've had stateside, to be honest--shots of Arak (anise liquor), rich tahini, fresh okra, etc. And that was before we ordered our appetizer, the famed roasted whole cauliflower...! I had a cheeseburger pita which was delicious and medium rare just how I like it. A tasty and unusual take on classic Middle Eastern street food, and the staff from our server to the friendly guys working magic in the kitchen couldn't have been nicer. My only advice? This is not the place to bring anyone who complains about loud music. Everyone who works at Miznon likes to keep it turned allll the way up! :)
It's a 10! Â The slow cooked beef and root pita is beyond flavorful. Â I need one of these at home. Â Amazing!

Ducked in on a drizzly day to check the folded cheeseburger off my list--I will say the patty was a tad too salty for my liking but overall a solid burger option. Service was gracious and the communal seating area along the wall made for some fun solo dining. Can't wait to try the ratatouille next.

Extremely disappointing! One of the worst burgers I have ever had. The reality is that $11 for what was presented to me? Â Mc Donald's is better. Absolutely unacceptable! After 15 minutes waiting, You get a burned cheese with some Â meat( they called " a burger" on a pita with 2 pieces of cucumber, Â one slice of tomato Â and some Â tahini sauce which I never tasted and the worst yet is when your first bite the pita, Â all you get is a very burned cheese soaked in dirty oil. I asked the cashier what was her favorite pita and she recommended the burger over one minute ribeye? I literally still have a burned sour taste on my mouth after 7hours? Please don't go there, Â it's a big, huge MISTAKE!!!! Not only that, service is also horrible. Shame of me for believing on Eater NY recommendations!!!

Was so excited that Miznon was opening - Got postmates to deliver a skate pita and the cauliflower pita...and they were both pretty bad - not as good as the meal I had at Miznon in Tel Aviv. The pitas were good but the contents were not... very disappointing!

I had the wild mushroom pita and it was ok. Since the menu item said wild mushroom, I was hoping for some shitake but got white button instead. It was good but nothing special enough to be worth $11.50 for 1 pita. Guess I should've ordered the cauliflower pita...

A real tourist trap - this place has perfected an ingenious gimmick - hiding tiny portions of ingredients with fluffy tasty pitas while distracting patrons with the staff swaying to a fun playlist. Totally over-rated!
Eat a whole roasted baby cauliflower? Â You bet. Â And a scrumptious wild mushroom pita sandwich? Â Too much food for a single person to eat for lunch? Â Maybe. Â But I cant wait to do it again!

Unique. Like no other place in NYC. The superb pita pockets with the delicious fillings are excellent. The pita, that is addictive, enhances the taste of the food inside that is superb on its own. Every bite is mouth watering. The large mildly hot grilled green peppers are excellent. We did not order the roasted cauliflower but next time we will. Miznon is one of the few places that we keep coming back when we are in that neighborhood despite, sometimes, a chaos when the lines are long.

Heard about this place on the Unorthodox podcast and decided to give it a try. Quite simply: One of the best lunches around. We had the cauliflower (something I'm not usually a fan of) and it was very tasty. We followed that with the cheeseburgers. The grilled cheddar cheese surrounding the burger was just super, and the pita was almost substantial enough to hold in all the juices coming from the sandwich. (Almost. Be sure to sit near one of the napkin dispensers,) This place is a winner and we'll be back.
The atmosphere was great! I was excited to go there today and to see what this place was all about. I expected the food to very good but unfortunately it was not tasty at all. Very disappointing :(

We stopped in for a quick bite. Ordered the lavan cauliflower and ratatouille pitas and asked for spicy. Both came out topped with a spicy green sauce and were delicious. Under $20 for lunch. Highly recommend.

Don't get the hype. Mushroom pita sandwich was bland. Friend got the steak and wasn't impressed. Cauliflower was good, nothing special. Didn't have enough forks so they gave us spoons. Expensive for what it is.

Went to Chelsea market one weekend to show some some friends from out of town and just happened to come across this place when we were looking for a quick bite. The food was great and the beer was good, and everything was reasonably priced. But What made the experience for me was the energy of the people that worked there. The music was fun, and everyone was dancing. The servers would come around with appetizer samples, and free shots. All around great time!

Food is delicious but the amount of filling is so little that it's really not worth it. Â I even brought it to the attention of the one of the guys working there. Â Literally after one or two bites, the rest was bread. Too bad. There are too many amazing options in NYC to waste your money there.

I'm going to be giving miznon three stars since I can't say that I am not disappointed. While I understand that this is an establishment that is trying to "differentiate" itself from Israeli food but be Israeli...it just didn't work for me that way. Great spot with how it's set up and the ability to sit down next to "mangals" acting as tables. That was done very well. However, I came to eat and left hungry which by itself is a violation of Mediterranean culture. I got a batata since I was excited to have a fire roasted potato. What I got was pretty much a sweet potato thrown on a tray. Had to ask for accompaniment and got sour cream and hot pepper paste. Next came the lamb kabob which "looks" substantial but far from it. It comes in a yummy fluffy pita with some grilled onion and tomato (must have been a slice of each) with hot pepper paste inside and one little pepper outside. You're essentially biting veg but mostly pita on one side and kebab on the other. It tasted good but for Walmart you are paying it's a total rip off. I for one will not be back as I would like to have a substantial meal...not spend money to go outside looking for more food that won't break the bank.

Wonderful street food, but in a clean and wonderful environment. Top quality gourmet cuisine made simple in a pita or other easy serving format. A little noisy inside, and the Chelsea Market is always bustling, but really fantastic experience. I can't wait for my next visit.

I'm so hooked. The cauliflower is to die for and I'm thinking of next time I can come back to eat it. Their pita bread is amazing and I wish all pita bread tasted like this. My new favorite place in NYC and this is exactly Â what the city needed.

I had one of the steak pitas which was really good, but not enough to make me full by itself. The cauliflower, which is nine dollars, is also pretty good, but it feels a little bit weird paying that much money for what is essentially a boiled cauliflower with some seasoning. Also, one of the employees ate a little bit of the steak as he was making the food, without taking off his gloves, which made me feel a little bit concerned about the sanitary preparation. Overall I would give it four stars - you've got to expect some amount of high prices given its location in Chelsea market - but deducting a star for employee behavior.
Delicious and super flavorful! I got the mushroom and it was so yummy you didn't even realize you're missing meat. Will definitely go back and try the other items.
