Got takeout from here the other night. Staff was friendly, order was ready quick, and the food was incredible! Ordered the chicken squash curry. Highly recommend

I was very excited to try Burmese food in NYC. I thought it was a pretty decent meal. Ordered 3 appetizers to share: the tea leaf salad, chicken curry, and braised pork. It was 't the usual Burmese tea leaf salad that I've had, but I enjoyed it nonetheless, and I appreciated that they put the chilis on the side as my spice tolerance is not very high. Chicken and pork were nice and tender. The onion fritter that came with the chicken was very nice. I really like how tender the braised pork was. I also got the tamarind limeade, which was very nice. All in all, I enjoyed my meal. There are probably better Burmese restaurants in other cities, but this was pretty good for NYC:

This was my first time eating Burmese food so I was very excited to try something new! I loved everything we ate. The tea leaf salad had a very unique, refreshing flavor to it. It was a little greasier than I would like a salad to be but had great taste. The beef and potato stew was definitely the highlight. The beef was cooked to perfection, it was so soft it fell apart when you stuck your fork in it. The flavors were great as well. Highly recommend this place!

This is a Burmese restaurant. Halfway through my meal, my partner said, "There's an old man sitting outside in the cold, not ordering." When I looked, I realized it was Big Brother Bernie Sanders staring grumpily at us. I asked my partner, "How's the food?" The reply was, "Socialist quality." I had to laugh. It was true. Food was "comrade-y." Kind of bland. Nothing hits the spot. No dish would make me come back again. Everything was just OK. Nothing to write home about. Just edible. Certainly nothing like the Burmese food I've tasted elsewhere.

Started strong. The first time I tried it, it was (felt?) comparable to places in the Bay Area so I was excited. I saw they were raising money through crowdfunding for a second location and considered throwing in because Burmese food is dope and NYC hasn't had much to date. Then I went back a second time and it was still ok but not as good. Third time I don't know where the flavor went. I'm still rooting for these guys to get back to their A-game though!

Good food. Good size portion and nearly authentic. I would have given 5 star but the management oversight was poor. We had ordered food to be delivered by DoorDash. They missed the rice pudding and also sent totally burnt both orders of onion fritters. 3 pieces of them for $12 is ripoff by itself.
Cute decor but the food was quite lackluster and under-seasoned. Even the dessert was under-seasoned

I am SO excited to have this incredible spot in the hood! We tried takeout a month ago, but nothing beats going in person. Since we had already tried the tea leaf salad (absolutely delicious) we switched it up with the fried salad this time around. We had already tried the ribs, but couldn't help but order them again. The ambiance and service was amazing, not to mention the little personal heaters at the tables outside. The flavor punch on the garlic shrimp noodles was perfection, and the broth on the fish lemongrass soup was rich yet balanced. We may have ordered too much for 2 people, but everything was so delicious, we didn't want to leave anything on the plate.

I went here with my friends for a dual-birthday lunch. Unfortunately, we were not impressed with the food. Just as all of the reviews say - the dishes are underseasoned and don't highlight the richness of Burmese cuisine. I had the pork glass noodle stew and could not handle how oily it was, in fact I had to leave some broth behind because it looks like it was mostly oil anyway. My friends had the chicken curry and coconut chicken noodle soup and were equally disappointed in the food. We also had some of the brunch cocktails and those were decent, but not memorable.

My friend and I had Rangoon on our list of places to try for months and held off for a special occasion, his birthday. We were so excited & left there so disappointed. BLAND BLAND BLAH! He got the fish cake curry, so bland. Absolutely no taste. I got the braised pork village style; which had a little flavor that one can easily reproduce at home with basic spices. Nothing flavorful about this place. Perhaps things were better when the restaurant first opened & the original chef was cooking things. Expensive meal that's not worth it. The only thing good about this place was the service.
Braised Pork Curry and Coconut Rice are really good combo here. Plus wide selection of beer to choose. Highly recommend to try this place!

Last night I had the good fortune to try @rangoon.nyc's vegan offerings; or so I thought. Basically, this is yet another example of a place that pays "vegan lip service," meaning a place that really only has vegan dishes as a way to not make us feel left out when we are dining with omni friends. Their pumpkin stew ($18) was simple and unimpressive, and their garlic noodle ($17) was a huge letdown with just a few pieces of bok choy and a soy-based sauce atop some boiled angel hair vermicelli noodles. For that price, omni diners had, for just $1 more, protein choices. The strong points of this restaurant were the decor and stellar service, which should be nice side dishes, not the main course. I did mention to our server about adding vegan proteins to their dishes, so I'm eager to see them improve.

Really enjoyed our dinner tonight. We will be back! Excellent and knowledgeable team, great flavors, and veggie options. We really enjoyed the appetizers. We got the tea leaf salad, onion fritters, and meatballs. The mains are very filling, so be sure to have room! If you like coconut, don't skip dessert. Just sweet enough! The ambiance is very nice and relaxing.

I missed having Burmese food around, ever after living in San Francisco and having access to several great restaurants nearby. The food at Rangoon was unfortunately below my expectations, due to I think, poor kitchen execution. Tea leaf salad came out overly salted. The pumpkin curry had hard and inedible pieces of shell and stem. The fish cake curry was fine but a bit forgettable. A $8 sesame cucumber side was insultingly bland. The best thing we ordered were onion fritters, which were like oniony latkes. Hoping the kitchen can work out the kinks.

This was the first time I tried Burmese food and it was phenomenal!! We started off with the tea leaf salad and the onion fritters. The salad tasted amazing and I highly recommend. Add the chilies if you can handle it (; the onion fritters tasted great and had a few spices and a yummy dipping sauce. We ordered some locally brewed New York beer and we're blown away by how delicious the sour beer was. Lastly, we shared a bowl of creamy vegetable noodles. The vibe is great here and the staff is very friendly!!

As a Burmese immigrant, I was finding it so hard to find authentic Burmese food and I was so happy when Rangoon opened! Finally, I was able to go this weekend and it was amazing. I was reacquainted with a taste of home. The chef and sous chefs are all Burmese and they captured and elevated the cuisine's flavors while keeping it local. The onion fritters and the mohinga were my favorite dishes but my boyfriend also loved the braised pork curry. I can't wait to go back and try all the other items on their menu!

Very OK. Probably won't be going back. I had the fish noodle soup and it was really bland! My friends got the garlic noodles and said they just tasted like soy sauce Â their fish cake curry was really good tho. But not a lot of food for the price. Dessert was the best thing. We got whichever one has coconut.
Amazing food and good options for vegans. Â Very friendly staff, great selection of beers and wonderful atmosphere. Â  Highly recommend!

Fantastic on every level! Â We sat in the gorgeous outdoor garden area and were met with outstanding service from the minute we walked in the door. Â This was my first foray into Burmese food, and it definitely will not be my last. Â Every dish we tried was delicious and beautifully presented. Â Specifically we tried the Onion Fritters, the Garlic Noodles, Fish Curry, Ginger Pumpkin Stew, Tea Leaf Salad, Sweet and Tangy Braised Pork, the Mohinga, and the Coconut Tapioca. Â Incredibly, each dish had its own unique flavor and complemented the other dishes. Â The entire meal was delightful, and the service could not have been more attentive and professional. Â I also have to mention how unique and interesting the wine, custom cocktail, and beer lists are. Â We tried an excellent wine that was recommended to us by the staff. Â All in all, this was a dining experience we won't forget!

I'd been waiting to eat at Rangoon for a very long time. The place is always packed, the decor is beautiful, and the photos of the food looked amazing, but the food was incredibly disappointing. Let me start with one of the most popular dishes in the tea leaf salad--it was refreshing, I guess, but it lacked flavor. I could barely taste the tea leaf, and the lemon in the dressing overpowered the rest of the ingredients and it did not go well with the tartness of the tea leaf. Then we ordered the second most popular dish in the lemon grass fish soup. The broth did not have any kick to it, it just tasted like green curry with a little bit of lemon grass. There was no fish flavor (or fish), and the noodles were overcooked. The egg was cooked well, but that's about it. At that point we were 0 for 2, so I decided to try a cocktail, which was actually pretty good. To wrap up the already disappointed night, we decided to try their only dessert in the menu and ordered coconut tapioca, which was literally just coconut milk and tapioca, absolutely pedestrian and anyone can make that at home. The tapioca did not taste homemade, and the coconut milk wasn't even sweet. So to summarize: terrible food, good ambiance, descent cocktails. Two stars, but I will not recommend it to anyone.

My partner and I dined in the backyard last night. We remarked on how it felt almost normal. It's well spaced out so it felt comfortable. We ordered the Mandalay noodle salad, spicy meeshay noodle, and prawn curry. I recommend ordering the Rangoon picked ginger. It worked like a nice condiment and really added something to the other dishes. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well.

Having been to Myanmar and appreciating their culture, they are known for bursts of flavor, sour tamarind, and generous food portions. We were very excited to visit and try the food as it is one of the only Burmese restaraunts in NY. We got the mohinga, coconut curry, and a few appetizers and it was very bland. Lacking the Burmese flavor that we all know and love. This place caters to the American palette which is extremely disappointing. Simply put, this is white washed Burmese food. Â I do not recommend this place and reccomend spending your money elsewhere.

This was disappointing. Went here this fall, and I had the fish soup, which turned out not to have fish in it but seemed only to have a fish broth. Pretty disappointing not to have any fish in it when it's a fish soup and definitely priced as if it had fish in it. The food was fine. Their wine is good. But not super likely to come back since it was pretty bland generally, especially since there's more places with outdoor seating than there were in October.

As some one who lived in Myanmar for a few years I was excited to try this Burmese restaurant in Brooklyn. After seeing the menu and realizing how expensive the food is I thought it must be because they are cooking authentic Burmese food. We ordered two appetizers and two entrees. I was dissatisfied and disappointed with everything we ordered except the coconut noodle soup. Tea leaf salad should be renamed as cabbage salad, chicken curry was salty and onion fritters was over fried. Will not visit again.
Very nice staff and interesting concept. However, the food was not good and overpriced.
Ate outside - 20 degrees or so but the meal and the service kept us so warm and happy. Top to bottom we loved everything we had thank you Rangoon for keeping us warm and well fed this winter

We found Rangoon on our way back from a trek into Bed-Stuy seeking a booster for our eldest. The heated sidewalk booths looked cozy and inviting and the menu looked good to warm up to. We had bean fritters, pumpkin stew and garlic noodles. Said eldest had been planning to head up to Queens to stay with her SO, but texted "My parents lured me to stay with garlic noodles." Good jasmine lager, warm tea and very tasty pumpkin, lentil stew. A bit pricey. Friendly staff.
What a gem!! Been here about 4 times and loved every dish, but favorites are probably the braised pork and the fish relish (which is good on everything).

I have been a fan of Rangoon Noodle Lab for a long time given my love for burmese food. When Rangoon opened as a restaurant, I was eager to eat here but my first experience was bad: slow service and cold and bland food. When I posted a negative review, Daniel the owner reached out to me immediately and asked for a second chance. It was very clear that he actually cared about peoples experience at Rangoon, and he really took care of us the second time around. Everything was on time, food was delicious and hot, and the khauswe, which is one of my most favorite foods of all time, was amazing. The shrimp and papaya salad was one of the best salads I've ever had, the onion fritters were tasty and the drinks were great. The garlic noodles were on the saltier side, but the shrimp was soooooo good. We also had the tapioca dessert which was incredible and because it was taking a little while for that to come, Daniel got us some dessert wine to pair and it all went really well togther! 5 starts for the whole second experience, its wonderful to see restaurant owners actually care about someones negative experience and try to amend that. Rangoon has a forever fan now!

Food and drinks were extremely bland (like what others have said). We got the bean fritters, tea leaf salad, rangoon chicken curry and coconut chicken noodle. I don't understand why there is such a long line but the food isn't very flavorful. Coconut chicken noodle didn't even tasted like it had any coconut. The only thing I would get here is the bean fritters. Service was very good - but I wouldn't come here again just for that.

First meal in a long time where my friend and I ate everything on the plates. We started with the onion fritters and tea leaf salad and shared the pork in banana leaf and pork glass noodle soup with shrimps. Everything was delicious. Â  The manager was also super kind and had great wine recommendations. Â I can't wait to go back and try more of the menu options. Â I'm so glad we finally have a good restaurant to sit down and eat Burmese food in the NYC area.

Food was bland. Overpriced. Got 1 chicken breast and a fingerling potato for 23$. Owner was rude when we came in. Fish soup was noodles with fish sauce tasted so bland. Noodles were soggy and soaked in the soup which was pretty much absorbed. The broth was all evaporated by the time it came out. Worst Burmese food I have ever had. Drinks are overpriced and not worth it. Go here if you want to waste money.

The food was amazing, and the whole team there delightful! We had my 50th birthday party (for 30) in the backyard last week and it went flawlessly. Loved the food so much we came back for dinner again later in the week. One of our new favorites!
Daniel, the owner,went above and beyond to make a meal for my daughter memorable. Â Thank you Daniel!

We got delivery from Rangoon tonight and it was lovely! I ordered the slow cooked pork, chicken curry, fermented tea leaf salad, fritters and the noodle dish with pork. The flavors were absolutely delicious and everything was obviously lovingly made. They used compostable or recyclable packaging for the food which was a nice touch. Highly recommend!
Doesn't actually have takeout. Inaccurate information previously on yelp. Drove 40 minutes here to be turned away.

I found out about this place when I was walking my snake to the yum yum store when my uncle pulled out a cream glizzy so my great uncle came out of the closet (figuratively and litterly) so he pulled out a glock and lit the place up so my hamster died of ball cancer so my cousin told me about this place and I've loved it ever since
We got the green tea leaf salad, garlic noodles with shrimp and chicken curry. It was all mediocre, very bland. I love Burmese food so I was disappointed.
The food is very good. I had a tea leaf salad and a noodle soup with pork and quail eggs. Cool vibe.

Such a delicious meal, and lots of kid friendly options (our daughter loved the glass noodles). Â Our favorites were the tea salad and Meeshay veg noodles (slightly spicy). The owners are incredibly kind and accommodating and helped deliver our food when I had trouble with the website and mistakenly ordered pickup. Would definitely try again, hopefully in the backyard next time.

Ive had nothing but great experiences at this restaurant and am surprised to see any negative reviews! I am a big fan. The ambiance is charming and they have a fab selection of unique natural wines. We love the tea leaf salad and the soups - I always get the fish soup which is unlike anything I've tasted elsewhere and SO YUMMY. It has an onion fritter as a garnish in case you dont get around to ordering those as an app. Our service has also always been spot on - friendly and professional.

The place is a gem. We had the tea leaf salad followed by the braised pork and lemongrass fish soup noodles topped with the spicy anchovy side. Every single dish was an experience. Please don't be discouraged by the negative reviews. The food has a beautiful flavor profile and you can spice it up if you like. The portions are definitely not small. The drinks were amazing too. We had the Chili flake, St Germain, Brooklyn Sour drink and couldn't get enough of it. Â I'm writing this while waiting for my coconut tapioca. A real culinary adventure. Do not hesitate.

Pretty mediocre food here - nothing we had came with the punch of flavor you expect with Burmese dishes, some were straight up bland, others were just average. The space is stylish and they've clearly put in the effort with decoration and presentation (and the prices reflect that), but the food is bland and extremely disappointing if you're expecting Burmese flavors
Owners Great. Food Tasty. Chicken FRESH! 1 star off bc price to portion ratio skews small. I'm American. Need leftovers if paying $16 + for entree. STILL GO!
Food was cold and not so good, just a place to fill the stomach while drinking. Very loud we would not go back again.

This is good Burmese food for people who've never tasted Burmese food, and are willing to pay a lot for tiny portions. The tea leaf salad, which is usually an amazing dish (and was great at the recently closed Together in Bensonhurst) was the tiniest portion of tea leaf salad I've ever seen and was missing much of the flavor and texture that usually makes this dish special (like, there was hardly any of the sauce that's normally in it). The mohinga was a bit better but still not nearly as good as it can be. The coconut tapioca dessert was embarrassingly bad, just flavorless mush. And, again, the prices were way too high for the size of the portions and quality of the food. Sad that people who've never tasted this kind of food and who don't know any better will get introduced to Burmese cuisine in such a disappointing fashion.

I was missing my annual trip down to Maryland, which includes a takeout meal from Mandalay in Silver Spring and was thrilled to find this place open for takeout. While the menu is a bit limited, everything we ordered -- tea leaf salad, Mohinga and Wett Thar Hinn -- was delicious. Will definitely be back.
Amazing food, very delicious. I have never tasted better Japanese fare. Don't live around here but I would certainly travel just to go to this restaurant

Read the Gothamist review and immediately went for takeout (pandemic times). Â Very friendly take-out service. Â The Rangoon curry chicken and onion fritters were delicious, and I could subsist on their coconut rice alone. Â The chicken soup was good, but I felt like it was missing something... Will definitely return and try some other options!

Rangoon is a charming little place, with very clean design, terrific menu and great service. Â Tonight we enjoyed the tea leaf salad, which was probably the most impressive dish I've had in a while, meeshay noodle, roasted vegetable medley and coconut rice. Â Impressive. Â Thank you for a delicious dinner!
Recently moved to New York and have been lookin for a Burmese spot. This place did not disappoint. The tea leaf salad and curry pumpkin were phenomenal. Cannot wait to come back!

Extremely rude host and after reading the rest of these comments clearly he's the owner too. It's a shame because it has a lot of potential. Bad vibes in general, and waiting for the owner to attack my comment as he seems to do so with every other criticism.

What a gem to find! Food and service was great. This is in my neighborhood and I never knew, what a shame! Go visit and support your local restaurants...cute outdoor area and really the food was fantastic. Not many Burmese restaurants around so explore this cuisine and you'll be pleased.
Amazing food and everyone is so nice! Still hasn't fully opened but I can't wait to come back to the full drink and food menu!

Excited to see different cuisines and cultures in the neighborhood! We ordered the onion fritters, chicken coconut noodle soup and the lemongrass fish noodle soup. The flavors we thought could pack a bigger punch but it was still delicious. My boyfriend wasn't sure in the beginning but he kept eating more and he ended up really liking it and finished it. So for those who are unsure at the first bite, keep going! These were flavors that we've never tried before and we're so glad we did.

Went here to try Burmese food, but unfortunately after one hour wait, having been told 15 minutes, then 5 minutes, then "you are next" to finally being told "not sure when we can be seated". I can't question his motivation or why it was so disorganized, but that's not the way you treat customers. Needless to say, I will have Burmese food somewhere else! Totally unprofessional.
Really charming outdoor dining both in front and in the courtyard, with good food and excellent service!
Rangoon has great ambiance and food. We went with a group and everyone was satisfied. The food took a little while to come though

This food scratched an itch I didn't know I had. The food was delicious. I had the vegetable medley and my husband had the chicken curry. Heaven. The tamarind sauce that went with the onion fritters was perfect. So happy to have this place nearby. We'll be back soon.

I really hate to do this, but the beef Shan noodle dish was so offensively bad, it makes me wonder why they even put it on the menu. To call it Shan noodles is really misleading also. Overall, this isn't authentic Burmese food. Disappointing

This is not Burmese food. The Shan noodles were Italian spaghetti noodles with bolognese. The mango salad was regular romaine salad with Italian dressing with some mangoes on top. Skip this place and just order Italian.

My partner and I celebrated our anniversary last week! We searched restaurants open during the quarantine. Yelp recommended this place and boy, was I pleasantly surprised. Food was absolutely amazing!

What can you say about a 130 year old restaurant. FABULOUS! Â old school steak Â house. Cocktails superb! Onion rings a bit greasy- I would skip next time for a different side. SautÃ©ed broccoli was delicious. Steak was like butter. Chocolate mousse cake divine. Service perfect!!!!! Â Reservations on the weekend needed.

Aloisius and Damian have made our visit very enjoyable. They were superb with their services, throwing in some humor here and there. Steaks were good, of course. But really, I was more impressed with the services than the steak. It was overall a great experience! Employees like Aloisius and Damian are hard to come by!

We got the steak for two, German potatoes, and creamed spinach. The steak came out perfectly, the temp was spot on for medium rare. I was really impressed with the cut and quality of their steak because it was so good. Â They definitely nailed it when it comes to steaks but I did feel like their sides were a bit disappointing. Both the German potatoes and creamed spinach were underwhelming. The complimentary bread offered were dry and cold. And I wasn't a fan of their Cabernet and Malbec. Overall I would rate dinner as 3.5/5. Also to note they are cash or debit card only!!!

I took my son here for his birthday and it was amazing. I made a reservation online and when I got in the restaurant there was a 5 min wait for a Saturday afternoon reservation. The restaurant was packed but the service was friendly and efficient. For an appetizer we had a Caesar salad which was great. The shrimp cocktail was huuuuuge and good but too much for me so my son devoured it. They came and sang him happy birthday and the whipped cream on top of the apple Dessert was perfection. The steak was superb and cooked to perfection as well. I plan on going bk soon

It's been a couple of years since my last visit to PL, my husband and I came for the second time with our daughter this time, we made a reservation and came a little late for dinner on a Wednesday night. As always the place was packed this time we didn't seat at the bar for drinks because we were with our little girl so we decided to sit and wait a couple of minutes until our table was ready for us. My husband starts with an old fashion but their selection of wine is perfect, we didn't drink too much because I'm pregnant so we jump to the food quickly. Steak for too never disappoints, perfectly cooked and served, their bacon is the best little part of the menu, fatty delicious, and tasty, and every bite, with order also Cesar salad simple but good, German potatoes and onion rings crispy and amazing. Also, my daughter get some fries, too much food for just three but everything was exceptional. We end the night with the pecan pie and the mountain of wipe cream are fantastic. Every plate is amazing as we remember, this is a classic and authentic steakhouse with no crazy plates or surprises about their food. They keep the flavor and quality of their food and service is old fashion too. Professional servers and workers here bring good service and are always static.

Ugh. Amazing. Also, have realized that if you come on a weekday dinner before 7pm, it's just getting started so you can sit down at your actual reservation time. Truly amazing - would probably just get the steak for one next time though, as we were stuffed and had enough leftovers for a whole new meal.
Favorite restaurant in NYC. This place has done everything right. Absolutely no surprises. The meat is great, the service is great, the ambiance is great. Nothing to complaints here.

I highly recommend this place. I thoroughly enjoyed the food and atmosphere. All of the waiters were very friendly and seemed to genuinely enjoy their job. Although they appeared to be older, they were still very passionate and kind. The temperature of the dishes was always hot, ensuring that the meat wouldn't cool down. I appreciated this attention to detail. Overall, I had a very positive experience and would confidently recommend this restaurant.

My bf brought me here for my birthday. This restaurant looks cool when you walk in. I like the old school look of it. I also liked that our table had a hook next to it where we could put our coats. Service was great and really fast! As for the food, we had the bacon appetizer which was alright. We shared the ribeye for two and the German potatoes for our meal. I thought the steak was a little bland, although I did like the Peter Luger sauce. I would have liked more flavor on the steak. The potatoes were okay but I would have liked more menu options for sides like I've seen at other steak houses. The drinks were delicious. We also had the sundae for dessert which was really good and the whipped cream was really tasty. Overall a good experience. I just felt like the dinner was lacking for the reputation they have and I'd probably prefer to go to a different steakhouse.

Came here two days ago for a friends birthday and this is my second time here. Definitely recommend making reservations because this place was packed on a Wednesday and from what I hear it's packed everyday of the week. We ordered 2 porterhouse for 2 and 2 rib steak and I personally preferred the rib steak over the porterhouse because one side of it was good and the other was very dry even though we asked for medium rare one side came out medium well. Love the Peter Luger sauce and the bacon was a hit with the group. We also got tomato and onion and the creamed spinach... I enjoyed the spinach. Waiters were friendly and liquor was strong (the old fashioned) is a popular drink here.

After trying their Long Island location and not being very impressed with the experience there, I decided to try their OG location and I definitely see why people still flock to this location. A friend from out of town scored us a reservation for 5pm and the place was already packed. We arrived 10 minutes early and were seated promptly by the window. We ordered their porterhouse for 2 , ribeye for 2, and creamed spinach to go with our steaks. The steaks were cooked to a perfect medium rare and paired well with their sauce. Â Our favorite was their ribeye which had the perfect amount of fat in each bite. We were way too stuffed to try anything else, but the Brooklyn location is definitely the place to go!

After seeing in many movies and shows and seeing pics from yelp we had to give this a shot. We had to make reservations a month in advance so make sure to plan accordingly. We expected a very upscale atmosphere but actually it was quite laid back and casual which was great. The food was amazing. The steak (ribeye for two) was absolutely cooked to perfection and was extremely flavorful and tender. Everything we had was great and I would highly recommend. We loved the steak sauce, although the steak didn't require it, it was very nice to dip the bread in. The steak sauce kind of had a cocktail sauce taste/vibe. We will definitely make this a place we visit every trip to New York.

We came here to celebrate a birthday. There so much hype about this place so we gave it a try. We had steak ofcourse and the salmon dish with spinach and mash as the sides. Â Overall we had just a ok time.

I love coming to this place with my husband and family. It's a very family oriented place. Peter Lugar keeps it simple; steak, tomato and onions. Thick cut bacon, the perfect meal for any man specially my husband. He loves red meats and thick bacon. The desserts are shareable. I think it's over rated but then again it's a place with history and class. I'm not a big red meats person but there are other delicious options for people like me. The service is always great and they have valet parking.

Drove 2 hours and 45 minutes for lunch today and every minute was worth it! 4 of us each got the Luger-burger and it was amazing. So well seasoned and perfectly cooked. We shared a large plate of fries for the table which was plenty for lunch. The burgers are huge and I ended up taking half home. Everyone who greeted us was absolutely kind and made the whole experience that much more memorable. Our server was exceptional. I wish we lived closer. First time visiting and I already can't wait to go back.

The wine was excellent, great value for a Napa Cabernet as a famed restaurant. Slightly different flavor profile versus normal napa cabs as the signature pencil lead flavor didn't shine through as prevalent, it did have great dark fruit flavors such as blackberry and dark cherry and had nice smooth tannins. The bacon was seasoned well and was very flavorful. The steak for two was cooked perfectly, plate came out sizzling and the crust had amazing char. The rib eye had the most flavor as it was well marbled and also cooked to perfection. Subtle flavors from the dry aging was noted as well.

How do you describe a Peter Luger steak; melt in your mouth steak? Simple salt and pepper but literally the steak needs nothing and just melts. The tenderness and flavor stand on their own. Tried the house special sauce and while unique I opted to pass it up. Decent wine selection so chose a Staggs Leap that paired perfectly with our dinner.

Great experience dining here for Christmas Eve. Top notch food, quality steaks cooked perfectly. We did the porterhouse, tomatos, bacon, shrimp cocktail and German potatoes. All food was amazing and service was what you'd expect here: super service. Skipped dessert because we were too full! I'll be returning...

Lots of hype for this renown place. It was a letdown for me and maybe because it's too simple. The taste of fries and burger didn't stand out to me. My friends said their burgers were a must try; although I'm glad I tried it, it did not live up to its name. I would suggest trying other items on the menu.

So, I've been going with big parties. And the last was a farewell party for my mom. I had to email Peter Luger for party of 12. They respond really fast and very professional. One thing is that I forgot to mention my mom is on a wheel chair, and they didn't tell us that we reserved the table on the second floor. Â However!! When they saw my mom couldn't even get up on the steps they were soo helpful and found a table for us on the main floor. The service was wonderful. We ordered bacons, fries, onion rings, steaks, bottles of wine and dessert. The service was extremely extraordinary! Very friendly and helped with my moms dietry needs as well for her salmon. What can I say ! My family loves it! My kids loves it! Highly recommend!

Y'all!!! This place is so good. My dad and I visit NYC a few times a year to eat some good food and shop. It takes a lot for us to visit the same rest twice because of how many restaurants there are in NYC but we have visited here a total of two times now. I do recommend making reservations a week or two ahead of time because this place gets packed for dinner. The service is great and everyone is very friendly. I will say that I eat mostly chicken usually but this steak blew me away! The salad was so good and massive. I would come back just to eat the salad again. Seriously, you have to try out this restaurant if you're ever in the area.
Loved every single thing in this restaurant. We stopped in before our flight and loved everything... I was able to score reservations a few weeks before. I would recommend ending with the cheesecake
Haven't been back in three years. They still do the classics great - porterhouse, German potatoes, cream of spinach, thick cut bacon... Only the prices have changed

The food was pretty excellent. The meat was pretty good and did not disappoint. The sides were also pretty stellar, the creamed spinach, onion rings and potatoes were delicious. The food came to about 80 per person, but I will say that you could prob get some meat and a side for under 50-60 if you really tried. The service was good and ambiance seemed actually a lot more casual than expected. Yes, people looked nice but the inside of this restaurant didn't completely give the upscale look so you'd probably be able to come in a nice pair of jeans.

It's so good to be back at Peter Luger after our last visit in 2019. This place is hard to get in but luckily we were able to snatch a spot through our Amex Platinum x Resy benefits just the day before our rsvp. Service was reasonable and ambiance is always nice. Food is always great, if not better this time around. We ordered Ribeye for Two and Steak for Two this time. They are all delicious. Ribeye's great if you want more tender and sizzling meat. For sides we ordered German potatoes, Fresh broccoli -- which was surprisingly really really good -- and the OG cream spinach. A trip to Peter Luger is not complete without its famous whip cream and apple strudels. Nothing better than a giant ball of soft cream and warm apple pie in your mouth.
It's the best steak in New York and anyone who disagrees is simply wrong or salty. It's no frills. Come and eat meat. That's it.

The ribeye steak for two was tough and chewy. It was not good quality at all. Â We were a party of 6 and no one enjoyed the steak. The burger was dry and over cooked. We ordered it medium and it came well done. The lamb chops were good though. A bit chewy but overall was the best meat order. The Caesar salad was nice. I think that was our only enjoyment. I don't think we would return again. This establishment is definitely for the name and history but not what we expected. I wanted a nice cut of beef that melted in your mouth. We received a tough experience. Go elsewhere.
Once a month we reserve a table there. The receptionist lady is very corteous. The dinners are always at their top. Our company enjoys our time there.

Went here for 20th anniversary. Service was amazing and so was the food. Wife and I started with bacon and tomatoes and onions. Chopped up and blended with Luger's sauce = amazing! Next my wife had the salmon and I had the rib steak. Everything tasted like melted butter. Absolutely fantastic. We ended with the strudel. Cocktails are great. Peter Luger's is well worth the price.
My experience at Peter Luger was great the steak melted in your mouth and their house steak sauce was awesome customer service was amazing 10/10 would go again
Not too many restaurants that have been around since 1887 and they still have a horse stable (nice). Â  Obviously, they are doing something right. Â I would definitely recommend them.

If I could bathe in their steak sauce I would. Our waiter said the steak sauce is meant for everything except the steak- and he's right. The bacon and lamb are must orders. FYI the burger is only served during lunch. Staff was friendly and made for a great evening
Great food and service. Excellent meat quality. Place looks a bit outdated, but I go there for the food and not the decor.

I've been to multiple steak houses are NYC and Peter Luger steakhouse has always been on my list, I was finally able to get reservations for my fiancÃ©'s birthday and was extremely exited to finally try one of New Yorks most iconic steak houses. Upon arrival you immediately notice all of the Michelin star and zafar awards on the wall, so naturally I was excited to see what all the rave was about. We was seated almost immediately and w few minutes later a waiter approached our table with water, a bread basket and the menus. The first thing we noticed was the extremely limited menu options, it was a bit disappointing that the there was barely any appetizer or side options. For starters we got the Peter Luger sizzling bacon, the bacon was probably the best bacon I've ever had, it was delicious and perfectly cooked. For the main we had the rib-eye steak for two with a side of Peter Luger special German fries. You can hear your steak enter the room because of that signature sizzle adding onto the anticipation. When our food arrived at the table, the waiter warned of us about the extremely hot plate and served steak and fries to each of our plates. The moment was finally here, it was time to dig in, the steak tasted like a high quality steak but lacked flavor, it seems like they rely on the flavor of the Peter Luger sauce they provided. After our meal we got the holy cow Sunday for desert, the Sunday was a perfect size to share. Once we were done, our check was brought to us with chocolate gold coins. All in all, the service was amazing, the wait staff was extremely friendly and attentive making the experience amazing.
The steak was very burnt. The surface was covered with a thick layer of char that my friend had to cut off. It also just tastes like a regular piece of steak. Not worth the hype.

Phenomenal meal. I'm not a steak person but I could eat their steak everyday. Juicy, tender and very flavorful. Definitely worth the hype. We also got broccoli and creamed spinach. Both were very good. Their creamed spinach is the best I've ever had. Not overly creamy at all. And their thick cut bacon is to die for. Great service!

Best burger I've ever had in my life. Went there for lunch, ordered the burger and ... omg it was incredible. You won't find a better burger on planet earth. No joke. I dream of this burger. It's the ticket to world peace. If all the world leaders ate one of these burgers together, they'd be filled with love and happiness, and the world would be a better place.

Luger's burger was outstanding but with some tweaks would be the best in NYC I've had so far. Â The bun was meh, and the burger didn't have a sauce but honestly it wasn't needed. Â What puts this burger in the top echelon was the quality of the patty which was second to none. Â Usually the dry age burger thing is a gimmick in most of the city spots, but this thing was awesome and the dry age flavor was very distinct. Coupled with the Lugers bacon on top, the burgers flavor was amazing even without a sauce. Â Better bun and maybe a light sauce will take this to the top, still a really really good burger!

It was good, it's just not worth the cost. Three of us had a total of 3 drinks, shared the steak for two, the broccoli, the creamed spinach, one baked potato and the sundae and it was over 110 per person. Everything was good, but I don't think it was good enough to warrant that cost per person when you think about how many awesome meals we could get for that cost.

Not much to say about this place that hasn't been said. Probably the best steak I've ever had. The creamed spinach is spectacular. You must have reservations for dinner. We walked in for lunch and were seated in 10 minutes. Also, cash or debit card only. Be prepared.
No frills steak house. Doesn't feel stuffy like many Manhattan steak houses. Delicious steak dinner that comes out sizzling. Salad was fresh. Overall great dinner.

The bacon was definitely the star of the show. When you walk in, it definitely feels very busy and loud but once you are seated it is less chaotic. The steak was good but it wasn't the best I've had. The wedge salad was good and necessary with all the meats we ordered. If you had to pick one steakhouse to go to, I'd say Keen's is the place to go to instead

What can I say? Â An institution in Brooklyn. Â Made a red well in advance and was seated within 15 minutes of arrival. Â The bread was soft but the butter was hard as a rock. Â Ordered the steak for 2 and it was good but the steak sauce put it over the edge. Â We ordered Apple strudel for dessert and it was to die for. Â The chocolate coins at the end were a nice touch.

A great place if you are a steak lover and don't mind if the menu doesn't give you many options. The ambiance was old fashioned and beautiful. Â The service was timely and friendly. The ribeye steak was tasty and prepared to perfection. Their thick slice bacon is a must try. We enjoyed our visit in a lovely evening in the gorgeous Big Apple.
Quality food (sizzling bacon strips and steak) and accommodating staff. I always do family reunions here.

Had to get a Peter Lugar steak while in NYC and it did not disappoint! Â Steak for two was cooked to perfection. Â Wife did not like the creamed spinach but I did and the German potatoes were pretty good too. Â Got a slice of bacon for an appetizer and it was good, but would order something else next time as the steak was plenty of meat. Â Read reviews about rude servers but we had excellent service and no issues at all. Â The highlight of the meal was the apple strudel. Â It came with a big bowl of fresh whipped cream. Â I love whipped cream and could not finish it. Â If you love a good steak and a subway ride to Brooklyn to see a historic restaurant spending a little more is well worth it.
One of my top 2 steak restaurants in NYC. #1 goes to Wolfgang, but Peter Luger definitely is worth dinning on special occasions. In between 4 and 5 stars.

I went a few years ago with my mom and ex for dinner and let me tell you! Their steak melted in my mouth and the drinks were on point as well. The service was very lovely and the ambiance was very quiet and reserved. Definitely recommend when you can afford it. The only downfall is how far ahead you have to wait for a table t make reservations online.

I was pleased. I had come a few years back and vowed to never return because the service was so bad and obnoxious. I was pleasantly surprised today. The waiter was attentive and really nice. The food was good. I find it to be overrated but it is a good steak.

After hearing about all the rave from my sister and friends, finally made a dinner reservation. First, reservation for a decent time on a weekend was not easy. Reserve few weeks in advance is my Â suggestion. Second, no sharing of main entrees. If you do, there's a $5/plate per person fee if you share. So, the lady and I ordered a porterhouse for 2 (MASSIVE) medium rare. It was cooked to perfection. Along with the steak, ordered Cesar salad, cream of spinach, and a slice of their "extra large" bacon. Everything was great, except the bacon. It was not "extra large" and it was burnt. According to my sister's many visits here, the slice of bacon has increased from $5/slice to $8. So to my dismay it was very disappointing.
Always on point and consistent. Looking for for a steakhouse that does it right each time? Look no further. PL never disappoints
Going to Peter Luger's is a process - ensure to make a reservation at least a month in advance and bring cash/ATM card!

Great first time experience. Â Went there for lunch. Â Ordered the jumbo shrimp cocktail, lugar classic burger, fries and bacon. Â Everything was perfect. Â Ordered my burger medium rare and it was absolutely delicious. Â The service was also up to standards. Â Thank you for accommodating me for a party of one. Â Can't wait to go there again, but for the rib eye.

Bustling dining rooms with tentative servers. Usually grab a drink at the bar before getting seated and the extra dirty extra olives gin martinis are amazing. Great bartenders to talk to. Their wedge salad is amazing. I usually get the steak for 2, medium rare with creamed spinach, a baked potato and the wedge salad. Definitely a must try stop in Brooklyn.
Excellent food. Great customer service. Definitely on my list of go-to places.

Yum delicious!!! We got steak for two (probably can feed three), creamed spinach and German fried potatoes. All tasty! Bread is cold but still really good and medium steak hit the spot. We wanted to order onion rings but the portion is very big just fyi. Desserts also look tempting! Service was also easy, nice and quick

I grew up just a block from Peter Luger in Williamsburg. My brother surprised my parents for their anniversary and we all headed to New York's top steakhouse. The waiter made us all feel welcomed and naturally I began to reminisce about walking by every night on my way home from school. The ambiance was of a traditional steakhouse. You could enjoy good conversation and appreciate your food without loud music. The waiter finished the meal with bringing a delicious chocolate mousse cake for my parents. This will definitely be a family moment to remember for life.

Not gonna lie this was not my favorite experience on any level. Food was okay, service was baseline and price was insane (cash only). Extremely overrated considering it's nyc and there are thousands of restaurants serving much better food and service.

Yet again another Peter Lugers review. Will they stand up to their namesake? Of course! It's Peter Luger's. The steaks are damn good the spinach is amazing the fries are more than likely fried in beef tallow and the desserts are to die for don't sleep on the lamb chops! I highly recommend you give them a try you can get a single order and have them cut them in half down the middle so that way you can get up to four people a taste of the delicious lamb as well as steak. We had the T-bone for two a ribeye and the lamb chops. Don't forget the shrimp cocktail, wedge salad, as well as all the other amazing things. The onion rings are very good as well. Make sure you have a reservation because if you don't, you will not get a table... I highly highly highly recommend you call weeks in advance before you want to come here. They have gotten much much busier and it is getting harder to get a table at this location.

Lives up to the hype. Get the wedge, bacon, potatoes, spinach and I'd say half the steak per person (it was two couples and the steak for three had plenty leftover). Ice cream should have more ice cream and less whip since you get a side of it. Completely packed but service was still great.
Everything was on point for lunch today! Even the waiters were quite entertaining. Haven't been here in 10 years! Great nostalgic lunch did not disappoint.

The steak cuts like butter & the bacon melts in your mouth. Truly a great dining experience! I also ordered a Luger Lager, the creamed spinach & German fried potatoes which were all lovely! Don't pass up on that complimentary bread & butter either, but careful not to stuff yourself before your main meal. Came here to celebrate my SO's birthday but probably won't be back until there's another special occasion due to the prices. After tip this was a $275 meal.
Best Ribeye, Best Steak I've ever had. I've always heard about how good Peter Luger is. Even with that expectation. Tasting it and experiencing it first hand, it exceeded all expectations.

Overrated. They need to remember where they started and not ride on the established name only. Indifferent servers with guaranteed tips...your individual experience means nothing and they don't try to hide it. Steaks...sure, ok. Sauces are flat and need to be brought into this decade. Sides are boring but spinach was nice. Prices are not comparable to the 'eh' flavours and shockingly poor service. A disappointing misadventure that cost $550 for a party of 3, seperate of alcohol. The sour faced bartender, annoyed that I sat at the bar and ordered a martini was another story. Get over yourselves Lugar team. Revise what once made you great. I'll be back then.
The food was amazing!! We got the steak with a side of broccoli - juicy and delicious and truly worth all the hype!!
This was one of the best steaks we ever had and the steak sauce is pretty we will most definitely be going back there again.
Best Steak Every !! I will go back to the resturant when Iam in NewYork !! Plus the Service
Food was good and so was the service. I just wish they had a larger selection of sides like other steak houses do. And best part is the free parking lot.

Went with my parents and boyfriend. We were seated promptly upon arrival and served a basket of bread and drinks right away. For starters, we ordered the mixed green salad with vinaigrette, one slice of extra thick bacon, and a side of potatoes. For the entree, we ordered the steak for 3 as our server kindly told us that the steak for 4 would be too much. I was surprised at how fast the food came (less than 10 minutes for appetizers). The salad was dressed perfectly and the bacon and potatoes were good (nothing special though). The steak was cooked exactly how we wanted it (medium rare) and contained both ribeye and filet mignon cuts. Portion size was more than enough that we probably could've been good with getting just the steak for 2. Overall, everyone enjoyed the meal and service was attentive. Our server checked on us frequently and also joked with us from time to time.

Peter Luger is one of those iconic places that everyone should try at least once. I came here not expecting much but was blown away by how good the steak was. We ordered the bacon, steak for three, and the german fried potatoes. The steak was cooked to a perfect medium rare and each piece was deliciously tender with just the right amount of fat. It also had great flavour and did not require additional seasonings or sauces. The bacon was a nice starter and didn't feel too heavy, perfect for sharing. And the german potatoes complimented the steak well. It's definitely a treat and an experience coming here but we all found it to be very well worth it.
red meet bonk onion tomato bonk character limit brrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr waiter was nice !

Massive disappointment!!! Food was good but service was TERRIBLE!!! Our waiter seemed too busy which I couldn't understand because there was an army of waiters working there.. The hosts were also incredibly rude, they ignored us and had a full conversation without acknowledging our presence even though we were standing right in front of them... Just incredibly disappointing considering the fame this place has.. We had the burger, which I won't lie was good, but I was so put off by the gaggle of idiots that worked here, it really ruined my meal... NYC has no shortage of good steak restaurants, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE!!!

I came here for dinner on a Friday night with a group of 3 people. I haven't been here in years so wanted to see how it is now. Maybe it's less crowded because of COVID-19? It was totally wishful thinking on my part. It was still crowded. We ordered the bacon, tomatoes and onions, steak for 3, creamed spinach, German fried potatoes, and of course the Holy Cow sundae. The steak was really good but pretty overpriced. I would skip the bacon, tomatoes and onions, and sides. The bacon wasn't anything special. The Holy Cow sundae was good and super decadent. Service was great, our waiter was funny and very attentive. I would probably only come back for a special occasion since it's a bit too pricey. I think there's better and cheaper steakhouses in Manhattan like Sparks or Keens.

My kids & I took my husband for his birthday since he had never been. Â Brought me right back to my childhood. Â If you are looking for a snazzy cool 21st century steak house...no...this is the same plain and simple place it always was. Â Start with the sliced tomatoes & onions & slather their secret sauce on, have the thick cut bacon...Just do it! Â Get a nice steak...rare! Â It keeps cooking in the plate, side of fries & creamed spinach! Â Did I forget the over the top bread basket! Â Pay the large bill in cash & roll on out of there. Â Expensive? Â Are not all steak houses now? Â Cash only..yup...worth every calorie & dollar? Â Oh yeah!!!!!

Went here for my graduation dinner with family. Place was busy and getting a reservation was not easy. Â Steaks were great, the salad with the big tomatoes wow sooo good! Service was excellent! Downside, wish it wasn't so crowded. But what can you do, if the place dishes out great food, it's gonna be popular.

Best steak ever...I was confused when I heard no fillet minion but every piece of steak in that mf taste like fillet minion; even the shrimp tastes like fillet minion lol...and if u don't order the bacon then you're just weird or didn't have enough

Excellent service, classic old style steakhouse, certainly a fun experience. For $200 a person I expected a life changing steak where it was ho-hum. Maybe we just got a bad cut but ours was chewy and a large run of fat on the NY strip side.
The food did not live up to the hype. The meat was very chewy and lacked taste for a porterhouse. The service was awful and the people inside who worked at the bar kept giving dirty looks.

I went to this location for a birthday dinner and it's definitely a staple in the community and reservations are hard to get but worth the wait. We order steak and seafood and everything was amazing. Everyone should have a date night at Peter Luger's!!!!

Peter gosh darn Lugers!! Felt like I was in Hollywood against those Bruins but sure enough just the Brooklyn burrow. Paisans everywhere giving me an earful but my kitties are young and timid. What isn't timid? The steak!!! Holy cow flavors a plenty and delicious cuts. Susie was sweet with the towels for plenty of sweats - no slippage! More I travel, more I realize how lucky I am to still travel, lose, and enjoy the BBN steak account!
Hamburger has odd taste. Very overrated. Cheesecake is terrific. Wait staff is very professional.
Very good food wow thank you for the recipe it was delicious thank you so much thank for

What an experience! Definitely a special occasion type of place! We traveled back in time considering the old fashion decor and the age of this place. They know what they're doing. The steak was perfectly cooked, spinach was delicious. The staff treated us like gold. See you again soon
It's gone downhill. Not as good as it used to be. Looks like they are focused on turning over as many tables as possible rather than quality.

Worth the hype! For 2 of us, we got the porterhouse (medium rare) for 2, fries for 2, sautÃ©ed brocoli and bacon and could not finish it all. Everything was delicious and the atmosphere is a true old school steak house. Will be returning!
Atmosphere is terrible, service ok, steak used to be great, but it has declined over the years.

This experience is everything you dream about! We went there to celebrate my son's 18th birthday and it was a complete success. We arrived over 1/2 an hour early and they were ready to seat us. We started with the thick cut bacon, a Caesar salad, and the wedge. All were great sized portions and absolutely delicious! The dressing on the Caesar was especially creamy. We next had the steak for 3 cooked medium rare. It is served sizzling and was melt in your mouth delicious. We also shared the French fried potatoes. They were fresh, hot, and perfectly salted. We finished up with key lime pie and Apple strudel. They were served with schlag which was the perfect accompaniment. Both our son and daughter agreed it was the best meal they had ever eaten! We look forward to visiting again!

Peter Luger lived up to the hype and I definitely will be back every trip I am in New York. Michelan Â rated abs makes sense. Excellent service and very organized and fast service. The food came out so fresh and fast. I loved everything I had.
One of the best steaks I've had !! Perfectly cooked , so good, Desert was also very delicious ice cream chocolate sundae and best cheesecake.

Way better than expected! I had some concerns about going here after reading other reviews. I'm pleased to report that it's worth the hype! We had a reservation for lunch, and we were immediately seated once we arrived. While I wouldn't say our server was friendly, he got the job done and was attentive. We had the bacon, lamb, and steak. They were all fantastic and cooked to perfection. Typing this review is making me hungry. A surprising and welcomed twist were the out-of-this-world desserts. Treat yourself and get dessert too. I promise, you won't be disappointed.
Peter Luger is well known for being an authentic NYC steakhouse with Michelin quality and amazing service. Just writing this review to say all of that is true!

This place is incredible. Went to the city specifically to try it out after getting a recommendation from someone while I was on vacation abroad. It definitely lives up to they hype! The serving for the steak for 2 was large (we could barely finish it because there was so much) and the quality was top notch. The waiters offered to give us the bone in a bag to take back from our steak to give to our dog. Overall very friendly and attentive staff. Will be back! I heard the salmon and burgers are also amazing. You really can't go wrong here! Just be warned that it's cash only and you should prob make a reservation far in advance.

Out of all my NYC trips, I finally got to try the famous Peter Luger's Steakhouse. I will tell you right off the bat, it did not disappoint. I have been watching videos and shows on them for years and I was so psyched that I got to finally try it. The Pat LaFrieda dry aged steaks were cooked to perfection and the service and presentation are on point. We also tried the beef bacon, which was amazing, and you have to get the tomato and onions to pair with it, as it is a little salty. German smashed potatoes were also a hit! I think the Steaks for 3 was a little much for even us four guys, but having a little extra is better than not having enough. I think ribeye for 2 would have been enough for us four to be honest. Amazing! It definitely lived up to the name and hype that we were expecting.

Peter Luger is an iconic NYC steakhouse you must experience, even if it's just once! I visited during lunch, which is recommended if you're looking for a more low key dining experience. I recommend making reservations, but you can get a seat at the bar most times. Expect old NY steakhouse service! I ordered the Luger-Burger with cheese, bacon (highly recommended), and fries. It was cooked perfectly at medium rare. Overall it was a super tasty burger and very filling! It's obviously on the more expensive side of the burger spectrum & overall pricing for food, which is why I think this institution gets bad reviews, but I left feeling happy & content. I look forward to returning for a steak dinner experience.

It was nice restaurant. I went there with hubby and parents in law. We all had a wonderful time. Made a reservation but it seems like doesnt have to be. There were people coming after us still gets table pretty quick. However i am not sure about the reason how this restaurant is that much famous. Once is enough for me but overall it was good.

Good ole fashioned steakhouse .. great porterhouse for 2, broccoli was good had a light seasoning to it, baked potato was standard. The bacon was awesome and the drinks were tasty enough and strong. We had the sundae for dessert and it was more than enough for two pple with an additional tower of whipped cream.
Yes the steak was amazing . The appetizers were great. The wine was sweet and I enjoyed my meal.

This is a NYC classic! Always wanted to try it and it was good! Dry aged prime beef! I can see why this is a institution for it. Now that I have tried the gold standard and have to see how others measure up.
Classic steak house straight forward amazing simple sides. My favorite is the cream spinach!
This is my favorite place. Steak is always perfect and service is top notch. I love the old fashioned charm about this restaurant. It's my goto restaurant for a special day.

Great place if your a steak person. Beware though these are not your average steaks so prepare to loosen your belt a bit after the meal because it's a large serving size. Hospitable customer service, great desserts, and delicious choice of spirits. Put your plastic away because they only accept cash transactions.

Was glad to be able to come here during lunch rush. Â  I was seated next to an outlet so u cld watch my old Iphone charge at nearby distance lol. Â I got the burger medium rare with side of bacon to add on top. Â  This was fucking good. Â Classic burger and service was decent they didn't overly bother tho I had to wait a bit when I wanted another drink to try. Â Next time I'll come for the steak but it's def worth trying the lunch time only burger? Why? Cos it's an American classic

The best steak I've ever had. I'm a huge meat lover and have been to many many famous steak or bbq restaurants. This is truly amazing. Looks thick and dry but once you put it in your mouth, it melts like you don't even get a chance to chew lol Our server Marian was professional and entertaining. Host was pleasant and nice too. Great and great experience

Peter Lugers is iconic it's not much you can say about Â and icon going strong. From the first step through the famous doors to the last step out, impressive service impeccable food. Â Like that old saying it's it's not broken no need to fix it. Â PL might not have all those fancy. Sides like other steak houses but Â you go there for the steak not the sides. Â We ordered Â a porterhouse steak, creamy spinach and a burger. Â Soft succulent flavorful steak Â with a splash of Luger sauce and it's a match made in heaven. The burger was wonderful juicy Â cooked to perfection. Def a go to spot.

Possibly one of the best steaks I've ever had, and absolutely well worth the money and the wait! The ambiance was lively and fun and the service was spot on as well. Already counting down the days till I go back and experience it again.

Thanks for the clogged artery! Â Johnny Carson claimed this was the best meal he ever had. Â I will agree at least partially, it was a great steak, a strange and surreal German experience, and a massive bill, but hey it was my BIL's birthday, and coming here for it has been a tradition in his family for many years. Â I think one of the sides someone ordered I could have left behind, but all-in-all quite a ful-filling experience. Â Medium rare, buddy! Â And yes, we made reservations
Steak for two, medium rare and the first bite we say "wow". The chopped salad and bacon will change your life. It's a trek to get here from Manhattan, but worth every penny.

Phenomenal! PL has been on the list for years but only just today had the chance to go. Tried the bacon, steak for 4, lamb chops, cream spinach, potatoes, and some desserts. Everything was cooked and prepared to perfection. Granted we're not huge steak eaters but I can't imagine how anyone would consider PL sub par. For us it was delicious. Even took the bones home to share with the dog!

Either you get it or you don't. Nothing fancy as it should be. Just really high quality excellent food. The service is exactly as an old world old school steakhouse should be. It is delightfully rude but still adequate, proper, and polite all at the same time.

I've been coming to this one and the one in great neck for 30 years.The porterhouse is the best porterhouse out there.Normally the service is just okay but the waiter we had last night was as good as the steak.we started with the tomato and onions and bacon.then we had the porterhouse with cream spinach and Luger fries, everything was excellent. My younger daughter is a vegan and the waiter was very accommodating.while the menu is certainly not vegan friendly he took time explaining what was vegan and what was not vegan. She Â got the mixed green salad with vinaigrette dressing, baked potato and steamed broccoli. She said it was okay but nothing special,all in all it was a great night as usual

Amazing steak. Literally the best you can have. I can't wait to go back!!I recommend sharing steak because they are big portions. If you have a party of 4 get a steak for 3. If you have a party of 5 get a steak for 4.

Without a doubt the, Â or one of the, best steak houses in NYC. Â Traditional ambiance, superb waiters, fantastic meat, accessories (including cream spinach, onion rings, Canadian bacon, etc.) & deserts!

An excellent, classic steakhouse experience. The steak did not disappoint - it was cooked perfectly and had delicious flavor. I actually preferred it without their signature steak sauce. Spring for the cheesecake with shlag at the end of the night, one of the best I've had. Removed one star as the sides and apps were tasty, but not showstopping. Overall very pleasant evening and will be back.

I've come to Peter Luger EVERY year for my birthday since 2017. My favorite steakhouse in NYC and I've gone to most of them. Always get the steak for 2 (or how ever many people join me). Sometimes gets the creamed spinach, sometimes gets the bacon(so good) Â but this time got the Caesar salad. They give you gold coins after dinner. *chef's kiss* see you again next year. Thanks Mike!

One of my favorite steakhouses in NYC since forever! Must get their thick sliced bacon, onion rings and their steak of course. The steak comes on a hot plate in case you need the meat to be cooked more. Their sides are superb especially their creamed spinach and don't forget to leave room for dessert!! We saw a table of 6 people ordered 3 cheesecakes so we got it as well and that was the perfect ending to our meal!

Awesome experience at Peter Luger. Had the steak for 2, a baked potato, and broccoli. Also got a drink or two. Everything was great and our service was over the top good. Steak wasn't the best I've ever had but very good nonetheless. The broccoli surprised me by how good it was. Drinks were cheap. I'll be back!!

Place was absolutely horrible. The wait staff is SO rude. I took 1.5 seconds to think of what beer I wanted and the guy said "I got about 10 other things I could be doing so I'm gonna walk away and let you think" and stormed off huffing and puffing. Every time he dropped out food or drink it was in the rudest manner. Not one person there had a smile on their face and was nice besides the people at the front desk. Truly horrible experience only come here if you want to be talked down too!
The steak literally melts in your mouth, it was so good. The bacon was amazing especially with that infamous gravy of there's. The service was ok.

Best steak and old world ambience in Brooklyn . Been going there since I was a kid. My dad was one of the "boys " and every time I went food was good , service was excellent and things have not changed in the 60 or so years I've been there.

Everyone says it's the best because it simply is. Every dish is so thoughtfully created and cooked to perfection. They keep things simple because the quality is just there. If you don't want to splurge on the steak make it in during lunch hours and have the burger - it's $19 and one of if not the best in the city!
Truth be told.. the steak wasn't that good. I can get a Tomahawk steak for 2 at Larsen's that is far more tender and flavorful than the steak at Peter Luger's.. Give me a thumbs up if you agree
Nothing left to say here, you need to go at least once in your life. Iconic, amazing, delicious. You don't go for the wine list.

Great steak, not that great side dish options, decent service but not the absolute best. Came for a birthday, but don't expect them to do anything - the most they'll do is add a candle to any dessert you order. Spinach side dish also quite good. Baked potato is as you'd expect. If you really care about meat then you'd enjoy but if you're somewhat meh about steak then it's a good experience but a lot of food.

Great experience for meat eaters and occasional meat-eaters like myself. We made a reservation for 4:45 PM on a Sunday, which was the only time available other than 9:30 pm, 2 weeks out. They definitely earned their Michelin star. The service was excellent, the display of meat was very impressive and impeccably cooked. The creamed spinach was my favorite side (the steamed broccoli is... literally... 2 heads of broccoli, steamed. I've never seen broccoli served that large). We got a filet mignon, prime rib, and porterhouse. My favorite was the prime rib - so soft, melt in your mouth. And, we go tot take the bones home to make soup for later. Would recommend to try at least once if you're in NYC!

Steak is amazing but just want to question who tf is recommending the cream spinach? This is literally canned spinach with maybe some stock for flavoring. Get the steak, stay away from the spinach - fr fr no cap

My fiancÃ© has been raving about this place since we first started dating and this was our first trip to NYC together. I made him make reservations for us so I could see for myself if it lived up to his hype. The ambience was cozy and very inviting. The manager was kind and even seated us 30 mins earlier than our original reservation because we got in early from our flight. We ordered the steak for two, a Caesar salad, and creamed spinach. When the steak came out, it was sizzling hot and gloriously glazed. My first bite of the filet side was delicious, but the sirloin side was exceptionally mind blowing! I LOVED the crunch of charred fatty edges and the occasional subtle hint of sweetness in random bites. The creamed spinach was a beautiful compliment to this steak. I tried their famous steak sauce with my meal, but honestly the steak can stand alone. Contrary to my nature, I didn't even order dessert because I wanted to savor the last tastes of the main entree. The hype is real!!!
Always amazing! And the service was even better this time around... Expensive.. yea, but it's worth every penny I spend in there! Always my go to for amazing steak, great service and key lime pie!
Overpriced for what it is and obnoxious patrons. It was good once and a regular place for steak; hasn't been in 10+ years.

We have always enjoyed Pete Luger's food until last Saturday night when we wnt out to dinner with our granddaughter and her friend. We ordered porterhouse steak with hash fries and creamed spinach, and rhe steak was way too salty fior my husband and mytself. Â We both could not get home fast enough to have some cold water. We live in Westchester so it was a long ride. I have hih blood opeessure and I am somewhat sensitive to the taste od salt as I usually avoid it at all copsts. This steak , in my opinion, was oer-salted!
One of the best steakhouse I have been. Friendly staff as well. We ordered steak for two this time

Steaks were delicious. We had the steak for 2 and ribeye for 2. Amazing! We also had the Caesar salad, the broccoli, potatoes and for dessert , the strudel. Our waiter was fantastic, very knowledgeable and helped us navigate the menu.

Having been here a few times, I came again recently for the hubby's birthday. This was right after they lost their Michelin guide recommendation for the year of 2022. One thing that has stayed consistent, is their food. The food is delicious and stays true to itself in what they're about. The Steak for Two was made perfectly and still cuts and melts in your mouth like butter. We ordered our steak medium rare, as they recommend, but some parts were a little too red for me. The sides are true steak sides and we ordered the must haves - the German potatoes, creamed spinach, and a thick slice of bacon. The bacon is my favorite and you won't find anything else like it. At the end, we ordered the Holy Cow sundae. So thick and delicious, but sooo good. And of course, we got the Peter Luger coins after. Food was great, but service was really lacking. The waiter wasn't very attentive and kept forgetting things, like my glass of wine, the napkins we asked for, my coffee at the end of the meal, and the coins. We came on a Thursday night and we had to wait a bit for the seats despite having a reservation. All in all, still worth the price point for the delicious steak, but don't expect five star service like they used to. We enjoyed our meal very much though.
Steak was delicious and perfectly cooked, a little on the rarer side of medium rare. Love it! Very delicious. I'll definitely be coming back. Happy dining!

I really liked this place. The food was good. The customer service was decent. I felt like my server was a in a rush the entire time. He would begin to walk away before I could complete a sentence and then have to return. This is a cash and debit card establishment. No credit cards are excepted. There is no valet. Street parking was available but I can see it being challenging at times. There is a $5 fee for sharing one meal. I enjoyed the ribeye. The lamp chops looked amazing and my mother said they were. We enjoyed a side of broccoli. I have to admit it was well seasoned. I enjoyed the key lime pie. The pecan pie was absolutely terrible. I placed an order for a single steak to go. I was told that steak was amazing as well. The takeout orders are placed in a foil lined paper bag. It really keeps the moisture, heat and flavor in the food. There was no need to reheat the food. I would have given this place five stars if I didn't feel rushed by my waiter. I would definitely recommend and return! See you again!

A classic for a reason-- Peter Lugers lives up to its name with perfectly cooked steaks and almost better sides. We enjoyed onion rings, creamed spinach, potatoes, and broccoli along with our steak and each one was better than the next. Pro tip, be nice to the maitre d', he is the gate keeper to scoring a good table on a busy night.
So worth it! Just go! Not sure why I didn't get to this place earlier in life. Steak for two, Caesar salad, fries, baked potato, huge jumbo shrimp and apple pie. Omg so so worth it!
Amazing service, amazing food. Could never go wrong for lunch or dinner. The atmosphere is warming, always felt like I was home. Only thing that would be missing is my Tv.

A great steakhouse in Brooklyn, you can't go wrong by coming here. While I usually see Peter Luger's extra-thick cut bacon at my local supermarket, I did not realize how thick the cuts actually are. The Luger's Sizzling Bacon was my personal highlight of this meal. The bacon, along with some of the other appetizers, is the main reason that I'll come back here. Although I didn't enjoy the Creamed Spinach as much, their other offerings in the Fresh Broccoli, Baked Oversized Potato with Sour Cream, and Luger's Special German Fried Potatoes were exceptional. The broccoli provided a green color to the overall meal and was well-seasoned. The baked potato was soft, delicious and paired extravagantly with the sour cream. The execution on a simple dish like this was nothing short of perfection. Their fried potatoes (read french fries) were a favorite as well. I'll definitely be back soon!

This place is heart and soul of Brooklyn. Established in the eighteenth hundreds and located in one of the most historical buildings. It gives the old school vibe from the minute you step in. It's always packed and crowded because it's extremely popular and it lives up the hype. The atmosphere is amazing!!! The food is absolutely delicious. Once you give this place a try, you will keep coming back. Keep it up, Peter Luger!!!!!
Favorite steak house hands down and the best drinks. Very few restaurants make a proper French martini so if you never tried one do so here.

The restaurant made a name for itself by keeping their specialty for ages. Â We were underwhelmed by somewhat indifferent service. Â But on a second thought, this may be a part of genuine effort to keep a place authentic to its roots

We ordered the steak for two, french fries and creamed spinach. They also give you a bread basket with some sauce. The steak here is good. I would definitely come back here and eat the steak again. I do wish they had more sides, however. It would be nice to have mashed potatoes, mushrooms or Brussels sprouts. I'm not a fan of the french fries and creamed spinach that we ordered. Both lack flavor (especially the creamed spinach). Overall, good steakhouse but needs improvement with the sides.

It lives up to the hype, trust me!! Was there with a larger group of friends to celebrate a birthday and we couldn't have had a better time. The food was delicious, dessert was phenomenal and our waiter was hilarious. Would highly recommend.
Tried the porterhouse, Meat was tasteless in my opinion had to drench in sauce to enjoy it
Awesome!! Food was great and so was the service!! Â This restaurant is a staple in the city for generations!!

Filippe was our server he was great. My son in law wanted to go to the original Peter Luger. We went and he was not disappointed. The 3 person porterhouse steak medium rare was cooked to perfection.
