The cheeseburger and hamburger medium rare was so big and juicy. We had creamed spinach and French fries and the potato special. The rolls and bread were delicious. Great food great service. We will be back

Located in the Williamsburg section of Brooklyn, is the third oldest operating steakhouse in New York City. Peter Luger Steak House. Long before ever stepping foot in the place I've been buying their steak sauce. It's been my secret until now. Sweet tart with the horseradish kick. It's incredible. I finally got to try the real deal. The bread selection was great with mini parker house rolls and onion tarts, they were correct with butter and dipped in the aforementioned steak sauce. Perfection. Then 2 of the thickest cuts of bacon came and you guessed it, went perfect with the steak sauce. The only thing that didn't need the steak sauce was the porterhouse. Sirloin on one side of the t shaped bone and filet on the other side. It arrived on a sizzling plate that was angled on another plate to allow dipping in the juices. Creamed spinach and German potatoes accompanied. A must experience for any steak enthusiast.
Twice baked potato and the steak were cooked to perfection! This might've been some of the best sautÃ©ed spinach I've had ever!!! Well worth it

The best steak I've ever had! I flew from the West Coast just to try this place!! It was DEFINITELY worth the journey!! I looked for the top steakhouse in NYC and this is it!! It was better than Keen's Steakhouse!! The steak was served up sizzling in butter, perfectly cooked and well seasoned. It'll knock your socks off!! My party had the complimentary bread basket, bacon appetizer( to die for) , Luger burger (really delicious), cesar salad, wedge salad with bacon, creamed spinach, steak for 3 and apple strudel for dessert. They also gave us the 125th anniversary chocolate coins. I wish I lived here in NYC so I could come here more often. It's all downhill from here! Nothing is better than Peter Lugers Steakhouse!!!!! Everything was great!!
This place is worth the hype! The steak was amazing. The bacon was an absolute must! The service was great. Overall top 5 steak houses I've ever been to.

Such bad attitude I tried to make a reservation and the man wasn't helpful and was so rude. He just told me that they don't have any available times tonight and told me to come back next time without even asking if I would like to make a reservation for another date. No class. trash. Lol
Steak house quality food, with a casual vibe. My kind of restaurant, simple but quality ingredients, made to perfection.

I had a craving for a burger, but I didn't want the usual burger. So I found the PL burger review on Infatuation NYC, and I can say that the burger is delicious. However, it's a hearty burger, much like biting into a full-on steak. It's very filling and is even better when you add the extra thick bacon to it, which adds a smokey and fatty flavor dimension to an already great burger. It's excellent in its simplicity. However, I do wish they had the option to add sharp aged Cheddar cheese instead of plain American, but the burger was still good. I think they need to fix the fries, they're a bit bland, and I would have liked sweet potato fries instead as an option. However, I will say I didn't eat too many of the fries because I was already so full from the burger. I like that I could add my condiments. I am a fan of Sweet Baby Ray's Honey Chipotle BBQ sauce with this burger. It worked well with the burger, cheese, and bacon. The other thing I will mention is if you're doing a pickup order as I did through Caviar, you need to go around to the left side until you come to a grated steel door with a doorbell next to it. Push the door, and the employee with open the door and ask you the name of your order. It's a bit confusing where to pick up your orders, and I wished they had a sign that tells you where to go as a random gentleman directed me out front to the proper location. I will say it's been a while since I last came here, but I noticed the place has a much posher crowd for a Saturday night than years ago, where ever was dressed in business attire as opposed to casual or business casual. However, it could have been that that was the type of crowd that was there that night as opposed to the norm.
I found this place completely underwhelming and was a bit too factory-tourist-vibe vs best old time steakhouse feeling... value doesn't match the quality of food...

One of the best steakhouses in NYC. Best to go for lunch so that you can get the cheeseburger - my fave. Also order: tomatoes and onions, Cesar salad, onion rings, steak duh, and shrimp cocktail if ur feeling fancy.

I was a little disappointed. This place has been talked about my whole life about how amazing the steak is and how it takes forever to get a reservation and it's well known. If i'm paying that much for a steak but i'm looking at what looks like the inside of a 1600's tavern, I was turned off. I felt over dressed, thinking this is a nice place but it's a bar with expensive steak. that's it. The steak was like the rest of these reviews, OK at best. I was told that if they're giving you steak sauce without asking that's a red flag and that they are aware that the quality isn't as good as they portray and the rest of my party was just as disappointed. I enjoyed my meal, but i wouldn't come back here.
Great experience and ambiance. Food was delicious, service outstanding. They let you enjoy your time and no pressure to rush. Look forward to visiting again!

When you arrive, you walk into a hallway filled with old historical photos. You can feel the history and smell the steaks cooking. Steaks are served family style in a German great hall. Diners vary from businessmen to families dressed casually. Steaks are tender and flavorful, but the menu is limited. I would say the best part of the experience is the restaurant's beautiful old world charm and setting. Kids love to go- staff is always very friendly to everyone, but especially the children. They pass out these special chocolate "Peter Luger gold coins" to the kids and they absolutely love them! They are also quite tasty (mild milk chocolate). Make sure you to make a reservation because they are also busy! Be sure to bring cash, too, because payment is cash only.
We've been to many steakhouses from LA to Honolulu... but no place compares to Peter Luger's. The steaks here are always amazing with the perfect sides. We have to limit our indulgences biannually!

Our foodie buddy highly recommended this place (persistently)... so we included it during our NYC visit. The menu was simple and straightforward... Meat, and nothing else! Delicious... great service...

Exceptional as always. Our waiter went above and beyond. The steak was served at its optimum temperature of medium rare. The German potatoes is as tasty and crunchy as they would be and creamed spinach perfect. Very accommodating for our party. However, the dreadful hostess they have at the door is recommended to be removed. Her place belongs in a cafeteria, with the bile attitude and demeanor she presents. Â (That's being kind). Lugers has always presented an outstanding service of indulgence and elegance. Get rid of the dead weight. For any further details, please do not hesitate to reach me.
We ordered 5 burgers. 4 of them came out the wrong temperature. Cooking meat to the correct temperature is literally the single most important thing a steakhouse has to do. Lugers failed.

The food is fine. The steak, cheesecake, schlag, and bacon are all delicious but overpriced. The cash requirement is ridiculous. I believe they started to accept credit cards a few years ago, but I noticed everyone who used Chase was declined.

So ridiculously OVER hyped. Service is mediocre and food is disappointing. The lamb was dry and steak lacked flavor. The only ok dish Â on the table was the two slices of thick bacon, generously giving 2 stars just for the bacon.
Celebrated my birthday here. I won't say this is the best steak I've ever eaten, cause it's not, but overall good experience. I just wish the tables are not so close to each other.
Disappointing. That's all I can say. Super brightly lit and underwhelming food. Cocktail was terribly made and there was zero presentation with any of the dishes. Not worth the $$. Skip it folks.

Ate here for dinner on Sunday, August 8. Â We ordered steak for 3, Caesar salad, broccoli and creamed spinach. Â  Â Prior to our food coming out we were given really tasty bread that my kid daughter absolutely loved. Â When the steaks came out they Â were cooked to how we liked (medium well) and was super tasty. Â The broccoli and creamed spinach were okay. Â For dessert, my wife and I shared a NY style cheesecake and my daughter got the sundae. Â Both desserts were fantastic! Â Only complaint is that we were sitting outside and it was a bit cold (started to rain). Â Other than that, we will def be back but will make sure we dine inside.
Incredible food. Incredible service. Went here for our 2nd wedding anniversary and we can't wait to go back.
Overpriced tourist trap. Good cuts of meat served with ketchup. Â Try strip house instead
Ordered 2 slice for 2 medium rare with 2 appetizers for 2. Went upstairs to the third floor. Service was incredible. Waiter was friendly Â knowledgeable passionate and proud of Peter Lugers.

My expectations were high. Â I was so impressed. Even my man was like damn that shit was good. We wanted to get a ribeye and a single but we wanted to know what parts we we're dealing with. So the waiter suggested a steak for two.. it was so good I felt like we were celebrating someone's birthday. My dude had to get a slice of bacon and it was a good idea because we had it with a salad. The gentleman who cut her steak was my favorite. Lol he proceeded to put vitamins on top of our cut pieces of steak. Aka butter and oil. I was dying. That New York sense of humor I love it. This place is way better then house of prime rib in San Francisco. Some say I shouldn't be able to compare those two but I really don't care. I'm definitely coming back.

There are rare occasions where the service is so bad that you have to give 1 star. The waiter, Martin, never even show up at our table until check time. We gave a 16% tips for a lunch. He demanded 22%. Excuse me, what did you do? You didn't even fill up my water. And it was not a cheap lunch. It was a $230 Â + tips lunch that the sever never even bother to show up except for serving us the steaks. And as he counted the cash, he insisted that we should give a 22% tips, for what? For doing nothing?

There are so many really good steak houses in NYC so it's hard to say they are the best. I do think it's a great place to take out-of-towners out because of the history. I'd rather go for Friday burger specials.
Went for lunch last Friday to the one in great neck total rip off terrible food greasy steaks fatty over dry aged poor service the place looks dingy and old terrible, A total rip off never again.

The food was ok. It just tasted like normal steak. Nothing special at all. The service was so bad. I was the only Asian person there and I could tell that the server was treating me differently from other people. He would go and ask people whether they needed anything else or if the food was ok, but he kept giving me a look and an attitude as if he wants me to leave early. Basically, he was treating me like I should just eat the food quickly and get out of the restaurant. I felt so disrespected and he complained and demanded more tips when his service was subpar. It was a terrible experience. I would have thought about going there again if the food was at least good, but it wasn't special at all. Super normal taste that you can probably cook by yourself.

You cant live/visit NYC and not have one of PL steaks at least once. So I did. Was it the best steak I ever had? NO. Was it a place you want to try? Maybe. Is the buzz surrounding it is too much? Defiantly. So you see where I am going with my review. I go with 4 stars since I did enjoy a good steak. But the IMO, prices are too high. 4 stars.

Way too expensive for the taste. Not exciting whatsoever. Only reason they can charge so much is because they have a Michelin Star. Go here to impress people with how much money you can waste on mediocre food, don't go here to have good food. The bacon was the only good thing at a place that prides themselves on their steak. They have good presentations of food but that's as far as it goes.

For a surprise early dinner before a hurricane was upon us, a pinky up meal at Peter Luger was a great idea. One of us had never been there so it was a great experience. The creamed spinach is one of my favorites. We paired with the French frjes and steak for 2. Their sauce is always delicious either to put on your steak or even just dip your fries. The service was great and at no point did we feel rushed out. While I did make the reservation about 3 weeks ago, it was worth the wait.

Touristy, yes, but sometimes being a tourist in your own city isn't so bad when it involves good food. We always have a good experience here, and we bring out of town guests here all the time. The waiters are mostly welcoming, they don't chit chat and just get your food orders right and quickly. I love that.

It was pretty pricey, but worth it! We got the steak for two, the spinach and the home style fries. Suuuupwr good! And the sauce that they made in house was to die for, naturally the steak was seasoned and fresh enough to go without it but it was a nice addition. We also had cheesecake for dessert, the whole experience was super good and would go again!
Over rated. The waiters act like there doing you a favor for serving you. I've been to both locations Brooklyn is horrible Long Island is just a bit better.

I don't eat meat but we went for my boyfriends birthday. The service was impeccable and vegetarian sides were delicious. Â The shrimp cocktail is phenomenal, and of course the steak was epic for my boyfriend
CLASSIC BK STAPLE. That's all I have to say but Yelp won't let me just post one sentence. We're not all self-appointed food critics, some of us just like to be succinct. CLASSIC BK STAPLE.

I was worried this would disappoint and that it would be merely a tourist trap. We went for lunch and had a very short wait even though we had no reservations. Maybe we were lucky! Had a delicious Bloody Mary at the bar while we waited. The food was AMAZING, and the steak... wow that steak. It was criminal how good it was and how perfectly prepared. Go, don't hesitate! Service is fast and operating like a well lubricated machine!
Dynamite steak! Many dinners eat with their hats on in tee shirts. Restaurant is an old classic.
Delicious burger for lunch. Be prepared to pay up though. $30 for a burger with bacon and cheese... fries were ok. Onion rings were more like shoestring onion rings.
Amazing the burger is hugely recommended and so is the steak if you can fit in a dessert I highly recommend the sundae. The staff are really friendly and the food service is right on time.
The steak was good. But I expected more. The service is not the best, drinks are ok too... nothing special in my opinion!

Heard of this place for quite a while and was able to book a table a month in advance. Â Have to say, when we got out of the subway, the area felt sketchy, with people loitering outside the stores. It was the first time we came to this part of Brooklyn and it did feel different from Manhattan. The walk from the subway was about 10-15 mins. Â The place was so packed around 6pm and then again it was Christmas. Â  Steaks came in single, for 2, 3 or 4 people. Â  The platter arrives sizzling hot and tilted to one side for the dripping to flow to one side. The meat was juicy and tender, really good. Â We also ordered a few sides which included creamed Â spinach, bacon Â and Caesar salad, since the meat just came by itself. Â The tables were very close to each other and can get very stuffy with all the sizzling meat platters on all the tables. Â This place was pricey and great for special occasions. Â Overall, well worth visiting, pricey but worth the experience.

Simply put - a great steak. Got the steak for 3 and an assortment of sides including cream spinach, onion rings and fries. The steak had the perfect crust on it and was beautifully medium rare on the inside. Definitely not cheap but I'd say worth it!
Over hyped, overpriced, and the steaks aren't amazing. If you've got the coin and don't mind fattening up, go for it.
I'm so happy I was able to experience this place with my best friend, we went here to celebrate our birthdays.

I am not a steak person and all steaks taste the same to me. Â This restaurant was not an exception. Â The waiter was very quiet and didn't talk at all, probably because he assumed we would know everything about the restaurant. Â I ordered a filet of fish but tried one piece of the steak for three that my family ordered. Â I was not impressed with the food.

Love this place, food is delightful and that rib eye cooked to perfection every time. Service is nice and atmosphere is calming. Can be pricey but worth the experience. I always go here for a delicious steak, can't wait to go again
Tourist trap. Better steaks at sizzlers! I mean really I ver hyped and over priced. Great place to take the grandparents that's about it.
Steak is amazing and steak sauce is perfect. Highly recommended for food crawlers...value for money thumbs up , cozy place . Next visit I'll try the tomahawk steak . Omg Â I'm drooling

I have been here a few times, and it's always been special. They take the stuffiness out of the network steak house. I have seen slip flops and construction uniforms to black tie, all is welcome and treated as the same. The staff is top notch. You tend to have one main waiter and another who helps fill in the gaps. You always get someone who knows the menu incredibly well, is warm and inviting, and a few really solid jokes. The steak is incredibly good and drool worthy. The German potato's are so flavorful and a perfect accompaniment. And if you feel like a drink they have all the classics and will be stiff!

I'm not one who loves steak but I can appreciate a good steak when I have one. Peter Luger no doubt is one of the best steakhouses in the country and it shows. We got our steak medium rare which was extremely juicy. I'd highly recommend getting it done that way. Make sure to try their steak sauce. For sides, we ordered French fries and baked potatoes which were both great. They also have another type of potato side which was probably the best of the three. For dessert, we ordered cheesecake, pecan pie, and the key lime pie as recommended by our waiter. Of the three, the pecan pie and cheesecake were by far the best. I'm not a huge fan of key lime. Overall, a great date night spot with a lively atmosphere.
This place is what it is. It's a steak house that has a long history in New York City. The food is good and flavorful. It's a bit pricey but expected. You will enjoy your meal.
Always a go to when I have visitors in town. A New York landmark. The sauce is what always gets me.

Wonderful dinner, super filling! The place is huge and they are limiting seating inside and also have outdoor seating. The staff is all very friendly and professional. The bacon was super thick and yummy, definitely worth a try (one slice for two ppl is more than enough because it's huge). The steak of course is incredible and the sides were great too. Three sides was probably too much for two people, but we managed to finish most of it (we were beyond stuffed). Only comment I would give is that the place itself is a super fancy vibe, but everyone is actually dressed very casually.. not sure why. Anyways, awesome place!!

I've had a good amount of steak up until Peter Luger, but this place changes the game for steakhouses. We made a reservation pretty far in advance afraid we wouldn't be able to walk in, and on a Tuesday at 11:30am, we didn't have to worry about getting a seat because there were a lot of tables empty. We were quickly greeted by Peter Luger's staff, who looked like they'd been working there their whole life! Since it was just lunch, my boyfriend and I ordered a Caesar salad and steak to share. The salad was rich and flavorful and hit all the right spots! I hadn't looked at photos before coming here, so when the steak came out, my pupils immediately widened at the sight of it. My mouth started salivating as our waiter cut it up, and I couldn't wait to try it. This steak was PERFECT in every way. Cooked to perfection (medium rare), charred slightly, and seasoned with something that came from another universe. If you want to treat yourself to a special meal in Brooklyn, this is your place!

Peter Luger's is an old-school steakhouse in Brooklyn with a beer hall vibe. The steak here was full of flavor, perfectly tender and melted like butter in your mouth. It was some of the best steak we've had in NYC. To accompany the steak we ordered the Caesar salad, fries, the house cheeseburger and cocktails. We left the restaurant happily filled to the brim and with their classic gold chocolate coins in our pockets. Highly recommend snagging a reservation if you get the chance.

What is there to say? We were lucky enough to get reservations and try this place out! We inhaled our steaks. Cooked perfectly. Service is wonderful! A must when visiting NYC. We loved the casual ambience of this place. Believe the hype!
Best steak in town!!! Would recommend to anyone looking for a good meal at a decent price!

We ordered the steak for 2 people (medium rare) and ended the night with cheesecake. The service was outstanding. We had a lovely gentleman serve us and he did not miss a beat. Cool experience. We also got our gold coins!

the service is always great , but unfortunately the food quality is not what it used to be , the sides were not good at all( potatoes and spinach) ,the steak was charred and flavorless, the burger on the other hand was AMAZING

This is my 1st ever review and I'm being 100% entirely honest! This is "My"review !1st I would like to qualify by saying I have ate at 2-3 maybe 4 Michelin star restaurants as well as some very upper end of quality restaurants. Peter Luger, I hadthe steak for 3 creamed spinach and German potatoes. The steak was almost VERY Good but I just can't label it anything higher than a good good steak! Â The German potatoes were good but they were Â very similar to square cut hash browns from a dinner I'm sorry but they were good but there is nothing about them or the steak that would justify the reputation this place has. I just don't see it nor taste it. The creamed spinach was excellent more spinach then cream but excellent flavor.Now to the ambiance . Plain Jane it probably looked the same 100+ yrs ago which there's nothing wrong with but if you never been here but heard about it, you kind of expecting something more especially considering this is supposed to be the best. Not in my book. Service was good food came out fairly quick and waiter was attentive. But I spent $300 I was just expecting more! My score 7.8 / 10

I love this place, I mean who doesn't! I did not get too take pictures of my sides I had with my steak but I enjoyed everything. My fiancÃ© loves steak and so why not go to the best steak house in NYC. A few weeks ago I went to the LongIsland location and loved it as well but they have a different menu and I prefer the Brooklyn menu more. The staff squeezed us in for a early dinner and everyone was beyond helpful and great! See you soon!
Great food. Peter Luger is a gateway to upscale cuisine. You can tell the chefs there know what they're doing.

Went to the "IcOniC StEakHouSe" and honestly not at all impressed. The price was similar to any tier 2-3 steakhouse but the service and food was mediocre at best. The waiters are all a bunch of middle age men standing around. Our server was fast and a no frill guy but this was definitely not a fine dining experience. Their steak sauce tasted like ketchup and the best thing I ate was my fries. Glad to have tried it out so now I know to never go back.

Best steaks, loud, great wine, this place screams NEW YORK (literally). We enjoyed our dinner here 100%! Unfortunately we didn't get any pictures because we were so excited for our food, we didn't have our phones out.

First time at Peter Luger after being a long time Wolfgang's customer. I have to say that for me the difference in porterhouse steak is that this one is much more seared and crispy. The creamed spinach has more spinach than cream whereas Wolfgangs has more cream. Really loved all the food!

Peter Luger's is a New York Institution and was the go to for so many years. My recent trips have not been what I remember and seems to be relying a lot on its reputation while it has become robotic and really just pushing the food out. You feel rushed and the food is good but not to the level it was.

We have been going to Peter Lugers for the last 5 years (missed 2020 due to COVID) and it is consistently the best. Â The drinks and sides are just as amazing as the steaks. Â This is a must if ever in the Brooklyn, NY area.

I finally tried Peter Luger after living in Brooklyn for 15 years shame on me. I had it delivered so I can't comment on the restaurant experience. But the steak melted in my mouth. The thick cut is good but it is only one piece. The cream spinach excellent. Of course their Steak sauce is always great. Next time I will dine in.

Went here because everyone said it was #1 steakhouse in nyc, but I don't think so. First of all, they made us wait 20 mins even though we made a reservation. Second of all, their meat was very chewy, and since the crisp was only at one side, it didn't added much flavor to the steak.

This was our first time visiting Peter Lugers Steakhouse while in New York in September and I'll tell you it will NOT be our last. It did NOT disappoint. There was six of us and each couple got the steak for two cooked a different way and we all sampled each other's... WOW!! I can definitely say it was the best steak I have ever had. The sides are very plentiful as well. You won't be disappointed. The service is amazing and the bar is remarkable. An experience you won't forget.

Hands down, you will not find a better porterhouse and cream spinach from coast to coast. I've been coming here with my father for years and still can't find a place that can come close. Yes, they are pricey and their chocolates has gotten smaller but I will be a fan for life
This is how steak was meant to be prepared. Never a bad meal. Hands down, best steak in the world. Wish the would open a restaurant in Boca Raton, FL.
We loved everything we ordered - creamy spinach, bacon, steak. Portion is very generous. We had plenty of food packed to go.

As always, Peter Luger's does NOT disappoint. All the reviews about people not having a good experience, I don't know what you're talking about. Our server Nenad, was fantastic. He helped us with our menu and tried his best to explain the menu to my mother in law (she speaks Spanish). I hadn't been here in a few years, and he truly made my return a great one. Can't thank him enough, if you're in the Brooklyn area and in the mood for a phenomenal steak and great overall experience head to Broadway and step into Peter Luger's.

For the price of the meal, it was a bit underwhelming. I've had better steak back home in California at Mastro's and I still cannot for the life of me understand the hype over the creamed spinach. It literally takes like mush. No creamy flavor or texture just spinach mushed like baby food. Our waiter wasn't particularly friendly even after he awkwardly stood there to ask for his tip amount and didn't even say thank you. I may be in the minority on this but definitely think PL is overhyped.
Simply amazing. Great steak, vibe and an awesome old New York feel. The burgers for lunch are also divine.

The staff and everyone taking care of you and food are wearing masks. The person taking care of our table was so sweet so kind. Attentive. He played our food so nicely. The drinks were so good. The only thing is that I wasn't fond of others around me wearing regular Saturday running around clothes. Sorry that's just me. The food, drinks and deserts were so so good. Until next time

Came here on a Saturday night and sat in the back corner at a table for two. The seating was perfect and cozy right by the window. The food was incredible and the bottle of Peter Luger wine we got was great too. I wasn't expecting to like it as much as I did because I really thought this place was overhyped, but maybe I loved it so much because my expectations weren't that high! Either way we had a great time. We got the bacon and Caesar salad to start and the porterhouse for two with the potatoes and creamed spinach for the main course. Everything was exceptional. The cheesecake for dessert with a side of their famous shlog was AMAZING. This was my first time coming to the Brooklyn location and I will definitely be back!!!

Steak was pretty amazing! The steak for 2 was plenty of food for my boyfriend and I. We didn't order an appetizers because none of them sounded or looked appealing. As for the sides, they were basic. We ordered the creamed spinach and it was okay. I wish they had more sides to choose from. As for service, our waiter was very nice but things did move a little slow. Let's just say this, if you go to this steak house, you're going to go for the steak, not for the appetizers, sides, service, or ambience.
an old favorite and a NY tradition! Â  always a great experience and of course great food too

I loved this place. Their customer service was excellent. Everyone treated us so nicely. Even our baby loved this place and was dancing lol I ordered the lunch burger and it was delicious. Fries, spinach, and lamb chops were great! My husband is a picky man so he wasn't crazy about his steak. We also ordered the hot fudge sundae and finished the whole thing. So good! I also loved how they gave our baby a ton of gold chocolate coins, which were yummy as well. I love restaurants that accommodate families with a baby so thank you! I would love to come back here!
One of the best steak houses. Has a old time mob feel but you definitely can not go wrong here.
There is no place like Lugers. The waiters here are true professionals. Always get the German potatos and creamed spinach.
Steak was definitely good. Sides are average. Staff friendly and attentive. Pricey but worth it both for the steak and experience of visiting one of the oldest steakhouses in nyc
Tried Peter Luger yesterday for lunch and the steak was melt in your mouth good. The bacon app was another star and lastly service was just as great
Been coming to this location for 20 years. Was phenomenal all my life. Last time I was here yesterday the steak was cooked horribly, no seasoning and no flavor of dry age. Hugely disappointed
Great steaks. Great atmosphere. You go to eat and eat you will. Nothing fancy but the taste of the food.

Best steakhouse ever! We had reservations for Saturday at 2pm. We arrived a little early and were seating within a few minutes. It's funny how the waiter tried to be really "gruff" with us at the beginning but by the end of the meal he fell out of character! Haha! The bread is delicious and the onion bread was awesome. It was full of onion in the middle. We ordered the creamed spinach, onion rings, German fried potatoes, steak for two medium and apple strudel for dessert. The creamed spinach was amazing and I completely understand the hype. It's not stringy or watery and has the perfect flavor IMO. The onion rings are perfectly crunchy and battered and went well with ketchup and the signature Peter Luger steak sauce. The sauce itself was on another level- bbq sauce plus horseradish and bursting with flavor that complimented not only the steak but the sides too. The German fried potatoes are like home fries but better! The steak was cooked well maybe slightly under but we were able to use the residual heat from the plate to cook those underdone areas a little more. It is slanted on the table so you can scoop up as much butter and meat juice as you want. Our sweet waiter split our apple strudel and it came with a HUGE bowl of whipped cream. Apple strudel was cinnamon and sugary delicious. It was too much food for the two of us so we have dinner! Will definitely be back next time we're in NYC! Can't wait for the Vegas location to open!

Fast service, excellent steak, what more could you ask for? We came here for dinner on a Saturday night and got the steak for 2, onion rings, creamed spinach and the sizzling bacon. Bacon was alright, just imagine a thick piece of ham, it wasn't sizzling unfortunately, just real warm. The sides of onion rings and creamed spinach were tasty. And finally, the steak for 2, was perfectly cooked, buttery and the best I've had so far. Would I come again? If I was craving steak definitely!

What can you say about Peter Lugers. Best in New York They have been around forever and are so legendary. Had the bacon as the appetizer, ordered the steak for two and the spinach and the german potatoes. Had strudel chocolate mousse and cheesecake for desserts!! Fabulous birthday celebration.

I used to go to the Peter Lugers in great neck as a child and boy did the Brooklyn chain not disappoint. It's a little on the pricier side and they only take debit or cash but it reminded me of old school American steak house deliciousness . The salads were dressed to perfection. The steak cooked a perfect medium rare melted in my mouth. The home style onion rings and German potatoes were bomb. You pay for the ambiance and great service (don't forget the unlimited sauce and bread) along with cute gold coins at the end. If your looking for a place to splurge that's quite reasonable with great food ratings go here!! It was around 90/pp counting tip and drinks so wasn't too bad for nyc. There is only street parking which can be a little tricky. Make sure to have a reservation as it was quite full on a Tuesday night!

I have wanted to come here for well over a decade. The hubs said he went with some work colleagues when we first met and i was green with envy. So this last trip to New York my friend and i huffed it from Manhattan to have this long awaited meal. The staff while friendly rushed you through the meal making it feel more fast food than fine dining. It was super bright inside unlike most steak houses. It's definitely a no frills menu. Started with a wedge salad that had the thick cut bacon cut up on top. That was very flavorful. I had the $61 "steak for one" and was underwhelmed. Got a side of creamed spinach and a baked potato. The potato was plain with a bowl of sour cream nearby. The wine list by the glass was types no brands. I'm fine with house wine but at $14 a glass it should be a little higher quality. Overall I'm glad i tried it but i don't need to go back. To be fair a nearby table of guys celebrating a bachelor party scarfed all their food down and chewed on the bone of their steak. All that to say i think it's a personal preference thing. This filet girl wasn't loving it.

The 2 stars are simply for the history of a 130+ yrs restaurant. The steak is decent comparable to other steakhouses, but the service is horrible. Our waiter was inattentive and impatient, and argued that 16% tips was not enough for a lunch meal. The service totally ruined the dinning experience
The food was Heavenly. The steaks are to delicious. Was treated to the meal. Love this person

I have only been here twice but both times were excellent. First time we got the bacon, steak for two and the creamed spinach and everything was delicious! The staff was attentive and very nice, it was an overall great experience. Second time we came during Covid, they have a pretty good outdoor set up. Heat lamps at every table and covered on 3 sides to block wind but opened on one to keep the virus out. This time we tried the burger and it was totally worth all the hype, I'm kinda obsessed with it now, it might be the best burger I have ever had. Also got the bacon, fries and some cocktails to complete this very tasty meal!
Steak was cooked perfectly, including the veggies and sides. Thick cut bacon is also a must. Nothing fancy about this place except the table cloths and their name! Expensive but reliable.

i came away rather depressed. don't get me wrong, the food was not bad but it was not worth the praise of the best steak in new york. the food was good but i have had better hamsburgers and steak. the hamburger was best described as amateur. the steak was juicy but by no means any better than steak at texas roadhouse or any other steak house. i truly did want to be impressed by this restaurant but sadly that was not the case here.

Best steak house, they've serving the same style porterhouse since 1887. Not much needs to be said. Never had a bad experience other than Williamsburg takes longer to book compared to great neck. For covid they have indoor and outdoor dining. It's a bit cold but they have heaters.

Absolutely worth the stellar reputation! Â Friendly host sat us straight away, server Costa was friendly to our daughter, fun with our guest and efficient at serving the most delicious steak we've ever had! Â Got the setup for 3 and it was beyond plenty -- cooked perfectly medium rare and came out sizzling on that signature hot plate with the clever support plate for the yummy sauces. Â Bread service was tasty with onion rolls and chewy breadsticks. Â Sides were creamy spinach and tomato w onion salad -- perfect tomato in thick slices. Â I would've loved a little vinaigrette dressing or a few blue cheese crumbles to add something to the salad but I get the simplicity. Â Desert of caramel ice cream was decadent and the coffee was strong and hot. Â Remember CASH only so be prepared -- but worth every penny! Â Hop the subway 1 block away and you're in business back to the city!
No frills type of steak house. Great cuts of meat which is perfectly cooked. I would book in advance as it's hard to snag a resy here.
Definitely lived up to the hype, the steak was amazing and unique, and the bacon might be the tastiest appetizer I've ever had. I would go here every time I visit NYC.
Luger chop salad all the way! My favorite keto friendly restaurant and love my greeting staff!
Best steak eating experience ever! Shared the porter house with my niece- best ever taste, will try the ribeye next time.

Some of the best steak I have ever had. The German fried potatoes were also really great. Plus, the cheesecake with homemade whipped cream was delicious. Our servers were very attentive, and even made a good recommendation on what ferry to take nearby back to Manhattan. Will definitely be back if I ever visit Brooklyn again. Old school steakhouse, which I appreciated and enjoyed. Sometimes there is no need to reinvent the wheel when food is great, which I loved about this historical restaurant.
Flew all the way to NY to try this hyped up steak house. Â It's good. Â But not much better than other known steak houses. Â I would say they are over rated. Â  Their iceberg salad was really good.

This steakhouse was hyped to be the highlight of our trip but it turned out to be a huge disappointment . Â The steak and burger we ordered were both over cooked. Â We had to request the burger be done over so it wouldn't go to waste. Â In our opinion, this place is very OVERRATED.

Our family visited my sister in NYC last month, and I specifically wanted to go to this place because of its steaks and the Â history of the place. We started with sliced tomatoes & onions, and thick bacon, extra thick. All of us loved it, I specially liked the bacon. My wife had single steak cooked medium, while our daughter and I had steak for 2 in medium rare. I was expecting more flavor from the dry aged steak, not even close to what I had expected. Good thing my wife enjoyed hers, otherwise it would have been a big disappointment. I don't think I'll be bringing my family back.

I've heard so many great things about this restaurant. I wanted this dining experience to be head and shoulders above the other fine steakhouses I've been to but sadly, it wasn't. You would think that a landmark spot like this with 135 years of operational experience, would completely impress a customer but it fell very far below my expectations. For starters, I would compare this restaurant to an Â expensive Golden Corral without all the food options. There is no dress code whatsoever and while this may be the appeal for some, I would expect that a restaurant that serves a $140 T-Bone steak, would enforce a better dress code. The menu was terribly limited. Of course steak was the main course, the sides only consisted of fried potatoes, baked potato (if available. I didn't ask) broccoli and creamed spinach. Our waiter had the personality of a soap dish and was as stale and cold and as the complimentary bread assortment that came out. At least put it in a warmer so when you serve it, it will melt the cold, foil wrapped, butter that accompanies it. While eating our meal at our table, a cleaning person actually swept around us with a broom and a dust pan on a stick. Completely inappropriate while in the process of dining. I saw on three separate occasions, the same waiter counting his cash tips in front of the entire dining room. Not only does this look completely tasteless, this guy is handling filthy money then serving customers food to them with no sanitary prep whatsoever. After waiting three weeks for the reservation date, I was disappointed and wished I had selected another, more quaint, steak restaurant in NYC. This place is a feedlot and nothing more. Herds of vacationers are corralled in for over priced beef and spirits with no consideration for a quality dining experience Â in a Brooklyn landmark. Don't waste your time or hard earned money. Either save your money and actually go to a Golden Corral ( there is a much better selection) or go to Keen's Steakhouse in Midtown South like we should have.

While Peter Luger is a big tourist trap and you have a lot of people visiting town dining here, I think it's still a great place to visit to experience old school New York. The waiters know everyone, people coming up from the side walk to give the staff hugs. I'm a vegetarian but went for my husbands birthday and I left full! (Not many vegan options though if you are wondering) I also cannot say enough about our waiter, Adi, who made our whole experience. He was kind, attentive and spent a long time just chatting with us about natural wines. He was very kind and probably one of the best servers I have had living in New York! Thanks Adi!

I think their steaks are very overrated and overhyped, however I would argue they probably have one of the best if not the best Burger in NYC. Love lunching here on Sunday with my family and escape the city

The most overrated steakhouse I've ever been to. You are much better off with a steak at Morton's or Ruth Chris for same price and better flavor and conscience. Also the owners have to be a bunch of cheapskates for not accepting credit cards. Which day and age are we living in? Who carried cash anymore? I strongly suggest to go elsewhere. Not worth the money or the inconvenience for paying cash or a debit card. The owners have to wake up and face reality. I personally can't tolerate cheapskate owners and will not give them my business.

Peter Luger is a steakhouse classic here in Brooklyn, NY. When you walk thru their doors you just know you're in for a great meal. Â The porterhouse steaks are cooked to perfection, the creamed spinach is always divine, and please make sure to order the bacon! Desserts are delicious here too but be mindful to leave some space for them!

While grief over the tragic loss of almost 1 million Americans from COVID-19 can never be overcome, and the global loss is nothing to kid about, the pandemic seems to be what drove PL in BK to accept online reservations... a major benefit to humanity.

I didn't have much expectations dining here. I just needed to check it off our list. Reservations are not easy to get. We just took a 5:15pm dinner reservation. Too early but what can we do? First, we were already in the neighborhood and it was raining so we just sat in the bar for half an hour. The bar tender was cool and there are other interesting people at the bar waiting to be seated. A huge basket of bread, butter and steak sauce were ready as soon as we got seated. Waiter was cool and not pushy. There were six of us and we ordered, two Caesar salads, 1 bacon, steak for 4, a huge baked potato, an order of broccoli and German potatoes. Timing of food was perfect and everything was done perfectly! I have nothing bad to say about our wine, breads, steaks, salad and side dishes. Is this the best steak I've ever had? Probably not but it's up there!I totally recommend if you haven't been here, try it yourself

The steak is perfection - crispy outside and tender inside. Â I love the tomato and onion also as a starter. I always wonder why they don't take other credit cards though and few years I had to go get some cash. Â Nonetheless it's one of the best, ever!

This has to be my favorite NYC steaks. Went for my wedding anniversary. We had Â steaks of course. Delicious, Â no need for the PL steak sauce. With a side of creamed spinach. We finished with the apple strudel served with the side of a massive plate of wiped cream. The one thing that stood out for me was the service was improved. In the past the service wasn't usually good but your not there for the service.

This is where my family celebrates! We dined just last night. I have been coming here since I was a child. It's a super classic no nonsense menu for dinner- did you know you can only get the amazing burger at lunch! Worth every penny.

Always amazing, one of my all-time favorite restaurants. The steak is always cooked perfectly, and comes atop a searing hot plate, which can be convenient when you're eating with others who like their meat a bit more cooked than you do. The outside of the dry-aged steak has a distinguishing crisp, adding texture to the soft melts-in-your-mouth middle. Would highly recommend pairing with the creamed spinach or German fried potatoes. They also make a mean old-fashioned. A classic, Brooklyn staple that I plan to return to every chance I get. Cash/debit only, but they do have an ATM inside.
Excellent Food & Service. I only go a few times each year, but always enjoy the dining experience!!

I've been dying to go at this place. I decided to get to burgers with my family and it was the most juicy and soft burger I ever had. The meat was extremely good as if it was Wagyu or some sort of high quality meat. Best burger I ever had!

Came here before covid, kinda hard to make reservations but I kept calling and finally got through. If you don't make reservations when you get there, there is another line for walk in's that day, they will take care of all the reservations people first and if there is still tables left they will take the walk in's. We ordered the steak, the bacon, shrimp cocktail and the German potatoes which is basically like home fries but they were delicious I think that was my favorite dish. The steak was ok, bacon was thick the hubby and son liked it, shrimp cocktail was good as well. I wouldn't say this is the best steak I ever had, it's also pricey so I don't think I'll be back unless someone treats me, Lol!
I went a while ago and the meat if fantastic! Pricy and cash only but it is worth it!
By far one of the worst steal places I've been too yo eat at. There are so many other steakhouses to eat at.
Good food great service and worth for the prices!!! Very nice for date night and good for hangout with friends too
Simple menu, no frills steakhouse with dry aged beef. Our party ordered steak for 4 and could barely finish it off. Cash only.

This place exceeded expectations. It feels like an old steakhouse, which it is, so it had a certain charm to it. Steak was delicious and perfectly cooked, a little on the rarer side of medium rare. Onion rings were incredible, fries were good, and the bacon was also awesome. This was easily the best steakhouse experience I've had in a LONG time. Well worth the price. I will definitely be coming back.

Let's address the elephant in the room: Peter Wells's 0 star review and is it warranted. Long story short: yes. Shorty story long: yes given the price, nearby restaurants and poor service. My friend ordered a rare steak and I ordered a burger with appetizers. It cost me $40...$40 for a burger with appetizers. Money is not object to the patrician class of NYC. But for $40 you can get better meat and literally any nearby steakhouse. Now the service. It's not our waiter was bad, it's that Peter Lugar doesn't accept credit card. This is beyond unreasonable for an expensive steakhouse. It's unreasonable for a plebeian street vendor. I have a diner's card for these reviews and they don't accept it for some unknown reason. This in an of itself gives me every reason not to go there. This is literally a health hazard, because of COVID. Cash is unsanitary. I should also not put my cyber security at risk by using my debit card. I would give Peter Luger 0 stars if Yelp allowed it. Peter Luger only runs on its reputation while providing service that only thinks about itself and not its customers. Take your credit card and use it Keens Steakhouse.

I've been meaning to come to Peter Luger for the past 5 years and I finally made it! Definitely lives up to its name as an iconic NYC steakhouse. I love that you don't have to worry about dressing up or anything-- you just show up, get served amazing food, then leave. We got the steak for 3 (medium rare), and it was incredibly juicy. Went super well with the two sides we ordered, the German fried potatoes (which were kind of like really good home fries) and creamed spinach (I'm not the biggest creamed spinach fan but this one was sooooo soft). We also had their famous bacon, which I enjoyed as much as I did the steak (and in case you can't finish it, the bacon heats up really well in the oven later). I was also impressed by the efficiency of the service. You could tell the staff was very experienced and we got our food quickly without feeling rushed. Will be back in the future to try out their burger as well!

This place is phenomenal I can honestly say they lost their touch a little bit but I'm not going to give them less than five stars because they work hard the quality of the meat is definitely different but I definitely recommend this location
Looks like an old pub. Bad ambience. The food is not seasoned and tastes like nothing. Lugers lives off of it antiquated obsolete reputation that has long since devolved for the worse.

I recently had an occasion to return to Peter Luger. I had dined at Peter Luger's several times in the past years & had always maintained a Negative evaluation of the establishment. In the previous visits I felt that staff were rough around the edges & dictatorial. This Famed New York Steakhouse was a disappointment to me.....but this most recent dining experience made me a Believer in the general thought that this place is one of the very Best Steakhouses that one might be privileged to dine in. Service was Exquisite, now let's speak of the Steak Prime Cut Medium Rare Ribeye was Heaven!!!! The cut of Beef of Beef along with the dry age process Produces the Quentasintial Steak. Hats off to Peter Luger.

Catalino was our server and he was fantastic! The steak for 2 was the best steak my boyfriend and I have EVER had - and we both love steak! It had filet on one side and sirloin on the other - they tilt the plate and add the juice - unbelievable!!! If you've never been, you must try this place!!!
Ridiculously good steak ! Why go anywhere else ?! You should know better! I am serious - don't waste your damn time.

Peter lugers. Enough said. Best steak in the world. Â  Â  Â The porterhouse is an American institution. The burger is the best in the world. The bacon and fries are unmatched. Add this to the list of things to do before you die.
All the good food starts here. Â You better have cash to eat here since they do not take credit cards. Â But, definitely good steak.
Classy old school restaurant. Perfect across the board. Steak and desert were definitely the highlights. Go for the German potatoes instead of the fires.
This is my second time here and the steak won't disappoint. Big portion as usual. Everybody loved the thick bacon. The server had a unique style to serve as well.
Best steakhouse in BK! Love the staff and service! The steak and bacon slabs are everything.
Old time steak house. Excellent steaks. I thought service was good. A bit of a wait to get in. Will be back

I ordered the burger with cheese and bacon and a side of fries for lunch. A bit underwhelming. My total was around $35 so I was expecting a bit more on quality! The burger was ehhhhh, the cheese wasn't melted and the bread was soggy. They packed the burger with huge thick cut raw onions and it was just too much. The fries were cold too and did I mention they had just opened so everything should've been hot and fresh. The 3- stars is for the bacon which was a hit. The bacon was the only thing that I enjoyed during lunch. If you're a bacon lover, you have to try it!

This is still and always will be one of the best steaks in New York City. Say what you will about the attitude and the service (all of which I find to be less offensive than some ny times critics), the burger at lunch is probably top 3 in NYC as well... ask for the onion and a side slice of bacon...
Their $18 burger was worth a trip to Brooklyn! It was close to the top of all burgers I have had. Our server (Mo) was super kind, attentive and simply awesome.
They only serve one kind of steak. We order steak for four. It was burned on one side and cook well done. Not the medium as ordered. Four people Cost $450.00 had better steak from Texas Road House.

Great steaks and other foods here people. I mean, it was hard getting in, but the wait was worth it. While you wait they have a good bar. So, the bread is awesome. So be ready for it. Great baked potatoes. But the damn steaks are so good. They cut it for you. Just eat.

I've always loved this place. Been going here for 20+ years. Unfortunately, they do not treat women with respect and that became apparent on my most recent visit. I was there with my husband and friends for my husbands birthday and when the bill came, I tried to pay with a check (an accepted form of payment according to their website). Â They asked me to fill out certain fields on the back of the check, and indicated I should make the check out to Signature Bank. I did exactly as instructed. As we were leaving, their incredibly arrogant manager attacked me in front of our friends saying "we are Peter Luger!" and can not accept a check made out to Signature Bank. Â When I pointed out to him that I wrote out the check exactly as the instructions were written out to me, he said, "ma'am, you do realize we are Peter Luger and not Signature Bank". Â My bad, my stupid woman brain confused a steak house with a bank! Â Oopsie. Â I've never felt so insulted and minimized; I did exactly as they asked and then they basically told me I was stupid for doing it the way they asked. Â been frequenting this establishment and promoting with family and friends for decades. No more. I'm disgusted with how they treated us and I hope every female that wants to be treated with dignity steers clear!

Can you imagine being born and raised in Brooklyn and never eating at Peter Luger Steak House? We finally made the pilgrimage this summer and enjoyed our experience there. We ordered steak for two ($129.90) and Lugar's Special German Fried Potatoes for two ($15.95). Both were fabulous. We asked that our steak be cooked medium, and it arrived exactly as requested. Service was quick and professional. All round great experience. Need to address the question, however - did this Michelin-starred restaurant make the best steak we ever had? Respectfully, no. A month prior, we ordered steak at a fancy Greek restaurant in Midtown, Manhattan (not fair to name names) and the meat was far more flavorful. We expected a good meal at the Midtown joint but were actually blown away. New York City has so many choices. It's the combined luck of purveyor, management and kitchen staff that determines the quality of what lands on your plate. Best to all.

My favorite steakhouse in New York. The bacon starter and the sauce sets this restaurant apart from the competition. The sear on the steak is unique and the vibe is comfortable and traditional. I like to eat there early and avoid the increasingly touristy crowd. Service is fantastic and I've never had a disappointing meal there.

OMG....the bacon and the house salad were amazing. Steak was divine...rich beyond belief....service was great and a little bit snarky. Key Lime Pie and coffee were perfect book ends to a wonderful meal.

Came here 3 times and the service is always great (: they have delicious steaks and the ambiance is nice. If you're visiting New York 10/10 would recommend you to check this place out! It's like taking a step into the pass when you enter this restaurant!

I really wanted to love this place due to the praise and hype that it gets, but I ended up slightly underwhelmed. Had a reservation and was seating immediately in the upstairs room. Staring with the bread, it was cold and not the softest. The highlight of the meal has to be the bacon slice. Was very good! Ordered a steak for two, which was good, but not the best. The steak sauce they had was interesting as well, almost like a sweet and sour sauce. I always thought having a sauce would take away from the natural meat flavor, which is why some other steakhouses take offense when you ask for it. So it was different that they have it included with all the steaks. Ended with the ice cream sundae, had good whipped cream. Took a really long time to get the check, had to wait for like 15 minutes to get the waiters attention. I'm glad I got to experience this place, but I probably would not return.
Great place to dine went here with the family and had a blast I would recommend people go here it's cool and very relax
Such an iconic restaurant. The steak certainly lives up to the reputation. Been here several times, would recommend!
Love this place. Has such an old school feel and the food is really great, the sauce is so good on the steak too!
Great restaurant. Â I had the steak, it was buttery, tender, juicy, and delicious. Â I enjoyed the experience. Service was good. Â I would recommend.
Pleasant and tasty steak dinner. Their aged beef was tender and flavorful. We came with high expectations, leaving with happy experience.

I know this is a famous steakhouse that everyone recommends in New York but I have to say it BARELY met the hype! Very happy with the service, their covid protocol, and the set up. The food was also really good and the meat perfectly cooked but it was just missing the wow factor. It was juicy and came searing hot though. I wouldn't NOT recommend it, yknow?

Prior to 2020, I have been taking my family to this fine establishment at least 3-4 times a year and unfortunately, had to take a 2 year break, so high expectations for the much anticipated return. Â Final verdict...a little indifferent about the return. Â I ordered the burger as an appetizer, along with bacon and a Caesar salad, followed by steak for three. Â Sides were French fries and cream of spinach. Â The bacon was a little too charred but the burger was delicious. Â The steak was fantastic but cream of spinach lacked a little flavor. Â The desserts are underrated, loved the cheesecake and holy cow but the mango sorbet was a pleasant surprise. Â The waiter who waited on my family and I was great and more than earned the 20+% tip. Â I will absolutely go there again but perhaps tempered my expectations...just a little.

Came here for my birthday last week. Â Had not been here for almost 7 years. Â  It's better than what I remembered. Â Had the porterhouse steak for two, unbelievably amazing. Highly recommend the German potatoes , wedge salad and OMG the BACON . Â For desert I recommend the cheesecake. Â  Can't wait to got back
Great dinner and service. Lived up to expectations for first time dining in. Would recommend to all steak enthusiasts. Old school atmosphere with generous portion sizes.

Delicious steak and bacon! We came for a birthday lunch- recommend making reservations for sure! Everything was delicious. Bacon was slightly burnt, but otherwise great. The steak sauce is not something I use and flavor wasn't ideal, but I guess it's known for a reason. The Luger lager was really enjoyable. Steak for 2 was definitely more than enough for us 2! Waiter was very kind and funny.
Still Awesome! Haven't been in a few years due to, well you know. Was there recently for a birthday and they still make one of the best steaks in the city! GREAT PLACE!
Delicious from the shrimp cocktail to the thick cut bacon also the Rib eye steak was delicious the lamb chops very well cooked. Definitely going back

COLD, CHEWY STEAK. One of the absolute worst and most overrated restaurants I have ever been to in my life. Â Unbelievably rude service. Very mediocre or below mediocre sides. The fact that this restaurant continues to exist and dupe tourists into dropping cash is mind boggling.
Food and staff are Â fantastic! Had steak for one and baked potato. Quick walk from subway. Next time I'll try the steak for two!

Excellent steak, but think the lamb chops are even better so you definitely won't go wrong with either! The bacon is divine by itself and on the wedge salad! Creamed spinach and shrimp cocktail were excellent! Service was courteous and attentive.

Peter Lugar's didn't disappoint! It never does. I first came to Peter Lugar's steakhouse (Williamsburg Location) when I was a young kid, and ever since it's always a treat. I most recently went to this historic steak house for my birthday in August and the quality is always top of the notch. This historic restaurant has been around for over a century (1887 to be exact), and they continue to perfect their craft. The steaks are dry aged in house for at least 4 weeks and the flavor is incredible. They come out sizzling, on an extremely hot plate and have been cooked to perfection every time I have been. I like my steak rare or medium rare and it has been spot on. Depending on party size, you can get a steak for one, two, three, or four people. The steaks are very large so be ready to feast. My server for this last time was named Danny and he's been at Peter Lugar for 19 years and he was helpful with all his food recommendations and was also very attentive. He even got the staff to sing Happy Birthday and the whole restaurant chimed in. I went without a reservation, which is a bit risky on a Friday night because they are usually packed. My family and I were seated in 10 minutes, but only because we got their early enough (around 5:30). I would recommend calling in advance- multiple weeks prior if you and your party would like to go at a specific date and time. Each time I come to Peter Lugar, I always start off with the thick cut bacon which is grilled and flavorful. They are also famous for their tomato and onion plater. It comes with a side of their famous Peter Lugar steak sauces which is delicious, and you can dip just about anything in it. It respectfully blows the likes of A1 sauce out of the water. If you like a great burger Peter Lugar has that too. It is made from their dry aged steak as well (cheese and their famous bacon can be added too). Unfortunately, they stop serving their burgers at 3:45 (end of lunch). Lunch reservations are usually not too difficult to get. They also have a full open bar, which is easy to get seating at if you come with a small party. They also have plenty of traditional steakhouse sides, such as creamed spinach and fries that you can order for the table. For dessert, I had the chocolate mousse cake with Peter Lugar's famous homemade Schlag (whipped cream). That was also fantastic, and I would gladly get it again. Peter Lugar is also famous for their massive milkshake which also hits the spot if you are looking for something sweet. Peter Lugar's steakhouse is on the more expensive side but is worth it for special occasions in my opinion. Lastly, they don't accept credit cards, unless it is their own, so come ready with cash. My favorite steak resides here at the famous New York steak institution, Peter Lugar.

The first time i came here was over 20 years ago i won a poetry contest in high school they said we can take our favorite teacher and go anywhere we want. I took Ms Serrano my sex education teacher Â But this was the first time i had a real steak blew my mind and changed my life. The place doesn't look like much it's small you would never think the best steak in the world would be in there and until today it's delicious melt in your mouth steak i thought over the years it wouldn't be as good with staff changes different cooks but i think they have some ancestors back there blessing the steak Â i love it
Horrible service. Very disrespectful staff. Condescending. Very average steak and food, simply not worth the hype.
It's way overpriced. Â Having the experience of being there years ago and now- the quality of the famous steaks degraded

Loved the atmosphere & location! Growing up in Williamsburg I've always wanted to dine here. It's honestly the best steak Â I ever had! Prepared & cooked to perfection. I don't know what was the best part; the steak or the date Â It was the steak
Excellent fresh food. I am a vegetarian and their vegetables and salads are always fresh! They use organic vegetables.In steak they are# 1 in New York!

Finally made it here. I was a bit skeptical it would live up to the hype, and it did. Steak for two. The flavor really is above and beyond. Must Â be the aging process they use, it is a damn fine steak. The fries were nothing memorable, loved the Caesar salad. Onions rings good, nothing you cant get anywhere else. Good bread, weirdly some places seem ti be going on the cheap with bread with pandemic recovery - stale or none. Hot sundae obscene in the whip cream, loved it. The type of place that waiters are exceedingly good at what they do given how busy it gets here. Super easy to get to from the train in from Manhattan.
Went to the Great Neck restaurant w/o a reservation. Best steak ever and the service was on point.

I've been coming here for years and I always have the same exact experience, simply epic. They make my favorite "steak for 2" in NYC. There's a location is Long Island which is also consistent. I absolutely love it here and recommend coming here for steaks.

This is the one place we were most excited to try while visiting New York. We weren't impressed. Started off with cold, not so fresh bread. I ordered the burger for lunch and it's not nearly as flavorful as it should be. My wife ordered the steak. The char was excellent but it was also lacking flavor. I'm stumped as to how everyone recommends this place as the best steak house in the city. Is it just because it's been around for so long? Heads up - they don't have fountain soda. Just a can. We wanted to love this place but didn't. I'd recommend trying a different steakhouse.
You're not gonna get a better steak anywhere else go there bring cash I have a great time at such an iconic place

Never disappoints, I've been coming here 20 years and it's always the same great steak and atmosphere. It is what Peter Luger IS, if you don't get it then go to some fufu restaurant. If you want an authentic experience that is the legend then it's still has its magic.....and the steaks are to die for.
Overall it was ok but you have to be in the mood for the harsh old NY service style and sometimes rushed service. Â Food was very good but honestly have had better steaks In NYC
Expensive sides but great steak. Probably the best steak I've had in my life.
Omg!!!!! Â the tomatoes and cheese with PL sauce, the steak with creamed Spinach and oh so yummy potatoes!!! Â When you want a steak, go here!!!

The whole meal was absolutely fantastic. From appetizers through desserts, it was amazing. The steaks were clearly the best I've ever had. Well it certainly was expensive, I would love to go there again.

The food is absolutely amazing but the steak was little more charred then I like. The bacon was absolutely amazing and extremely meaty. It also had great marbling which was delicious. The Luger-Burger is deceptively tasty. It looks like a regular burger but it has amazing flavor. The restaurant was slightly pricy but that is expected based on what we order.
Love love love!!! Saw this on Steak Paradise a long time ago and wanted to go since. Awesome service and food
Great for meat lovers. Â Service was very good. Â Our salad was good. Â Not a steak eater but everyone else who likes meat in our group enjoyed it.

Was dying to try this place and finally last night had the chance it did not disappoint tables were nicely spaced apart due to Covid we had the steak for two ,creamed spinach and hashbrowns .Everything was very delicious. For appetizers we had shrimp cocktail and the bacon very good also and desserts did not disappoint . Must say though it is very very pricey it was a treat but it is expensive be warned .

This place lives up to the hype! It is a bit on the pricey side but worth it. We ordered the bacon strips and creamy spinach as our appetizer and both dishes were phenomenal! The bacon strip was juicy on the inside, crunchy on the outside and had great flavor. The creamy spinach was great as well. For the entree we got steak for one and salmon. The steak was well worth the hype. Obviously this place is famous for the t bone family owned steaks and for good reason. Juicy. Cooked to perfection depending on what you order. The portion is more than enough! Don't mind the service. It is a little informal and sometimes feels rushed but the food quality makes up for it.
Great service and even better steak. I've been coming here on and off for years now and they've kept up their quality of service and food. Don't miss the apple pie to top off your meal!

I finally had the opportunity to check out the legendary Peter Luger's last night for a birthday celebration. Man, was I disappointed. I'm not sure if my expectations were just too high, but let me start with the service. Our server was cold and just plain unpleasant. He wasn't super helpful when it came to the menu and almost made us feel like he was annoyed that we were there and dumb for asking a question. He barely checked on our table and we had to wait at least 40 minutes for our check at the end of our meal as he went MIA until we asked TWO different servers if we can have the bill. I can't say this was the same service as a whole though because we noticed other tables next to us were being well taken care of by other servers. The food was just OKAY. Not the worst, but also not the best. It was very old school, bland and nothing spectacular. I had the Cesar salad (hard to mess up), steak for two (medium), jumbo shrimp cocktail (wasn't a fan), and creamed spinach (didn't taste fresh, almost like it was frozen spinach). We then had the "Holy Cow Sundae" which was tasty and the chocolate mousse cake, which was hard as a rock, and again not that appetizing. It's a place to check out if you're into the history of the establishment, but definitely not a place I'd want to return to. One VERY IMPORTANT last thing I noticed, at least on the night I was here, was the lack of diversity in the staff which consisted mainly of middle-aged white men from what I observed. It was a little uncomfortable and made it feel like this is more of a "boys club" type of place in my opinion.

Never fails! Came here for dinner with family tonight. Our wonderful server Christian was fantastic! Staff are enforcing Covid protocols and social distancing. We ordered steak for 2, grilled Atlantic salmon, cream spinach (slightly too creamy), onion rings and cocktails. We enjoyed everything's as usual! (Only smallll thing is the bread for the table. I know they are not know for that and it's not their speciality but we could do without it the next time we come)
Love it here wonderful homey feel with excellent tasting dishes 10/10 little pricey but you always get what you pay for

Had to try the iconic steak house. The wedge salad was great, the sliced bacon was a bit of a disappointed but the steak made up for it. I guess it's no longer the best but still a must try if you are in Brooklyn.
Steak and burgers by the best in the biz. Can't wait for the Las Vegas location to open.

Absolutely one of the best steaks I have ever had in my life. Peter Luger definitely lives up to its reputation. Came to celebrate my cousin getting into PT school. We ordered the steak for 3 cooked medium rare. The plate was sizzling when it came out and the steak was cooked perfectly. It was juicy, tender and I absolutely love their house sauce. I even bought some to take home with me. Their cream of spinach is a show stopper! It's not overly cream... which is just the way I like it. Our waiter made us a Schlag cake to celebrate, which was so amazing. Definitely made our experience unforgettable.
Simply the best aged steak in NYC. Â Better so for The NY Times being so whiny about it

I honestly went into this restaurant with mixed feelings. Mainly because the menu is so vague and almost boring. There is a reason why. Everything they do is perfect. This is going to sound so clichÃ©, but it honestly was the best steak I have ever had in my life. I do not know what they do to the meat but it is perfect. Sides don't even matter because the taste in this steak is to die for, but they are still a must. German potatoes and creamed spinach were recommended and did not fail to please. The apple strudel was amazing. I could go just for the strudel if were being frank. If you get the chance to eat here. You must do so. Treat yourself.

The absolute best dining experience and steak I've ever had in my life... totally worth the 200 dollars we spent. the steak is literally cooked and seasoned to perfection. So tender and melt in your mouth... yet caramelized and crispy in all the right places. Just absolutely blown away. The thick slab of bacon was so good as well! Just try not to eat too much bacon and save your stomach for the steak... even though it's irresistibly so good....

Sorry for posting this a year late. Peter Luger is a staple of NYC and was on our bucket list of places to visit before we left New York. We were rightfully disheartened when all the restaurants closed due to COVID, but on my fiances graduation when we got to splurge on another's dime we decided to go all out and order Peter Luger for takeout - and boy was it a once in a lifetime experience. The meat was seasoned to perfection and the dessert and side dishes were perfect! Would love to return to be able to enjoy the steak at their sit down restaurant one day!
There's nothing like it. Sure, it's crowded. Sure, it's expensive. Sure they only take cash or a Peter Luger's card...but the steak is amazing so it's worth it!

The place looked family friendly. Nothing too fancy or extravagant. The menu was pretty simple. I came for steak and it was delicious. The bacon was very good too. Only the bread was boring. Soda was available in small glass bottles. It was a pricey meal but definitely enjoyed it.

I'm a carnivore at heart and over the past 30 years I've tried some of the highest rated steakhouses in the nation. From the East coast, MidWest, Southwest, Northwest, and West coast! There's just something special about that aged 100% grass feed buttery steak at Peter Lugers. Just perfect! I'm excited to hear that they are opening one in Las Vegas, I just hope it's the exact same experience, and without the 2 month wait list.
It's Peter Luger . What is known does not have to be explained. Are you hungry? Go eat , bring your appetite and a healthy wallet.
Steak, manhattans & potatoes. Best at the 'holy trinity' of mob dinner selections in the USA.
I mean who doesn't know Peter luger steak place. Very cute ambience with good food selection and drinks.
Great great food great location and lovely staff when ya go to this place make sure you good and hungry Â  Thank me later
Simply the best steak in NY maybe in Thr USA. Keep your selection simple , steak, potatoes and creamed spinach and you will be very happy
Excellent food and service-bring $$$. Â They don't accept credit cards except their own.

I've always wanted to try Peter Luger so my boyfriend and I decided to check this place out for my birthday. Make sure to make a reservation two weeks in advance otherwise it's going to be hard to get a reservation! Upon walking in, we were greeted by the host and seated right away. The ambiance of the restaurant isn't all that great. The bread they gave us was hard and stale. Our waiter spoke really low and I could barely hear him, and he barely checked in on us. We ordered the bacon to start and the bacon was amazing, so you must order that! The steak for 2 (medium rare) was so buttery and tender. The creamed spinach, German mashed potato's, and onion rings were just okay.
Over priced. The drink menu is dated. Steak was good but you can find similar or better with greater value and nicer setting. Mostly disappointing.

Wowwww just wow! Don't know how they got the sides of the steak crusted with the most tender medium rare center I've ever had. By far the best steak I've ever had and all steaks will be inadequate from now on. Our waiter Frank was awesome and made our dining experience go off without a hitch. The steak and bacon we're everything I could've dreamed of. And thank you to the mÃ¢itre d' for bringing us complimentary champagne for our honeymoon. If you're in NYC don't think about it and come hungry!
Go for the thick cut bacon. It's the best bacon i have ever had. It's juicy, full of taste bud popping flavors, and expensive. It's worth the money if you've never tried anything like it.
Best steakhouse tried in long island. Great sausage. The dessert is soooooo large. Disadvantage is that you have to use debit card/cash. Besides, don't forget to bring cash for parking tip.

Very expensive. Steak was fatty and It was not cooked as ordered. Spinach was odd tasting. Onion rings bland and chalky tasting. Overall felt like I ate a very greasy meal and did not feel well. Onion and tomato was good. Blue cheese wedge salad was too cheesy. Shrimp cocktail sauce seemed to be the steak sauce with horseradish added. Desert sundae was very good with homemade whipped cream. Wait staff was excellent.

I didn't know the bacon that comes with the Luger Burger is the same Black Forest bacon served as an appetizer. I was still satisfied with service and taste of my order. Mixed greens salad was good. The steak sauce was the star. No complaints.

My husband and I can attest to the other reviews that state POC will be seated on the second floor. Initially, we were disappointed to be placed upstairs, in the corner. However, we were excited to enjoy the food and what others have stated about this historic restaurant.
