Even before arriving, our taxi driver said we could get a better steak and experience in the city, but we just knew he was wrong; boy, was he right! For my husband, the food was average, but for me, it was BELOW average. The bread was cold, the drinks were horrible, and the steak was bland. If we had to pick the best part, it would be the Caesar salad with chopped bacon, which is why I'm giving it two stars. This was our first and last visit. I wish I had read the reviews before making the trip to Williamsburg. Just like our taxi driver tried to warn us, if you're considering this restaurant, I recommend you reconsider.

I honestly have to say this place is overrated and overpriced compared to the other amazing steakhouses ive been to for a fraction of the price. Although we had reservations, we still waited about 40 minutes to be seated!!! Once seated it took so long for our server to even notice us, and was very difficult to even get some water. The food wasnt bad at all but it also wasnt amazing. The steak was cooked perfectly but wasnt any better than the other steakhouses ive gone to. The side hash and creamed spinach was also good but I expected more because theyre so raved about. I just overall did not enjoy the service and the food for the price I paid and definitely expected more...
Never been here but I wanna visit & try they food & tag along a friend & check out the area

Aside from NY draconian covid policies, mask until seated at table, the steak was great as expected! Had to try the bacon! It was also amazing! The steak was so big I split it w some buddies. One of my bucket list try out places!

Consistenly cocky and pretentious waiters/managers work here. If you want the EXACT same food and have some decent service, go to any of the Wolfgang's steakhouses instead, just in case you didn't know.

One of the worst meals I've ever had. Server was a jerk, didn't bring menus and got mad because we didn't order (first time diner) plates were all chipped, food was above average. Rushed in, rushed out-total joke. New York has better!

Peter Luger was a bucket list dining experience for a while, so I was excited to finally snag a reservation this past July. I read many reviews online that I'd have to wait to be sat, even with a table booked, so I arrived with a few minutes to spare before my reservation time. Fortunately, my party was sat immediately. Upon being seated, I noticed the diverse crowd - there were large groups of tourists, couples celebrating, business men wining and dining, and even a table of (what looked like) teenagers, all pulling together their cash to pay for their meal. One thing that was consistent was the server, who was a total pro. No matter who he was speaking to, our server was personable and knowledgeable. Needless to say, he had been here for years and definitely knew the ins and outs of service. To me, service alone can make or break a meal, so this immediately impressed me. Our food, too, though, was incredible. From the negronis to the bacon and even to the complimentary bread, I kept wondering what could possibly top the last dish. Obviously, the answer was, the steak. For our main meal, we ordered the porterhouse for two along with the german potatoes and the spinach. Between the two sides, I personally loved the spinach. I ate all I could of the steak, wanting to savour the experience, but still was able to take home a small amount as leftovers, which were still great the next day. And, to top it all off, our course, we wrapped up our meal with a pile of the chocolate coins (so many, in fact, that I still have some at home months later). My entire experience was everything I hoped it would be. I can't recommend this place enough for anyone looking to celebrate or even just have a memorable meal.

Located in Brooklyn, it was challenging to find parking spot on the street. Nevertheless I found one near by the restaurant. Â Made a reservation for 3:15pm, because it was the only time available on the same day. Â As I entered the restaurant no one was wearing a mask, and at the same time they asked for the covid19 vaccination card. Â Luckily everyone was vaccinated in my party and we were allow to dine in. Â We ordered the steak for two, and burger and fries. There is a $5 service charge if you don't order anything. Pretty tight if you ask me. Â We were so hungry that we literally devoured their bread that our server brought out. Â When our steak came our server warned us it was very hot and I can hear the sizzling sound. Â He used two spoons to base the precut steaks with the grease and butter that was in the plate ( he tilted the plate). Â Before I can take a picture the our server gently put two pieces of precut steak and based with butter from the plate. Â I nonchalantly pick one with the fork and dipped into their house made steak sauce. And OMG this dry aged medium rare piece of steak was the best steak I've tasted in my life. Â And trust me I've eaten truck load of steaks in my life. At that moment I felt like I can eat the entire steak all by myself. Tried the burger it was ok, but not for $20. Thick cut fries tasted like well thick cut fries. Â I went back to the steak and it was back to the heaven. Â Believe the Hype!!!

Went for my boyfriends birthday, we ordered the steak for two, German potatoes and sautÃ©ed broccoli. For drinks we had pinot nior and the New York sour. Everything tasted amazing! The wait staff wore gloves and masks at all time and tables were separated accordingly to the social distancing rules.

Peter luger definitely is my favorite steak house in BK. It's the only steakhouse I can order rare and I don't fee like I'm the animal eats raw meat, they cook just perfect. I enjoyed every single bite of it. Very friendly bartender and waiter, we had a really good time. Tips, bring your cash or American debit card.
Service and food is always great!. Staff is polite and attentive. Everything was delicious! No matter what you choose, you won't be disappointed.
Great steak house with best service! Period! Excellent steak and sides and hot fudge sundae. Â A must experience when in NYC.
There are definitely way better steakhouses New York City, and ones with good service.
Service was so efficient and wonderful, food was incredible and atmosphere is laid back and not stuffy like most steakhouses. Great experience!
From the first step in to the walk out everything was 10/10. You cannot beat this restaurant, no matter how hard these imitations try. An A-Class experience top to bottom

Went with 5 friends for lunch. 4 of us got burgers, 2 got steak. The burgers were inconsistent. We all ordered Medium Rare with cheese. Mine was beautifully red and perfectly cooked. Theirs- all over the place. One of their's well good, the other two okay, just no consistency. The steak was perfectly cooked. Service was rude and hit my friend in the head with a plate after clearing it because he was in such a hurry. He didn't even seem to notice as he said nothing at all. Burger cost $33 per person out the door with fries, cheese, tax, and tip after we split the bill.

The reputation proceeds itself. I would give 5 stars for the bacon, 4 stars for the steak and 3.5 for the burger. The quality of the steak is similar what you would normally have in a $$$$ steakhouse. The buns of the burger are dry and the meat is overcooked for a medium-rare doneness level. The bacon and fries are surprisingly better than expected.
Solid steak house if you want "steak" hot plate allows you to cook to your preferred temp .. sides meh drinks also meh

We resulted in these present circumstances cafÃ© for supper. This cafÃ© was prescribed to us by a companion. The group was incredibly decent and we had an extraordinary inclination. We cherished this eatery a great deal and we will come back to this cafÃ©.
I went there because my friend said it is so good. But after teasing, it just like regular steak house. In my opinion, it has nothing special.
Definitely never coming back. Wasted money on overly cooked and extremely burnt steak. Tuff, dry, burnt

There's a reason this place is 133 years old and has survived pandemics ,multiple presidency's Â and world wars, don't listen to the spoiled haters or unappreciating snobs and find out why this place is what it is, don't come Here looking for a trendy amazing side dish that looks cool to pose with for your social media. The focus here is the steak, if you want to try one of the best cuts of steak you ever put in your mouth that melt like butter, Peter Luger is the classic New York steak house. The steak is so good nothing else will even matter. Yes the sides are good but basic, But that meat and the way it's done is something that's a right to passage and something you will never forget.

OVER RATED IS THE WORD , the steak is the only good thing about the place. the waiters are all over, there is better service at Applebee's. it's better to go somewhere like the Cheesecake Factory. It wasn't worth 500 the sides are not included I recommend to take everything don't leave anything behind. They will ask you if you are done at the ends and try to take everything that you didn't eat and trash it.

It's very good steaks and lamb chops. Very very good. But it's a coronary clogger. So take your Lipitor. Sides were good too. We had the spinach, which was not overly creamy or oily, so that's good. The German fried potatoes were great, like crunchy hash browns. Service was friendly. Â Apple strudel dessert was great. Their steak sauce was not to my taste and was cold; this was the only small negative. The steaks were very good by themselves and don't need the sauce.

Planned a trip to NYC . Got so many recommendations from friends to try this place, so I thought it would "great". Â The steak was not all that , my bread was cold, baked potatoe was plain, literally just the potatoe. I think the service was great , the employees were nice and catered to us. But then again I think it's cause I'm from San Diego so I'm just spoiled with high end good quality food so I can't judge what others may think is "great".

Spectacularly bad service. I had to physically restrain the busboy from running over an elderly member of our party who is walking with a cane. I appreciate people being enthusiastic about their jobs, but wow, give an old lady on a cane a break. We were sat by the kitchen, where we kept getting bumped into and lectured by the wait staff, who seemed upset that we were in the restaurant. The second confrontation came with a waiter, who wanted to move us even closer to the kitchen for his convenience. He needed to be told no emphatically. This was a caricature of hostile New York service, to the point where it was embarrassing. Couldn't get out of here fast enough, won't be back.

An old school steak house with a choice of prime meat for 2, 3, 4 ... Â  wood tables and chairs. Wine list is very limited. Â The wait staff are the best and worth going for. Â The meat is cooked as ordered. Â Recommend the wedge with an extra slice of bacon. Â The Sunday is a nice finish.

The Steak was great. The sides were average. The desert was delicious. The setting was too old for my taste. With that being said the chairs were hard and uncomfortable. Another big issue was that the choice selection for steaks was horrible. Their was no choice lmfao. They only sell Filet Mignon. It was very affordable.

We went to Peter Luger for a celebratory birthday dinner. They took our temperature at the host stand and escorted us to our table. Everything and everyone screamed classic- the ambiance, the charming waitstaff, the menu. We order the bacon which was juicy and crisp. Then, we got the steak for two, creamed spinach and the German potatoes. The steak was juicy and tender with a well crisped top. Added the house steak sauce and the flavor profile went to another level. After dinner we had a lovely chocolate mousse cake with whipped cream that was the perfect end to our meal. There's a reason they've been around for over 125 years!Chocolate Coins were a nice takeaway!

The best steakhouse i've ever been to. It's a shame that idiot from the New York Times had to write a scathing review about this spot in order to make a name himself. There is a reason that this place was founded in the 1800's and is still unbelievably packed, even in the middle of a pandemic.
Food are amazing. Service is good. Outdoor dine in is cute. Definitely a nice spot to have steak !
Saw a man poop next to my table very secretly but he did and when I locked eyes with him he winked at me menacingly...otherwise decent food
Exceptional steak and fantastic service. And get the spinach. Peter Luger's does not disappoint.

Fricking awesome. The whipped cream? Amazing. The tomatoes and onions and bbq sauce? What the heck who would think to do such an amazing thing. I love them. Omg how could I forget the creamed spinach. Pls get that if u go. Popeye would appreciate u.

Recently I've ordered a burger from Peter Luger for delivery and was very impressed with the taste, but more specifically the taste of the fries. They had a deliciously mild steak flavor and they were very well packed. Whoever packed my order was kind enough to add many chocolate coins in the bag. The food arrived quickly and I thought the plastic bag was very cool. I was very pleasant with the food and I am looking forward to eat at their Williamsburg location soon.

Great place and definitely worth trying and not crazy expensive for great quality steak. Everything comes out very fresh, like hot off the pan. We got a slice of bacon, steak for two, potatoes for one, fresh broccoli, and two glasses of wine (large pourings) for around $210. I would recommend everything, especially the broccoli surprisingly, which had more flavor for being steamed. Also bread was so good? Just wish they had it warmed up or something
What are the best steaks I have a half, I highly recommend this place the only downsize was that they rushed you out after you finish your meal the check is headed to you immediately.
I mean it is Peter Lugers! Although I don't eat red meat anymore this is a family favorite and a classic spot to go to for special occasions. Traditional and traditions.

Worst steak for they hype, it has zero flavor. Comes out on a sizzling plate that is half oil, served with there cold house steak sauce that tastes like cocktail sauce. Drinks were warm, bread and butter were cold and service was subpar. For the price and hype of this place I was expecting something far better than what we received. You can get a better steak at Outback Steakhouse for a fraction of the price, don't waste your money. And if you're thinking of going for the experience, you'll hardly get that either. Super bright lighting, no music, no ambience at all. We were the most dressed up people in there, with everyone else wearing shorts, jerseys etc dressed for a bbq. If you're looking for a good steakhouse in NY this definitely is not the place.

Best steak I've ever had! I know the Peter Luger reputation and honestly thought it might be overrated. I was completely wrong. They completely deserve their reputation as one of the best steakhouses in the country. So delicious.

This place is the holy grail, apex predator, Wilt-Chamberlain-100-point-game of OG steakhouses. This is the old school steakhouse you need in your life. Â Just get the bacon and the porterhouse and let the waiter help you choose a wine. You literally cannot go wrong.

Came here for an anniversary dinner a couple months ago and forgot to write a review. The steak was good but not steakhouse quality flavor wise. The creamed spinach was unique although I wouldn't recommend it. The German potato's where the best thing we ate. The cocktails were wonderful. Overall it didn't live up to hype.

I'd never heard of Peter Luger until I just happened to mention to my dentist that the wife and I were going to NY for a wedding. He said, if you like steak, go to Peter Luger in Brooklyn! I was immediately intrigued because, heck yeah, I love steak!! I read some reviews and yes, the reviews for the steak were legendary, but the service? Eh not so much. But I'm all about red meat so I called a few weeks before our trip and made reservations for the night after the wedding. It's funny because at the wedding reception, we sat with some fun locals who had all been to Peter Luger and they all sang the same tune: great steak, bad service. Â So when we finally arrived at the restaurant, I was expecting the host and servers to be "surly". Â Couldn't have been further from the truth! The host was super friendly. Our server was awesome, answered all our questions and was just super nice and attentive throughout our meal! Maybe it's because they could tell we were tourists (we're from the SF Bay Area) but it was one of the best dining experiences ever! As for the steak? The porterhouse for two was the bomb!! So frickin' tender and juicy. One side NY steak, one side filet mignon. Best steak ever - right up there with the wagyu we had in Tokyo! The bacon appetizer was delicious, the steamed broccoli had an amazing garlic flavor and the ice cream sundae was the decadent dessert afterwards. The bread they serve to start actually has grilled onions inside! I highly recommend Peter Luger for the steak lovers out there! It definitely deserves the praise it gets. We're going back, baby!
the steak is great and delicious price little over but it's ok but the place is ugly old and dirty no music no service
Steak is incredible. Lighting and ambience are less than ideal, especially since they switched to bright white LED bulbs.
One of the best place ever! I definitely recommend the Peter Luger! Very good service

I've brought my husband here multiple times and the food and service has always been great. We start off with the thick cut bacon, and then get the steak for two with creamed spinach and fries. So so good. The steak is always cooked at the correct temperature and the service is always friendly. Sadly, I never have room for desert.

Peter Luger in Williamsburg Brooklyn is an excellent place. Whether it's launch or dinner the Food is just excellent. I won't lies very expensive but it's worth every penny. I've been going here over 20 years just love them
Phenomenal classic steakhouse. Also great Luger burgers during lunch time. Only takes cash or debit!
The food is fresh and the service is outstanding. The location very good if you're driving. Parking not a issue.
My family was visiting me from Beijing and we had a great dinner here, the steak is absolutely nice, service is wonderful and the old fashioned style is just charming.

They either need to get with the times or hang it up. The sides lack flavor the meat quality isn't as good either. We aren't barbarians where we only want to taste the product in its purest form. Meat without seasoning taste like crap. If your not willing to enhance the flavor you'll see more reviews like this

To this day, my favorite steak. There is just nothing comparable in my opinion and I have eaten in many of NY's finest steakhouses. Peter Luger is the first restaurant where I actually enjoyed the steak that I got and understood why people are steak lovers. Many steaks seem flavorless to me but not at Peter Lugers. It is perfectly seared, so soft once you cut into it and incredibly flavorful. Pair it with their signature sauce & it's paradise.

Classic steakhouse, good environment and order is cooked to perfection. Â I ordered the porterhouse and it was delectable. Â I drop by here every time I fly out to NYC and am never disappointed. Â I recommend this place highly.

I came here 6 times, twice on birthday to same Brooklyn location. I've been to Wolfgang, Keens, Hunt & fish, Quality Meats, Ruth Chris, Morton's, etc but in my personal opinion Peter Luger is the best. Steak is crispy on the outside and smooth inside. It has a rich smoky beefy taste. Bacon is a total gem and definitely doesn't feel like a sidekick. Make sure to have minimum 4 people in the party for Holy Cow dessert because it's a gigantic dessert. If I had to find one loophole on this restaurant, it's the bread server before the meal but it's okay. Who comes to Peter Luger tor appetizer bread? It's a steakhouse and steak is on point!

Delicious steak and spinach. However, the fries and ice cream were mediocre. Also, the lamb had an unusually gamey aftertaste. Otherwise, it was an excellent experience with great ambiance and service.

Came here on Christmas day and had an excellent experience! The steaks came oozing out hot with the butter still sizzling (something I haven't seen other steakhouses do) and the meat was incredibly tender and delicious. We got the steak for two which was a porterhouse steak and the portion was absolutely huge and maybe only ate half of it for two people. (could easily feed 4 with a steak for 2 and some other sides!) We also got the Caesar salad which was really crisp and refreshing and the bread they had, in particular, the onion bread was also really delicious.

column3: Huntingdon Valley, Lower Moreland Township, PA
column6: Still a classic. The steak is perhaps quite not as on point as in years past, but a true New York and American experience nonetheless. My favorite thing to do is actually hit Luger for lunch and get their burger, which is made from the trimmings of the porterhouse and may be the best steakhouse burger in the country. Add cheese and a side of fries or german potatoes. Welcome to Luger euphoria for less than $40.

Been wants to eat here for over 20 years and finally did it. Live the casual atmosphere. Cocktails were just ok. Steaks were very flavorful. If you don't like over cooked steak I would suggest taking what you will it and putting it on your plate when it first comes out because the plate it comes on is really hot and will keep cooking the meat. French fries were addictive but pass on German potatoes. Onion rings looked great. Will need to try them next.

The experience of Luger's is still worth it IMO. While the steaks are no longer "best in class", it's still really fricken good. Don't be swayed by the snobby critics that say it's past it's prime. Get a scotch, bacon, a steak, creamed spinach and enjoy.
Very classy spot. Â  Those steaks were amazing and the sides too. Â  Drinks are done well to. Â Will comeback.

You hear so much hype about this place that you might just think if you were scheduled for a firing squad that day, you would probably ask to eat here just before that. Â But the steak is not to die for. Â There is mostly hype which I assume is inspired by the "me-too" crowd of the shamelessly tasteless folks who likely follow the Kardashian's for their entertainment, ethics, and fashion sense. Â I've had better at Mortons. Â I've had better at Smith & Wollensky's. Â In truth, I've had better grilled in my own back yard if you have access to a quality butcher shop in your neighborhood and a buddy who knows his cuts working in the back. Â You wait. Â You deal with some pretentious workers. Â You sit at loud, crowded tables in what could pass for someone's partially finished basement. Â It's not glamorous. You pay the price and then you can say you've been, I suppose, if that's important just like you say you've used the communal urinal at McSorley's. Â It's a NYC thing.
This place was so fun. The waiter Mike was so great! Made the whole experience terrific. Food was delicious.

I'm sure Peter Luger has been thoroughly reviewed on Yelp. What I will say is that the quality of the meat or the consistency of the quality has declined as this place became more and more touristy. In fact, the 4 times or so that I've been here have always been with friends from out of state or country, so I'm definitely not helping the issue. Personally, I think there are many other steakhouses in the city that are better without the crazy crowds and reservation chaos, however it's a NY institution, so everyone should try it at least once, and use it as a measuring stick for all steakhouses they will go to in the future.

What more can be said about this iconic steakhouse that hasn't already been said?? The quintessential NYC steak experience, Peter Luger delivered on all fronts. From the bacon slabs to of course the steak, sides and dessert, this was truly an amazing experience. The wait staff was professional, courteous and knew exactly what our group needed. Worth every penny!

After seeing this place on TV, had to give it a try! The steak is cooked to perfection. Perfect medium rare with a really nice crust on the outside. After taking a bite it was perfect texture, but I felt like it was missing something flavor wise. My friend got the Peter Luger burger with cheese and bacon. That burger was amazing. Really nice party, very good flavor right amount of saltiness. If you aren't willing to drop money the burger is a solid choice!
We come here at least once a month with the family and this place never seems to let us down fresh steak great mixed drinks and most importantly great customer service the staff is amazing

Came here for my fiancÃ©'s sisters birthday. We had heard great things before and didn't know what to expect. When we walked in, it was clear that they've been around for a very long time. They had awards hanging all around the entrance across from the bar and it was jammed pack. I imagine that they're always so busy. We had a reservation, but still had to wait 30 minutes. The wait was worth it! The steaks came out still sizzling and each bite you took literally melted in your mouth. I had a Bloody Mary as well and it was very strong! Definitely worth the cost. We also ordered pretty much every type of dessert and everything was amazing. Of course, it came with their famous schlog (whipped cream). I had even told the staff we were celebrating a birthday and they came out and sang and brought out a dessert for her. We were definitely stuffed to the brim and everything was delicious!

I stopped in here only for a beer, but I was able to catch a steak pass by me on its way to a table and smelled fantastic. The beer was great I had their house beer, and the bartender was very talkative Â and nice and added to the experience hopefully he'll still stick around and be there next time I visit and maybe next time I'll stay for some food
Best steak in my neighborhood y'all, the prices are a pit high tho don't recommend their mashed potato

Let me be honest. I love this place. I wish they had more sauce options though. Maybe a butter garlic sauce for the steak? Not jam. Wish they stuck to a stricter dress code. I like to feel like I'm going out to a fancy place. Not a Burger King with good food. Food a little over priced but the steak is cooked perfectly every time. I think the waiters could definitely be more attentive and the staff is horrible in the front. The fact that I made a reservation and had to wait in line... not happy. It was around 15 of us. We came in for our reservation and there was a line. They said they didn't have our reservation online even though I had a hold on my card for it.... Just not happy about the fact that I still got charged even though they were to busy to accommodate us. I still went back though eventually because the steak is great. It could have a fancier luxury look for the way the food is priced, but I guess they just want to serve you nice food in ugly place. Anyways, get some butter garlic sauce please and up the ambiance!

I guess the attraction here is the history of it all. But after being seated at a table on the second floor that hadn't been wiped down, we should have know where the meal was going. Next came the ridiculously dry, almost stale bread along with their famous sauce which is reminiscent of cocktail sauce. We came in for the lunch burger which is considered to be one of the best burgers. For us, it was only a so so, (not much flavor) leaving a lot to be desired. Walked out $96 later only wishing we had passed on this entire meal. The meal highlight, the gold coin chocolates.

If you're a meat eater - Luger's will definitely a hotspot for you. Was it the best steak I ever had? Prolly not- but it was tasty for sure. Â We ordered The TBone steak for three and it was yum. The sole was also delish. The Bacon might have been my personal highlight of the meal - that and the tomato and onion salad. Â The Signature Steak sauce is tasty -(think sweet and sour w horseradish) - Â good but not super amazing in my opinion. Â The Caesar salad and French fries were also a delight. You need to make a reso a month in advance. Service is swift and the entire experience is fun. Would I come back? Yes I would -but with the abundance of restaurants in town, I'd won't be terribly bummed if I didn't get a reso. Luger's was good. But this foodie has had better. Also, if you're vegan - don't bother venturing here. Not much options for vegetarians.

The portion is very decent! The steak, side vegetable, and dessert are all very good. Medium-rare steak was very juicy and tender. The side vegetable portion is pretty surprising so I did pack half to go. The warm apple strudel came with in-house made whipped cream. It was very delicious. Staff are very nice and approachable!

I've heard mixed things about Peter Luger, but from my personal experience, it's one of the best steakhouses around. My friends and I split 2 porterhouses and a bunch of sides and left very satisfied.
The best steak in the world! There is no mistake in the taste. There's no other flesh that's moved.

Came here late one random night. They were packed but we were still seated promptly. The entire staff was so friendly and accommodating. Love their set up during this time every party is seated in their own private cubicle like space. Food was delish and steak was juicyyyyyy. Will definitely be returning ASAP!
Excellent food, great steaks. Highly recommend this place. Nice environment...........

What is there to say other than this place is classic and phenomenal. No wonder there is so much hype around Peter Lugers. This Brooklyn staple defines consistency. The service is stellar. The food is no fuss and hands down this is the best steak I have ever had. I'm sorry I didn't save room for dessert but I just couldnt stop eating this steak. Overpriced steakhouses like Mastros have nothing on this place. A must try and visit on any trip to NYC.
Off the chain mane they really live up to there name make sure your pockets are loaded tho this spot is pricey af

No service mild and very rude when I first came , went there by myself and it's look like they don't like Asian ppl . Steak was average not the best that ppl have to go for , it's just an fucking old build as they claim . Then during my meal they tried to nice but it's look fake , when it come to pay , I put under 10% tips because of Â fucking rude service and disappointment , then the waiter tell me I have to put 18%-20% , seriously!! never been any place that tell ppl how to tip by voice ! This is ridiculous Â , I also been work in restaurants I know how to tips you don't need to tell me , if they impressed with the service they would give a good tips even food tastes bad .. anyway Â at the end I still put less than 10 % anyway , Â then Â leave with very upset.

Iconic steakhouse. Came for dinner Saturday night. Delish porterhouse. But couldn't find the luger burger, found out its only a lunch item. Came back the following lunch. Utterly amazing and simple beefy burger.
Wow what a disappointment, when i got to Peter luger i was so excited when i left i was sad. Dont believe the hype

The best steak I've ever had! Hands down. My boyfriend and i decided to have our anniversary dinner here. People say it's overrated, but man I don't think so! It's so good. You're paying for the quality, ambiance and great service. We will be back!
Steak perfection. Not pretentious. Just high quality steak. Too bad people in Williamsburg are a bunch of betas who don't eat meat and can't appreciate the art that is Peter Luger.

Culmination of our Road Trip 2021 in New York City is a stop here. Great experience! Ordered the Porterhouse for Three...even though two of us will be eating it the most :-) Old School hospitality and ambiance. We need one in Los Angeles :-)

Overhyped and overpriced tourist trap. Â Ordered burgers and a steak for two so the whole group could try their dry aged steak. Â Burgers and steak were cooked the way we requested. Â Service was adequate and felt rushed at lunch time. Â Taste wise the burger was good. Â But with the addition of cheese, bacon and fries was close to $30. Â Sorry it wasn't that good. Â Also do not recommend the bacon. Â It's like a big thick piece of fatty ham. Â Glad I tried it but certainly would not return
Food is amazing, but could add some new sides to the menu. Service is on point and the hostess and staff are all so attentive and kind!
Loved the buzzy atmosphere but the food was just meh. Â Had the Tomahawk steak and it wasn't as tender or flavorful as we would have liked.

Creamed spinach was fantastic, German potatoes were great but could have used a bit of seasoning. Steak was cooked perfectly and cut like butter. Service was great but ambience was a bit underwhelming for how much of a landmark this is.

Normally, I love Peter Lugers restaurant. However, their delivery service is horrendous. My husband placed an order for Father's day for delivery for his father. Entered wrong delivery address. We have been trying to contact the restaurant for days with no response. We have called and sent emails. (see screen shot.) Fed -ex will not release food shipment due to clause in shipment delivery. Contacted credit card company to dispute charge since Peter Luger restaurant is useless. $400.00 worth of food.
First time here and food was great. Definitely a place for meat lovers . I will come again
I want you don't write with you but I feel like I needed to I wanted my steak well-done waiter was telling me that show me my business how I want steak cooked

Amazing steaks! Been to New York countless times and finally remembered to make reservation. It was awesome that they had their own parking lot which was free. We waited about 5 minutes once we checked in. Our server was attentive. We had a party of 3 plus my 5 year old. We ordered steak for 2, lamb chop, 2 pieces of bacon, Caesar salad, fries and onion rings. The steak was tender and delicious. It didn't need the steak sauce. The lamb chop was good also. Bacon was a thick juicy cut of ham. Everything was just yummy. I would definitely come back for the steak the next time I am in NY.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: This pace fell off. The steak wasn't seasoned. They kept pushing their steak sauce to smother it with. If the steak is good, you don't need the sauce. The salad was bland. The only thing that was good was their home made whipped cream. Or maybe that was cool whip. Idk. This place use to rock back in the day. With all these new places opening up, you guys need to step your game up. Â It was my friends bday. I brought a cake . They said I couldn't cut the cake in their restaurant . One of the girls we were with knew the owner or manager. Idk which one . And they ended up allowing us anyway. It's who you know I guess. The waiters were probably the only good thing about this place. The young lady who " tried" to welcome us wasn't so friendly .
Not as good as I expected . Â I gave4 stars , if people were waiting to be seated , would put on their masks would be better. Â No only in the restaurant Â wore their masks , even waiters.

It has been said that the restaurant is the best steakhouse in New York and I have to agree. The staff were very friendly and professional. Their recommendations on food and drinks were superb. My family and I and friends will be coming back soon.

Service was absolutely top notch WOW! The guy who took care of my wife and I was from Albania man what an excellent waiter! We had the steak for two with the German potatoes and we had some beers. The steak comes out sizzling! Make sure you dip the steak into the sauce it's absolutely made to go perfectly with the steak. Simply phenomenal place worth the hype.
So Over rated it's not funny maybe I miss it's hay day. But the bacon is out of this world but the steak is subpar if you ever been anywhere

Steak is ok but make sure you have a $50 to get a seat. Stood there for 45min with open tables and on other couple waiting. I was not seated even with reservations until a $50 was handed over. Some how one of the 10 open tables was all of a sudden ready for us. Watch out for the "amazing" onion and Tomatoe appetizer the sling. It was 3 slices of Tomatoe and two raw onion slices for $18 smh. Go to STK and save yourself the hassle

Awful service -- food one step above Â The Outback. My how the mighty have fallen. Â Sad since the service pulls them down even further. Not worth your time, money and effort. Atmosphere is even more abysmal when factored in with the rushed and annoyed service. Steak comes our (non sizzle) on dish. For $60+ steak for one you should expect much more. Felt rushed and stressed.

Worth it!!! After 10 years living in New York I finally decided to come here. Granted, I'm not a huge steak fan but my husband mentioned he would want steak for his birthday so instead of making it at home I took him out to Peter Luger. Initially wanted to get dinner reservations but they get booked almost a month ahead so we opted to come for lunch instead. Perhaps it was better that we did coz a steak lunch at Peter Luger's rightfully felt so indulgent. Anyway, definitely go! Eat steak. Revel in the amazing fact that such an institution exists. And enjoy your company!

Disappointed with the meal for 2 ordered after reading all the hype about this restaurant. Kendrick Lamar ate here so it has to be good, right? Wrong. When I think of high quality steak, I think of meat that melts in your mouth when you eat it just like how you know you're eating high quality sashimi if it melts on your mouth as you eat it. We ordered the steak (looks like a porterhouse) medium rare but it was burnt in some areas. While some pieces of the steak were good, I found myself giving my jaw a workout when chewing the meat. Not worth it for the price you pay. I definitely had better. I think the best part of the meal was the thick cut of bacon as an appetizer.

First off the food was absolutely amazing. The steak for two was to die for and was the perfect amount for me and my mother. I would also like to point out that our server Justin made our experience even better(if that was even possible) He gave a great recommendation on the sides and was very friendly and personable. For me service is half the dining experience and it was simply amazing.

Food was fine...but the service was a joke. When me and my party arrived for our reservation the first thing the manager asked us is if we were vaccinated and if we had proof. I asked when did this happen and was told a couple days ago, you know, no biggie but the fact that he didn't ask the white couple that came in after us as we were finding the pictures of our cards kinda pissed me off but I let it go. Another manager stepped in and took us to our table. Then the server we had had an attitude from the beginning....not sure if it's normal for servers there to slam and throw shit on the tables but that's what happened. One of my friends decided he wasn't gonna eat anything there because of the shitty service. While the rest of my party were eating it seemed like another table that was just seated by the nice manager had issues with the crappy manager who was overlooking the reservations. And guess what they were Asian as well... this place seems to have something against Asians...a shitty way to end our day in New York....will not be going there in the future and that's probably what the management wants. So if you are Asian be prepared to have your vaccination card in hand cuz apparently it's needed there.
love their take out. but it might be a secrete... so keep your hat on the down low. Â  love their meat!! oh yeah
The service was good, and desserts great (the schlag!), but the steak was a little overrated and sides overpriced.
Props for the outdoor service during the pandemic. Can't go wrong with the Porterhouse steaks. Martinis are always well served.
I don't eat meat often but when I do I go to Peter Luger. Timeless quality food and atmosphere.
No music no hospitality... way over rated and will not be returning. Thank you for my bday steak.
What a great steakhouse the customer service the prices the food is just great I highly recommend this place im from Chicago im in NY for business and oh boy was I satisfied

I came here for a date night with my boyfriend. Service was attentive and steaks were juicy(I even ordered mine well done)! Make an early reservation to enjoy your dining experience before it gets packed. Would love to come back here.

A lot have restaurants haven't been the same since before the pandemic. Peter Luger has not. This has always been my favorite restaurant and I was extremely happy coming back here and learning that nothing has changed and everything is as good as it always was. I love it when I'm about to finish my order, then the waiter says, "potatoes and creamed spinach?" That's how I know it will be amazing!
We come here for the Saturday (12-3) lunch burger- it's my favorite burger ever and fries are delicious! It's worth the wait and the staff is enjoyable. Never disappoints!

Ok so yes I can nderstsnd this is an institution and probably one of the most famous steakhouses of the entire east coast HOWEVER a legacy has to be honored and protected and a rating is more than just for food so here we go: service 0 out of 5 (dis-genuine server who was missing in action most of the time who is only working there for the big tips and chased after us complaint about his tip- I never ever had anyone chase after me regarding their tip- I mean ever....so ambiance next again scored 0 out of 5 just because the lights were harsh and it felt like a barn packed with people. Finally the steak and fries - really really good- not unbelievably good but still really good which is what made this a 4 (actually should be 3.5 but there is no half so it's a 4)- go for the steak and go slightly tipsy so the rest won't matter!!!

Just went to Peter Luger for the first time after covid 19. They are the same great old school NY restaurant. Order the steak, bacon, & German potatoes and you're good. The Peter Luger Wine, sauce, and Luger Lager are excellent. One of my best experiences. Would prefer if the bread came out hot though.

I was excited to try Peter Luger while in the city with my granddaughter. We were seated quickly with consideration of my semi disabled status. Our waiter reviewed the lunch menu with us and we chose the steak for 2 with a side of fries. The bread was served at room temperature but it was so tasty and the butter so rich that we didn't care. Our only complaint was that the fries (in my opinion) were subpar.

Disappointed. For the amount of money spent and all the hype of the place - i was looking forward to a good steak but it was not all that! I had a better tasting steak and better service at Ruth Chris steakhouse. Maybe I'll try it again to see if I'll change my mind.

Tried it just because it's famous but really it's Your average upscale steak house mixed with a old school traditional dining experience. Party of 4, ate $1000. I'd say money would've been better spent else where.

The steaks were very juicy and thick!!! I just wish there were more side options to pair with the steak. Our fries and bread was also cold once we arrived at our tables. I liked at the end after leaving our tables they came us all chocolate gold coins. I would come here if you are a steak lover but I expected more from this place as concerning the menu and cold items on our table.
Ate here a few weeks back. Nice place, nice staff, but i kinda feel it was overpriced for what i got. Sides were a little skimpy.

After trying so many steak houses in NYC and Paris, I still find myself craving for the Peter Luger Porter house dry aged steak (Medium rare). I originally gave it 4 stars but now I want to update it to a 5 stars. Until I find that steak that will beat it, I'm gonna have to keep coming back.

We asked for a porterhouse for three persons cooked at medium rare. Â The $172 steak came out cooked more than medium rare -- see photo. Â The restaurant staff should pay close attention when cooking a $172 steak. Â The total bill for four persons was $320. Â Also note that the crowd waiting to be seated was ridiculously huge. Â This will not be my first choice for steak since NYC also has Keens, Sparks, and Delmonico's.

Since moving to the Midwest, I am accustomed to high quality inexpensive beef, so slapping a premium on steak, better match the hype. I have always been curious with the dry age process and Peter Luger's name has always come, on topic. Friday, I finally had the opportunity to experience their high quality dry aged cuts yet simple preparation. First of all, the staff was fantastic and accommodating, the moment you walk in, you are greeted and welcomed. Enrique our waiter was fantastic and did not fit my expectation of what an established steak house server would be, young but extremely professional and knowledgably with the product. Let's get to the point, the reason for flying to New York! First bite was like, chewing into a meat gushier candy followed by a burst of umami. This definitely a new experience for me, not to say wet age isn't good, this experience is just unique and definitely will come back to try this again.

Good steak with good presentation. True highlight is the old-school waiting staff which reminds me of a place my pops would like. Overall it's solid and will ride out the century on the back of it's historical relevance.

Very old school vibe. And I liked that. We all got the steak (obviously). Portion for 3 with all the fixing and a portion of 2 without butter (not as good!). I though my steak was delicious. Also the bacon was out of this world. Skip the onion rings. Creamed spinach was great too. I went in with mediocre expectations due to some of the reviews and was pleasantly surprised.

Like the old feel of the restaurant. But I went there to treat my clients to a good steak. Â So ordered the Steak for 3. Â It was a fatty mess. Not enough meet for two unless you want to naw on grizzle. Â  Good waiter. Was caught off guard by no credit cards taken. Â Guy taking my debit card was pushy and had to be checked in place. Â Won't be going back.
Attentive service, very laid back and cozy environment with a great ambiance and a beautiful interior design taking you back to the 18th/19th century! Love the ceiling!

The hype is deserved! Â Peter Luger surpasses a mere "woohoo" - earned 6 stars in my book! This was the best steak I've ever had - and I've had a lot of red meat in my lifetime, in great steak houses in Dallas, Monterrey, Chicago - but Peter Luger tops them. Â I loved the simple menu - no BS, no larded descriptions, it's just porterhouse, sized for 2, 3, or 4 - and the only other steak options is a ribeye or a NY strip. Â That's it - unless, sadly, you don't eat red meat, then there's a token offering of salmon or sole. Â Peter Luger's steak is aged perfectly and grilled to perfection, juicy, minerally, toothsome but tender, and oh-so-flavorful. Â Wow. Â Service is great too, old-school, with a waitstaff that knows their stuff with that Â New York attitude that some can find off-putting but I find charming. Â We started off with an appetizer of their home-cured Luger's bacon - and omg, what a slice of fantastic pork belly that is. Â Sizzling, crisped, fatty and meaty - just tell your doctor it's a bucket list item and you won't do it again (but you know you will if you get any chance at this again!). Â Our group of 9 shared three "Steak for 3" and they were perfect for our appetites, sliced off the bone into meaty, tender chunks. Â Plenty of sides to choose from, but the focus is on the meat, naturally. Â Solid wine list as well. Â And I liked the touch at the end, scattering handfuls of Peter Luger gold-foil wrapped chocolate coins on the table. Â Great fun and a terrific experience. Â Be warned, no credit cards, so bring plenty of cash, but they will also take your debit card (and empty the account, but it's worth it!).

My favorite steakhouse in New York!!!! Amazing steak, super buttery and juicy, served on a super hot plate. I recommend to follow their suggestion and order medium rare. The waiters are real professionals and do a great job. Strongly recommend to start with the bacon as a starter (super thick and super good). Also recommend the pecan pie with their homemade whipped cream. Extremely expensive but worth it. Will certainly be returning!!!

The hype is real! I have lived in Williamsburg, BK for ever and had yet to go here. Decided to treat myself recently and it was definitely worth it! The service and food was up to par. Can't wait to go again soon.

I used to have a charge account here. When I used to go here all the time the clientele was 80% local 20% tourist now it's the opposite but still doesn't take away from what Brooklyn used to be in the old days. Ronnie the manager Nigel the bartender and the waiters still have the flavor of real Brooklyn. Our waiter Lou was great even though he's only been there 15 years the oldest waiter just retired after 52 years at Peter Luger's. The steak is good not great drowned in butter as usual but in all the years I've been here I've never had the Canadian bacon which is a must order. The onion rings were delicious cream spinach as usual great tomato and onions with a special sauce always good. If you have never been here you have to go. There are very few places left that still have that flavor of real New York. Only cash and don't order desert.
Great Food to eat and entertain your guests and yourself to. Being born and raised around Peter Lugar's is a luxury but their burgers are awesome!
The quality of the meat is good. However, I ordered it to be medium rare and it turned out to be medium well. The steak did not feel like it worth $115.

Pro tip, the lamb chops are dry aged too. Adds all the complex depth of flavor you expect from their classic porterhouse in a lamb chop. Steak for one was a little lacking compared to what I've known with the steak for two, but still great with their signature sauce.

Best steak I've ever had. I always get the steak medium rare and it's always perfectly seasoned. The steaks are so juicy and tender and is the best I've had. I love getting a side of creamed spinach and fries! If you're here during lunch time, you can also order their burger which is a pretty solid no frills burger. It's best to make a reservation to minimize wait time since getting there early before they open typically would still result in waiting for about a half hour.

Who needs a review for Lugers!? Come onnnn! Â Top notch.. yes, you can get a great steak at many places but to go with that these guys have the best wedge salad (I'm a big wedge guy) I've ever had... I'm a big fan of going for lunch for the wedge and the burger! Ohhhhh THE BURGER!!!

We have eaten at a ton of steakhouses and figured we would check this off of the list. Overall it was okay- steak was good, bread was hard and seemed stale but dessert was the best part. Wouldn't come again but glad we tried it.
I don't care what Pete Wells says but this is the best steakhouse in NYC! Best steak, best bacon, best burger! Don't sleep on the lamb chops! They are super underrated! I love every time I go!

let me begin there is only one reason to go here and that would be to prove how stupid of a sucker you are. cream spinach is spectacular thats it , steak we received was garbage, i truly think it came from the garage the inconsistency of the cook gave it away not to mention the bite the was spoiled yes spoiled utterly just a dattdamn shame

I was not impressed by this place . The prices are so high and they brought out cold bread, the whole place smelled like the bleach . The wine tasted water down. And the decor wasn't anything to look at .

This spot is serving meal kits as well as offering delivery during Covid of course nothing beats the in person experience but the livery is a great second option right now the food was phenomenal and I'm just glad that they're still open and operating so many businesses Lost a lot of money doing these tough times I highly recommend this Peter Luger
This place feels overpriced, overrated and limited in options. They use to have a great steak burger lunch deal, not sure if they still do.
Peter Luger is a really very nice and good restaurant. They have delicious steaks. I made a picture of all the nice things I thought of. Yay Peter Luger!

We were in Brooklyn passing by Peter Luger's, and decided to go in to see if we could make a reservation. We asked for any time a available and snagged one for the weekend after. We arrived early and decided to order drinks while waiting. To our surprise our table was ready earlier than we expected(and earlier than our designated time slot). The service staff were wonderful, the steak even better, and the kids loved the burger we ordered. The creamed spinach was also delicious. Just remember keep your drink orders to a minimum because it does add up!
We came here for our Â anniversary. Â Excellent! Â Steak was amazing and french fries were cooked perfectly. Little pricey but worth it! We would come back!
Maybe because I'm not such a steak fan but this steak spot didn't do it for me sorry. We were also located near the window seat and I spotted a large cockroach crawling near the windows
The food was delicious, the service was great. The hospitality was superb. I really had a good time

Kiery, our server, the managers Peter and mike, and the entire staff made a very good experience GREAT! Food was excellent, but without strong customer service, a dining experience can be mediocre. Not here. Excellent from beginning to end. Thank you, Kiery, Peter, and Mike!
This is one of the best places you can eat in New York it's it might cost a little more than other restaurants but it is well worth it for the experience

Really amazing meal - the dry aged rib steak was so flavorful, charry, buttery, and really simple. The burger, made from the same source of meat as the steaks, was so juicy and beefy too. Couldn't have asked for a better meal and was glad I could try arguably the nation's best steakhouse. Also ordered the tomatoes and onions at ~$16... didn't seem that worth it after it came served a la 'ready to put on a burger' - but everything else was to die for

I came here with a friend and family member. We had reservations and we arrived a little early but they were amazing and accommodated us right away. We sat in a room that had one large party of about 6 men and unfortunately they made most of our dinner unpleasant because they were just loud and obnoxious. However, we ordered the steak for 3 and it made up for those baboons who just annoyed everyone in hearing distance of them. The steak sauce they serve with it is so yummy. You can use it as a dip for your bread or just go ahead and slurp it down because it's that good!! I wish I asked if they actually sell it. The service from our waiter was phenomenal and he did quality check right away when we got our steak. I went here on a Sunday night and it was raining but the trip was all worth it! I would come back here again!!
Steak was good. Â Service is not up to par for a classic steak house. Â Out Waiter was not very pleasant. Â Other servers were.

Established in 1887 and has perfected steaks and burgers. Even before it opened there was already fifty people waiting outside for lunch [yes, lunch! Not even dinner]. If you want to make reservations, know that they're booked six weeks out. Also, if you get dessert, choose the sundae with their homemade whip cream. Burgers were better than the steaks in my opinion. But what do I know - I went for dessert and their homemade whip cream

Came here after hearing all the of the hype and chatter and was sadly disappointed. Staff is very not welcoming or friendly. My steak was burnt on one side and undercooked on the other. Complete rip off for the quality of meat and service. Much better going off to other steakhouses in the city, or watching a YouTube and learning how to make your own. Really sad because I thought this would be my new spot.

Great experience I had first time going to Peter Luger's here in Brooklyn the service was phenomenal the waiters waitresses were all on top of their game one thing I didn't like is I asked for well done I never got it well done and then they told me that you shouldn't get your steak well done I like to eat things the way I want to eat it should not tell me how I should eat it but overall food was great service was great

Hands down, one of the best steak houses I've been too. You have to make reservations 1-2 months ahead of time because this place is famous for it's world class steak and everyone knows it. I went with a group of friends and we got the porter house steak for 3 but 4 of us split it and we still couldn't finish the entire steak even though it tasted delicious. We also got the creamed spinach which was good, but not the best I've ever had. The sizzling slab of bacon was delicious as well- definitely recommend this juicy appetizer if you like pork. We wanted to try the Luger-burger because we got positive reviews about it- the burger was also good but not to die for. My vegetarian friend got the salmon and it tasted juicy- steakhouses do have the best salmon. As for our drinks- we got a bottle of the Peter Luger Napa valley Cabernet and it went perfectly with our steak! To end the meal we got milk chocolate coins that hit the spot before we paid.
it's worth it. I know there's it's expensive but in terms of quality you're getting your money's worth

The wife and I are here a while back just before indoor dining was shut down. The steak for 2 was perfect cooked as ordered. All the sides were delicious. Service was too notch. When we save up for another meal there we will be back.

I called up January 10 and asked for the first Saturday available. The guy on the phone told me February 5 so I made the reservation for that day at 5:45. I called the day prior (February 4) to confirm the reservation and a lady answered the phone. She stated to me that she did not see the reservation for February 5th but did see one for February 9th which is a Wednesday at 5:45. I told her it was an error on the restaurants end because I would never make a reservation 3 weeks prior for a weekday. She also rudely said that it was a girl I spoke to on January 10 when I made the reservation. I ensured her it was a male but I can tell she thought I was lying. She was very rude and said there is nothing she can do. This caused a huge inconvenience for my wife and I being we made arrangements for a baby sitter and changed around our plans. I've eaten there before and obviously the food is great but will never go back because of the way I was treated. I understand they don't need my business and because of that I was treated accordingly.

column3: South San Mateo, San Mateo, CA

column6: Reservations were easy to make online, and both text and phone confirmations were received prior to the date. Upon arrival, we were greeted immediately. Once seated in the dining room bread was placed on the table. The rolls had onions on top and inside which were quite delicious. There was also another breadstick type of bread but we preferred the onion one. Drinks are not listed on the menu and you need to request another menu if looking to browse the options. I asked the waiter for the list of beers on tap and he named them for me. I ordered a Brooklyn lager and as stated on the back of their menu, the drink was oversized and a generous pour. Â As an appetizer we ordered the thick sliced bacon which comes by the slice, so we got two. The waiter brought them over and said as they were on the small side they gave us a third piece to make up for it. The bacon is tasty and a must try for sure. As an entree we ordered the steak for two, and appetizers we selected the German potatoes and onion rings. The steak came pre-cut which was nice and it was still sizzling on the plate. While the potatoes were melt-in-your-mouth delicious, the onion rings were not up to par. The onion rings lacked favor and softened within minutes to a soggy consistency. Thankfully, there was plenty else to eat. All the sides can serve two or more people so sharing is definitely suggested. The steak was flavorful, and if it isn't for you, they provide their own Peter Lugers sauce in a gravy boat for extra seasoning. The service was fast and the wait staff was pleasant. The chocolate coins you receive with your bill are a nice bonus!

This is by far the best place for steaks! As to why it was so difficult at one point to get a reservation. Now they have an app to book resys. Anywhoo, you can't leave with out at least trying the Bacon Strip. This is not your typical bacon from the breaktable! It is thick and delicious, especially with the PL Sauce. I ordered the Steak for Two and loved every bit of it! Cooked to perf, following my medium well instrucions. I also had the spinach and fries (a little over cooked for fries) but overall excellent service! The waiter was very helpful and I enjoyed my dinner. I'm sure I'll be back again.

Everything is always amazing here! It's easier to get a lunch reservation than dinner and the menu is the same so it's still a great experience. We started with the wedge salad and Caesar salad. The dressing on the Caesar salad is amazing. Also the wedge salad comes with a slice of their thick cut bacon on top, which is amazing. We then got the porterhouse for 2, German potatoes and creamed spinach. The porterhouse for 2 can serve 3 people and it was cooked perfectly at medium rare. The German potatoes were flavorful and crispy and the creamed spinach is one of my favorites. We ended with the apple strudel dessert and chocolate chocolate chip ice cream. My husband loved the apple dessert and I loved the ice cream as it comes with huge chocolate chunks. I would definitely recommend.

It's exactly what everyone says and exactly what you'd expect. This is neither the formulaic (admittedly decent) and clubby chains like Capital or Ruth's Chris nor the 'nicer' spots like Delmonico. It's one of a kind. No kidding it feels like a beer hall in Munich. Lots of tourists and locals alike. The bacon, omg. Especially with the sauce. Steaks right on. And the sides and desserts. Whatever. Just get in a Lyft and go before another 10, 20, 100 years goes by. And the NYT review is 100% right. And 100% wrong. You should try to understand why.

After calling a month in a half in advance, we were only able to get a lunch reservation, so we took it! I ordered the burger and my bf ordered the steak for one. My burger was probably one of the best I've ever had. It was cooked perfectly and tasted amazing. The steak was ordered medium rare and it was definitely closer to rare. This was a slight disappointment to bf, so I ended up splitting my burger with him and having some steak because I could probably eat it rare and be happy! It was great quality. The fries were thick and crispy. Would be in the top for best I've ever had as well. I'm glad we took the trek to Brooklyn to check this place out. It surely lived up to the hype!
Way overrated and not worth the money expected a lot more for the price will try something new next time as of noe not in a hurry to return
Get the steak for 2 med rare and dessert! If you're in time for lunch, get the burger- it's amazing! Oh also, the bacon is delicious and thick cut. 10/10 would recommend!

New York Times did a negative review of P.L. solely because of an ideologically driven pansy-ass bias against anything masculine and old school. Well I have news for you NYT: this place will outlive, out-class, and out-earn you and all of your kind. Old school establishments will survive long past your due date in this town. These are the best steaks in NYC forever and the new urban progressive social revisionists can kiss my hindquarters.
Amazing meal --- we received our order on a timely manner everything was wonderful, food was warm and fresh!

They'll lose your reservation then tell you to wait 3 hours even when you have confirmation code. Staff is rude and honestly disgusting. Wants you to pay 500 on a meal but they can't even seat a reservation.

Probably my favorite steakhouse in town. Just a big fan of that crispy texture on the outside of the steak. The only downside here is that they only accept cash or debit card. No credit card allowed. They need to keep it classy.

I went with 3 of us. We ordered the stake for two, Great quality of beef. portion was more than enough for 3 of us. The service was also good. Since it's aging beef I can't eat it at home so it's definitely worth it to come here for special occasions.

I've been back a few times now, but I just get myself to say that it lives up to the hype. It's a good, solid, traditional/old-school steakhouse. The steak is good, but there is plenty of quality competition out there nowadays, which puts out as good, if not a better prepared steak. The staff and service also leaves a lot to be desired and they act like they're doing you a favor by being there, especially the older waitstaff.

We love Luger's. The steak is absolute perfection. Start with the Caesar salad and the bacon (a must!). Our the steak with the creamed spinach. Then perfect meal. The only difference each time we done here is our server. Your server can make or break your meal. Armand was our server tonite and he was a genuine delight. Such warmth and professionalism. A true gem.
Classy and casual all in one. We been going for almost 20 years. Steak is delicious. Do not forget to bring cash!

We were at Peter Luger's a few weeks ago, and the food (steak for 2, creamed spinach, German-fried potatoes) was perfect and classic as always. The only reason to review is because our server, Kristian, was so excellent, professional, and kind. He took great care of us and was a huge benefit to our entire experience.
What a great find! Glad we stumbled in here. The dishes are quite large so there is a lot of food! Outright, I must say their service is impeccable Yet I definitely recommend this place!

I will never understand the hype of this place. Over priced and unseasoned. I've had better meat from street carts. Not worth the price.... but again, For some people its the name, but I dont see the worth.

I was going to give this place another chance this time for lunch so I go online to book a table for one (Im off for two months, everyone else is working, what the heck!), plenty of open spots for two when I change it to one all of a sudden no times available hmmm. I call and told them I tried to book online and no luck. Do I walk in? Im told by an unfriendly woman, there aren't any availability for one until next month and stressing that tables are VERY limited. I go back after I call to check and see for two, well my eyes didn't deceive me the first time, there are plenty of slots which goes to show discrimination against solo diners which is a shame because its NYC, known for its large population of singles. You keep breaking my heart Peter Luger. Singles want to contribute to the economy and enjoy a good meal as well. I guess I'll spend my money elsewhere.

I feel bad not leaving a 5 star review because of the whole hype of this restaurant but it just didn't exceed my expectations at all. Came here for my birthday dinner. Made reservations a week before and the only time available was at 9:45 so MAKE A RESERVATION. The ambiance was not all that at all. The wine glasses and plates looked really old at outdated. I have gone to multiple high end steak restaurants and the serves are usually dressed really nicely in suits and even light music playing In background. I even felt like the service wasn't all that great either for being a $$$$ restaurant. Idk if it's just how it is now because of covid but wow. The worst part was the steak. It was sooooo overcooked as you can see in the picture posted. That is not medium well. It is completely burnt. We got two sides, potatoes and the creamy spinach. I really like the. Really spinach. Was really bummed about the bad experience especially since everyone hyped it up so much for us. Going to have to pass.

I've been going to Peter Luger for many years with my family and at least 5 times a year with a large group of guys. Â  The online scheduler is amazing and the way they handled the Covid issue was second to none. Â As soon as you get the bread and onion rolls you're off to the races. Â  I've to date not had a better piece of thick cut bacon or steak in my life. Â And don't get me started on the burgers. Â There are plenty of great burger joints here in NYC (The Jackson Hole, The Grand Canyon, 5 Napkin Burger, The Corner Bistro and the list goes on and on). Â BUT, Peter Luger's burger is hands down the best burger I have ever eaten and you can get steak fries with it (enough fries for 2). Â Everything is delicious. Â The German Potatoes, Tomato Shrimp and Onion chopped and mixed together, the Cream Spinach, and the list keep going. Â My mother loves the salmon. Â Then the deserts. Â All amazing. Â Cheesecake is my favorite smothered with Schlag! Â I always take about 6 slices of bacon home to heat up for a few days (yum). Â I already have my next reservation booked lol.

Went back to my childhood neighborhood and to o one of the old spots I dreamed of going as a kid. I always wanted to dine at Peter Luger Steak house but the quality and service was less than I expected. Also, I had to ask our waiter to replace our glasses a number of times as our glasses were dirty. Literally, I saw someone's lips imprinted on the glass (gross). I hope Peter Luger goes returns the high standards it once held. I don't see myself going to back Peter Luger Steak house.

I sit here at my table inside The Peter Luger restaurant, stuffed, happy and am amazed at the quality of food and service. Make reservations and you wont be disappointed. We got the steak for 4, bacon, tomatoes and onions, salad, sundae, cheesecake all outstanding!!!

Made a reservation a month in advance to eat outdoors tonight. They texted me an hour earlier saying my reservation was cancelled due to NYC ordered shutdown because of the weather (but the weather is fine and other places are open). Travelled 2 hours from Jersey and paid $60 for parking. No apology... no rescheduled date. I even called days before asking if the weather today would be an issue and the employee gave me attitude for even asking. I get that it's not in their control, but their staff seems rude. Don't bank on your reservation being protected.

The steak for 2 was BOMB DOTCOM. Priced a little under $110, it was perfect for sharing. Although my friend and I didn't order any sides, we were more than satisfied with our portions. The meat was buttery, juicy, and tender, while the edges were perfectly charred. Now this is what you call medium-rare. They also cut the steak into small pieces for you and keep the bone on the plate in case you like to eat the remainder of the meat off the bone like I do. Unlike other steakhouses, Peter Luger didn't have that bougie vibe (extra point!) and it was pretty well-lit so you can actually SEE what you're eating. Excellent service and the entire restaurant gave us a homey feel. Don't let their debit card and cash only policy prevent you from coming here; you won't be disappointed :)
Awesome steak burgers and cream spinach. Their home fries are delicious plus their cocktail drinks are great

I'm back to keeping kosher so I don't come here any more BUT the steaks are delicious! Â I know everyone raves about the thick bacon cuts but that part didn't do it for me. Â It was the steak AND the pecan pie!
My favorite steak house in America. Haven't tried their takeout or the outside seating yet but stay tuned...
Special celebration with a friend. Ignore the brusque service part of its charm. The porterhouse is fabulous melt in your mouth. Incomparable taste. Worth it for the memory.

Best steak ever? Well that's for you to decide, but for me? I loved every juicy, melt in my mouth, flavored filled bite! Wow! I wish I was eating it again. Walking in knowing this is the the first steak house from 1887, and still in business means something is working! We travel to New York for my mother-in-law's 60th birthday this was definitely one of the places we had to go to try, and it didn't disappoint I loved the full basket of bread (three different types) the steak fries were amazing, and for the steak... well it says it all in the beginning! A steak I won't forget any time soon! As a average earning joe, it was pricy but that comes with the territory of great food! I would go back again without a second thought of was it worth it

Absolutely amazing dinner! I've been waiting for four years to come here. Despite all the anticipation, Peter Luger significantly exceeded my expectations. Staff was super friendly and the service was some of the best I've seen in NYC. All of the food was delicious, but the steak was.....perfect. Can't wait to come back. Special shout out to Ronnie and Shabo, who were both exceptional. Peter Luger sets very high expectations with its reputation. And yet somehow manages to exceed them.
Great experience and great meat. Â If you are a meat lover, this is heaven...we had a burger, rib eye steak and one person steak, all were excellent. Service was great!
The best steak in nyc. I don't care what anyone says! Great food. You have to try the whip cream. Get the steak medium rare PLUS.

My fiance and I were totally impressed by the steak! Â It surely lived up to the high expectations, melt in your mouth and buttery. Â The service was great as well! Â We started with the shrimp cocktail and ended with the cheesecake...all divine!

This place has been on my list for years - not sure what took me so long to try it...oh wait, it's because they never answer the phone. Either way I was hyped they decided to let me spend my money there and dine with them on a Monday night. My excitement quickly faded. We were sat 45 minutes after our reservation on a Monday night. The service was deplorable - top 5 worst experiences in the city. Food and drink? Decent. Dirty martini was great (kudos to you Mr. Bartender). Steak was fine. Baked potato was drier than the desert. Bread was served cold - with cold butter - which I found strange (though I never met a carb I didn't like). At the end of the meal the host came over and apologized for sitting us late and offered us free dessert (so thank you for that). Ice cream sundae was the highlight of the meal! Would I come back? No. Am I glad I came? No.

Peter luger is a great place to eat in NYC. The experience was amazing. It can be pricy Â but it is so worth it to go at least once. The meat is super soft it melts in your mouth. Our server felipe was so nice and friendly. We went with a large group and it was fun. The burguer is also really good.

Another place I was anxiously waiting to visit. Being that most places in NYC are closed, this trip was to focus on what is open. Our group elected to sit outside, DESPITE indoor dining still being available. We did lunch and my party had varied choices: one of us ordered the rib steak, it was an ENORMOUS portion, another had the hamburger and I chose the salmon. We all sampled everything, and nothing was less than perfect. The German potatoes and creamed spinach rounded out an excellent lunch. Strudel and coffee for dessert. Remember, they don't take credit cards for dine-in, we did cash and debit (Dutch treat) ... I would definitely return. For what it's worth, we took the subway from downtown to Marcy avenue, then WALKED back across the Williamsburg Bridge after that large lunch. I preferred the walk.
This place is extremely over priced for what it is. The good is amazing and service can be hit or miss. I personally don't think it is worth this price point.

If you're a foodie and you appreciate an amazing steak...you will love Peter Luger's. Â The service was impressive. Our server was Felipe, by the end of our meal I felt like he was family. Â We had the potatoes as a side....a must; creamed spinach YUM; but the bacon... seriously...shut UP...I wish we would have ordered more. Â Was it expensive? Â Yes. Was it worth every penny? Â YES! Â It will definitely be on my must cost list every time I'm in NY!!!

Overrated and over priced. Â  Their era is gone. Â  Â They used to have good food and the hostile sarcastic waiters were kind of fun. Â  Now the food's not good, the service sucks and it's way too pretentious. Â Time to close.

An absolute classic that lives up to its storied history. Everything was fantastic, I even found the curt and gruff service endearing. The creamed spinach complemented the perfectly cooked sirloin and the house made whipped cream elevated the desserts to another level.

Well, this lived up to all the hype. Supposedly the best steak house in NY, this did not disappoint. I would recommend making a reservation and they only accept cash or debit cards - no credit cards, so plan accordingly. The food was outstanding, our favorite was the side of bacon - you have to get it!!

First of, totally worth going to Brooklyn. We only could do lunch ,could not get reservation for lunch nor dinner , got lucky and after some wait got 2 spots by the bar. limited offerings but we had steak and a burger, fries. Orgasmic... really really good!!star taken off for lack of ambience to my taste, not attentive bar staff - Â bartender I believe his name was Chris not attentive at all, empty water glass forever and had to wait and get his attention to order drinks, however quite vocal about tip being paid to the bar separate from food order ( food service good, Andrew I think???) Â and the smallest not very clean bathroom. For the way they present themselves , I expected a better atmosphere. Do not risk it and make reservation!!!

I love Peter Lugar. Its such a classic place to get steak and its really all about the experience. Â It's not as fancy but you will get a really good steak and you will want to come back. Reservations are hard to get if you want something for 1-2 weeks in advance. But if you book a month out, you usually can get a decent time.

Great service and food, you gotta have to make a reservation, it was packed. We ordered a steak for two, prime rib, German fried potatoes and creamed spinach. We ordered holy cow as well. The food was more than enough for four people. Steak was cooked perfect juicy and soft, chewy for some parts. I love their fried potatoes and spinach but it's not for everyone. My parents doesn't like it because it was like mashed potatoes. The dessert was so good but a little bit to sweet at the end if you're finishing it by yourself.

No NYC trip is complete without a trip to Luger. The sauce is the best part, I put that stuff on everything. We usually go with a group of 10 and we all split a couple porterhouse steaks - Medium RARE. We adore the bacon slices which if you don't eat a lot of meat is a meal in itself.
