All the sides are yummy but I'd say you don't need a head of brocoli or fries. The spinach is the best complement for any steak and the coffee with their whip cream is INSANE! so don't forget to get coffee at the end and they'll give you a dolp of cream on the side. Make sure you bring cash! =)

I have been to this fine restaurant 3 times now. The steak is to die for and the spinach and mash potatoes as sides make this meal extravagant. The only thing I can take a star away from is that they charge a fee if you dont come as a couple. If I pay for a whole steak for myself why charge me a fee because I came alone!! That's crazy to me. Other than that the service and food is amazing. Always a go to for a great steak dinner.

For the price I expected much better. I heard from a friend who took me there that the steak is so good it "literally melts in your mouth." Unfortunately, no such thing happened (neither figuratively nor literally). I equate my experience to what I'd get at any other decent steak restaurant, like Texas Roadhouse. At least there I wouldn't have spent hundreds of dollars. One last thing. Servers and bartenders are cranky old men.
Love the meal. Not the greatest steak based on everything I anticipated. But maybe another try later

This is the steakhouse of ALL steakhouses. They've been in business since the 1800's and have rightfully earned themselves the number one spot on the list of best steakhouses in the country. On my recent trip up to the big Apple, we made reservations here months in advance. The porterhouse for two along with the German potatoes and creamed spinach were the main reasons we dined here. It is cash only so keep that in mind but it's worth every penny. The steak cut like butter, it was so decadent and rich-I couldn't stop myself from eating more than I probably should have. The taste of that juicy pink steak with the perfect sear on the exterior cooked to the perfect medium rare standard was worth the wait and the price. The wine list is minimal but perfectly selected.

If you want the best stake in the entire country , this is the right place Peter Luger I recommend bring your own wine and couple Cuban cigars after finish eating and ask the waiters for a nice brandy or cognac to relax with your illegally Cuban cigar Cohiva esplÃªndido Â or Montecristo and if you don't have one of those then down the street you have Davidoff cigars ok bom Â apetite !!!
Great aged steak. This steakhouse is famous for a reason. Well worth the price. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu. So glad we stopped and tried it!

I have been eating at this place for 45 years and nothing has changed, it's still always amazing. I had the pecan pie for the first time WOW that was great. The service staff is always top notch and the over all experience is never disappointing.
Peter Peter what can I say? I know Fake news !! Bad review from the Times my my I loved my Ribeye. My first visit and I was impressed because it couldn't get any better!!!!

To be honest I was hoping they would have a chimichanga. I eat them frequently, very delicious. Didn't end up being as big of a deal as I thought it would, Peter Luger cooks a great steak. The decor was very classy, and those that know me know that's very important. Make sure you get the potatoes.
Best steak in nyc (oh brooklyn). Â Was a bit of a wait (we were a party of 8 but totally worth it. Great food and service

Amazing steak huge portions. Also the appetizer we had the bacon and it was the best bacon I've ever had, the bacon pieces were really tender and juicy- devoured it in seconds. I asked for rare on the steak and it was perfect. The dessert we got pecan pie and it came with the best shlag (whipped cream) I've ever had. The whipped cream was really fluffy and not too light but not too heavy. I definitely would recommend checking this place out. The service was also fantastic and staff was so friendly to everyone!
everything was A1 here ! food, service and decor all on fleek ! Waiters was great company

we haven't been for 20 years, everything was as we remembered it except service is less gruff. steak for 3, spinach, hash browns, onion and tomato salad, onion rings and draft beer were all among the best we've had.

My family and I have been traveling to NYC over the years and made it to Peter Luger on our last trip. Â Overall, it was good but certainly not great given all the other steak options available now. Â We did really enjoy the bacon because it was a nice thick cut and was different (in a good way) from other bacon. Â However, you come for the porterhouse. It was a good strong beef flavor due to aging but not exceptional. Â My son ages steaks at home and cooks it up just as nice if not nicer than Peter Luger.

I have not been here for YEARS, but from what I remember it was the BEST. Â The porterhouse (rare) as to die for as was the creamed spinach was was just as good. Â I hope I can visit one last time before I leave for the west coast for good!

This place is a joke. Â Our hotel concierge made a reservation for a party of 4 and when we arrived, Manager on duty advised Â that they don't have our reservation. Â After checking, they find out that the reservation showed cancelled. Â We advised that we never cancelled the reservation so if they can somehow find a way to sit us. Â But to our surprise, manager on duty flatly denied sitting because the reservation showed cancelled.. Â So we explained to him that we Â flew in from Los Angeles and made reservation Â months ahead so that we can experience their steak. Â But to my surprise, this guy made no attempt to sit us and just gave us a blank stare and said sorry that the reservation showed cancelled and that he is unable to sit us. Â This is the kind of establishment Peter Luger is running. Â They have no concern for their Â customer and was plainly unsympathetic. Â you can imagine if their manager acts this way, how good of service can you expect from their servers. Â So I have explained all this to my concierge and they advised that Peter Luger is known for bad service and for this reason, they do not recommend this restaurant to their guest.. Â So instead, they made a reservation at Benjamin prime where we had one of the best steak and services in town. Â So if you want good food, good service and good location and ambiance, go elsewhere as you will not find any of this in Peter Luger..

We went on a double date, over ordered to try a nice mix of things recommended by friends. We went for my friends wife's birthday (I do not eat red meat) I ordered shrimpCocktail SO good! Then my main dish was salmon, which my friend made me return it. It honestly was not good at all. I know it's a steakhouse & according to them their steaks were delicious . Our server was nice, I actually saw the male host shove someone to their seat which I couldn't believe my eyes lol whip cream they make I enjoyed and their cheese cake was standard.

Brooklyn Bucket List worthy for sure. This most recent visit was my third time around and there's comfort in the fact that not much changes at Peter Lugers. The intoxicating smells of steak that waft on Broadway outside the restaurant only intensify as you enter the door. The menu remains simple and the steak for -however many in your party- is an easy and delicious decision. The bread basket gets an A+ (just don't fill up on those onion rolls). I've ordered the sliced tomatoes and onions at the staff's suggestion during prior trips and was pretty disappointed. This time around we opted for the thick cut sizzling bacon slices (as other diners have suggested) and wow! Never passing on this appetizer again. The side order of the Special German Fried Potatoes was also a first for me as well. Our leftovers were packaged up in a neat doggie bag and were just as good the next day. Yes, it's cash only (a bummer given the high cost of the meal) and while I didn't have issue making a reservation (as others have. I'd suggest calling early on a Saturday or Sunday), we did end up having to dine at 5:45pm on a weekday to secure something sooner than later. An experience for sure!

Came here for family lunch for Father's Day. Waitstaff was very professional and knowledgeable. Overall a good experience but the steak was just okay to me. I felt like I've had better steak elsewhere. Steak tasted kind of bland and needed the steak sauce.

The steak is wonderful and this an amazing dining experience every meat lover needs in their life time. Â Is it my favorite steakhouse no.. but it's great and it's classic. Â The burger is by far the best item here, it's soft and somehow light but buttery and delicious. Â I would eat that burger every day.

Super cool old-timey ambiance. It is expensive but the service is immaculate and the food is amazing. It's been around forever and it shows. They know what they're doing. You won't regret coming here.

Steak was delicious... let's get that right. Thankfully, they're open for outdoor dining but the location is not ideal. Heavy traffic and a nearby subway line that drowns out conversations. Takes away from the Peter Luger experience.
Classic and super delicious place! Excellent meat and superb service. This is def a must when visiting NY and looking for a traditional place with awesome meat cuts!
The bomb. Expensive as hell but worth it for special occasions! Steaks are out of this world. Extremely hard to get in.
A dick move to not accept cash. And is racist. Did not tip since we didn't get the service we paid for.

So I'd come to NYC for work, the other tattooers I went out with recommended this place. We work hard an love a good steak after a 12 hour day. It was everything I'd heard it would be, Â I only it gave it 4 stars, and that's because my steak got a little cold faster than I'd have liked it to, but I ordered it medium rare so that's probably fault. Other than that I loved it an I'll definitely come back next time I'm in NYC.

I think the food is good but not worth the hype! It's definitely not number 1 steakhouse. After 2 years of living in NYC, I finally made it here and was longing for more. It's a hassle making a RSVP. Call a bunch of times 6 weeks ahead and hopefully you'll get through. The dÃ©cor is simple and classy. Excellent service. I had the single steak medium. The meat quality was good, but I didn't taste any seasoning! The caesar salad was good. Nothing special about the french fried potatoes or creamed spinach. The "Holy Cow" sundae was great. The chocolate gold coins were a nice touch. This place is old school, but nothing fancy. This is the most overrated steakhouse in NYC. They need to get with the times: use open table for RSVP and accept credit cards.

I am not a steak person, but I came here for my brother's birthday. It's an institution, so I was expecting good things, to be blown away or whatever, and to write a glowing yelp review about how this was amazing, even though I'm not a steak person. I was sorely disappointed. The steak was disappointing and chewy and expensive. Not worth it!

Do not dine at this racist establishment. We made reservations for lunch on a saturday and was seated at the room closest to the front door. While we waited for our food, I looked around and was slightly confused by the overwhelming number of asians but didnt make much of it as I saw that there were some other ethnicities in the mix (not caucasian) To my utter shock, I realized as I was leaving that there were two other rooms with wide windows and hall tables with more visibility to the street, full of ONLY caucasians. Never thought I'd have to experience this. And of all places in NYC. I am so incredibly disappointed

Its seriously a pain in the tushie to get a reservation here. Â You have to call a month ahead and after fighting a few busy signals, hold for awhile. Â But worth it. Â The steak is phenomenal and sides are fantastic. Â Save room for desert! You are Â going to want that famous Sundae! Â They also bring out the homemade "schlag" which is fresh, whipped cream along with some chocolate coins at the end of your meal. Â If you can, be sure to get a couple slices of the thick Â cut bacon. Â They have house made steak sauce that, to me, reminds me of A1 mixed with Heinz 57. Â I thought it was super good on the onion rings but didn't want to corrupt my steak with it. Â Just remember, CASH ONLY!!!! Â And enjoy. We will be back.

The lunch burger is the best deal. For $16, that's totally worth the money. We ordered both the burger and steak at the same time. The steak is tasty as well. Â But I personally like the taste of the burger better.
Very decent place. I would recommend the steak for two! Porterhouse! That's just the best thing on earth. And by the way even the caesar salad is really good!

Yes it's expensive and you have to pay cash, but you'll be eating some of the best aged steaks in your life. Â There's a reason they've been around over a century. Â Remember, everything is a-la-cart, so don't expect a side of vegetables or fries unless you order it. Â If it is over your budget, but you still want to try the restaurant, go for lunch on a weekday.
Amazing food and service. Very friendly severs. We really have a great time here in the heart of Williamsburg, Brooklyn.
Amazing Service! Steak was cooked to perfection, this place was nice and cozy and made my visit to New York, quite pleasant. Thank you!

Very overrated unfortunately . I was really excited to go here but it just wasn't a good experience . The service is very New York , a bit rough around the edges - so was the food . Soggy , fries, salty bacon and tasteless steak . I spent $300 there and it simply isn't with the hype.

Can I give 0? Ok I can't fine I'll give the lowest. Why? Way over-rated place, way over priced. Food is disgusting. If you want to spend at least $200 for two try somewhere else. With a waiter serving you and always complaining that he's going to quit you won't find any thing good to say about this place. Need some wine to wash down your charred meat and you serve me a glass of wine dumped with dregs from three bottle bottoms so that I'll choke and won't talk? You underestimated me. This is not a practice from a C rated restaurant OK. Jesus. If you are a New Yorker don't go to this sick tourists attraction. You deserve better.

Well, despite recent reviews, I continue to love this place. My son takes me every year for my birthday, and I always look forward to it. To me, the service has always been perfect, not rude at all. I always get extra bacon to go!

Some restaurants simply do not need a lot of bling to bring people in the door and Peter Lugers is one of them. This is the place to go to if you want a porterhouse steak... cooked to perfection, tender, charred on the outside, moist and partially pink on the inside, sitting in its own juice waiting to be enjoyed. It really is that good. I won't bore you with the other dishes nor the ambiance or wait staff. They were all exceptional but they are not the reason I go to Peter Lugers. The porterhouse steak is why you go here. We were able to get reservations for lunch on a Saturday without to much difficulty...dinner reservations on a weekend would surely require a few months lead time. Do whatever you must to enjoy a porterhouse steak at Peter Lugers in Brooklyn, New York.
Grilled meat is my weakness! It is very difficult to find a restaurant that can make it delicious! But this is exactly the case! One of the best steaks in my life!

This place is a true signature of New York. Make sure your get the wedge and thick bacon to start. The steak is very good. My only complaint would be the sides are ok at best. But let's face it, you don't come here for the sides.

I have been to steakhouses all over, and this place is still number one in my book. The steak is out of this world. Unfortunately, they are not keeping up with the times and their appetizers are really nothing to be desired. The mozzarella with tomatoes, the large shrimp cocktail. All is delicious, but something additional is needed. The German potatoes are really not German but burnt potatoes that are often inedible. Took my family here earlier and they couldn't eat them. The French fries however is out of this world. I suggest a steak for two with shrimp cocktail and the french fries. The apple struddle for dessert is a must. Also, they make good solid drinks. Listen, if you are interested in amazing steak, this is the place to go. You won't have fancy appetizers, but your belly will be full with amazing meat that is difficult to match.

Underwhelming and disappointed is the best way to put it. Â Service, sub par. Â They didn't even try. One of the servers Â didn't even give my girlfriend right of way when walking to out seats. Â Food, nothing special... dry aged? Couldn't tell it was dry aged. Â If you want a nice steak with service to meet the price point, go elsewhere. Â This place has a chip on its shoulders', rubbed me the wrong way.

We flew all the way from California to have try the Prime Rib. Â When we arrived on Friday for lunch (with our reservation) we were seated almost immediately even though they had about an hour wait for non-reservations. Â Sat down to some amazing fresh bread and butter and a vat of their homemade steak sauce. Â When I tried to order the Prime Rib, I was informed they were already sold out. Â They didn't even have any scraps left. Â I told the waiter that I had come all the way from California to eat the Prime Rib and he apologized. Â So we ordered their special cheeseburger that we had also heard all about. Â When it arrived, the waiter told us he hooked us up with free bacon and cheese since he felt bad about not having any Prime Rib. Â The burger was delicious and the bacon was amazing on its own. Â After the burger, we were stuffed. Â He asked if we wanted dessert. Â We declined due to being too full. Â The cool waiter showed up a few minutes later with two bite size pieces of their homemade apple strudel and whipped cream. Â He said that it was so good that we had to try it. Â He wasn't kidding. Â It was amazing. Â If I wasn't full, I would have gotten more of that stuff. Â The whipped cream alone was worth it.

NOTHING SPECIAL... Why do people continue to come here, wait, and pay so much for this place? Came here on a Thursday evening. Had a reservation for 7:45, was seated at 8:20. What's the point of making a reservation? Ordered the steak for 2 along with creamed spinach and German potatoes. The spinach was not good. The potatoes were burned. The first piece of steak was good and everything after that was downhill. Paid $180 for 2 people. NOT WORTH THE MONEY!!! There are much better steakhouses in this city, don't waste your time.

This is the best Peter Luger I have a been to we've been going here for the past three years never fails the meat is cooked to perfection the way I want it the waiters waitresses managers everybody is so friendly at this place every time I make a reservation for a certain time I don't wait no more than 1015 minutes if I can give you guys 10 stars I would definitely check out this Peter Lugar's

Great steak, just simply awesome! Juicy, perfectly cooked and just all round fulfilling! The wait staff were pretty attentive aardvark pleasant. Have been waiting to try thus place for a long time and it was definitely worth Â the wait!

This restuarant is a has been retro place with no quality left in the steaks or the service. Even the person taking reservation was nasty and rude. They pride themselves in high class but serve food on a paper table cloth and accept only cash. So many better options available today for steaks around the five boroughs, who needs to deal with crap from old timers that serve no quality food.

Good solid steak. Â Even if you're not a beef eater you'll still enjoy their signature cut. Â The creamed spinach was yummy and so was the bacon. Â Also be sure to order enough steak for the whole table (i.e party of 3 should order steak for 3) even if someone is not much of a meat eater in your party. Â Make reservations or else be prepared to wait like an hour or more; ok for walk-ins if you're a party of 2; they sat bunch of parties of 2s. Â Only other complaint was on our server; not much smile but whatever we were there for the food. Â Must visit at least once while visiting New York.

Had lunch reservations here. Had the steak for two and burger along with a salad and 2 glasses of wine and one vodka soda. The wait staff was extremely nice. Jack was our server. It wasn't as crowded as I expected it to be which was nice. The meal including tip was $220 which for a steakhouse I thought was extremely reasonable. And the food was delicious. Steak was tender and served on a hot plate and the burger was tasty as well. I'd recommend getting reservations. I called on a Wednesday and the only reservation time they had was for Sunday at 145pm. So it gets pretty full quick.
Always delicious. Generous portions and good service. Basic steak and potatoes place. Love the wedge salad. You don't leave hungry!

I was excited to go here for Thanksgiving and treat myself, since I am unable to spend the holiday with my family because of covid. Â I spoke to one reservation taker, I believe Maria, who said they had a few spots open. Â I said I'd call back shortly when I figured out what time is best. Â I called back and spoke with Mark, who refused to allow me a reservation since I was only one person. Â  He was extremely rude and frankly, heartless, to refuse just because I have to be alone - on a holiday!!! Thanks Mark, for being so unaccommodating - I will find another place to eat that has nicer humans.

For the schlep ALLLL the way to Williamsburg - not worth it. Save your uber fair and just go to a steak house in Manhattan that takes credit card. Despite having a reservation, you're greeted by someone that will scratch your name off a list and told "we'll call you". When asked how long the wait is, be prepared to get a rude response as if you're a peasant for asking and a response of "when a table opens up". Well why make a reservation in the first place right? At least our waiter was funny and kind. In terms of steak, you really just have a "steak" for 1 and a porterhouse for 2-4 people. The sides were underwhelming and under seasoned except the onion rings. The meat was not bad but again, equally as good here in the city. Save your time and money and go somewhere else is my opinion. You guys have have been the ish back in the day, but your head has become overly inflated that you need to learn better customer service.

This place has fallen off the rails! And Michelin needs to rethink the fact this place has a star. Listen at the end of the day it is better than 90% of steaks out there. That being said when you spend 200 bucks for a meal and go to what is billed as the "best steakhouse in nyc" you don't expect gristle on 20% of your steak. It doesn't make sense. Why isn't the fat rendered, why isn't it trimmed? As for the sides...they are fine...but for the price not worth it. Point is it's meh. Anyway...

Horrible. Â Walked in and the staff standing around the check in counter sneered and shuffled as if they were annoyed we were there. Â We were asked for proof of vaccination, but no staff had on a mask. The furniture looked like it belonged in an old pizza joint. Â While the waiter was placing the water on our table, the bottom of the glass broke off and water and ice splashed all over my clothes, my face and my feet. He apologized an moved us to another table. Â Never offered me a towel or anything to dry myself with. Â To make matters worse, another waiter took over. Â He was so obnoxious. Â He spoke to us in a condescending tone pretending to be courteous. Â Insult to injury was he spoke extensively to the patron dining at the corner table next to us and insisted he take a dessert on the house. Â I wasn't looking for a free meal, however, I do feel some acknowledgement should have been expressed due to the drenching I took from them. Â Found them rude and nasty. Â Burger was mediocre. I don't trust them. Will never go back. Â Ruth's Chris and Morton's remain the best. Â Luger's can't compete.

We were a party of 7. Made a dinner reservation ahead of time and had to wait around 20 minutes, well worth it. We ordered the caesar salad, wedge salad, shrimp cocktail, and bacon to start. The bacon was delicious, definitely try it. We ordered the porterhouse steaks and a ribeye, all cooked medium rare. I never had steak so crispy on the outside and so tender juicy in the inside, it melted in my mouth. Ordered creamed spinach and german potatoes for sides. Mmmm. Had the peter luger wine which complemented our food well. The sundae was so good, I was so full but had to have it. Our waiter was attentive and friendly. Would love to return for another occasion!

There's a reason why it's so hard to get a reservation here and it's because the meat is basically drugs. Â It's so delicious and juicy and perfect, you will become addicted. Also the creamed spinach and bacon slice is everything.
Great steak, very fresh and tender meat. The BBQ skill was great as well. The fat was crispy but inside very soft. The only downside is that you have to book a month ahead, too popular...

They say on their website they take walk ins. We showed up past 2pm and apparently they stop taking walk ins around 2pm. Customer service wasn't great when they turned us away. Also, if that's your policy why can't you p it that on your website? Also, as an Asian person who usually dresses pretty casual, I wonder if I would be treated the same if I were an older white male wearing a suit.

Words can't describe how truly amazing this place is. Everything from the staff to the decor and the steaks. The steak for 2 is perfect and comes out hot and sizzling. The wait staff has a different way of doing things and you have to get a reservation in advance to make sure you get a table!!! Doors open at 11:45am and a line is forming at the door. Hands down the best steak, bacon and peas I have ever had. The decor is simple and old fashion and so New York. A must stop if New York. $-$$$

Been here twice now. Peter Luger's obviously has that national if not global reputation to uphold in terms of being one of THE best steakhouses around. I was in 2 minds of giving 4 or 5 stars as both times going I had a really good meal but I think it's a fair metric to say that unless there is something wrong that merits losing a star then until that happens, 5 stars it shall be. Meat was perfectly cooked every time we went and service was ver friendly with a nice touch of "old-schoolness" to it. And to top it off dessert with their in-house Schlag is to die for!

First of all this place is packed! I mean packed with people. So if you decide to stop by without a reservation good luck being served. It's located in Brooklyn right off the Williamsburg bridge. You can either drive or take the subway where the station is located a few blocks away. The steak however is amazing. It reminded me of Florentine steak which I had back in Florence. The steaks were huge I would say 4-5 pounds depending on which order you choose too try. We tried the steak that was good for 3 people even though there were 4 of us in the group we could barely finish it. The steak was cooked to our perfection medium rare and each bite you could just taste the tenderness and quality of the meat. Our server was prompt and very attentive. I would definitely go back when I get another chance too visit.

The steak, the burgers, the cream spinach, the potatoes, the deserts, the rolls, the shrimp cocktail, the steak sauce. You have to be a moron to give this place lesS than 4 stars. Yes it's very expensive. If it wasn't expensive, I would be dead by now from clogged arteries.

I'm no really understanding all the backlash Lugers is getting after that times review. This place has been consistently great. Just went here for my husbands birthday and we had a fantastic time. The waiters here are pros and the steak was delicious. It's also fairly priced for the enormous portions you're getting. Def worth checking out if you're a steak lover and not looking for a pretentious place.
Service is incredible, very friendly and fast. Steak is the best I ever had. I definitely recommend this place and will come back very soon!
Well it is expensive for a piece of meat. The waiters are keen on handing you a bill and to move you on and out. No need to cross the bridge.
My 7th time here always amazing to get there steak, there appetizers especially creamed spinach are very good.

I was very excited to go to Peter Luger's from everything I've heard previously. I made reservations for Sunday afternoon earlier in the week. Parking was super easy; the valet attendant saw us waving to him so he immediately directed us to a parking spot. We were seated within fifteen minutes of arriving. Our server seemed a bit disinterested and placed our plates on the table very aggressively but I believe that is part of the culture of the restaurant. I ordered a steak for two, broccoli, the special German potatoes, thick cut bacon, and the chocolate mousse cake. The steak was good but the reason why I gave this place four stars is that it was very greasy and oily. It felt very heavy to digest. The best part of this dining experience was definitely the thick cut bacon (a MUST have) and chocolate mousse cake!

Tourist trap alert. Our server was rude and the food quality is over-hyped. We went there for lunch and ordered a grilled salmon and appetizer size lamb chop along with rib eye and single steak because we didn't want to eat too much meat. The server probably expected a small bill and suggested that we couldn't afford the larger steak. We ordered a medium rare steak but it came out medium well, i.e., way overcooked. Lamb chop is actually not bad. Overall bad experience. There are better steakhouse in the city.

Peter Lugers is always my go-to spot for steak. They will never disappoint you. The steak comes to the table sizzling hot, which is music to the whole table's ears. It's a must-go and true staple of NYC.

Food was great. This may be my new favorite steak house. The meat was so tender! I got the dinner for two and two sides and ended being too full to finish. Can't wait to come back in the future to try the other dishes.

The place to go for Steak Lovers.... the service is Great and the Steak is cooked, as per your request !!! The baked potatoes are the Best !!! Always my go to place for Steak A +++++ NYC's Best Steakhouse !!!

Great experience. I love the 'old school' feeling of this place, from the setting, the staff, right down to the menu. We came for the steaks so we skipped the appetizers, much to the surprise of our waiter who seemed to push a bit for trying something. I just don't understand eating lettuce at places like this, it's just a waste of stomach space. Our party of 5 got the Steak for 4, along with three sides (spinach, onion rings, and the German potatoes). The portion size was perfect. The steak comes out pre-sliced, which I prefer, and our medium rare came out perfect. The steak is a porterhouse and has wonderful flavor- earthy, soft, marble, with a chewiness on the edges that adds to the texture. The sides to me were OK, not spectacular for steakhouse standards. Definitely worth a trip for the steak!

Carefully cooked stake, classic but delicately prepared sides, good vibes.. absolutely one of the best stake house in NYC. Would love to come back for sure. The only problem is that they don't accept credit card.. it is not very friendly for first time visitors. The restaurant may tell you when you book over the phone, but for those who use online reservation, how can they know beforehand?
Good steak but did not meet expectations, especially for the price. Â Some meat burnt and not flavorful. Â Was glad to try once at least!

Old school steak house. Â Need reservations at least one month in advance. Â We made our reservation at 9:45 PM ( only available time) and still had to wait an additional 15 min. Â Was worth the wait as always. Â Streak is tender/melt in your mouth and well aged. Â People can be rude when answering the phones and the staff seem to have a matter of fact attitude (maybe it's NYC vibe) but regardless. Â It doesn't keep us from returning.
Not worth the money. I ordered a med well steak and received a bloody rare steak,unacceptable. Trust me save your money.

Don't bother to waste your time to go to Brooklyn. I give it zero stars/The service has been declining for years and the last time I was there before this weekend was three years ago. Nothing has changed in their service for the good. The service is horrendous, the shrimp cocktail taste like latex with horseradish and the porterhouse steak taste like your local low end Urban supermarket.

Just Amazing for the last 3 years I have been visiting the best Steak houses in the Tri State Area and last night I reached the pinnacle of Steakhouses. The New York Times 0 Star review is an abhorrent insult 0 Stars is Outback Steakhouse. Well anyway Peter Luger was absolutely amazing from their sauce with bread or their bacon to their porterhouse and then round it off to their holy cow dessert what an experience very classy very simple how all steakhouses should be it was an absolute pleasure last night. Thank You !!!!!!

I always wanted to try this restaurant from a long time now . I wanted to visit the one in Brooklyn ,but it was so hard to get a reservation , so I decided to go to the one in Long Island instead,trust me the waiting time is way shorter than the location in Brooklyn where you have to make reservation 45 days ahead of time.I Was unable to get a reservation with the one in Great Neck in Long Island within 2 days , I was very happy about that .upon arrival the place was completely pack there was no where to sit to wait to be called but nevertheless it was worth the wait, customer service was good and the host was very honest with his opinion on options for the food.we had the Porter house steakhouse omg it was so delicious we also had creamy spinach and potatoes with their best bottle of wine, I must say it's the best steak house I ever been to and I can't wait to go back by the way we couldn't finish the wine because it was very strong and we are not a drinker so we took the rest of the bottle home .it was almost $300 for 2 of us and it was money well spent. They also have a valley parking in the backyard of their Resturant.

Our reservation was at 8:45 PM but we weren't seated until 9:15. There was also a mixup about confirming the reservation, although I don't think that affected our wait time. The restaurant is extremely noisy and it was difficult to hear the waiter most of the time. The food itself was pretty good though; we ordered steak for 3, German fried potatoes, and creamy spinach. The steak was cooked to perfection but slightly too buttery. I would recommend against using their steak sauce, as it just tastes like shrimp cocktail sauce. The potatoes honestly weren't that good either, as there was just nothing special about them. The creamy spinach was tasty and flavorful. Our waiter was good and fast. I would give a higher rating except we waited too long even after making a reservation, and the steak was too buttery.

Visited the place in May. I loved the service, the porterhouse, the spinach, the deserts. I don't know how they do it but the steak is so tender, truly excellent. Great old feel atmosphere adds to the experience. Diver sole and salmon were also good, large portions. We also ordered the German potatoes and a mixed green salad both great sides we enjoyed. Service was excellent. Ambience was great. Steak was outstanding. Great wine and perfect service. Not for casual dining, but for a very special day the place to be.

Went here with a group of friends. This is an "old school" steak house. Had the steak that they call the Rib Steak, which was $65. Steak was just ok. I've certainly has far better steaks across this great country. I really can't understand what all the hype is about the steaks here. Just average. The servers were nice guys and really helpful with our large party. Decent wine list and they had some great Bourbon's at the bar.

I waited a long time to come to Peter Lugar's I'm in the one in Brooklyn,the waiter came over right away great guy great waiter. We ordered the porterhouse for two and the New York strip and the Â creamed spinach,tomato onion platter and hashbrowns the steaks were cooked perfect and the sides were excellent. Â We also ordered pecan pie and keylime pie with of course the shlog! I'll be back for sure next time I'm in Brooklyn. Simply the best!
The foods are not worth the prices especially during these times because you can find same type for less and better cooked
The best best best best steak ever. This place rocks and service is legit. The chocolate coins after dinner were delicious as well!

Meat was great, but did not really like the service attitude as the waiter wasn't very nice. Price was okay, typical NY. Had a window seat so great view though. Food came fast, one of the best porterhouse steak I've had. Also the bacon was awesome, just a little greasy all together. Overall pretty good experience, definitely met my expectations.

Usually the steak here is really good but today was an exception. We always order our steaks medium rare - the picture on the left is from Nov. 2018 and the picture on the right is from today. Both were Peter Luger steaks ordered medium rare. We flagged down our waiter and told him our steak was over cooked and not what we were used to from Peter Luger. He got a manager who looked at the steak and just said "it's medium and also it's been sitting out" with no apology or anything. It's a little ridiculous that a manager at a steakhouse does not know what medium rare looks like and we are expected to accept something not to our order. We weren't expecting anything but definitely did not expect excuses and blame. For a $100+ steak we definitely did not get our moneys worth.
Best steak I have ever had in my life. Fantastic service, friendly staff. A must visit when in Brooklyn

I ate here yesterday 8/5 (Sunday) w/ my husband and mom. The steak for 3 & bacon was delicious as usual and that cheesecake is crack! Tried the onion rings and it was delicious (a bit on the oily side). Service was good - our waiters were nice and attentive. It was my mom's first time and she loved the food very much!

Made reservation online for a Friday afternoon lunch. Â We got seating after a 5 min wait. We ordered prime dry aged steak medium rare, it was cooked to perfection. However the steak itself is bland, a disappointment. Our favorite is the sliced tomatoes with their house sauce, the sauce bought out the fresh tomato favor like no other. I have never had tomato this good. it's well worth the price. The sizzling bacon is also excellent, juicy and tasty. Â Who knew we come to a steak house walked away impressed with a simple tomato dish. 5 stars for the tomato slices, 3 stars for the steak.

Ok, so this is embarrassing, but despite being a life-long Brooklynite, I only went to this place for the first time this year. It's exactly what it purports to be: an old school steakhouse. We came as a group of 4, waited a touch past our reservation time, which was fine because it gave us time for martinis at the bar - yum!. We ordered a large porterhouse to share as well as bacon and some sides. Everything was good. I found the service to be pleasantly old Brooklyn. I think this is probably someplace everyone should try because its an institution; but, ultimately it didn't blow my mind. I would return if someone else was paying or if I was planning something celebratory for someone who really wanted to go to a steakhouse (as opposed to any good restaurant that makes steak).

The restaurant is so classic in it's own manner. Filled with pple visiting from around the U.S of A and overseas tourists. Made a reservation a month ago. I noticed their old style hand written booking system is rather impressive. We ordered the steak for two - Porterhouse. BF and I indulged it strategically. Even avoiding the carbs of bread, the massive dish will easily fill you up. The tomato and onion dish with the special Peter Luger sauce was so refreshing. This meal of juicy tender meat will be remembered for a long time.
First time here and it was fantastic ! The thick bacon, onion rings, and the steak for two was delish ! The servers were super helpful and were very accommodating. A must try when you're in NY !

I've lived in Brooklyn for almost a decade now and Peter Luger Steakhouse has always been a fan favorite when choosing a restaurant for my family to spend special occasions. Make a reservation. Usually, I find that weekend slots are available at least a month in advance. We always order the shrimp appetizer. The shrimps really are huge and the sauce makes them even better. Their porterhouse steak is always made to perfection - medium rare, flavorful, juicy, and tender. When I first tasted their signature steak sauce, I wasn't sure how it would taste with steak since it does taste a bit like cocktail sauce, but I was surprised to find that it goes wonderfully with the steak. It adds that acidic bite to the very rich meat. Do order creamed spinach on the side! Another tip: order wine. I haven't tried everything on the cocktail menu but the old fashioned was crazy sweet and it took away from my meal.

Great server and good food. The steak was pretty good, not the best I've ever had but definitely top 5. Â The meat was well cooked at medium rare but wish it was a little more tender. The price was expensive, but I wanted to check it out since it seemed like a NYC steak staple. The side of bacon was delicious
Life changing steak experience!! Everything we god was amazing. Can't wait to go back for our next special occasion!!!! Thank you Peter Luger's for making out Anniversary so enjoyable.

Wolfgang's is better. Just stating a simple fact. This place is a staple for steak. But there are better steakhouses in the city. Wolfgang's, Keens, hell, even Pietros does a better steak. Sorry to go against the norm here but I'm just being honest

I normally don't write reviews that often, but we were so excited for this place, based on all the amazing reviews, huge hype and publicity. We were speechless and dumbfounded on how terrible the steaks were. They we're cooked well, they were very tender (due to the aging I'm sure) but they were just flavorless pieces of meat. So much so, neither myself nor my husband could eat more than a few bites. Very fatty and no flavor. We couldn't believe it, and are still quite shocked. We're glad we went to try it, to see what all the hype is about, but will definitely never return. Huge disappointment.

column3: Monmouth Junction, South Brunswick Township, NJ
column6: This is beyond a doubt the best steak restaurant I have ever been to! Â The steak is always done exactly as ordered and is tender and delicious. Â Yes, it is pricey. Â But you get what you paid for here! Â Their steak for two is more likesteak for four. Â The vegetables are fresh and delicious. Â This was my last meal before having gastric bypass. Â I will never be able to eat such huge portions again, so I wanted my last meal to be my best meal!

Peter Luger not only lives up to its reputation, but rather far exceeds it. Our experience started with an appetizer of the Luger's Sizzling Bacon. The thick cut bacon was incredibly flavorful and a sign of things to come. Next up was the wedge salad because, hey, I guess we needed something green. Even that was in a class of its own. For the entree, we shared a steak for three. The knife cut through like butter and the temperature was perfect. Hands down the best steak I've ever had. Our side of creamed spinach and potatoes was the perfect compliment. Somehow we were able to save room for dessert and enjoyed a delightful hot fudge sundae with the special whipped cream. I've never been so full yet still wanted more. From now on, Peter Luger will always be a mandatory stop anytime we are in New York City.

48 hours later after eating at Peter Luger's I finally woke up from the food coma that ensued after feasting. I was warned that the food is so good it'll knock you out and that was true! I made reservations a month in advance and secured a time of 4:45pm on a Saturday. It wasn't busy and we were able to be seated when we arrived at 4:15pm. Our server was Danny and he was a very attentive server. We ordered a pellegrino (sparkling water helps digestion), bacon (2), porterhouse for 2, spinach and the potatoes. I have to say, the bacon was the best I've ever had. I've had bacon from all parts of the spectrum but this bacon brought me to heaven (and clogged my arteries). When the steak came, it was still sizzling in a pool of buttery goodness. My server basted the steak and then served it to me which was definitely a nice touch. The appetizers, spinach and potatoes were definitely up there as well. I've never had creamed spinach like the one at Peter Luger's, it definitely pairs well with the steak. For the steak itself... I suggest rare because it is still cooking as it's brought to the table. I got the medium rare which was still tasty. Don't forget to drench the signature steak sauce onto it! Our bill ended up to be -$172 before tip. I'll definitely return after I take a few months to unclog my arteries. I can't wait to do it all over again.
The best Steak House in US !!!!super service and great Atmosphere !!!we had a great time for my friend birthday !!!

This place is as old school as it gets and let me tell you it's worth it. Such an experience. Just don't forget your cash (or I read they take debit cards now) because it's NOT cheap. My husband and I shared the steak for 2, french fries, broccoli and he got a beer and it was about $185 with tip. That's a lot of cash to carry around with you. And that was just for 2 people. But this is definitely a must do if you're in Brooklyn. Just make sure you make a reservation WAY in advance. My husband and I got lucky with a 3:45PM reservation on a Monday of a holiday weekend when we called last minute. I don't think others have been as lucky as us.

This place definitely lives up to the hype. Probably the best steakhouse experience I've ever had. The menu is so simple but the ingredients are definitely some of the highest quality I've ever seen. One bite of their steak will change your perception of what meat is, that's I promise! After eating at this restaurant I seriously doubt I will be able to eat steak anywhere else again. Â If you havent been to Peter Lugers, I highly recommend it as a classic NYC experience!

Anywhere Dave Portnoy goes, has to be great right? I was in a bad place, but I was really hungry, and I tried to choke down the famous tube steak, it was terrible. Non-union cockroach infested shithole.

Went here with my brother and mom a few months ago, and we were really unimpressed with Peter Luger. The vibe and ambiance is interesting, but you can get much better steak elsewhere in the city. Normally I'd say you should go to these kinds of places just to say you've done it, but I don't think you're missing anything here if you never go to Peter Luger (and have gone to other high end steakhouses).

They definitely live up to their hype and thats saying something as it's often considered the best steak in NYC, a place with tons of amazing steakhouses. The porterhouse is divine, the Bacon slab no one else can replicate so perfectly and the pecan pie and whipped cream is delectable. Service was meh, could've been better and they do take only debit or cash. Reservations are hard to get thru with, but definitely try to make one as no matter the time of the week it's packed.

I would rate this -0 if i could . I saw this restuarant on a youtube video titled the "best steakhouses in nyc" honestly not even the best its overhyped steak i'm BORN AND RAISED HERE IN NYC i'm telling you it's not all that good . i got the steak for 2 and i've had way better steak from underatted restaurants . I'm hispanic and if you're person a color DO NOT come here i warn you forget about dining in here if you are , they serve only whites top notch service and i felt segregated in a restuarant jesus , i got sent all the way to the back outside , the waiter didn't even bother to come back once until it was time to pay and even at that took forever to come , the stares you recieve from snobby rich white folk who think their all that is uncomfortable because they think you're a person of color you can't afford a "rich" steak let me tell you my GRANDMA sh*t even my little 13 year COUSIN cooks better steak than this . The price isn't worth it , the food is straight trash , the service is trash , ambiance is trash , the snobby people there are trash and wack i'll smack fire out of all of y'all . My experience was tainted and i've seen it for myself first and last time i ever step foot in peter luegers .
Amazing! This place was definitely worth the money. The food was absolutely amazing and we loved the ambiance. It's a must if you love steak and are in New York.
OMG!! The steak and burgers (we went for lunch) I die! Can't even post the picture of the porterhouse steak cause all I have was a video of the sizzling steak coming to the table!

Peter luger number one best steak. Seriously, they make the ordering process simple, leave you in their very capable hands, take you down the magical journey into your mouth and really make a great experience. The waiters are super nice and knowledgeable about their meat. You say how many steaks per people you want and they give you some tasty morsels of sirloin and filet all sliced up on a hot plate. Perfect sear and so so well-seasoned. Not overly seasoned mind you, just a touch. Seriously good and tender enough to make you weep. Fried german potatoes were great as well, though a bit saltier than i expected. Still a lovely experience.

Amazing food at a expensively reasonable price. I say expensively reasonable because with all that me & my wife bought the meal only came up to about $160 We got the dry aged Porterhouse for two with 3 sides and cheese cake. The sides that we decided to get were the onion rings, creamed spinach and german fried potatoes. The spinach was the best I ever had truly amazing I enjoyed everything else but that side definitely stood out. The homemade whipped cream on the cheese cake was amazing Worth the calling repeatedly to get a reservation and the $200 bill (tip included)

I know critics have been hating on Luger's lately but as a first timer and a person who regularly eats steak, I had zero problems whatsoever with the food and service. Both were excellent and I really can't wait to return next time the fam and I are in New York.
Be here over 10 times.. hub loves there steak.. me loves the burger which is only on lunch time. Â We love Mike and jarek. We will always be back.

Steak for two, thick bacon, cream spinach make a perfect meal. Do remember to get a reservation first, or needs an hour to wait. The steak is perfect, I mean PERFECT! Next time I would skip bacon and go steak directly!

One of the bucket list places to eat in the world. We really enjoyed the food, the ambience and the whole experience. Our server has worked there over 25 years, and knew the drill well. Peter Luger's steaks are cooked with a lot of butter contributing to a different flavor. I've never eaten better food. The lamb chops were the finest.

Hard to give Lugers a 5. It's definitely a tourist trap in my opinion. The steak is very good and I like the bacon. Everything else is just subpar at best in my opinion. The restaurant itself actually bores the heck out of me. There's really nothing comforting in there when it comes to decor. I would never turn down a meal here, if people I know want to go I would go but I'm not running back to break the door down of Lugers to get in there. DeStefanos is definitely the best steakhouse all around in Brooklyn in my opinion
The steak was amazing but for the price, there could've been some extra pizazz. The sides were just okay, so four stars are really just for the tenderness and juiciness of the steak.
Best in the game. Service and food was excellent and no wonder they are booked out for weeks. Couldn't recommend more.

First time here. The steak and sides were good! It's just that the service was not okay. Our server was clumsy. My husband's drinking water spilled while the server was fixing the table, good thing my husband was able to avoid it. Mind you, we came in right when they opened so I wonder why the server felt like he worked on a previous shift already. He wasn't even smiling or felt accommodating.

Don't even need to mention that Peter Luger is the best steak house in nyc. It is hard to make a reservation tho. You should do at least a month ago for dinner. Foods are the best. You should try Bacon! Steak, spinach and dessert. Everything was awesome. Servers are good. However, you have to wait a little bit usually even tho u made a reservation. Great family , friends and date night.

BombDOTCom!!!!!!! Went to visit New York for a week and we looked up the best possible steak house there is to dine in. Â Asked for a few recommendations from friends and literally everyone recommended Peter Luger!! So I called in about a couple months before my vacation so I can reserve a spot and one day they were so busy, the phone just kept ringing and ringing so I tried again the next morning and finally got through to somebody. Â Ordered enough steak for 3 people and it was DELICIOUS! they have their own sauce that kind of taste like BBQ sauce but goes really good with the steak. Â Love the vibe of the place as well! Definitely will want to come back and try their 2nd location when I come back to the east coast
Not much to say. Â Steak was marginally better than I could cook at home. Â Service was pretty poor. Â  Will not be back

Over rated, very fairly priced. Steak selection is minuscule.. bread stunk. Sides decent. Rib steak overly fatty. Â Overly pretentious for a no frills place. More of a tourist attraction than a top steakhouse in the country. No wow factor.

The ever hyped and ever famed Peter Luger is a great steakhouse, but over hyped. The steak was very very good, and easily one of the best I have had. That said many of the sides were bland, unoriginal and average at best. Come for the steak and check it off your bucket list, but for a more well rounded steakhouse experience I'd go to Strip House, Wolfgang's, or several other options in Manhattan. Again, it's a terrific steak, but the sides and starters left something to be desired. For more pics and reviews check @BuehEats on instagram
This place is highly overrated. The steak is mediocre. The service is just so bad. The waiter is VERY rude and will shout at u if they don't give big tips. Will never come back again.

Was taken here for my birthday dinner. After seeing it on the travel channel for having such a great reputation among steakhouses, I was more than eager to try it out. I'm a steakhouse fanatic! I ordered the porterhouse medium (perfection) and broccoli. The waiter was such a great host. The restaurant lived up to its reputation and left me satisfied.
Best bacon I've ever tried in my life. The steak was delicious. I love their as well. Always have to reserve the table. They don't take walk in.

Wow totally worth the hype. The steak was like nothing I've tasted before. A single piece of bacon could be an entire meal. Bloody Mary's were excellent. Tomato and onion helped balance out the rest of the dishes. To top it off, their key lime pie is out of this world, and it was served with the best whipped cream mountain I've ever had. I'd jump at the chance to go back if money was no object

I'm only 30 and I can honestly say this was the best served steak I ever had. The staff was knowledgeable and honestly we didnt have to order, our waiter George just knew how to take care of us. All worth the price. I would find any excuse to return and I hate traveling to Brooklyn.

Good steak, Michelin star (one) even apparently. But I kid you not, they have THE WORST attitude when it comes their service. They're also cash only or debit card only, very frustrating. Trying to make a reservation here over the phone is beyond frustrating. I guess they just started using Resy (reservation service site/app) but are booked for the next three weeks and I will be in NYC this weekend (10/11/19) ...

Steak was amazing rest was garbage from rude woman with whom I made the reservation, rude woman who confirmed it sounded miserable and then hung up on me, chaos and a wait time upon arrival, brisk but efficient waiter, food was like 1950s joke- not finest ingredients, probably American GMO wholesale salad tomatoes vegetables etc where in this age and for that price, could at least get nice produce a farmers market- you don't have to change guys, just up your quality! Steak was great, great people watching. My dad, who took me there for my birthday, also wants to add, "By way of inconveniencing customers, I could add that instead of wait staff taking my debit card and bringing it back to sign, I had to go to the cash register. As to staff being nice, providing a little camaraderie, the people at "check out" were nice." So, the steak was nice and they were nice when you gave them money.
Remains the undisputed champion of the New York steakhouse. Even as a bus full of tourist pours in during lunch service the staff and quality of the meal does not diminish.
This's probably my favorite steakhouse in town! Very good friendly service! And steaks came out beautiful and tasty!!

Coming to NYC we knew we had to come here. The service was exceptional, the steak for 2 was tender, but the credit card policy is old school. It wasn't the best steak I've ever had, but the presentation of bringing it out on a sizzling plate and the way they served us made it memorable. For us this was something great to experience, but I'm not sure if I would come back again. I would give it five stars if the steak blew me away but it didn't.
Amazing food, steak was superb. A little pricey, but worth every dollar. Will be going back again
Totally what it's cracked up to be. They certainly have some of the most delicious steak ever. If you're visiting nyc, this is a MUST! It's difficult to get a reservation, so try to plan accordingly.
Some of the best steak in New York. Know what you want before you get there, as the restaurant caters to steak connoisseurs. Pay cash and don't forget to order the bacon.
King of Steaks. King of New York. If you know what you are coming here for it never disappoints. Best all around vibe for sure. Bow down.
@11112018. Steak for four people, two pieces of bacon, creamed spinach, onion rings, two glass of red wine.
Excellent, simply the best food and taste of my steakhouse crowded power lunch/dinner crowd with rustic chophouse ambiance! Sizzling and delicious, make a reservation!!!!

I was disappointed. Even with reservations there was a wait and the food lacked flavor. The bread and their house steak sauce were really good but the steak had no flavor, the potatoes just tasted burnt and the spinach was goopy. I wouldn't return to this location, I'll probably try the one in great neck.
It was good. Â I think because it came so strongly recommended by everyone that I was a little disappointed, but overall bread, steak and German potatoes very good...just priced a tad high to me.
Besides the wait, the food was amazing, def come earlier than your reservation due to parking and what not.

Heard all the hype of this place and feared it would let me down. Thankfully, it delivered! The steak was unique and not really like any other steak i have had. Crispy on top, but medium rare and juicy in the middle. Amazing french fries and old school service that you just dont see anymore. When in NY, this is a must go to location.

Absolutely amazing. We had the steak for 3 and although one of us wanted it cooked more than the other two, the waiter was able to sear it extra at the table making it perfect for all of us. We also went with the suggested creamed spinach and German potatoes. Perfect sides that weren't too heavy with the amount of meat we were indulging in. Then we went on to have the hot fudge Sunday and it was beyond. Paired the meal with Brooklyn lagers. It was perfect. The only downside was the one that wanted steak slightly more cooked had originally wanted salmon, but they were out.
Best steak I have ever had, it was juicy, buttery, and melted in my mouth. Sides were okay; creamed spinach and home fries but I came for the steak and it did not disappoint.

I decided to take my family out for dinner and we were a party of 7. My overall experience wasn't as good as I'd hoped for. My server was extremely rude, he rushed through explaining the menu and he looked annoyed every time we asked him a question about the menu. We asked for hot water and it took him 10 minutes to get it. Now, to the steak, people spoke highly about 'Peter Luger steak', to be quite honest, there wasn't anything special about the steak, there was no butter as an option - and maybe people like it that way, but I personally didn't. I'd much rather eat del frisco's steak, where truffle butter was an option on the steak, would I come back for another visit? Probably not. Would I recommend it to someone who just like their steak plain and simple, of course!

Yes, it does live up to the hype. I'm no big steak lover (I think steak is a fine dish, but it's nothing I seek out in particular), but Luger's is 10/10. I got the burger during lunch, too, and that was excellent. The restaurant is super authentic (not stuffy at all), servers are very friendly and the old school vibe is kept alive. The portions are pretty generous, too. I'm glad to finally have visited.

Steak and service was great here and really the only gripe is that the price is slightly outrageous as most things can be for great food in NYC! Â I knew it was going to cost a pretty penny, but it just mind boggles me when steak joints overcharge for their steaks. Â Born and raised in the Midwest and my mother who worked at a beef packing company, I've had a lot of beef in my life and the prices could definitely be a 1/3 less than they charge
Fantastic place. Â  GreT food great service great experience

Took my fiancÃ© here for his birthday (He's really big on steak). We had reservations but still had to wait like 30 min. Imagine if we were a bigger party. The steak was absolutely delicious! I just wish they had a bigger variety but sides (only broccoli and fries). Service was poor

This was our first time here and it was amazing! My girlfriend and I were celebrating my birthday and came out to NY from LA. Jose the waiter made this experience even more special by bringing us a complimentary slab of bacon to go with the special sauce. He said he wanted to make sure we tried it since we came all the way out from California. Was such a nice gesture. Steak, spinach, and German fried potatoes were amazing. Pecan pie, cheesecake, and schlag ended our meal on a tasty note. Overall had a perfect experience.

Its not bad but not great. Definitely a tourist trap and almost a "must do" if you are visiting Williamsburg for the first time. but for the price point and experience you get you can easily go somewhere else and have better tasting food and a nicer atmosphere. the staff rushed the whole experience and were also a bit snobbish when ordering. the steak was ok, but just that. ok. Not like life changing. and again, if you are paying that much you might as well have food you want to remember. its just not worth it.

We were virgins on this visit to Peter Luger, Brooklyn. Recommended years ago by a colleague in Washington, this famous steakhouse did not disappoint. Our Porterhouse (steak for two) was absolutely amazing! Â I have never had a better steak, ever. The Cesar with bacon and the sides of cream spinach and German fried potatoes were the perfect compliments! Â Then the cheesecake served with a bowl of fresh real whipped cream put it all over the top. Peter Luger an absolute must, unless of course, you are vegetarian.

Absolutely delicious steak. As you can tell with all the other reviews that it's good. I just want to point out that the creamed spinach was amazing as well. I don't think I've had cream spinach that was not overly soaked with heavy cream. I mean cream is good but I like to taste my veggies too. This place had the right combination. It was not heavy and yet so delicious.

Steak is just as good as everyone says it is, The service was so spot on you can tell these guys are veterans. Onion rings were amazing and to top it all off we noticed every table around us had ordered a sundae so we said the hell with it and got one too.......prob the best sundae I've ever had Worth the hype and money, and kinda necessary to just say you've been here at least once!!
This is one of the best steaks I have had. Prices a bit crazy and would be nice to have larger menu. But the meal lived up to reputation. Awesome.

I love Lugers. I'll always love it here for their dry aged porterhouse, but we were truly disappointed this time around. Our charbroiled crust of steak was just very charred that it made most of our meat too burnt to enjoy and ruined the taste for us. I think we will need to be more specific next time around but we just never had this problem here before. Not sure what to make of it but I know at some point, we'll be back here again. Just not too soon.

I would like to preface this with the fact that my favorite type of steak is a CHICAGO steak lathered in garlic, butter, salt and pepper. I have heard so many good things about Peter Lugar and have been wanting to try it ever since. We got there and it was BUSY! It had a nice vibrant environment that is really enjoyable. We got seated 15 minutes after our reservation time and once we got seated, the chairs were not comfortable. Our bread basket arrived and I noticed that it didn't have the same type of bread as everyone; there was three different styles in everyone's and we only got two. I had to ask to get the same type of basket as everyone which shouldn't be the case. Also the butter was cold and hard to spread! My husband asked for sparkling water and they brought him club soda. We asked if they had sparkling water and they brought out pelligrino which was what we had originally asked for. The steak was great, well prepared. We got the steak for two which was more than enough. It could have used a little bit more seasoning but the steak itself was good, maybe even great but just needed a little bit more salt. The Peter lugar potatoes were amazing and would highly recommend. It's a good steakhouse but wouldn't necessarily go out of my way for it!
Peter Lugers jus a ny staple....although I think It is overrated and a tourist trap I will always go because it's stil good food

I've been to Peter Luger (Long Island) before and rate the food highly. I've never been refused service before, but I was at Peter Luger's (Brooklyn) by the host. Typically a hostess/host would say, "Oh the wait is this many hours to discourage you, but I just received a "No". Thanks Peter Luger you just lost a customer for both locations today.

Yes the steak is so on point! I ordered steak for two with my bf but it was not enough for us! Why a 4 star tho? The menu didn't have much option and so we ordered fries and the fries was not good at all. I am a huge fan of friessssss but the fries we ordered..i barely touched it. However, the dessert was so good! We ordered the Apple Strudel and it came with the whipped cream. The home made whipped cream was so delicious! I cant go back for the steak and dessert!

Good food... steak for 2 was 7/10 and the service was 1/10! The two men at the front in suits that looked like managers had a horrible attitude. They should be kind to customers that technically pay their salary. Extremely ungrateful people. Our waiter Ricky also was rude, dry and not helpful. Overall horrible experience. I've left 2 reviews on yelp and I had to leave this one. Sorry, but true.
The food is good. The wait is a bit long and it seems outdated inside in terms of decor. Overall I would recommend. Just know you will be spending over $100 when you eat here.

Been here three times over the years, and finally after the third disappointing visit, I haven't returned. The vibe at PL is definitely cool - dark woods, white cloth tables and the manliest and sternest waiters serving thick porterhouse chops. The first time I went, the steak was fine - sufficiently tender, the bacon was lovely and thick and the sides were good. However, subsequent visits, the steaks were overcooked, chewy, underseasoned and disappointing, especially given the price. Since then, we've long discovered Wolfgang's - opened by a Peter Luger alum, that has the exact same offering, but much more consistent steak. Unfortunately Wolfgang's just doesn't have the same guidebook history, but should really skip the hype on this one and head to Wolfgang's on Park Ave.

My experience here is always a great time. If you want mashed potatoes, you have to come for lunch time because they don't offer it at dinner.. why? I asked the same thing. Nothing better the juicy tender steak with mashed potatoes. Either way their creamed spinach is delicious to have as a side. Tomatoes and Onions are a classic favorite too. Good job at keeping it classy Peter Luger!

Strangely. I didn't love it the first time I came years ago. I've probably been back four times or so since, and I can't get enough. Hands down the best steakhouse. If you're expecting a very fancy vibe when you come in you won't get it. Looks like a German beer hall inside. Don't get the cocktails they're not very good. Stick to wine. Cash or debit only. Have to make a reservation month or 2 ahead of time to get in for dinner. Even with reservation you'll have to wait 30 min or so. Still worth the trouble. A little better with a group since so much food but great for two too. Get the tomato/onion, bacon (even if you don't love bacon (I don't) this one is next level and unique), porterhouse steak, german potatoes, and creamed spinach. The sundae is quite good and simple too. Very low frills, incredible food. Pretty much a must go every nyc trip.

I've gone to this place so many times as a kid, so in my head is perfect. I recently took my boyfriend who's never been there before... well I had to make the reservation about 7 weeks in advance. Since then I've been to many other steakhouses and I have to say Lugers doesn't have good side options. The steak game has evolved and the steak was good but ... so many other steakhouse are good too. I wanted to give them a 5 but I can't it's definitely only a 4. Â I was actually shocked because this was part of a birthday gift and he wasn't impressed!
Good old school type of steak house. The bacon is a must. Must make reservation ahead of time. We made ours 1 month ahead. Cash only.

Came for a lunch reservation at 12:45 on a Sunday. They do not accept credit cards which is a bummer, so be sure to bring your debit card! Complimentary bread basket and butter was delicious but don't fill yourself up with the bread! We started with a Caesar salad which was a good beginning to the meal. We got a burger and a steak both medium rare. Really good quality meat and you can taste the aged meat. Our waiter spooned the meat drippings onto our steak slices which he referred to as "vitamins" lol. Luger sauce comes on the side which tastes like a mix of horseradish and bbq sauce.
This is the best steak I have ever had! The steak for two is so excellent. The key lime pie is also excellent. The service and environment are great! I will come again!
Simply the best. Get a porterhouse, a Brooklyn lager, some German potatoes and leave room for the ice cream sundae. A truly incredible experience

Spontaneous decision - got a bit lost in Bklyn, saw Luger, decided to stop. Excellent food - 2 Old Fashioneds to start, the porterhouse for 2, tomatoes and onions, home fries, pecan pie with Schlag and an Irish decaf. Service with a smile and good sense of humor, piping hot food. All in all, a wonderful experience and look forward to going back!

I experienced some of the best service and steak in my entire life at this restaurant. You must make a reservation to guarantee you will be seated. Once inside your treated like your royalty. The servers are inviting and friendly. The food is pricey, but you pay for what you get. Top of the line service and food. The jumbo shrimp cocktail and sliced tomatoes with onions are excellent. You must have at least one slice of the sizzling bacon it's out of this world. The steak was life changing and has ruined how I view other steakhouses. If you visit Brooklyn and don't visit this one of a kind restaurant you're shorting yourself.

We had the porter house steak for two and it truly was delicious. It wasn't the best I had, but it was good. Their dinner bread rolls would be bomb if they would serve them warm, but they were so cold. Skip the spinach. That sh*t was nasty AF. Fries weren't bad. Service was mediocre (bunch of cranky old men.)
Unfortunately was disappointed by the famed Luger Burger. Â Bun is lackluster, price is too high IMO. Â I get that you're paying for the brand but i would rather go elsewhere for a great burger.

Luger Luger Luger ... what can I possibly say about Peter Luger that hasn't already been said by thousands of other folks? Â The steak for 2 was absolutely delicious -- the meat literally just melts in your mouth. Â This is truly one of the best steaks throughout the U.S. Â Please don't use the sauce. Â Don't insult the chef! Â The bread basket, strawberry bowl, apple strudel, fries, shrimp cocktail, bread basket ... all absolutely delicious! Â Don't forget to make a reservation at least a month in advance. Â We've been here a few times and it's nice to see that they started accepting debit cards since it was only cash back in the day. Â The guys also sing Happy Birthday pretty darn well.
The service was second to none, as always. Impeccable. The food was succulent, delightfully flavored, and presented beautifully. Once again, I had another perfect dining experience at Peter Luger's
Love this place!!! I booked this place way in advance for lunch. The steak speaks for itself. The cream of spinach is so good. Bring cash.

Amazing place the steak is so good Â % will recommend this place to my friends!! We couldn't. Make a reservation for dinner so we choose lunch it was amazing our server where from Europe and they were quiet of Â we really love coming to this place.

I am still dreaming of that amazing steak for two. I like how this place is no frills. Just give me a nice steak and let me enjoy it with some sauce and don't break the wallet. Came here for my birthday and it will be hard not to return each year after that. Although I might get a heart attack. The sides are nothing special here and the onion rings were too oily.

Peter Lugers is best steakhouse I ever been to. There is no ambiance it's simple decor with the best steak you ever eaten. I have been here numerous times and I can't ever remember ordering. The server said Porterhouse medium, spinach and potatoes and we were good! We had the bacon as a appetizer and I have never been the same. Trust me have the bacon appetizer. Don't forget to have the cheesecake with "Schlag"! I could never read or understand the bill, but you will see the $ amount. With it all said and done I have been here numerous times and don't see why I won't return. I must say my wife and sister didn't like the simplistic appearance, we couldn't disagree more. I think I'm planning a return trip now!

Since COVID hit we have ordered delivery from Lugar only, recently. Steak was perfectly medium-rare, sides were on point and hot. It's a high priced meal but worth it and honestly the food was as good as dining in the restaurant and I never much cared for the in-restaurant service, so I actually prefer the delivery. Buy a bottle of steak sauce, as it doesn't come with the meal and is delicious.

Came here yesterday for lunch, the food was ok, not too bad, not too good. The service was horrible! My server disappeared for a long time, waited for at least 20 minutes for him to come and waited for another 10 minutes to check. The server answered all the questions with attitude, no patience at all! Not worth to come! Never come back!

This place has been around for some time and they expect tourists and crowds there. Ivan the server was rude and didn't like to repeat himself. The food was overpricedâ especially the baked potatoâe ($22) and it comes with a side of butter. $14 for slices of raw onions and tomatoes. Its highly rated but probably not for their service. Just get the bacon here it's like ham.

Love their steaks. Â Have been here about a dozen times and every visit is a treat. Â My husband loves the shrimp cocktail and we both split the steak for 2. Â We love the spinach and the potatoes. Â Can't beat it...
Over rated. Â It's cool and nostalgic but if you want good food there's tons of other, better steak houses in NYC

Who would rate this pace 4 out of 5? I've had the good fortune of going to many top tier steakhouses. Â I'm from chicago so I am predisposed to not love anything from NY... but... from A to Z this place just exceeds my very high expectations. The bacon is a meal in itself. Â The first time I came her I was shocked that they'd consider putting their steak sauce in their tomato and onion salad Â  You know what? It works! Â I started with they and a slice of bacon and finished with a little surf turf. Peter Luger's is everything you want an old school steak house to be. Â It's no surprise that the service is outstanding as well. Our waiter's name was Kire Â I'll request him every time I come back. You should too. Â I told him I'm trying to stick to the keto plan so he brought me just a bowl of their whip cream for desert. I didn't eat it all but wanted to lick the bowl clean.

The crÃ©me de la creme of steakhouses. Â Whenever I'm in NYC I make it a point to stop in. The tomatoes and onions appetizer, served with their trademark sauce is a must. Â Then, steak for two, steak for three, etc, plus some creamed spinach and a side order of potatoes and you'll have a fantastic meal. Â  Don't miss it. Â Also - they take reservations up to two months in advance - be sure to make one.

This was an enjoyable dinner and we are glad we made the effort to get a reservation. The place is very rustic with old time wood tables and a menu that looks like it hasn't changed in decades. We got the standards, tomatoes with onion, bacon, steak for 2 and the german potatoes. All the food was very good and reasonably priced for the quality. I wish they had a better wine by the glass program for those that don't want to order a full bottle to get something other than the house wine.

4 1/2 stars. Great steak served family style. Seared very well. Their sides are pretty good too. We got the t- bone steak with spinach and German potatoes. Got reservations beforehand as I was told it's hard to get seated without one. I can see why this place has been a staple in NYC for many years.
