Good good steak. Maybe my friends hyped it up too much. Wasn't overwhelmed but was satisfied enough. Nice friendly service overall. Old school for sure.

I figured I'd update my review in case anyone was wondering if Lugers was resting on their laurels. Nope, still my number one steak in the US and my number two in the world (#1 goes to Bar Nestor in San SebastiÃ¡n) and that's up against hundreds of steaks in a lifetime so far. We returned this week for about the 10th time since my last review and it was as good as the first time. I would say the waiters have gotten friendlier over the years tho. Not that they were bad before, just more charmingly gruff. We've had a lot more of the dishes over the years too, but my favorites are still the same: steak for two or three, the bread with butter and their sauce, the spinach, and absolutely the bacon. If you haven't been, you owe yourself to go.
Never disappoints! If dining for lunch try the burger! Great option is to split it as well at a steak! Do not leave without trying the bacon!
The best steak in NYC! Not only the steak, the bacon is also amazing! Needless to say the service and the atmosphere!

Came here for my birthday! The steak is amazing.. Â Idk how else to describe the quality of the meat. Good service, good wine, good food and good company. It was a perfect evening. Definitely would recommend if you are celebrating or just wanna eat some good expensive steak lol!

Very disappointed with this place. I know they have a BIG name in NYC and a long history. But it is the most overrated restaurant I have ever been to. We ordered their three most popular thing on the menu, including the salad, bacon, and steaks. None of them is good. Salad looked worse than street food. Bacon was way too fat. The steak was burned and black (we ordered medium well). And it tasted so dry and hard. It is not worth your money. If you are a tourist, maybe it is a place you want a picture from outside, but for the money we paid ($260), we felt like totally fooled:-/

Ummm hands down the best steak and food I've ever had in my life!! This place is amazing in every single way. The service is so quick! The steak was so juicy and unexplainable. This is a must try place! The dessert was also unreal!!! I highly recommended this place. So worth every penny!

THE BEST but you have to understand that Dale came with her grandfather starting in 1949 (70 years ago) and I started to come with my parents in 1959 (60 years ago). We've come with our kids and our grandkids and we always eat the same thing..........sliced tomato & onion in Peter Luger Sauce, steak for 2, creamed spinach, German potato..........and then they carry us out. Yes, it's a tradition (don't forget the gravy that's basically butter & melted fat and terrible for you). There's just something about it.
Hard to justify the price. Service was pretty bad and the food was good, but not the best I've ever had

What do you say about Lugers that hasn't already been said. Â The steaks are aged to perfection. Â the rub is outstanding and I love the old school atmosphere. Â Worth the hype and the trip from my house in NJ

I went to Peter Luger as friends refer it as the best steak house in New York. Â We ordered two "steak for two plates" and bacon on the side. Â I am sure all of you had a good steak at Peter Luger and my experience was not too far away from that. Â Two plates somehow I felt they were cooked not at the same degree. I am just being picky here, one plate was perfect, juicy and meat was tender. Â Another plate was less satisfying. Â The bacon was rich...oily, quite tasty. Â It was a busy afternoon, maybe that's why I was left thirthty. Â The waiter could fill my glass a bit more frequently. Not much to complain, it's not a bad experience. Â But is it New York 's best? Â I leave it at this.

I planned this dinner for my husband 2 months before, made a reservation the end of October for December 30th. Anyways fast forward to the day of, we get there 15 minutes early to check in. We waited like 20 minutes which we didn't mind (we came early so we don't miss the reservation and they dont take us!) it was busy and crowded everywhere including the waiting area and bar. We get seated and we have two incredible waiters, one was named Mike and the other ones name I forgot but he was Georgian. They both were friendly, smiling faces, informative, patient, engaging as we looked over the menu and was indecisive as I had questions. My husband was in red meat heaven lol. Side note I'm a picky eater that doesnt eat every red meat or the salmon on the menu (I like it marinated and not to smell fishy)sooo the waiters were honest and said it doesnt get seasoned so I didnt get it but I got full on the generous size portions of appetizers! My husband loved his medium steak, the spinach and everything else shown! The sauce they make is amazing!!!!! Although it says steak sauce I dipped the garlic bread in it. Overall everything was great, well worth the wait, money and calories 10 stars!!!

This is my favorite steak places. You have to love the New York charm. There's no porterhouse steak around. Desserts are delicious as well as the bacon. French fries a great too. One day I just want to try the hamburger but unfortunately I live so far away it Â seems like a waste to drive so far just for that. Make sure you have cash and Are ready to wait.

2/14/18 took out my girlfriend for dinner here. It was her first time and she fell inlove as I have. We had the steak for two, French fries for two and a bacon slice each as an appetizer and some Pinot Grigio to drink. Perfection every time. If you're ever in Williamsburg, you must visit the best steak house in nyc!
Always always crowded and they don't accept reservations. So be prepared. Their onion rings was great and their steak was tasty too. Medium is good for us!

Although my favorite cuisine is Korean, this is my favorite restaurant period. First, the atmosphere. I'm not much of a dress up and dine kind of person. I believe food should make you comfortable and at home. However, I do like the quality of fine dining restaurants. Peter Luger Steakhouse, while having the perfect atmosphere where I feel perfectly at home, manages to give me the best piece of cow consistently. It's atmosphere makes me feel welcomed, at home, and comfortable. Second, service. I've read a lot of reviews saying their service has their signature rudeness or whatever. I actually don't know what the hell they are talking about or what kind of entitled pricks they must be to feel that way. The service is not too in-your-face. They let you enjoy your meal, your conversations, and your moments. But they are always there to help, or fill up your water cup or whatever your beverage of choice might be. Finally, the food is insanely good. I've yet to taste a juicer, more tender, and more flavorful piece of meat in my life. Words cannot describe the sheer magnificence of their premium dry aged porterhouse steak. You will taste a piece of heaven every time you take a bite.

Yep, it's true... that their steak are really good!!! My bf said it's the best steak he had so far, and i would say it's one of the best steak i had as well (comparing it to Lawry's steakhouse in Beverly Hills, CA). The dry aged beef was tasty, juicy, perfectly cooked and oh so tender. We also had the cream of spinach, german potatoes as sides and wine. The bread they serve for free was good too. Definitely a great place to eat a high quality steak if you have the time and money to go here. The price is expensive but you get what you pay for. Â  Â They do not accept credit card, but accepts cash, debit and checks. We spent around Â $200 for what we ordered for 2 people.

I really can't add anything to this review that has otherwise not been previously stated in the thousands of other reviews. Â Please though, if you've never been here before, do not do yourself a disservice........make absolute sure you add some pork to your beef and order the bacon appetizer.......guarantee you'll be glad ya' did!

I'd rate this place a 5/6 out of 10. I've had better steak before. I ordered the Atlantic Salmon. It was a nice size but I mean, it tasted like the salmon I get from Black Angus Â No joke. It was whatever. Nothing special. Same with the steak. My group ordered the steak for three and I tried some. It was whatever. They're known for their French fries (I don't know why) but they were basic. Thick cut fries. Again nothing special. What I disliked was that their soft drinks came in little bottles. I hateeeeee restaurants that do that. Like why can't you get a soda machine. I honestly felt like I was in the Titanic. The place looked old (which it was and I guess what they're known for). The bathroom was tiny. Our waiter wasn't all that great either. Not enthusiastic at all. He was so bland. Mostly older people as waiters. I saw one shaking his head to a family. I won't be back here again. Sorry!

I'm a homegrown Angelino but I had the honor of eating at this steak house when I was in highschool visiting my brother. How can I describe my experience here: Â "I felt like I met God." Now that I'm married I wanted to take my wife here on our first year anniversary. Honestly I was nervous that the greatest steak experience was only to stay in the past. I never loved being SO WRONG! Â Peter Luger's still got it. And I just want to shout out to the only waiter I've ever wanted to take a picture with: Catarin. This guy really made our first year anniversary the most memorable experience while we were in New York for the week. Thank you Catarin for being such an awesome human being. We would love to see you again and only come when you're working the next time we come back. Â And we will be back
Best steakhouse period. The history alone is worth the trip. Porterhouse and creamed spinach are the must haves. Burger is also great if you can stop by for lunch.

I love this steakhouse. It's a must- try in New York. The steak was incredible. We had sirloin and fillet mignon which we kind of regret because those are not our favorite. But they still tasted pretty good. The thick cut bacon was juicy and to die for. The bread was really good too, especially ones with onion in it. However, If you are looking for a romantic date night place, there are probably better options in the city.

First off, anyone that doesn't say this is 5 stars is full of it. Â Second, the staff is always amazing. Â The burger is off the chains. Â The porterhouse is delectable. Â And to top it off, the bacon is ridiculous. Â I spent about $220 for two of us, but it is well worth it.

My family and I went to celebrate Father's day and we ordered the Steak for Four, creamed spinach, jumbo shrimp cocktail. The steak was AMAZING. Â We ordered it medium-rare and it was cooked perfectly. It had the right amount of sear and super tender. Â The service was great as well - the waiter came by to check up on us pretty frequently. The cream of spinach paired with the steak was great. The jumbo shrimps were delicious and super fresh.
Always great food and atmosphere here. The steak is top quality and the sides are delicious. The waiters are very nice and funny. You can only pay with cash or debit. No credit cards allowed.
having it delivered is amazing. obviously not the same experience but the quality remains topnotch yum and kudos

This is a very famous steakhouse, it has a Michelin Star Â and is considered one of the best in the country, we had a reservation and still had to wait to be seated. Â We had a comedian waiter who only spoke to the ladies. We ordered onion rings as appetizers to share and their famous onions with tomatoes. We then ordered bacon to share as an appetizer & then steak with fries. The meat was very good & the steak sauce delicious.

I am definitely a huge fan of better lagers. The cuts of steak are juicy with very little fat. The price is around $100.00 per person if you came for steak. They are one of the oldest steak houses and you can say you're a fan of steak if you have not tried them. The customer service can be questionable and some customers are allowed to use credit cards. Â Besides that I its worth a try.

Top notch experience at Peter Luger. I've wanted to try this place for quite sometime now and finally I realize why it gets so much hype. With reservations they get you in quickly. We got the onions and tomatoes for the app, the steak for two, and then a Sunday to finish it off. The steak was melt in your mouth good.

Excellent Steakhouse been there few time with friends. Steaks are Amazing and creamy spinach is my fravit wow. Only thing i need to see at peter luger next time I visit is updated place, it's a bit musty smell inside.

Seeing reviews and social media we were super excited to try the hyped peter Luger steakhouse. Came w total 4 people and ordered porterhouse for 3 w couple sides. Thank goodness we didn't order for 4. We were stuffed! We got the steak cooked between rare and Med rare but came out rare. The steak sauce is too sweet imo. Good steak but thought it would be more flavorful and softer. Some parts were soft but most was little chewy (bc cooked rare maybe?) for $280 for 4 people I think it's slightly overpriced but def w good experience. Good service just wished the steak was more soft or more flavorful. The creamy spinach was tasty!

The food was absolutely amazing. Â Steak was cooked to perfection and the bacon appetizer was amazing all the food here was great. Â Everything we ordered was perfect. Â The original decor keep the history of this place. Â Would highly recommended this place. Â It's a cash only restaurant and make reservations months before your trip.

Where do I start? Â  Best atmosphere. Â Best shrimp. Best tomatoes and onions. Best bacon. Best steak. Best potato and cream spinach. Best martini. Â And of course pecan pie and Shlog. Â Might have had a better lamb chop. Â Maybe not. Â Waiter was a bit out of it. Also best maite D Â will be back

Personally, me and my girlfriend experienced great service. The staff was very professional and respectable. Overall, our steak was just good enough to enjoy our dinner, but it definitely wasn't anything really special. Steak was actually borderline mediocre. Luckily I went with $300 in gift certificates so it didn't hurt my pockets. Creamed spinach was mediocre. My favorite thing was the German potato's. Slab of bacon was all fat nothing special. Overall, the food wasn't quite up to standard considering a $260 bill. Pecan pie is really good tho. My girlfriend loved the cheesecake we took home. I'm probably good on ever returning tho.

Peter Luger's is exactly what you expect it to be. The steak is terrific, but for $100 it better be. The French fries are good also but again, it was $15 for fries for two... it better be. Peter Luger's lacks the charm it needs for charging such expensive entrees, but at this point you know what you're getting yourself into. The portions are huge so if you're on a budget, order the steak for 2 for 3 people and you'll all leave full. Idk.. I rather spend my money on more fulfilling food but you go to Peter Luger's just to say you went so... enjoy?

Just one of the best steaks ever. The vibe is old school cool. The waiters are "seasoned" and provide the right feel to the place. Oh, and get the side bacon for your appetizer. It's insane. There's a few other places that are doing the super thick cut bacon these days and most are great. Peter Luger beats them all. Their winning factor is that most others have an issue when the bacon cools off. PL solved that problem.

Oh Peter how my belly loves you! Â Clearly a top NYC steakhouse for a reason. Â It's even weird that just tomatoes and onions with some secret sauce could taste soooo amazing. Â I would recommend the tomatoes, the steak with some side and tons of Schlogggggg (extra thick whip cream). Â This meal is so consistent and delicious I have never been disappointed. Â Good luck going out after this meal, your tummy will be happy and you won't be able to move :)

I came here with my wife during lunch. We order steak for 2. One was medium and the other was medium-rare. I recommend the medium-rare. We also order the jumbo shrimp, spinach and fries. I love the jumbo shrimp and my wife love the spinach. The service was good too.

Meh nothing special! It was good but not great! I'm not sure what all the fuss is about. The Metropolitan Grill in Seattle is way better. I had really high hopes for this place so maybe my expectations were too high. The dessert was good!

The bread served at the beginning of the meal is really good though I wish it had been served warm. The recommended tomatoes with onions as well as the thick sliced bacon would be the main reason I would come back to Peter Lugers, both were delicious. While the steak was very good, I'm not sure that I would call it the best steak I've ever had. Be prepared to wait a bit even if you have a reservation.

Delicious! Came here for my husband's birthday today. Got the rib steak, fried potatoes, creamed spinach, bacon, strudel and pecan pie. Could have skipped the fried potatoes but everything else was delicious.

BEST STEAK IN HISTORY! Chop the shrimp tomato and onion drown it in their sauce and u ll never have a better salad in ur life and then the steak comes out and u just feel like u died and went to heaven)

Steak for three, onion rings, "Peter Lugers" german potatoes (basically hashbrowns), shrimp cocktail, creamed spinach, ceaser salad and a variety of bread selection were excellent. Our group shared everything and we still had some steak and sides leftovers. Eventhough we had reservations, we still waited 30 mins in which we didn't like. Food didn't take long to arrive to our table and we appreciated the great service. Def will return for the lunchtime burgers. Overall, a casual restaurant with great Steak!

Reservation is a musttt. Then you still have to wait a lil bit once you are there. They are always booked. So make sure you reserved at least a month in advance. Food is great! Great steak! Better than Ruth Chris yo with pretty much the same price. Their price is very reasonable for the quality that they provide.. Not just the food.. from service and overall this restaurant is impeccable.

Have been to most steak places in NYC and Lugers continues to remain an icon. For me not so much because of the food itself but the overall old-school experience. I'm more of a Del Friscos fan but can't complain at all about the thick cut bacon, tomatoes and onions and Lugers sauce. However many people you are subtract by one and share the steak.
Amazing as always great steak perfectly prepared. Simple but amazing. I didn't even use steak sauce the steak was so good.

This might be a step above the one in Great Neck. Â However, I'm shocked by the way people dress - who the hell goes to a nice steak house in jeans? Â Really? Â The food here is very tasty; I love the porterhouse, creamed spinach, onion rings, and German potatoes. For dessert we had the cheesecake which was unreal and that schlag..omg! Â Yeah, I need to come here again, so worth the price! Â Oh, and bring a lot of cash, because that's all they take; it's at least 100 dollars or more per person. Â (Thank goodness my parents were treating for my birthday!)

Peter Luger has a great reputation, but why? I mean it's expensive, it's quality meat so it should be expensive. But its really not all that exception. There are plenty of big city steakhouses that are expensive. It's really not special. Been a few years since I've been there, but whenever I get back up to NYC I will likely not go back. It's a fine meal, but not priced properly and it's pretty boring in the restaurant. The bacon is the best thing on the menu, which is also overpriced.

Ordered rib steak, single steak, and creamed spinach. Some portions were very good-the pieces next to the bone with fat. The charred flavor really flows out. The steaks I ordered were medium but came out medium well. A few pieces didn't even have red or pink in them. I won't come again since there are better steakhouses around, but the first trip is worth it.

I'm happy that I finally got to try this place. Great service and great steaks. I do wish I had taken a friend's advice and ordered the steak rare since the plate was hot. We ordered medium rare and it started cooking to medium over time. The quality was good and you tell it was dry rubbed, but I wouldn't say it's the best steak. Their bacon though.... Let me say I'm not a bacon person (that's right, I said it), but this was actually one of the best I've had. The pieces were thick and were not that oily or salty. It could've been a meal with some sides honestly. Peter Luger definitely delivers quality meals and for how well known it is, I would said it's priced very competitively.

Be sure to make reservations for this place!! The bf and I enjoyed the steak for two, cream of spinach, and bacon slice. I think the bacon is worth a try! It's soft in texture and is perfectly seasoned.

Satisfaction. The steak is tender and juicy! Definitely a 5 star. We also ordered 8 bacon. It was reasonable price. My family and I had a very good time. Definitely would come back again and recommend this to others. We also ordered the Peter Luger red wine, it was a bit dry by itself but pairing it with the steak was good. Some people enjoy dry wine. Martin was very friendly and funny. His level of service was beyond excellent!

Definitely a five-star steakhouse. The dry aged porterhouse was excellent. The bacon was great and not too oily. Definitely ordered the tomato slices and pair them with Peter Luger's steakhouse. Amazing combination!

This place was on one of mine and my moms bucket list... I was fortunate enough to be able to come home, and the service was amazing... The drinks were beyond amazing... And I'm definitely make it my life's mission to bring my mother back here to enjoy this wonderful place.

This place is famous for a reason. Their name is the definition of high quality steak. Â We had a bit of a wait, but the steak comes out presliced on a sizzling plate of butter. The slab of bacon is memorable. Â  The waiter was pleasant, and they treat every customer like they want you to have a good experience.

I went for dinner with my family who visiting out of the country, it was our first time at this place. I think the exceptions were high and the restaurant didn't disappointed us. Great appetizers , amazing steak and delicious desert! Just keep in mind even tho you have reservation you might wait awhile for you table. Worth the time and $$$.
The steak was amazing .. exceeded my expectations. No need to get dressed up, either. Very casual, and prices aren't as high as I thought

Pricey but pretty darn good. Â The Zagat awards on the wall when you e tee tells a good story. Â I'd recommend the iceberg wedge to start. Â Amazing thick bacon slices and fresh ingredients made this thing stand out. Â We enjoyed the Steak For Three paired with their house Cab from NAPA Valley. Â We ordered Medium cooked but I might go with medium rare next time. Â It was still very good. Â The waiter was a grumpy German guy who seemed irritated that we asked for chives. Â They don't have chives for the potatoes, fyi. Â  They take debit cards and cash and can split the check across a few debit cards. Â Something you must try for sure!

I am one to not always order a steak but I did here and did not regret it! The meat was cooked to perfection and I loved the steak sauce. We also ordered the hash browns, broccoli, and cheesecake with the schlag. Everything was incredible! In addition our waiter was very friendly and got our food out quickly. You need to make a reservation in advance in order to get a table but it's definitely worth every penny.

This is one of my favorite steakhouses! The trick is to go for lunch or a late lunch, the wait was only 45 minutes. A reservation for dinner has to be made well in advance.. I tried all the sides and ordered the steak for 2, everything was amazing, most importantly the sauce! Service was amazing, food came out fast, this establishment has been around for 131 years for a reason!!

FINALLY made it Lugers when we had family in town two weeks ago... after living in NYC for 10 years!!! Now I get it. The BEST steak I have had. The BEST burger I have had. Hands down. Can't wait to go back.

Wow. Â So I've seen this place on numerous food network shows over the years. When I finally got my chance to get to New York I had to try it. Â Get reservations a month in advance. This Brooklyn piece of heaven was all it was cracked up to be. We ordered the tomato and onions with bacon and covered them in the house steak sauce. Â The porter house for four was our meat choice. Melted in your mouth and you could cut it with your fork. Â German potatoes with the whole thing. Perfect in every way. The waiters were lifers and very blunt and to the point which only added to the experience. Â Bring cash because it's cash only and don't forget the apple strudel Â with house whipped cream. Â It's to die for. Â Experience NY the right way with this place
This is the best steak I've ever had in my life. My mouth literally waters every time I pass by it on the subway 12,000/10!!!!
Unbelievable dinner at Peter Lugers. This was a highlight our our NYC Holiday vacation . The steak was perfect and you must try an appetizer of the thick cut bacon.

Definitely a memorable experience eating here. Â The steaks were fantastic and the waiter was great. We had a couple drinks while waiting for our table and they were delicious as well. Â The atmosphere is upscale but not stuffy. Also, it's a bit loud but it was a Friday night so as you can imagine it was full. Would recommend and I will visit when in the city again.

Yum! One of the best steaks in town! Â Just unbelievably expensive!!! Â Not sure I can justify spending $300 for 4 people for lunch. Â The ice cream sundae is probably the best I've ever had!! Why don't they take credit cards in this day and age? Â I would say I prefer Keens.
too expensive and only credit card acceptance not for low class eating only for rich

Worst service from the front desk and rude too. Not going back for sure. Even the assistant is shower bad attitude when I told him my friend is parking Â their car. He answer me back hey you think is my first day working here and I got so piss off when I'm trying to let him know the truth.

It's my 2nd time going here with my family and it is still very much a strong and famous staple for steakhouses and for steak fanatics out there. I'm only giving it 3 stars due to the fact that when we ordered the steak for 4 people, the steak didn't sizzle like it always does and the meat came in kinda cold, which was obviously very disappointing. The food and service was still good though but when the main product comes in like that, it is very underwhelming so it was subpar at best. Hopefully they can do better next time.

Been here on my birthday and ordered a steak for two. The taste was great but you have to be careful with the hot oil under the steak. The steak was large so you don't need to order other plates unless you really want to try them. The salad on the other hand, was mediocre. I guess that's why they're a steakhouse. Staff was friendly and introduced us some places to visit nearby since we were not locals.
This is a wonderful place. The atmosphere is lovely and feels like old New York. Frank was fabulous and we can't wait to be back!

Definitely one of the best steaks that I have ever had. The main courses, fixings, and service are classic, no unique culinary concoctions, everything you would expect in an experienced, quality steakhouse. It would be nice if they accepted credit cards.

This is my favorite steak house! It's a must visit every time I come to New York. Their sauce and the steak pairs very well together. Whenever I go here, I always get the steak medium rare, and it is always cooked to perfection. I like how the food is served family style. Overall the menu is very limited but every dish is perfected; although, the tomatoes are just served raw and sliced so they're definitely not worth the price. I'd highly recommend making a reservation. MUST TRY!!!

How do your write about a legend if you weren't totally ensnared by it? I'm sad to say that Peter Luger did not live up to expectation. My husband took me here for our anniversary dinner, due to hearing so much about the place. The decor was very historic, I loved it! We had their famous Porterhouse Steak for 2, side of creamed spinach and potatoes. Must admit at first bite the steak was amazing, however the later meats became tough. I really did not like the creamed spinach. The potatoes were also ok. We saw a lot of people order this white whipped cream looking thing called "Schlag", with gold coins so decided to try it. It was nothing more than just plain ok whipped cream. Lastly to top off the whole experience, the service we received was horrible. $200 wasted on not great food and horrible service. I would save that money and try another steak spot.

This is my go-to steak restaurant in NY. Last week's experience was a tiny bit inconvenient. Everything went well until we asked for the bill. We tipped the waiter who serve our table about 15% . He came back with the receipt in his hand, outlining the sentence where it says that the recommended tip is no less than 18%. We did notice this before we pay. But I've been to this place several times and this waiter is, among all the others, the least enthusiastic and professional one. No interactive talk, indifferent, and couldn't Â remember our order. Anyway,we tipped him 18% just because we love this place and don't want to be seen as cheap bastards. BTW I'm not sure whether the tip percentage is mandatory or recommended. Please let me know. Just so next time nobody would be embarrassed.
The steak melts in your mouth. Â Unique taste and steak is super tender. Â Don't ask me why just try it
second time here and i love it. service is great and so kind. it's always a great time. bring cash or debit. steak is great and bacon is delicious. you come for streak and expect steak.

My first time there, and it totally lived up and even surpassed the hype. Â A lot of steak house are just a name, and seems they don't even try any more (no names!). Â Somehow got a weekend 5pm reservation for 2, and they seated us pretty much on time in a packed restaurant. Â We asked their recommendation and started with a slab of bacon which was decadent and awesome! Â Then had steak for 2, cooked perfect medium as requested along with their German fried potatoes. Â i had a slice of cheesecake and he brought like a whole bowl of fresh whipped cream which i only can force down half of it was so much! Â They forgot to bring something for my wife's birthday but it's understandable they are so busy people coming/going constantly. Â Next time i want to treat myself it will be here!

The Steak wasn't anything special and honestly this place is just overpriced for what it is. It took three months to book a table and the anticipation might be the reason people get so excited. We got the porterhouse for two and German mashed potatoes and spinach side dishes (both mediocre) Although the service was nice and attentive I did not appreciate being rushed in and out quickly. I feel the chocolate coin at the end was the only enjoyable part of the meal.

dined solo at the bar. got there about 30 mins before they opened and there was a decent line. most are waiting for a table so you can skip the line and get to the bar. ribeye was good steak. nothing crazy.....but good. bacon was pretty ridiculous and the creamed spinach was also great. kinda wish i tried a burger. service is obviously old school. when you sit at the bar you have a tab with the bartender for your drinks and then a server comes around for food orders and you have a separate tab with them. kinda weird but it all works. glad that i went but unless im coming for a burger at the bar i probably don't need to come back.
Nice place, crowded people. RESERVATION is the key! All meats are good, except little bit over cooked. My medium rare feels like medium.

Steak was cooked perfectly; however, I found it a little underseasoned. The bacon was amazing! Get that! I got the apple strudel for desert and no regrets from that! Best steak I've ever had? No, but it was good to try just based on reputation and hype.
Nice time having lunch. Had the hamburger for the first time. Â Omg best I've ever had!!!! Of course I was already stuffed from the bacon, tomato and onions and rolls!
Really good and delicious steak house with nice staff and great service.

Disappointed. :/ We ordered medium rare and got medium well done steak. Side of tomatoes was literally sliced raw tomatoes ($15). Creamed spinach was passable. We came here with a late lunch reservation and still had to wait. Not worth over $100 for this meal, and the cash only part didn't help either.

Like butter ! Like I butter I say! One of the best steaks I ever had . You would think a good steak is a good steak but every now and then you find something special and Lugers is exactly that. My waiter was a little crazy but then again this is New York so he was only being genuine. Good job guys.

Went there for lunch and ordered burger. The food is good but boy the payment was pain in the ass. They only accept cash and that day I was riding my bike and had only credit card on me. Had to go to their office and waste a whole bunch of time just to pay. There was another guy who was complaining about the itemized receipt for reimbursement. Their accounting system is horribly outdated. Not to mention that I had two separate bills for drink and food. Â The whole billing experience was so excruciating that overshadowed the food.
Why write a review?... It's Peter Luger. You either love it or it's a tourist trap. You can't beat the Porterhouse for Two though, anywhere at any price.
Not your average steak. This place is mouth-wateringly delicious.
Michelin Star Resturant. Must make reservations way ahead of time. Cash or debit card only. Known to be one of the oldest and best steakhouses.

I had top of the line lunch!! Absolutely amazing!! Had the honor of meeting Nigil. Told him why I was eating alone and the reason for my trip and Nigil was so companionate . He made sure I had everything I needed and my Aperol Spirtz kept coming. let's not fail to mention my amazing Lu Burger!!! Thank you everyone for such a positive afternoon! Much needed!

I went here for the first Â time, and outside of really feeling like the only black man in the building (which I'm just fine with) but the steak was ok. I dropped a pretty penny here or should I say a pretty Benjamin here just to see this iconic place, Â and with all the great steaks around here now days this place was a pleasant disappointment. I also hate the lighting here. I felt like I was on set my whole meal. I guess my episode for food network is coming soon.

It took so much efffort to make reservations to this Brooklyn location and so not worth it. I expected the steak to better than the Long Island location because this is after all the Â original. Â Well, it was such a disappointment and we were so mad we wasted our time and money. Â We waited so long for our steak and then the steak was just not quite the Peter Luger quality. Â Never again.
Amazing!!!! Go experience the atmosphere and food you don't see at high end places. Awesome night. N they gave free drinks so got lit n they paid out uber home. Great place!!

This place is very hard to get reservations so keep that in mind. Â Good service. Â Casual environment. Â I ordered the porterhouse for 2. Â We all know the quality of the meat is good from a place like this. Â My only complaint is that the steak lacked seasoning. Â The Luger steakhouse is terrific and can be added to the steak. Â Overall, I had a good experience. Â I would recommend.

Bucket list check! This place lives up to its reputation. We ate with a party of five and this place lived up to its reputation. The bacon was a recommendation from a New Yorker and it was unreal. We then ordered the steak for six and we went to town with the German potatoes. The steak came out sizzling with the butter and we were all in heaven! I cannot wait to return.
Came here tonight with my bf to celebrate my birthday. We got a steak for two, bacon, creamed spinach, and fries. It was so delicious. It was worth every penny! The service was excellent as well.
Fantastic meal. The steak was absolute perfection Â and the service was friendly and prompt. Good bang for the buck took. Can't wait to come back!
The burger was good and the French onion rings was very good too. We enjoyed our Saturday lunch there. Also ordered mixed salad and a slice of bacon to share. Yum :)

Holy. Moly. This place is good. You absolutely need a reservation. We called a week prior for a table for 3 at 8 on a Tuesday in December. You have to call to Make a reservation and their phone lines are constantly busy. With this restaurant being over 100 years old you expect it to be very old School and it is!! The decor brings you back for sure. Their vodka martinis are absolutely heaven!!!! But their porterhouse steaks are Devine!!! Loved it so much. I dream about it now that I'm back in Cali. Can't wait to go back.
This is the best steakhouse in NYC and possibly the world . The steak just melts in your mouth . Be sure to get the bacon steak .

All I can say is this is the best steak I ever had. Cooked and aged perfectly. I could taste the aged meat and the crispy crunchy edges had me at hello. My medium rare plus was cooked to perfection. DO NOT leave without trying their apple strudel with their house made whip, after all, this is a German restaurant. I never finish any dessert and I finished this even I knew I may throw up if I eat another bite from being overly stuffed. I regretted not asking for that huge bowl of left over whip cream to go. Their steak, bacon, and dessert are one of a kind and a must when in NYC.
I wish I could give this place a million stars. I've never had a bad meal here. Whenever I'm in NYC I make it a purpose to eat dinner there. It's an amazing no frills place, you go for the meat!

I don't have to explain about this steak house. I think everybody knows they are the best in New York. I'm in love with this steak house. Especially, their bacon is amazing. I really love their dry aged steak. I am usually disappointed by other dry aged steak, but the peter luger is one of the best. I want to go again next week!
Everything about this place was fantastic. The atmosphere was fun and casual, the service was outstanding, the food was unreal. I loved their thick bacon slices. The steak was delicious.

Great steak. Porterhouse medium rare good to share for group of 3-4. My type of place. Maybe not for everybody though. Only accepts cash. I will always go to Peter Luger when I'm in the city and have the time or can set a business meeting there. Highly recommended.

It's a very nice place for a good meal. You can taste the flavor of the fresh meat. Delicious! We ordered a steak for two that got ready really fast. Portion was good for 2 people, we also got a side of fries for 1. As for desserts, everything is quite big, we've got the cheesecake (more than enough for 2 people) with their house special "whipped cream". Really recommend this place, but if you're trying to come here reservations need to be made in advance, and don't give up on calling. We called non stop for 20 minutes and when they answered we waited more 20 to talk to the attendent
Got the food delivered as I have never eaten here pre Covid. Â Everything was amazing. Â Go the route of getting a side a bacon on the side. Â You won't regret it.

I'll keep this short and sweet - hands down as good as it gets when it comes to a steakhouse. Believe the hype. The bacon, tomatoes & onions, hash browns, creamed spinach, steak, and desserts are nothing short of superb. Don't think twice if you have an opportunity to dine in this historic establishment.

We went on a Sunday evening. The food was good but not impressive. We ordered the bacon as a starter and it's great if you like bacon. We ordered the steak for two medium rare as a main dish but it came medium and some parts of the meat were hard. We complained to the server but he insisted the steak was cooked medium rare. For sides we ordered the spinach and the German potatoes. Both were wonderful. Overall good, but not worth the hype and the price in my opinion.
Loved it! Great steak and amazing service. Make sure you get onion rings, so airy and fluffy!

I love steak and when I knew I was he as ding to New York, I instantly reserved my table here. Â It does feel like you go back in time when you enter and that is because of the combination of the decorvsndvfriendly wait staff and host. Â I ordered the steak for 2 with a side of brocolli. Â You start of with bread per usual, pretzel, onion, and typical bread sticks. Â I would have prefered if they were served warm but whatever. Â As for the steak, it was tender enough to be sliced with your fork. Â Flavor wise, it was inconsistent but maybe it was because of its size. Â Some pieces, it was served sliced, were more flavorful then others but still good balance of salt and butter. Â My one complaint on the steak was that it was charred from the searing process so some parts of it tasted overly burned. Â As for the homemade steak sauce, it was too reminiscent of cocktail sauce for me so I used it sparingly, not that it needed it. Â It is a nice touch to give you chocolate coins after the meal. Overall it was a good steak but not the best I've had.
The best steak i have ever had. Â Don't forget to order the bacon and creamed spinach with your steak

5 star service, food and ambiance! Despite of what I read on service, our server is really friendly. We ordered steak for 3 people, medium, thick bacon appetizer, cream of spinach, and holy cow sundae that has awesome whip cream, ice cream, crunchy toppings and cherry, best sunday on earth!!!

Tom the md checked our party in. Wonderful table by the window breads galore Ivan the waiter kept the water flowing 4 in our party ordered Â steak for 3 plenty medium rare so tender with creamed Â spinach of course thick bacon for an appetizer then the Cow sundae with singing waiters an a candle so delicious stayed 3 hours +++ very good Birthday celebration Â ty all

What can I say, Peter Luger did not disappoint. Â This was definitely worth the trip from Midtown and the 9:45pm Monday reservation (only available). Â I was a party of 1, but thankful I got in during my short visit to the City. Â Walking into Peter Luger, the first thing I noticed was the big crowd. Â The bar inside to the left has an old school German feel and big decorative steins to boot. Â I came with a crisp Benjamin in my pocket, so I did not have one of the half dozen beers or so on draft or any spirits or wine. Â This trip was all about the food. Â Once I sat down, I was greeted by one of their infamous servers. Â When I told my server I was doing well, he replied that he was feeling more medium rare. Â Points for cheesy steak humor. Â The first thing to arrive was the bread basket and a large vat of steak sauce. Â The bread was delicious and I ate the whole basket. Â Rookie mistake on my part. Â Then came the bacon. Â I was told by a friend I had to try the bacon and I'm glad I did. Â It was an exceptionally thick, smoky, flavorful slab of bacon. Â Went nicely with the steak sauce. Â For my entrÃ©e, I went with the rib steak and a side of the German potatoes. Â After a twenty minute wait or so, she arrived in all her glory. Â The steak was huge. Â Bone-in, easily tipped the scales over a pound and a half. Â First cut, right away I could tell the steak was cooked perfectly medium rare. Â What I appreciate about Peter Luger is the fact that they let the beef shine on its own. Â No fancy truffle shavings, bÃ©arnaise sauce, mushrooms or any of that. Â Just pure beef. Â The steak was very juicy and had a nice buttery flavor. Â The fat was well marbled and really melted in your mouth. Â As good as the steak sauce tastes, it was going nowhere near my steak. Â It was a really quality cut of beef. Â I ate the whole thing. Â I wasn't going to let any go to waste. Â The server was impressed by my knife skills and the fact that I ate a basket of bread, a slab of bacon, half a side of German potatoes (which are very good), and a huge steak down to the bone. Â He rewarded me with two gold Peter Luger (chocolate) coins for my accomplishment. Â My meal came in around $80, so my hundred dollar bill covered my food, tip, and subway fare back to Midtown.
Traditionally kept menu. Outstanding service, Â & unique cuts of beef.... and of course they're very own "Peter Lugar's" Steak Sauce!!!

One of best vibes you can have while eating a bomb ass steak. From the bar, the great sides, to the little coin Chocolates you get after the meal. Don't be cheap and do burger for lunch. Spring for wifey ' yourself to get dinner for 2

After long day of shopping, we walked in for a dinner. The food was good. Our server was very humble and offered some specials that gladly ordered and enjoyed. You guys rock! Best Steakhouse in New York

The steak was perfect and the service was top notch. The waiters were very helpful and courteous. We orders a Cobb salad, piece of bacon, and a single steak and a ribeye. Everything was good. Held up to the hype

We decided to go to Peter Luger's for our 1st post shelter-in/quarantine dining out experience. It was a hot day, so we decided for their burgers and not the steak. These have to be the best burgers we've ever had! Also, the waiters are doing an amazing job, so we tipped generously.

The wait was worth it. My wife took me to Peter Luger for my birthday she knows I love a good steak. We had no reservations, my heart sank when we were told to wait. And the wait was well worth it, soon we were seated, the waiter came with a sizzling tender steak for two, it was great. Next time I'll bring my whole family, the prices are up there but worth every penny .
Peter luger os fire the steak & potato the drinks is on point its for you in the lady in your life
Cold bread, cold steak sauce, rude staff constantly reminding us that tip is not included in the check and asking us for more tip. Made us super uncomfortable.
Use to be my go to place for steak, however there are so many more places to have a great steak.. Service is not the same anymore either.

I have been on the hunt for the best burgers in the city and when Peter Luger kept appearing on lists, I decided to check it out. My friend and I made a reservation about a month in advance and were counting down the days. Unfortunately it was extremely underwhelming to me. My friend had a few recommendations on special dishes to try and I was really not thrilled with any of them. The tomatoes for an appetizer was literally 5 thick slices of a tomato with sauce on the side to drizzle it on. The sauce tasted like cocktail sauce to me and was in no way memorable. Then we got burgers with cheese and bacon. I kept getting pieces of grizzle in the burger- definitely turned me off. I know PL is famous for their bacon, but being all fatty I was not a fan. Maybe if it was crispy on the outside, but it was not. Then we got the German potatoes and those tasted just like homefries (breakfast-y) to me. The real kicker was they charged us a $5 splitting fee even though we ordered 3 things to share. I can see it if we only ordered 1 dish, but we ordered 3 and spent $85 still for 1 burger, 1 app and a side. I won't be in a rush to come back anytime soon for their steak.

The secret here is to go for lunch and get the burger. I sort of wish they offered it for dinner, but the steak is awesome too. I pretty much soak all the steak sauce up in their tasty onion rolls. Pro tip: schlag for dessert. Thank me when you do.

Finally got to try the infamous Lugers. The steak is really Tender and buttery. Also recommend the spinach and German potatoes as well as the strudel. The starter bread was cold which is disappointing and the fact they only take debit and cash is a letdown.

Checked it off my bucket list :) a popular no frills (not fancy, not formal, no table covers) restaurant with great steaks and Â a Michelin Star. Â This famous favorite restaurant has been around for 132 years and is in Â Williamsburg, a neighborhood of Brooklyn. They were Â named The Best Steakhouse in New York by Zagat for about 30 years in a row! They have all the awards in wall as you enter to prove it! But the real proof in I'm the steaks which are Â perfectly juicy porterhouse steaks cut in massive portions. They have their own sauce but the dry aged steaks Â is amazing on it's own. Peter is the go-to spot in New York for Â carnivores locals & tourist! Â The serving staff was very nice & accommodating. We were in NY for only 2 days and decided last minute Â to go for lunch. I called ahead , they open at 10am, I Â made RSVP for 11:45am. I Â highly recommend a RSVP. Don't fill up on bread and keep in mind, they have a large restaurant and will accommodate walk-ins if there is availability. Â We ordered steak Â for 2 and nice bottle of wine. ,The steak comes hot, sizzling Â and pre cut. The creamed spinach side is s must and was amazing. For dessert the homemade local key lime pie was by far the best I ever had & it came with a mound of homemade whipping cream on side ...mmmm
We were blown away by the food; best steak I've ever had. Just make sure you make a reservation. We went in for lunch on a Friday and it was packed! Great service as well, we were very happy

Worth the hype. Make sure you check in upon arrival and that you have reservations, otherwise you might be disappointed . We had a very friendly server. I really liked our creamy spinach . It's not the typical mush , it was made well. The salmon was good but I believe the steak was great . My better half was in heaven eating that steak Â lol . We had to walk off the food afterwards .

Literally the worst meal I've ever had. Sadly :( Steak had no flavor at all. Maybe they don't season meat here? Not even the fat, and there was plenty of that. Â The cold bread and the fries saved the meal. Honestly don't know where the other reviewers were eating? There was no seasoning at all on the steak. If you like that you'll love this place. I was so shocked with the great reviews! We were so excited to go. Now if I were offered a free meal here i would decline.

When it comes to a steakhouses this place is an institution. Clearly. They only been doing it for what like few years! Think again. But of course, you knew that! Just a great steakhouse. I've eaten at many, many, many steakhouses. Matter a fact way too many to remember. I went here on my day of birth! Making a reservation is highly recommended. This place is no joke and does get filled dumb quick. Ordered steak for two. I ate most of it. Ordered their tomato dish. Which was bloody delicious to be honest. I don't think I devoured tomatoes that fast!! Oh, and had to order their applewood bacon. Which was like butter!!! I think I ordered side spinach dishes as well! All and all it was a great experience. If you love steakhouses give this institution of a place a try! Make sure you bring CA$H! This place does not do plastic! The only plastic they take is the one that says "Peter Lugar" on it!

Amazing & consistent, every time! Best steak in NYC, worth every penny! Shared steaks are recommended, with all the juicy goodness on top. Slong is the whipped cream, I recommended it with pie, amazing!! I've been addicted and dreaming about this. I've gone the past 3 weeks like clockwork.

I have traveled near and far searching for the best steak house (have hit some of the top ones in the country) and no matter what Peter Luger will forever be the king of steak. It's delicious every time and the menu is simple. Get the bacon, the steak for 3 or 4 (medium rare... don't you dare order medium) and be prepared for the steak to melt in your mouth. Pricey but it will definitely be the best steak you have ever had. I have been here 6 times and after every meal I say this is still the best steak. Waiters aren't the nicest but I'm there for the steak more then anything. I recommend going around 4:00 for an early dinner otherwise it's a good wait.

Peter Luger is true to itself - it's a fun experience with a great steak, but definitely no frills. The waiters are rude and rush you, but that's they MO and they're proud of it. It's a great meal, but just don't expect to be treated how you'd expect for a dinner that will cost $50+ per person. Also bring cash!

Look, if you're in search for a review to change your mind about coming to this place, you're not going to find it. I mean who wants steak that's literally going to melt in your mouth? Or heck, smell the buttery piece of dry aged, specially selected, perfectly carved porterhouse sizzle on a hot plate that you "cook" to your liking? Meh, what a sham! Having to prepare your own steak in an historic steakhouse.. 5 stars nothing more.

Came here for a birthday dinner. Â The steak was well prepared and ultimately that us what we came for. Â If in the area, and able to get in, we would come back; however, would not travel to Brooklyn again just to come here.

Peter Luger lived up to expectations. The steak for two was tender and juicy. We got the German fried potatoes as well as the creamed spinach. I really enjoyed the creamed spinach as it wasn't too heavy and overpowering. The service also lived up to expectations. The golden coins were a fun touch and the Sundae was amazing. It wasn't overly sweet. The perfect amount of chocolate ice cream and whipped cream.

First time here in NYC from Los Angeles so being in Brooklyn is just as amazing. We heard that the best Steakhouse here is the Peter Luger. As you walk in you will see all their achievements an awards for being the best in town. Theirs a bar as you walk in to get loosen up. If you ask them what's the best on the menu they'll say anything is good which was true. A friend of mine made the reservation to come here so i don't know the whole process but I heard it's hard to get s a lot here so call it in an don't take my word for it. The special sauce is amazing. It's somewhat a mixer of a variety of sauce to create this one amazing sauce. If your from out of town I recommend you order the bottle water (flat or distilled). I can't say much about the parking cause we Uber here. We ordered a lot of food. We ordered the steak for four an 2 orders of the Rib steak. Two orders of Spinach an potatoes with a side order of Lamb shops, Amazing. At the end of our eat it was too much food even for 6 of us. This place is good for family outing especially if they coming from out of town. This has to be a must go spot when visiting NYC. Last but not least it's very important to know that they don't take credit cards: Cash only.

I know there's a lot of buzz about this place. I thought it was so so. A little disappointing for the price point. Service was very good though. One of those places you have to try. But... Not sure it warrants a repeat.

When you want a steak beyond the wow, Peter Luger is it! I feel hands-down. Going there since I have been a child, nothing is different. The steak for....is perfect! Must have tomato and onions, cream spinach, and home fries. The waiters are still wonderful. If I have a special, special event, that's the best! (Williamsburg)

Can't say anything that hasn't honestly been said already. My writing degree is useless for a place as timeless and classic as this joint. Want what I can only describe as expert-level service and a steak that could be found in Fred Flinstone's kitchen? Come here. And have a steak dinner so special someone should have just been married, birthed, or died for you to be here.

One of the best steaks in NY, great selections of draft beer. Portions are huge so consider that when you order sides. My favorite sides are the creamy spinach and German potatoes. I always get the steak for 2 medium rare and it's just amazing. I will say snot $200 for two with drinks. Totally worth it! I want to try their burger for lunch next.

It was fabulous experience. The staff was so kind and entertaining. He made us enjoy with some jokes. And off course, dishes were all great. We ordered stakes for 2 and rib for 4people. It is adequate. ( also we got creamed spinach and salad.) Besides, we had some dessert. Lime tart and cheesecake was awesome. Â I love them. The waiter cut them into 4 piece. It was easy to share.

I'd always watched these shows about the top steakhouses in America/world on food network and travel channel, and Peter Luger has ALWAYS been on those lists. Needless to say I was excited to try what is considered by many to be some of the best of the best. Peter Lugers is a NY institution that's well over 100 years old so it goes without saying that it's consistently done more right than it has wrong, and if I could sum up my experience there I think that's how I would phrase it, "more right than wrong". We came in almost an hour ahead of schedule and the staff had us sit by the bar for a bit. Now obviously this is NYC so a beer is at least $10 almost everywhere just like in a large portion of Boston's inner city joints, the difference is in Boston you are paying $10 to drink in a city with more than one successful sports team....had to. Anyway despite how earlier we were the staff managed to get us seated incredibly fast which was unexpected given how busy they are, so we were very thankful. We ordered two single strips and one prime rib special. Before we got our entrees our excellent waiter brought us some bread/butter and house made steak sauce. The bread was excellent but it was not warm....all the same we ate two baskets of it so whatever I'm not much of a complainer I guess. When our steaks arrived they were all cooked perfectly and paired well with the house steak sauce. Now I must admit I am not generally a fan of the strip cut of beef because I feel as though it's rarely executed properly, and I ordered it simply because it was advantageous with the way they structure their menu. I can compliment the chefs enough on their work because they really impressed me and it was easily the best strip steak I've ever had. Because Peter Luger is such a storied resturant I will not knock it for having a simple menu but I won't say I wasn't hoping for more options. Overall an excellent experience and I'd love to go again.

I've been coming here since I was a kid. The steak is always fresh and tender and the sides compliment the steaks. Make sure you bring lots of cash because they dont accept credit card. Also, the drinks are very good and strong and the waiters are fast and have a sense of humor. Cant wait to come here again.

First time visiting the restaurant after hearing about the "old school" institution. Â We didn't have reservations but figured "2 at the bar" would work out. We were disappointed that there is no eating at the bar and we couldn't even put our name on the list. Everyone was friendly so we had a few drinks while deciding where we'd eat. The bartender was so sweet to suggest 4 other top places. We were having fun, no rush to eat so we stayed a bit longer. The gentleman with the reservation list came to us and said he could accommodate us. It was a great steak, great vibe. Ridiculous desserts! Worth the trip. I loved the "only cash" rule too.

Best steakhouse in Brooklyn by far and in my top 3 for all of NYC. The reputation is kept there with amazing food and service. Walking in here you are taken back to a golden age of steakhouse food and decor. Many of the workers have been there for years and can help with any questions easily. All the food is amazing but of course the sides are to die for. Steaks cooked to perfection and done any way you want. Will not be disappointed at all. Not far from the Williamsburg bridge

Wow, this is honestly the best steak house I have ever been too. There stellar reputation really shows through the experience from service to food. The thick slice of bacon? The mouth watering steaks? The great service? Oh yes please! Don't worry about being too full! Just walk it off at the Brooklyn and Manhattan bridge which is a short ride and definitely worth the visit!

This is by far/ hands down the best Steak House in the World! Not only do they have mouth watering steak that melts in your mouth but the staff, other guests and atmosphere/ environment plays a huge role in the greatness of this restaurant. If you are unsure if you should call and make a reservation here, just message me & I will make the decision for you. The Prime Rib is crack, the creamed spinach is speed and the tomato & onions are the cherry on top.

I went Peter Luger for graduate celebration, and it was perfect decision!! My family from Korea, really enjoyed the food here. The service is also very good, but just remember. As they take cash or US debit card, (no credit card!!!!)I used my debit Â card to pay the bill. But , as I don't go brooklyn that much, the credit card company regarded my transaction as fraud. LOL It took me 30 mins to pay. And I saw some people after me, suffered same issue!! Please bring cash. This place is definitely worth it:)

Jose was our our waiter tonight in the service was excellent. The steak was just like I saw on the food channel and the portions were giant! If you're in Brooklyn you need to come to this location. The only downside is they do not take major credit cards debit only.

HANDS down the BEST steak you will get ANYWHERE. Â It is well worth the month long wait (you have to call ahead for a reservation a while in advance- it is not a place you can just walk into and get seated). Â The staff is very friendly and attentive to your tables needs. Â Try: the wedge salad and any of the steaks. Â So well marinated and cooked to perfection, the meat falls off the bone and could probably cut it with a fork. Â Absolutely delicious. Â Highly recommend this experience when in New York City!

Really good burger in an old school environment. Comes very plain then they nickel and dime you for the essentials. The meat is the best cut for a hamburger I've ever had. Of course opted to get cheese and bacon making the total $25 for a lunch burger. Cheese smothered the patty and the bacon was outstanding. Onions are the only complimentary element to add to the burger as well as Peter Luger steak sauce. Really good meal overall but at $25 just for a full burger, not sure it's worth venturing to this part of town for. Very good but as a full meal and experience, not the best burger I've ever had.

I'd give one star but decades ago I lived for going here. I agree with the Times article, unfortunately. The steaks I had the last two times were all wrong and had poor texture. The owners can say what they will but the decline is there. Not entirely their fault, as beef quality in this country is not what it was. Too bad.
Stupid good. Like I really have to tell you. It's the whole experience. They make you feel like family. Say hi to Tom for me. Outstanding in every way!!!!!

My birthday dinner did not disappoint. This place earns its reputation as one of the top steakhouses in the country. It has an old school charm to it and the steaks are delicious. We ordered the steaks for two, creamed spinach and German potatoes. Everything was on point. Our dog loved the bone we brought home for him.
just fantastic. great steak, sides and ambiance. great service and well worth the money.

Finally got to try this gem. Impossible to get a prime reservation, but once you get it... The food is worth the price. Everything that has been said about the restaurant is true. Bacon, steak for two (rare), and German potatoes are a must. Will definitely be backed. I'm hooked now.

This is old school steak done right. Absolutely loved Peter Luger. I will say this place is crazy hard to get a reservation at but once you do you will not be disappointed. The service here is top notch. Our waiter was very attentive and knowledgeable. We decided to get the steak for two and fries. The portion size here is massive. We got a huge plate that came out sizzling hot with perfectly cooked steak. The fries were also a huge portion and tasted great. They must cook the steaks in butter because they were so juicy. Â Only down side is they don't take credit cards so be sure to bring cash. Prices are what you expect at a nicer steakhouse. This is a must try.
The best steak restaurant, ever, don't miss it, great service, just bring your guest and have fun, ah the chocolate sundae, don't forget.....
My favorite part was dessert! NY cheesecake had the perfect consistency plus a bowl of whipped cream and chocolate coins. I had the salmon, my husband had the rib eye. Good experience!

Everything was delicious! I had the porterhouse steak for 2, fries, baked potato, bacon, and a sundae. This was one of the best meals that I have had in awhile. After calling for a month and not being able to get a reservation. I went in on a Saturday around 2 pm and was able to get in because a reservation canceled. The bartender was trying to tell us to go across the street to another restaurant if we couldn't get in for lunch/ dinner. The only negative thing is that they don't answer their phone so it's very hard to get a reservation.

Pro's: this is a very Brooklyn experience. The people are incredible. The wedge salad was one of the best I have ever had. The whipped cream was solid. Con's: the steak is not the best. This is over priced.
Amazing food and service. My family and I have been eating their steak since I can remember. I try to go at least once a month now.

Great steaks, small prime rib, not even everage frozen cream spinich with chicken base cream and butter, so so home fries,ok service, but the worst is there new reservation system, it is impossible to get a reservation for the day and time you want, even 2 month in advance, you find very few New yorkers there anymore, mostly tourists, sad a new york instituition is gone, i am shure the owners make a lot of money for right now.

Racist establishment that was extremely rude to my Chinese family. Also not a coincidence they only seated minorities to the top most floor while the other non-POC patrons took up the main seating on the lower floors. It's 2018, people. Also, food was super expensive and not worth the price. Cash only? Really? Come here if you're white because you'll be treated well and it has a nice rustic vibe.
Beautiful cuts of meat as excellent service. Our waiter was attentive and friendly but not pushy. Drinks were good too. Overall a great experience.

Came here with my fiance for his birthday and it was fantastic! We got the steak for 2, thick cut bacon, and creamed spinach with some drinks. From the service to the food, everything was perfectly executed. We ordered the steak medium rare and it was PERFECT! The thick cut bacon was so good we ordered a few more slabs to go. The only thing is, I wished they had mashed potato but not a deal breaker. Our servicer Nick was absolutely amazing and if I can I'd always request him!

I was trying to make a reservation and the woman was very rude. The signal was not very good so I couldn't hear her well. She treated me like I don't speak English and was extremely inpatient. I get Â like this is one of the most popular steak houses in New York. However, if you keep treating your customers like shit all I can say is good luck with your business.

Unfortunately and surprisingly, I was very underwhelmed by Peter Luger's. The steak was lacking flavor to me. I also didn't like the sauce, which I know is a personal preference, but it just tastes like shrimp cocktail sauce. I wanted to love it here and did enjoy the experience but sadly it just did not live up to the reputation. Glad to have checked the box, though! I will say, the service was lovely.

I seriously don't know what the hype is about. Yes, this is a true "historic" restaurant because it's been around for ages(1880's) but the steak was mediocre the fish fillet that we ordered my daughter was awful( no taste and you can taste the oils it was deep battered in) the dessert was nothing special at all. The only thing that was was good was my aperol spritz. We were celebrating my husbands birthday, they do the same thing to everyone if it's your birthday(all the waiters stand around your table and sing happy birthday)after them singing his song another 3 followed within a 2 foot radius which was extremely annoying-almost seemed like they put all the birthday ppl in one section. Anyway, we left spending over $400 and I can tell you that we won't be coming back despite all of these raving reviews. There's just soooo much better out there, I won't wait for a month to get a reservation to have my husband whom is the biggest meat lover I know tell me that this place was nothing special( he never says that about meat). Anyway to each their own.

Pretty bad service and had to send the steak back 3 times before they finally were able to achieve a medium rare temperature. Â Inexcusable for a steak house at this price point. Â They are living on their reputation.

I do admit the food is outstanding. The porterhouse and Bacon especially. Â The sides are delicious and in the grand scheme of things the price is what you would expect for a nice evening. Â The only issue I ever have with this place is I honestly hate waitstaffs that try to hard. I understand great service but when they start pressing it stands out that it's purely for the tip to be padded. Â Now call me frugal but when I go here and the bill is $350 I'm ok with leaving $65 as a tip. I don't like to be pressured by "immaculate service " to leave $100. That's just my impression I like places to be respectful

Its a really really great place. We went as a party of 7 for my boyfriends birthday and the food was fantastic. The steak was to die for. There isn't much to be said that hasn't already been said. Give into the hype and try this place, its worth it.

I was so excited to dine at this restaurant since it's been around since the late 1800's! Very rare to say the least. I came her on a Sunday afternoon on a date and thankfully he knew someone to be seated right away for our reservation. If you do not have a reservation- expect a long wait. We started off with the Caesar salad and bacon. The Caesar salad was everything you could expect for a Caesar, nothing special however very good. The bacon was insane! Literally, cutting into the bacon was simply so succulent and more of a steak bacon. It was that good. After, we each shared the lamb appetizer. It was so delicious and not that seasoned which was great because you want to taste the meat, especially if it's a good cut. My date and I split the cheeseburger after which was out of this world! I'm a huge burger lover, and this restaurant blows every burger I ever had out of the ballpark. The bun is more of a brioche style, the burger has dry aged meat that's grounded within which takes the taste to the next level. Last but not least we both split the Â porterhouse steak . The filet mignon and NY strip of the porterhouse was dry aged perfectly. I had such an amazing time . The ambiance was more of an old school feel with tourists and people from the neighborhood dining. The desert was delicious the chocolate moose was delicately whipped on top of an Oreo cookie crust. Well done. I highly recommend for lunch on a Sunday. P.S. the burger is only available for lunch until 4 p.m. Plan accordingly !

The Best of the best steak house! Private parking available, excellent customer service, make sure call for reservaciÃ³n en advance. Salad, dessert, just delicious. A little priceless but is worthy, excellent for family reunion, Busines, & friends reunion too! Come to Williamsburg stop by. Highly recommended! No words to completely describe Peter Luger Steak House! Just Amazing!
Definitely worth the money! It's says cash only BUT they'll take debit card not credit card

Excellent! Food was delicious. We had the bacon, steak, creamed spinach, french fries, German potatoes, baked potato, apple strudel, Holy Cow Sundae, chocolate mousse cake & the schlag ( homemade whipped cream). We were a big party so we got to try everything. Well worth it! Great service too!

Had this place for the first time this past weekend after years of hearing everyone hype it up. The host was a little rude, we had a reservation of 7 and showed up with 8 after confirming over the phone and the host was a little sassy over it. We went to through baskets of bread because we were so hungry. For appetizers we got shrimp, bacon and tomatoes and onions and for an entree we got two steaks for 3, German potatoes and creamed spinach. We asked for medium rare and it was cooked perfectly however it was not seasoned so it through me off on the first bite, but after adding salt and pepper it was great. For dessert I had some key lime pie and it was the best key lime pie I've ever had! Also there Peter Luger's wine was the best deal for your buck. Overall it was a great experience and would definitely go back here, but the atmosphere makes it seem more a place I would go back with just the guys and not really a date spot

Didnt do much else but the steak and some onion strings and wine. The steak was soooo good. Its definitely a great experience coming to Peter Luger. I had heard that when you order a well done steak here, youre looked down upon and they still cook it pink but i didnt have any issue of that kind. Our steak was cooked just to our liking. No pink whatsoever.

They really have an amazing pr machine going . I am not into meat that much so my review is obviously a little bias . I went twice over the years and both time after a couple of bites of my stake I ended up just eating creamed spinach . This is a review I should have posted last year but forgot . I've had much better meat in Manhattan at a lower price . But then again this is just my opinion and I am sure fatty steak lovers will keep coming here and enjoy both the meat and the buzz.

I came here for my birthday and it was somewhat difficult to get a rsvp. Â The steak was tasty but maybe it's because I always heard of the hype it didn't really live up to my expectations but it was still tasty. Â The bacon however was amazing.

Maybe my hopes were set too high from all the attention from food tv shows but this was easily the worst meal I had in NY. Number one warning sign was all the tourists. Number two was the condescending waiter. Number three was the waiter trying to push more food on us. Came here on weekday lunch so not much of a wait. Bread was cold and greasy, cold butter. Cold "Luger" sauce aka cocktail sauce. I cook a decent steak with a sous vide and searzall and everyone I ate with agreed it was better than their under seasoned steak for 2. Hamburger was even worse, shaggy mound of flavorless beef. I think this is one of those places that's gotten too famous to the point that it no longer matters.

We love it! The meat is super juicy and tender, service is excellent and casual. We are normally not really meat lovers but the first bite of the steak just blew me away!!! My recommendation will be to get the porterhouse for 2, creamy spinach, the bacon and the sundae. In fact, except the fries are a bit average, everything else is top notch tasty. Also, even though it was a bit difficult to get a reservation (I called like 3,4 times before getting a lunch reservation), the actual dining experience is very pleasant. There was not much wait once we got there, we received very attentive service throughout.

This place is an institution and I hope it continues to serve up good food for the next 125 years. Â The shrimp cocktail, burgers, porterhouse for two, and bacon are all fantastic. Â They don't do a lot here - but what they do, they do right. Â It doesn't get much better that this when it comes to a steakhouse.

Exactly what you always expected. American style food. Clean cut menu steak, potatos, and bacon. Service is good and place is very clean. You don't win multiple Michelin stars if it isn't what it's suppose to be! Check out my instagram for places to visit and eat @expensive_appetite

Not even sure if this place needs my review! One of the best steakhouse! Finally got a reservation for a birthday. Make sure you call atleast a month in advanced to get a seat! Got bacon, porterhouse for 2, and creamed spinach. I must say it was literally the best steak I've ever had....ever. I'm drooling just thinking about it as I'm writing this review. The bacon and spinach was also great adds to the meal which I recommend. For dessert we got a sundae and the wait staff put a candle and sang happy birthday. It was very cute. Need to save up again to enjoy another meal here. Hope to come back soon! Â Also they now accept debit cards! You need to go up to the cashier with the waiter to enter your pin. It was a little weird entering tip with the waiter right there.

Unfortunately, I have found that the steak is hit or miss the last few times I have gone and that the wannabe Albanian gangster waiters act like they are doing you a favor. The sides and bread are consistently better than the steak; which should not be the case in a storied steakhouse!

Always heard about this place. On my second business trip to Manhattan I ate here and the steak was incredible. They put a small desert plate under your actual plate so the juices collect at the bottom. They have their own brand of steak sauce, and it's all I use now. My waiter told me that it went with everything including desert. He was right! The steak is priced by itself, and everything else was a la carte. My dinner to include baked potato, vegetables and two beers was around $80.00 I also left with three bottles of sauce. Great service and great meal!

One of if not the best steakhouses in NYC. They stick to the classics and keep it simple. Between the bacon, tomato and onion, shrimp cocktails even, everything is delicious. Let's not forget, there are few things in life better than a porterhouse from Peter Lugers.

Amazing! Â Simply the best steak PERIOD! Â Just came up from Florida with the family. Â From the bread to the Bacon and the Salad to the steak. Â Wow. Â  Typical fake news bullshit with some review I read in The NY Times about Peter Luger. Â Still the best. Â  I wish I saved room for dessert. Â  The kids want to go back before we leave. Â  Keep it up Peter Luger. Â Can't wait to see ya soon.
Ridiculously over priced; I mean, the steak is good, but my wife does it better. You need a reservation but they keep you waiting a half hour anyway. And the servers are grumpy.

Oh yes oh yes !!! Already planning a return visit. Had a 1:45 reservation today but was late. All good was seated within 10 minutes. My nephew and I ordered the steak for 2 (so tender and oh so good) Also the wedge salad and bacon (this is a must) cream of spinach and German potatoes ( just okay). And don't forget desert apple strudel and there homemade whipped cream ( wish I ordered a second) service was good. No complaints here will definitely go back.

Wow, made reservations a month ago. Tried calling last night to confirm time and method of payment accepted... on hold for over 20 mins to be hung up one.
