Attempted calling today as soon as they opened- obviously phone was off the hook for hours. Called back and after on hold for 5 mins they couldn't find reservation and put me back on hold. After 20+ mins on hold, I hung up and scrambled for last minute res on Christmas Day. Beyond disappointed and my son in the industry will be sure to pass along!!

It's been years since I have been here and I am proud to say the food and service are still first rate. I had the steak for two which was perfectly cooked and flavorful. If you don't want steak they have other items on the menu like the burgers which I highly recommend. But everyone comes here for the porterhouse steak which has won numerous awards. Like many prime steak houses things can get expensive so I only go on special occasions but the steak is amazing. As a rule make reservations to avoid huge lines and they now take debt cards but still no credit cards.

We had a reservation for a Thursday which was fairly easy compared to weekend. Despite a rev, we waited quite awhile. Our waiter was excellent. From seating to out the door it moves fast. Â We waited almost as long as our dining time. Â Our food was delivered very fast. Â We had steak for 3, German potatoes, creamed spinach and nice bottle of wine. Â The steak was good. Not great by any of our opinions. Â The bacon and Â fresh rolls were very good. Â We spent $400 for 3 (no salads or dessert). For that money I've had much better steak and dining experience elsewhere. Â The experience was not enjoyable. It's so brightly lit and way too fast meaning you feel herded so they can turn the table. In my opinion, this was not a pleasant dining experience.

This place is very popular. If you are looking for a fancy place to dine this isn't it. The beef is aged. My husband and I had the porterhouse for 2, fries and creamed spinach. The food was good. The PL sauce adds a nice flavor to the steak.My husband thought the restaurant was overrated.
Great steak!!! I ordered the bacon and some veg to go with it. It's so good I book another dinner after it. If you ever go there for lunch remember to try the burger
Very disappointing. Day old bread, dry bacon, and mediocre steak. Perhaps this model worked 100 years ago but this is far from the best steakhouse anywhere.

Doesn't look like much when you walk past, and honestly, I'm not sure how to feel about this place. It really doesn't have anything that pulls you in, or make you believe it's a good establishment until you read the reviews. I feel some of the reviews weren't completely honest, and I know that's a stretch, but I noticed some of the 5 star reviews are people who don't review at all. As others have mentioned, the staff is snobby, and your food is guaranteed to be drenched with butter. Vegetables tasted like they came straight out of the can and onto my plate. I understand Peter Luger was one of the places to go when you were looking for a steakhouse to eat at a couple of years ago. I noticed all the good reviews were from years ago and all the bad ones are more recently, which adds to my opinion that this establishment is going downhill. Another thing I don't like is telling your waitress how much you are going to tip them, because I noticed some waitresses making faces at another table. I never guess someone's financial situation but it seemed that they were in a tough spot so shame on them for making faces. If anyone is wondering when this story took place, it was right before it closed to the virus. Overall, wouldn't really recommend to anyone unless they have a really good tolerance level.
I don't think anyone goes to PL for the Yelp reviews. It's a NYC icon and a major must have for any steak lovers. It's an experience for sure.

I guess they don't need another 5 star review but they deserve it nonetheless! Â  I visited NY on vacation and the meal there was one of the most memorable just based on taste alone. Â The steak was perfectly cooked (I requested medium rare). Â I had some fries for the table but we barely touched it because we couldn't stop eating the steak. Â Make reservations way in advance (weeks to months) because they're always full!

I had always loved Peter Luger the first time I ate here was because we just wanted to taste the steak in this world famous steakhouse. Me and my husband celebrated our valentines date here, highly recommend anyone to call for reservation. Peter Luger is a popular restaurant and there can be long lines without reservation you might wait to get seated. Service was great as usual they served us bread first as a free appetizer. We ordered the steak for 2 and side dish onion rings. The side dish itself is good for 2 people, before we made a mistake and ordered 2 side dishes. Creamy spinach and onion rings, we had a difficult time finishing the two meal, although they said creamy spinach is their highlight dish i find nothing too special with it. Creamy spinach was delicious of course but it was just too hyped up. Anyway the steak was amazing- tender, juicy, delicious. After the main course we ordered the Holy Cow sundae it was so good. Size is good for sharing but for people who love chocolates like me 2 order is a must! Â Remember to bring cash no credit cards accepted here And always tip 18-22% I cannot comment on that as service was quick! Will definitely go back here for special occasions if only the restaurant wasn't too expensive I would be here more frequently.

Ate here after getting engaged on the empire state building. The place will always have a special place in our hearts. The porthouse lives up to the hype and is right up there with some of the best steakhouses in the city. Limited menu but perfected Items. Service is quick but prompt. I would not call this fine dinning just more of a unique old school experience with very good food. The thick cut bacon is where they really stand out compared to other steakhouses

The food was only OK at best, overpriced and the service was bad. AND, when they brought my shrimp Cocktail, there was a used spoon with chocolate sauce on the dish!!! Our cocktails came after the appetizer, my salad was so over dressed with dressing it was not editable. The broccoli was tasteless, and when they brought everyone else's entree, i was informed they were out of mine. There are so many great steak restaurants in NY, THIS IS NOT one of the them. Tired and terrible food!

It is all hype. Only one cut of beef, a T Bone, expensive and could say below average. The only thing it has going for it is that it has a very unique taste. Comes in steak for 1, 2 , 3 and 4 people, each portion is $50 bucks. We had steak for 3, and shared between 4. It was barely enough. The rest of the food is expensive and average. They do have the most rude and obnoxious host going in for them. So if you like tipping hosts to get a table, this is your place, otherwise not the great meat eating experience it is supposed to be.

It was an amazing experience. Months after months of trying to get a reservation and getting out on hold for minutes to half an hour. I finally got to try Peter Luger with my boyfriend. We did the steak for two which was about $110 and a slice thick cut bacon for each kid of us was $6.95. The price is like every other steakhouse you go too so we weren't too worried about the price at all. Our server (forgot his name) was extremely attentive and very nice and entertaining, it made our dinner ten times better, he also explained what we should pair the meats with and the thick cut bacon with the gravy, and it was legit out of this world. At the end, we had to to-go the rest of our steaks and sides because it was so filling. I would most definitely make another trip just for their bacon and steaks, thank you!

I understand Peter Luger has made some waves in the news recently for not sizzling like it used to; however, I found my experience to be exemplary. I started off the bacon which was incredibly flavourful and practically melted in my mouth. Afterwards I split a filet with my friend and I found that it was cooked thoroughly (medium rare like any filet should be) and again packed with immense flavour. Although there were complaints about the service recently, I found it to be very satisfactory and accommodating. The NY Times Article must have really been a wake up call to this place because my experience was phenomenal. I would 100% recommend for a nice night out and truly believe this place has earned its Michelin Star.

You can't go wrong with the steak here. I've been here multiple times with my family where we order steak for 4, creamed spinach, and German potatoes. Food has always been on point with the steak always being the star. Always perfectly cooked, and if it's too rare for some of your table mates, they will individual pieces for you in the sides of the plate. Wait staff are order New Yorkers so their attitude can come off a bit abrasive to some. Make sure you make your reservations early, and bring cash.

This was my first visit to a Peter Luger Steakhouse. It was a Friday at 1:20pm. I thought that going on a weekday soon after Lent would make for an easier experience. There was a 30 minute wait until a bar spot opened up. I had spent time in the very loud waiting area behind the bar with some guy conversing loudly into my ear in Japanese. Â You don't need to make lunch reservations at most places for a table but here you do. The bartender doesn't take lunch orders but I was helped by a waiter. There's no music or televisions. I ordered the Luger Burger with fries. It was basically a naked sandwich that's gone in a few bites. The steak fries are also plain. It's a fine lunch but not worth the cash, wait or the chaos. I received a Â tasty chocolate gold coin with my bill and it's not even Hanukkah. Ironically, there are no waitresses on International Women's Day.

I ate there on January 16 at 5:45 PM.The temperature was about 40Â°. I stopped by about 10 days prior to see how it was set up and on the corner of Driggs Avenue and Broadway there was a table that had barriers around it and a great heat lamp above it. It was about 45Â° that day. I asked the people on how it was eating outside and they said with the heat lamp it was not that bad. On the night I ate there I was very surprised that all the tables didn't have the great heat lamps and the heat lamp over my table you could barely feel anything. None of us were dressed properly because I told them about the great heat lamps and that they would not need a heavy heavy jacket. The food was great and so was the service but we basically gobbled down our food because we were all so cold. If you're going to eat there and it's going to be cold outside make sure you get the tables with the good heat lamps or wear a heavy jacket. Don't make the same mistake I made

Doesn't live up to all the hype in my opinion. Was it good? Yes absolutely! But definitely not one of those life changing experience where you have to go if you live/visit (in) NYC. Â The sauce was fantastic, definitely helped the steak a lot. Â But hey it's an option!
Peter Lugers is one of the most overrated steak houses I've ever been to. The history is of the place is awesome but the food is subpar.

With this price you can definitely get better steak at other places. Too expensive, and the service wasn't very good. Heard waiter complaining on customers back. They no longer have Porterhouse for 1. Very disappointed.
Love love love this place. Always a treat for my hubby and i to make it here. We come from Westchester county! Worth it!!!! Pricey but i never mind after the meal!

Went here with my partner and had a great time. This place is very family Friendly and great for a date night. I'd only suggest you make a reservation ahead of time. I'm n occasion you might be able to just go on and wait for a table to open up. If you want to cure your steak crave this is the place.

The food is delicious. What I object to is a $40 per person cancellation charge for a reservation, if not done 24 hours in advance. Worse, they made us wait 1/2 hour to be seated. No apologies. No comped drinks. No recognition that a reservation with a $40 pp guarantee doesn't even assure on-time seating. There was nowhere comfortable to wait. Just a noisy bar area. We will return, but I will aim for off-hours. Ohh, and the cash-only policy is a hassle.

You hear a lot of mixed review was about Peter Luger, but I've ve never had a bad experience. I've been going on and off for years with a group of friends and we always have a good time. Never had any issues with service. Yes it's not cheap and cash only, but the appetizers and steak are always done right. Had the burger for lunch once too and would like to again. There's a reason it has survived in NYC since the 1880s when most restaurants from the 1980s are gone.

So, I am definitely considered a carnivore. Â I love meat. I don't eat meat everyday, but it always calls me to come back to the red meat side. I've been to Peter Lugers on 2 separate occasions and have always fell in to a meat coma after indulging in the red zone. I would consider this place a man's place. Men from all walks of life ready to indulge in a hearty caveman dinner. My family and I decided to head out on a Tuesday to eat here. As soon as you walk in there is the smell of sizzling beef in the air. So my salivary glands are working in overdrive and I have to hiss back the saliva to prevent from dribbling. Our waiter Ivan,as all the rest, were very accommodating and you can tell there is a team spirit. The table bread came out prepared 3 different ways. I remember the onion which had onion bits on the in/outside. It was very good. I wanted another piece but made sure to keep room for the meat. For appetizers we had the slice of bacon and shrimp cocktail. Â The bacon was so rich with just enough fat crisped up from cooking. It was divine. When added with the house steak sauce it was mind blowing. I could have had 2 bacon slices and the shrimp and called it a night. However, give me the meat. The shrimp were huge and extremely filling, and a little on the tough side. I ordered my steak prepared medium. And may I say when I saw my plate come out sizzling in its juices with that steak aroma I was ready to dig in. All I can say is that it was great. The pieces of filet mignon taste like butter melting in my mouth. The steak was addicting. My mind kept craving for more while my stomach was begging me to stop. Let's just say my stomach won. I paired my steak with fries and cream spinach. The fries were a bit over done but still good down to the last potato. The spinach gets a thumbs up, not soupy or too creamy. My mom ordered the filet of sole. She wasn't impressed. She claimed the batter was soft and tasteless. I guess they put there hard work into the steak. And just to end the night with something sweet make sure you try the home-made schlag or whip cream. Very rich in flavor. I would absolutely recommend this place to my fellow carnivores and advice them to keep an open stomach. I know it's corny, but it's the truth.

My first Yelp review goes to the infamous Peter Luger. Yes, the steaks are good (nothing you wouldn't find at another NYC steakhouse) but the service is absolutely horrendous. The bartenders downstairs are extremely rude - one even chased us upstairs to make us pay or tab after we told him we had a table upstairs and that we'd be back downstairs to pay out our tab. He said it was for accounting purposes that he had to chase us upstairs. What?!?! In addition, the wait staff is extremely aggressive and again, rude. My first time here and I will never ever be back again. And to all the reviewers that say this is the #1 steakhouse, you probably also enjoy Applebee's steak

Came for dinner and everything was great! The meat was cooked perfectly and well seasoned. The bacon was fantastic. The spinach and German potatoes complemented the meat. Our server was attentive and friendly. Excellent meal!

I have always seen people hype this restaurant up on social media and I was expecting it to be great especially since it is a Michelin Star restaurant. But it was pretty average. I don't personally think it deserve a Michelin Star. There was nothing special about the food. It's a good steak don't get me wrong but there's no WOW factor and there is not much flavor it wasn't a GREAT steak. The creamed spinach was alright not much flavor. I just did not understand the hype. I will say our service was great our waiter was so friendly!

Once again, enjoyed a lovely evening at Peter Luger's. Â The food is so delicious, the service is solid, no none sense...attentive Â without being superfluous: Â This is a meat eaters dream, the steaks are amazing and the bacon is ridiculously delicious.

Went here in 2011 during a NY trip. The food was really delicious. The waiter seemed exhausted and a not very polite, but that could also be an east coast hospitality thing. Â Either way, really enjoyed the food. A must for stopping by when in vacation.

Ate there Tuesday night for a family dinner with my brothers in honor of our dad, who was a butcher in NYC. The steak was excellent it's a great venue and we had a terrific time. Would like to give a special shout out to Tom for accommodating us when we had to change our dinner time at the last moment, and to Damien who served us. We grew up eating great meat from my dad and Peter Lugers did not disappoint

Absolutely the best steak in NY. Ordered steak for 4 for a party of 4 and it is just the right amount. Usually I order medium rare for steak but decided to try rare this time and omg they literally melt in your mouth. Appetizers wise, not that many option, got 2 order of the cured bacon so is a hmm not worth the price. Desert is great! The cheesecake tasted really good, and they also give you a whole bowl of their house-made whipped cream!! Deliciousness!! The Holy Cow ice cream was a little bit too sweet for my taste but dang the portion is huge. Out party cant even finish half of it!
I'd rather eat at a diner than this place. Waitstaff is snob. There is no decor and the steak is soaked in butter. Â Not worth the hype,nor the trip. Â Try Keen's or Delmonico's instead.

One of the best steak we've ever had! My husband and I agree that every time we visit NY we have to go to Peter Lugars! We order steak for two medium rare, german potato, wedge salad, and key lime pie. Everything was great! The total came out to be around $210 with couple drinks. Cash only place so be prepare!

Great food, authentic old school feeling. People will say "it's not what it use to be" or "you can get. Better steak else where", don't listen to them. Not only do you get a delicious meal, and appetizers but you get a very nostalgic feeling being in the Brooklyn location. Â Weekends can be difficult to get a reservation but it's worth it even if you have to eat late.
Great food, service okay. Â I've been here many times and the only complaint I have is that making a reservation is impossible.

It was my mother's first time to NYC and she wanted to go to a great steakhouse. After some research, I decided to make reservations here. I had to make some adjustments to the reservation prior to arrival and it was such an easy experience. When we arrived, we were treated by the manager, whom we made a great connection with. We were seated within moment and placed our order. We got the steak for two and baked potatoes. Everything was fantastic. The steak was perfectly cooked and the butter was incredible! I highly recommend trying the steak with their signature sauce as well, though the steak hardly needs it. The wait staff was very attentive and as we paid, they gave us chocolate coins. Everyone was fantastic. It's definitely worth every penny.

I'm writing this review to defend Peter Lugers. Â I treat myself to one of the best steaks in NY once a year for my Birthday. Â If your looking to eat kale then don't waste your time, but if you want a great steak, then this is your place. Â Yes its expensive and can get overrun by tourist at times, but this is not your corner Diner, its Peter Lugers, a place for something different and special. Â I do not think that NYT's review was fair at all, sounds like the writer was having a bad day and was just looking to bash them.

I had been told that the steak would be the best thing I would ever taste. We visited on Mother's day 2019 for brunch. We had reservations for a month. When we arrived it was very crowded, but we were seated very quickly. I'm not sure if it's a restaurant theme, but I did notice that all the wait staff were all older males. Not super friendly but neither were they rude. I did manage to get one giggle out of our waiter. We ordered the steak for 2 and potatoes. The steak was cooked to perfection, but missing any seasoning/ flavor. The potatoes were cold. I was a bit disappointed considering the build up that we'd heard before the visit and the price point. Maybe it was a fluke considering all the phenomenal review I had seen before our visit.

This is probably the best steak I've ever had. Came here on a Saturday with my boyfriend. We had a reservation and was seated promptly. There was a lot of people so I'd definitely not recommend walking in. We got the thick cut bacon because we read a bunch of reviews that recommended it. It was amazing, the char on it was perfect and so was the flavor. We also got the steak for two cooked medium and the Germans potatoes. The potatoes were nothing special. The steak.... Was fantastic!! It just melted in my mouth. The most tender and delicious steak ever. Would highly recommend, and return.
This steakhouse epitomizes the New York experience and is the pinnacle by which all others should be measured.
Best steak in NYC I tried so far! Their steak is juicy and perfectly made! You just have to deal with the heavy crowd.

Hmmm if you love Steak you must come here before you die. Its not fancy, no shnazzy leather chairs with a fancy waiter. There is a table a chair and guy in a white dinner jacket who is about to help you order one of the best steaks you ever ate. They do it family style here so if you come with friends be prepared to share and the house steak sauce amazing!!!! Sides are on point. this place is a must go ladies amd gentleman.

Obviously you can't go wrong going to Peter Luger. My review will be but a drop in an ocean of 5-star reviews for this Brooklyn staple. By far the best steak you can get in New York City, not over-priced, and a super simple and classic menu that's great for family style dinner with groups. You must ask for the whipped cream at the end (they'll bring it out with a candle in it if you're there for a birthday) and they always drop a ton of chocolate coins on the table as well. Just don't forget it's cash only!

Amazing! Â Worth every penny. Everything we had on the menu was excellent- from the Caesar salad to the bread to the melt in your mouth steak. Enjoyed the food, atmosphere, and excellent service! Â Thank you Bernard for making our visit to Peter Lugers memorable. On a side note- they only accept cash and debit cards- no credit cards. And you MUST order the bacon!

What a classic place. One of the few restaurants in New York where you can actually have space at your table. You're definitely not packed in. Is the meat overpriced?... of course but the experience and quality are high, so in my mind... totally worth it!
Besides being an institution, the service and food are top notch. Â Great for a special event.

It was my first time here, my boyfriend took me as he's been several times. It was an easy simple and straightforward menu, very fast and prompt friendly service. It's spacious but feels intimate as the style of the entire restaurant is "old fashioned." But unlike all other restaurant that like to imitate the old fashion style, it actually is old school style down to the service, ambiance and food. The apple strudel is the best I've ever had!!! Yum. Easy to love all around!!

Peter Luger is the quintessential NYC steakhouse. It has all the old world charm and the food is legendary...but is definitely more about the experience of having gone than it is about anything else, because you can get just a good food at other spots

I was always a fan of Ruth's Chris and for many years I resisted the whole hype of Peter Luger's and I finally gave in at the insistence of my son and we had a great lunch there this summer. I think they could use a little bit of an update interior to create better ambience. I was not a huge fan of the bacon slices that we ordered as add on. I did enjoy the steak and I would go back again. It did have a long wait even for early lunch but it was managed well and we were treated well by the staff
Honestly, the best thing here is bread and beer.. the steak did not amuse me as much.. I felt like I've had the same steak else where ... not too impressed .. and it's so hard to get a table..
This establishment is A staple in Brooklyn for good reason. From the bar service to the wait staff everyone is very attentive. I would definitely be visiting every time i am in NYC.

My great uncle was a waiter at Luger for 30 years from the 50's to early 80's...this was my 2nd visit in less than 3 years after finally making it here at 44 yrs old...simply the best steak I've ever had, the most rich, deep flavor of beef you'll ever eat. Had the thick cut bacon and steak fries again (perfect!!!), and tried their Ceasar salad upon a referral of friends, also amazing. This place is worth the hype and both trips here now have been home runs!!!...lastly, ignore the neutral or negative reviews where the reviewers didn't even order the porterhouse. For a long time it was the only steak served, now I see people who've ordered the rib steak well done or even the chopped steak and then go on to say they "don't know what all the fuss is about" etc. get the damn porterhouse!

I ate there for the first time this past Thursday while I was on vacation and it was by far the best steak I've had in my entire life and I've had steaks all over. The restaurant has a very cool old time atmosphere and I love that the servers actually serve your food for you. I will definitely be returning next time I visit New York.
Very bad service and unfriendly! I don't know why they got Michelin star! Â  I don't recommend people come this restaurant.
By far, one of the best steakhouses in the world. Make sure you get the bacon.....oh yeah, bring a lot of cash
We, 6 adults & a 9 month old, went on this past Saturday 5-19. Â The vibe was "ol skool". Â I cannot express how great of a time everyone had. Â True professionals
Once you get a reservation, the food is bomb. I would bever pay that much for a steak again it wasnt anything i cant do at home ot have in another steak house with direction.

Wow! Their telephone line was busy all day long and I could not get through to someone for a reservation. I didn't give up, it's now 4pm (pacific) and finally got a reservation for November. I regret not getting the person's name - whoever answered the phone. He was so rude and unprofessional. I'm in shock! I don't even know if my reservation went through because he did not confirm it with me at the end of our conversation - it just went dead silent. I will call back again in October to confirm. I expected a better service for the $$$$ I'm going to spend here for dinner. What a joke!

We celebrated our ten year anniversary here...The best steak I've had so far tender juicy and filling it's amazing how a few pieces can really fill you up the. The porterhouse we had serves 3 but we were there with our 2 children and it was filling for us all. The service is great the waiter checks in you and puts a few pieces of the steak on your plate as it's served to the table it's a nice touch.

Amazing place for steaks. Since the first time I came to this place, I knew that there was no better steakhouse at least to me in New York City. The best part about it is the rooms have high ceilings, are bright and airy and therefore it doesn't feel stuffy, noisy and cramped like certain old-school steakhouses do... and also means you can eat massive quantities of steak in comfort. Of course, the steak is delicious - even more delicious than I thought it could be. And the staff are extremely friendly and helpful and both times I went this year was with parents (mine and others) who can be rather tricky to please.

Still a favorite steak house of mine. Â I did a mini personal tour of several steakhouses in NYC, and Peter Luger's is still among my favorite. Â The porterhouse was near perfection. Â Skip the house made steak sauce , you won't need it. Â The porterhouse was served medium, as my preference and the temperature was perfect for that cut. Â Great wine selections. Â The spinach and the mash potatoes are good.

The steak is over cook and the bread is cold. The alcohol is over priced. The creamy spinach is not creamy at all, it tastes like someone has already chew it first. I can barely taste the dry age flavor of the steak. The sauce is spicy taste like horseradish in my opinion it does not fit the dry aged steak.

Was here 13 years ago and it still is the same quality. People are just dressed down nowadays. Caesar salad was a great start for our group and of course the highlight was the steak. So juicy and tender and had amazing texture and flavor. The meat and oil didn't coagulate even after the last bite. Best steak in the world. Worth the trip!

Been here many many times, starting in the 1980s. What can I say about Peter Luger's? Â It's the best steak I've ever had, and it never ever disappoints. Â Perfection every time. Â The whole experience, from bread basket to schlaag, is perfection every time. If you like steak and you've never been to Luger's, you need to get here before you die. Put it at the top of your bucket list.

By far my favorite steakhouse. I've been coming to Peter Luger's Steakhouse for years. It's a great place to take someone to celebrate. This time I took my youngest son to celebrate his 18th Birthday. Everything was perfect but then again it should be, they've been doing for 130 years.I started off with a glass of Laphroiag 10 Single Malt Scotch. Nothing goes better with steak then a good single malt. We ordered two steak for two's because one of my kids likes his steak medium well. (Crazy!) One was Medium/Medium Rare and the other was Medium/Medium Well. Like I said, they were perfect. There are a few staples I feel you have to get if you eat at Peter Luger's so we did. They are the Sliced Tomatoes & Onions, With Luger's Own Sauce, Luger's Sizzling Bacon, Extra Thick, Luger's Special German Fried Potatoes, and Creamed Spinach. Believe it or not but after all of that food we made room for dessert. They make an excellent Ice Cream Sundae topped with Homemade Schlag (Really good whipped cream). I look for another reason to celebrate so I can come back.
Omg best steak! A steak for two can feed three people so don't be too ambitious when ordering ! It's a lot of food !

Make reservations at least a month ahead! We did and we waited maybe 15 minutes. By the time we grabbed a drink at the bar and good conversations, our names were called. The drinks were oversized pour and we loved it! We ordered the bacon as an appetizer and it was the BEST part of our night! Add a little Special Peter Luger steak sauce on it and top it with some bread and that experience was memorable. Our main entree was the T-Bone steak cooked medium well (I would do medium next time) and the side of special potatoes. The plate came sizzling out with the juices of the steak poured over it! Uber yummy - I really enjoyed the steak since it was a great example of medium well cooked perfectly - as you cut into the steak it becomes redder and that was perfect. The Special Potatoes were just that - Special and seasoned to perfection! One last thing - we were celebrating my birthday and they brought out a Big bowl of whip cream with a candle which was cute but funny. I just knew there was a brownie or a cheesecake under all the whip cream, but it wasn't besides the Gold coins on the side. Overall, amazing steakhouse and we truly enjoyed it

Place is over 125 years old and you can feel the history when you walk in. We started with the bacon and ended with the apple strudel. What an experience. 5 of us shared the porterhouse for 6 and it comes out sizzling. Amazing stuff.

Simply steaks done right. They are cooked perfectly medium rare is medium rare. This place is hard to get reservations and if you end up getting one it is most likely early or late in the evening. If you have a choice and are on a vacation I would recommend an earlier sitting. Once the 6pm rush begins the reception area is FILLED with guests. The steaks are all USDA prime and you have an option of a rib eye, single, two, or three person steak. I went with the Rib Eye and shared it with the wife; the steak was more than enough for us. There was no way we could have finished the steak for two. We also had a side of vegetables to go with it. From the presentation to the service everything was what we came to expect from a classic steak house. The steak was tender and juicy, it arrives pre-cut and the waiter serves you splices of meat along with their special steak sauce. While the steak sauce was good I would still prefer A1 or HP but thats just my opinion. Not sure what others complaints are but this isnt supposed to be a hip steakhouse. The pricing was great due to the portion size of the food, as others have said one appetizer is more than enough for 2-3 people. Dont be afraid to share as everyone is doing the same and the waiters even suggest that. Those having issues waiting maybe should have called ahead and made a reservation; a good tip is to call between 3pm or 6pm and I made my reservation 2 weeks in advance. Last thing they are CASH ONLY and do not accept credit to me thats where they lost points. All in all good steaks and comfortable classic atmosphere.
When you are having dinner here you know what you are getting. And it is always good when I am taken here.
Food doesn't get better! Â I typically dont go here for the friendly waiters lol. If you frequent you will understand what i mean lol. Â But literally the best meal in the world!

Peter Luger remains the best steakhouse in New York, dare I say the North eastern USA! While the prices are expensive, the meal makes up for it in spades. We were celebrating Mother's day & my son's birthday. Obviously the highlight of the meal was the juicy, tender, perfectly cooked steak & that famous Luger sauce. The baked potato was the largest I have ever had & the sour cream delicious. The large broccoli was also perfectly cooked. My son ordered the creamed spinach for his veggie, a steak , shrimp cocktail & a cheese cake with Luger's famous Schlag. My daughter had the same meal as I had & my grandson enjoyed his fries & some steak. My daughter got a large sundae with vanilla ice cream , chocolate fudge Â and the home made whipped cream, which was decadent & sinfully delicious. Every morsel of food & dessert was top notch. To make the experience even more perfect, our not gruff at all waiter ,Jose was efficient, fast, very pleasant, accommodating & went out of his way to help us enjoy our evening. I highly recommend Peter Lugers for those who like the best of things & for those who want to know what the best is really like.

The steak here is dry aged for 28 days and is delicious. While it was not marinated in much seasoning, the smoke dry aged taste was satisfying. The restaurant also has a special homemade sauce for those who like sauces. Save room for dessert, the hot fudge sundae and cheesecake are well worth it. The restaurant offers great ambiance, with friendly, knowledgeable wait staff. The only disappointment was the cold bread and hardened butter served before the meal.
Service was absolutely amazing. The bacon is unexplainably delicious. Was able to get a window seat. Definitely enjoyed this experience!
The steak was so flavorless and dry. Even the bread was ridiculously cold. The only good thing on the menu is the bacon. Horrible service! I repeat HORRIBLE SERVICE!!!! Was not worth the hype.
recommended by friends, lugar's steak was awesome, we waited for around 50mins, but at the end of the day, it was worth it. Very friendly staff.

My family and I decided to go to Peter Luger for Thanksgiving. We were not sure what to expect given some recent media coverage but we left extremely satisfied and very glad we went. The server was attentive and very helpful. The cocktails were classic steakhouse staples. The steak was cooked perfectly and the sides were just as tasty. The whole table also loved the bacon and the pecan pie! Â We will visit again.

Overrated steakhouse...it was okay. I find it pretty oily and heavy feeling. Very traditional way of preparing and seasoning steak. But i guess if it aint broke, dont fix it right? I wouldnt highly recommend it. But if you are a tourist and into doing touristy things and trying out touristy restaurants then go for it!! Its nice to say you have been here during your visit. And just like Per Se. Another touristy spot that doesnt really deserve the attention.

What can I say about this NY staple? Well, it's a place you have to see, just once, more than that, it's just not necessary. Their steaks are good, but I've had better. All their food is good but nothing special. If you have never been, go and check it out, but not a place you go to for good steak on a regular basis. Way overpriced and they only take cash.
Love this place always great service and perfect steak haven't not been in a while but can't wait to go back.

Amazing steak as usual, took a star off for the ridiculous and frankly obnoxious way they do reservations. I made a reservation 40 days ahead for a 8:45 pm dinner on a Sunday. But I reiterate, the porterhouse is delicious and makes you forget the reservation process
It's all it's hyped to be and more. The steak is great but don't underestimate the side dishes which will leaving you sweating. Brace yourself.

Peter Luger really lives up to their reputation. Solid steakhouse in Brooklyn. I took my boyfriend Â here for his birthday and raves about it. It's cash only or debit card i believe. It's like taking a step back into the time. Their cream spinach is AMAZING!! We ordered the porterhouse steak for 2, the cream spinach, fried onions i believe. Must visit

Be prepared- the portions are huge - but super yum. All our meats were cooked to the temperature we ordered. The staff was super friendly. Â We didn't get drinks (I stuck with a diet coke and water)- so I can't speak to that. But if you're looking for a solid meal, I would stop here!

Don't try to call, I think they take the phone off the hook. It rang busy for 2 days. Food is always fantastic. This famous old haunt ALWAYS delivers. Open for lunch but night time is better. Expensive, tasty & fattening. Just what I wanted. Cash/Debit or PL credit cards only.

It was definitely an experience I would recommend. You feel like you're entering a godfather scene. The steak and Cesar salad was amazing. The buttery sauce that the steaks release is divine (especially if you're on the keto diet). The service is alright not the best but the steak did make up for it.
I had to call them multiple times for reservation and i finally made it. Overall I could say I definitely love it.

As with most establishments that are known, front of the house can be rude. Fourth time I try to get in super early even with tables wide open during post lunch hours and be turned away under the pretense of reservations only by the same person. Sometime people get indoctrinated into believing something is special when it isn't. Maybe this is special but boy what a horrible host they have (short men goatee). Can use a bit of an upgrade

The best steakhouse period! Â  Reigning champ of porterhouses Â and thick cut bacon. Â If you want to have great,tasty, and a classic cut of steak this is it. Â There is no other steakhouse that comes close. Make sure you get yourself all the favorites. Â Start with Onion and tomatoes, pour some steak sauce on that and eat with thick cut bacon. Â  Get the steak for 2 if with a date or a friend Â along with either their French fries or German fries. Lastly make sure you order a side of creamed spinach. Â Finish your meal off with dessert. Â Any of which you pick would be fine because the reality is you want the Schlogg Â if you haven't been to Peter Lugers you're doing yourself a disservice. Go now!

So, we sat in the big room which is my favorite. Â We ordered salads, wedge, Caesar, and tomato. Â We also ordered the bacon as an appetizer. Â The steak was better this go round and the hot fudge sundae finished the meal off perfectly! Service was good. Â Will return ASAP!!

Went there yesterday with my cousin and cousin in law. It was all of our first times dining at Peter Lugers. Always been hearing amazing things about this place and we finally got a chance to check it out. Made the reservation online a month ago. It was for a Sunday afternoon at 3:45. Got there at 3:40 and checked in with the gentleman in the front, who was very friendly and organized and took the time to learn the correct pronunciation of my name lmao he then told us to hang out by the bar and that he'd call my name when they're ready to seat us. It was dumb hot outside like 88 degrees and extra sunny. While we waited we ordered 3 ice cold Brooklyn lagers and by the time we were halfway done with our beers our table was ready. We were led upstairs beer in hand to a nice room and sat at a 4 person table. Our server was very friendly and straight to the point. We ordered two slices of bacon, steak for 3 cooked medium rare, creamed spinach, and German fried potatoes. We asked our server if that was enough food for the 3 of us and he said yes that's perfect. There was bread on the table, and their signature steak sauce. The bread was good but nothing crazy. Tried it with the sauce, and the sauce is good, also nothing too crazy, it kinda tastes like ketchup with a little bit more tang. Our server brought out the bacon and even though we ordered 2 slices he brought out 3, 1 for each of us, and told us not to worry about it, which was really nice of him. Bacon was delicious.....It's hard to put into words what the bacon was like. If you are a fan of bacon, then this will make you very, very happy. The king of all bacon. The steak came out along with the German potatoes and creamed spinach. Steak was spectacular. Best steak I've ever had in my life no cap. First time ever eating a dry aged steak. Creamed spinach and the potatoes were also delicious. One of the other servers chatted with us for a little bit. We ate everything and left no leftovers. We were more than satisfied by the end. Perfect amount for the 3 of us. We also got another round of Brooklyn Lagers and ordered 1 slice of chocolate cake. They brought chocolate coins and their special whipped cream as well. Cake wasn't too special but it was just right, a little something sweet after that amazing meal. Whipped cream was fire. Overall, I can't even lie this was a 10/10 experience. I don't think there is one thing I'd change to make our meal better. We were there for the steak and it blew our mind. The bacon and spinach just brought it over the top. The service was very professional and kind. Everyone must've just been in a happy mood that day. My expectations were very high and this meal blew right past them. Definitely nice place to go to once in a while. If you're down to spend $100 a person for a nice steak dinner once in a while for a special occasion or whatever, this is the place. Definitely a great place to bring a lady especially if she likes steak as much as you. But not just any lady she's gotta be wifey. We'll be back!

When looking for an old school steakhouse experience, look no further. I came here with a friend and the first thing you notice is this place has history. Located at the edge of the Williamsburg Bridge in Brooklyn, it's one of the oldest steakhouses in NYC. The servers know their steak and are happy to make a recommendation or have your steak made the way you prefer. We got a porterhouse for two cooked medium rare and it was perfect. The bacon is also amazing. You feel like a part of history when eating here and the quality and taste of your food lives up to the hype. Great experience overall and would highly recommend.
Best steak I have ever had mouth watering steak falls apart in your mouth it's incredible delicious
An Amazing institution.. Â best steak in Brooklyn .. love the old school vibe . Â  Take the family and feast

Not worth it for the price paid. 150$ for a steak set and paid extra just for a baked potato and other sides. Not worth it at all, the steak came out burnt and wasn't filling for two people even though they say it's two people portion. My hubby brought me here for my birthday and they made us sit in this crowded area in the middle of a room when there was plenty of room on the other side with window view. It felt more touristy than ever, a huge bunch of Asians were waiting outside as if they were brought here by a large tour bus. The quality and service wasn't that great, many times we had to flag down our waiter to get something, he wasn't attentive and always missing. I don't think the steak was any special... It was too burnt and dry!! I didn't think this was worth $200 total meal for two. I would rather go else where.
Went here for my birthday lunch. It is by far one of the best steakhouses i've ever been to! The medium rare porterhouse literally melted in my mouth like a spoonful of butter.

This would probably be a three star steak if it weren't for that price and the ambience. There is absolutely no reason to eat here, stay far away! The interior is so brightly lit it feels like you're eating an interrogation room. The steak was plentiful but pre-cut (why?) tasteless, and poorly cooked. And cash only? Give me a break!

The Taste and quality of the food is undeniably perfection at it's best. The staff are overworked and abrupt. The wait time is exceptionally long, and terribly painstaking. However, it's exceptional, if you are willing to stand in line, even with a reservation! They've earned their stripes for sure!

Such an awesome experience! We made the mistake and. It ordering the medium rare! So don't do what we did and go for it. The meat literally melts in your mouth like butter. The place is an intimate vibe to it like you sitting at home lol. We loved this place and the service and food was excellent.
Everyone should already know about the steaks, hands down you're getting a great steak period when you order one. Â I'm a fan of the burger for lunch. Â WOW......definitely a home run.....
Loved the steak for sure! It's a must have experience. Went there with my family and friends, always had a great time.
Must say every time i go back here ahhh its just sooo good! Best steak ever!

I believe that salt and pepper is sufficient for a good cut of meat. I don't like any sauce on my steak, because sauce hides the real characteristics of the steak. You want to taste the succulent beef without tampering with its flavor, like Bistecca alla Fiorentina. However, on the east coast and in most of the chain steakhouses, they smother the steak with butter, garlic, thyme, rosemary, and some prefer steak sauce. In Texas, people believe that it is a sin to add anything to the meat except salt and pepper. I've been eating steak all over the world and I can proudly say that Texas offers some of the best steaks in the world. Let's cut to the chase with Peter Luger. After reading the negative reviews from the New York Times, I was skeptical, but since I was traveling in NYC and I was willing to take a risk and take a shot with this 100+ year old establishment. During COVID, NYC is struggling, and Peter Luger is no exception. Despite all those hurdles, their service was above par and their steak was really good, although the butter overpowered the beef flavor. Their fries were good too and the price was reasonable. I can say that it is one of the good steakhouses in NYC with historical characteristics.
Had the ribeye it was so juicy and tender! Didn't care for the sides as much but love love my steak!!!

What can be said. It's Luger's. You go for the steak and the atmosphere. Cash only unless you get the Luger's credit card. Porterhouse is the way to go. Request an appetizer mix of tomatoes, onions and shrimp cocktail. Then mix in Luger sauce and it's all you need. Some of the best waiters in NYC.

Ribeye was good but nothing spectacular. Slightly overcooked for a medium rare and too much burnt surface. Service by the waiter was sub-par at best. For example I was surprised he went on to serve the steak slices on our used plates that had a decent amount of bread crumbs and herbs. Not worth the hype and wait at least based on this visit. I will be returning to Keens for my next steak meal.

First things first. The service was subpar. So no complains here. But oh boy are they not worried about covid. Big bachelor party table of about 6 guys. Walking around freely without masks in and out of the restaurant and to bathrooms etc. Asked the waiter to talk to them. He did and management did but the group argued and didn't comply. They were allowed to stay screaming, yelling, laughing, walking around not wearing masks. Peter Luger doesn't seem to understand the concept of open windows or a strong hvac system either. Air was sticky and hot, no fresh air at all. Me and my fiance felt very unsafe and we have been to many indoor restaurants but Peter Luger has been the worst experience. The food was alright. Bacon is phenomal and so was the dessert (cheesecake and schlag) but the steak was mediocre at best. We had the steak for two and it was tasteless. I make better steaks at home. Drinks were good and strong. Overall I got this off my bucket list but won't return.
This was a great experience . It is a very old school restaurant but the steak is out of this world .. I will definitely be back ..
totally on the Peter Luger bandwagon! probably the best steakhouse in New York. the porterhouse is cooked just right and dances on your tongue!

My family loves spending special occasions at Peter Luger's. We usually go to the Long Island location but its significantly further than this one. We decided to give it a shot. So I call to make a reservation for a Friday lunch (their burgers rock!) and I'm told that we don't need a reservation. I found that odd because we always made reservations because we know they get very busy. So I decided to call back the next day and again I was told no reservation needed. Who am I to question them? So we arrive Friday 1pm to be told we needed a reservation! We had no choice but to leave and go someplace else to eat. It was so disappointing. Â  We will stick to going to Long Island to avoid these sorts of problems.

I thought for sure it was going to underwhelm and I was okay with that since I was into the experience but it exceeded my expectations. The steak was cooked and seasoned perfectly and flavor was spot on. The bacon with tomatoes onions and Lugar sauce was surprisingly just as memorable. The sides were a step behind some of the other top steakhouses I've been to but nobody goes for the sides.

I have been coming here for years ! I no longer eat beff but still come with friends and there sole is an excellent option! I also love the wedge salad and potatoes!!! You can't go wrong here!!! It's a real treat !!
One of the best steak houses in the country. Worth the price. Lamb and steak is extraordinary. Even when you're full dessert is still a must.

Going to keep this simple and short because we can all agree that if you are in NYC, you MUST eat here for steak. It is as good as everyone raves about. Porterhouse with spinach, german potatoes and their sundae to end it. Trust me, you will not be disappointed.

Wasn't a fan of this restaurant. It uses to much butter. I felt sick and tired after eating there. The pie was good but way too much sugar. I wish they didn't use so much sugar and butter. But if you like your food that way you will enjoy this place. Really popular places often have this problem but be prepared to wait even if you have a reservation.

Good place service was ok cream Spanish was amazing. Potatoes were a bit charred bread was good steak for 4 so it was good but lacked a bit of salt/seasoning good spot but not try best steak I've ever had.

Everyone claims it's the NYC must. Have tried the porter house twice about 6 years apart. It's an old school classic steakhouse. If you have a large party, you'll be amazed how many plates the waiter can collect with one hand and how well he can balance them. For the steak itself though, it's good, but not really that special.
This was one of the best steakhouse experiences in nyc. Perfect portion size and price with good service.

Everyone needs to go to Peter Luger's at least once to really see what an American institution it is. This steakhouse has stood strong past the test of time. Solid ratings aside, it's a great restaurant to visit on special occasions--it has that nostalgic feel and the food is always deliciously consistent. Came here for a Holiday dinner with the Hubby and friends, and we left stuffed and happy! If you're contemplating on a proper meal here, the fine steakhouse experience will certainly lighten your wallet.
The steak was so good! Unfortunately i'm not used to eating rare steak n my stomach didn't react well to it lol. Â But I'd do it again

Underwhelming. Peter Luger has a legendary persona outside of NYC, but when actually visiting, it's not all what it's built up to be. Has a 'did it once, don't need to go back' feel. Crowded and expensive for the quality and experience. Steak was okay, at best. Much better steak options all over NYC. The steak sauce is delicious and the reason I came in the 1st place.

Well, finally had an opportunity to visit the fame Peter Luger Steakhouse and couldn't wait to have my rare occasion of indulgence in "Red Meat!" Mouth watering and tastebuds lurking for what so many have said is a once in a lifetime experience, NOT. Â So though many of my fellow Yelpers here have raved about the star of the evening, namely the "Steak," for me it was 'meh,' just ok. Actually, a let down to be honest; except for the steak sauce, yummy! lol. So overall, again, the USDA Prime Beef, not bad, but certainly not worth a return trip for the price you pay when I can get the same or better quality in the city without trekking to Brooklyn. Nothing against my Brooklynite brethren. Service was great, ambience is cool; luv the laid back feel, basically come as you are, but again for these taste buds as well as the price, Peter Luger did not rise to the occasion. Â Even the sides , the fame sizzling slab of bacon, which weren't cooked enough for my liking, luv my bacon "crisp" on those rare occasions I do indulge and the french fried potatoes are nothing more than a side of hash browns. So go if you must (be sure to make reservations) perhaps your steak will be much better. But for this wallet, I'll stick to this side of the train tracks where I know these savory taste buds will be satisfied and fulfilled.
Classic, old fashioned steak house. It was a lovely experience and the food was amazing. THE BACON IS SOOOOO GOOOOOOD! although I with I had enough room in my tummy to try the burger.

Amazing food. Aged stake was sooo good. Cooking in oil as they bring it out. Ahhh so yummy. Bacon was awesome too. Service was amazing. They have multiple people helping, very fast. Also had the cesar salad and German potatos. Both very good. I love a good Cesar salad. Now back to the stake, did i mention how good it was???? I have been in NY for 4 days, this was the best meal so far.
The steak was just as amazing as I'd heard it would be. I like the old-style service and the quaint side dishes. Wonderful experience!

The steak here is something EVERYONE has to try! I had the Steak for two, and it is crispy and perfectly tender. Cooked PERFECTLY on both sides of the T-Bone. the cook it in a vertical grill then pour the juices one rit as the serve you. The sides here are MASSIVE, not like your typical expensive/small sides at a steakhouse. IT IS CASH ONLY so make sure your bring enough!

I've been here several times and no disappoints as of yet. I enjoyed the steak but what I love most are the tomatoes onions chopped up with the bacon and shrimp smothered with their signature steak sauce. It's a little expensive but you know the saying you have to pay to play. It's a must go to place if your ever in Brooklyn.
When are you talking about classic New York steak houses, this is got to be at the top of the list -- the number one place to go whether in Brooklyn or out on Long Island. You can't beat it!

We had moved to NY for 18 months, with Peter Luger on our bucket list before moving back home. We finally got in our last week in NY and it was quite the disappointment. I've had much better steaks at several high-end steakhouses around the country. I love their steak sauce, but you can buy that at supermarkets around the NY metro area. Service was fine and it's a historic atmosphere so there is that. So we've checked the Peter Luger box, but see little reason to ever go back.
Iconic restaurant, a must try for meat lovers. The beacon is out of this world! You have to reserve in advance, always very busy.
Awesome steak, fries and tomatoes! The he tomatoes with the house sauce where excellent. The steak were like butter. The frÃ­es crunchy. Best steak I ever eat!
Best steak! Who wouldn't say that! Literally melts in your mouth. Can't wait to go back!

Not a fan of the steaks, it's doused in so much butter but they make a great burger. We ordered for our team lunch and I ate two! I still bring visiting Â friends and family to Peter Luger for that classic NY steakhouse experience and it never disappoints.

Decent steakhouse. The cuts are good quality, but they drown it in butter so much that I don't taste the actually steak as much. Love their whipped cream. It is a great NY institution with the old NY feel and great service. Will be back!
Nothing to say that hasn't been said. Â The best steakhouse in NYC.

Came here with the hubby for a treat! Happy to have finally made it to this classic steak house. Amazing food and outstanding service. Sizzling bacon and shrimp cocktail were so good. Almost didn't have room for the main - prime rib for me, medium rare steak for him. Delicious! We will be back again and again!

It was okay. I ordered Potterhouse for 2, Bacon, and Creamy spinachh. Food was not superior to other steakhouses in New York. Servers aren't kind. I even felt bad when I went out of the restaurant. I won't visit again.

I've been waiting a long time to finally get to come here. Â It really was fantastic. Â We had made a reservation, even so we had to wait a few minutes. Â This is a popular place. Â We tried the bread they brought out: onion rolls, anise rolls, and plain rolls. Â We had to try the bacon, it is great, so thick it is almost like a ham steak. Â Enjoyed the creamed spinach and the fries. Â The steak for two is huge and awesome! Â You could easily share it for three. Â They cooked it a perfect medium rare and top it with clarified butter. Â I like how the waiter serves everyone steak and sides on their plate. Â Very classic. Â The butter in the steak is great, but be careful not to overdo it. Â Too much butter covers the flavor of the steak, just add a touch of salt. Â I've eaten great steak in Texas and in South America, this one stacks up well. Â Perhaps not the greatest steak of all time, but really great and it deserves any steak lover giving it a try. Â - Finally you must try the apple strudel, it's about the best I've ever had!

Definitely over hyped. Service was terrible. Menus are thrown on the table and so are the chocolate coins given at the end of the meal. Waiters act as if customers owe them something. We ordered one well done and one medium rare steak. The exterior of the steak is burnt black beyond belief. My mom couldn't stop going on about how she could cook a steak better than this restaurant-at a cheaper price as well! After this visit, don't think I would come again. Perhaps it's just this location...

This place is actually awful. And you would never know from all the awards they probably bought for themselves. From making a reservation to the waitstaff to the drinks. Bad. We actually were able to get a same day reservation and I know now why. We showed up 5 minutes early to our reservation and still had to wait about 20 minutes which I don't really have a problem with but I want this review to be honest and the whole story. We sat down and ordered our drinks. We ordered a steak for two, lamb chops, salmon, fries and 3 sides and 4 drinks also a shrimp cocktail. The shrimp cocktail was actually the best tasting thing we ordered ( hard to undercook shrimp) but whatever. We ordered both of the meats medium rare. They brought the steak out first. The steak arrived to the table grey. The waiter said that it had cooked on the hot plate on the way from the kitchen....... ......... ........ we were underwhelmed to say the least he then with tongs brought us 4 pieces of rare steak from the kitchen and threw them on top of the well done one that was not good and said here are some rare ones on the house. Then the lamb came out shortly after also grey. The steak was edible but DEF not the best steak I have ever had. Probably one of the worst I think I have had a better one at an Applebee's in the mid west. The lamb tho was awful. I feel so bad that poor lamb had to be killed just for the meat to be severely over cooked at this point we told the waiter this was not good and very well done he said it also cooked on the hot plate they served it on and that we didn't eat it fast enough. The waiter got the manager who said the same thing that had we eaten faster the lamb would have been better. It took everything inside me not to leap across the table and make him eat the lamb himself. He then asked "well what do you want me to do about it" we were all a little shocked by this question and before we could answer he offered to take the lamb off the check. That seemed fair since I wouldn't even feed that lamb meat to my dog. The waiter then poured water in one of our Vodka tonics to refill it. A simple mistake but when we asked him to replace it. He asked if we were tourists as if we were trying to get free things. It was very disrespectful. I actually do live in NYC and have for awhile and eaten at many restaurants I have never paid a bill over 400$and was treated this way. That was def a first. All and all it was a very bad experience. I don't know if anyone will read this but felt I needed to say something. That restaurant has been there forever and maybe it's under new management. I would go anywhere else before going back.

This is probably one of the most overrated steak house in the country. Â Sure the steak is fine, quite good depending on what you order .... but is it really worth the wait and the price!? ..... In my opinion..... definitely NOT!

The only Michelin-starred steakhouse in New York! After many trips to the big apple, I was finally able to give them a shot. Â Note: This review is strictly for the food and service. Even though we had a 6:45 PM reservation on a Saturday, we were not seated until 7:15 PM. The manager came over and apologized to us and offered all cocktails and desserts on the house - which was very kind. There were 4 of us in the group, we had the 'steak for 3' and a side of creamed spinach. This turned out to be a good amount of food as you should be aware, their portions are quite large. The steak was delicious...quite possibly the best I have ever had. The spinach was also tasty. We had the key lime pie and apple strudel for dessert - which were both pretty good. The decor of this place is a bit outdated - although some may say its not suitable for such a fine establishment, I believe it adds to the historic appeal.
Great food with some nostalgia built in! Â Only complaint is the hour commute into Brooklyn from Manhattan
It's Peter Luger! What's not to love. One of the best places to get a steak. Great vibe and helpful staff.

Very good steak . Very limited selection,sort of the same steak over and over again. I waited 6 years to get a seat as I always failed to reserve in advance . Yes the steak is good but I have had far better in NYC. ( if you read my other reviews ) we went to Gallagher's steakhouse on broadway & 52nd and their quality cuts were far superior to What Lugers serves up. Peter Lugers was good but by no means was it $558 + 15% tip for 4 very hungry guys kind of good. I didn't feel I got the same level of quality here or value as compared to other steak houses within the same price ranges. I felt the place didn't live up to my expectations & all the hype I've read about over the years. I was expecting the best steak I had ever had but that didn't happen. I was a delicious steak and good service but by no means did it beat my favorites such as Bobs chop house in Houston TX / Gallagher's NYC / Old Homestead on 9ave & 14th or Chicago Chop house.

Pretentious, run by an arrogant staff and not comfortable enough to be so highly rated. Â Not even the food warrants most of the reviews given by tourists looking for an authentic NYC steakhouse. Â Skip peter lugers and dig deeper.

You don't have to hold a Peter Luger pistol to my head to write about their mind blowing food. Coming from Texas, the land of beef, this steak house stacks up with the best of them. The steak for two (porterhouse) was juicy, cooked to medium rare perfection, and split amongst three ravenous people. The sensational sauce can be slathered on, but is not needed. The Luger's Sizzling Bacon must've came from "some pig" because it was extra thick and "terrific." Luger's Special German Fried Potatoes possessed a nice crust with soft insides. The service was superb. The cash only restaurant has an enchanting aura and ambiance that only a place with such famous history can boast.

We had dinner here for celebrating my sister's FIT graduation. Definitely it was very time and great food for having our wonderful time. Steaks were just awesome and all their side dishes were great! Definitely come back for our special family occasion

Definitely over priced but I like the authentic atmosphere of this place. It feels touristic and very local at the same time. I think it's bc the interior feels local yet everyone inside feels like tourists lol. Despite the tourist centric spot, they do serve great steaks. I also recommend bacon sides! They're one of those thick ones. Remember to eat salads for a week before coming here :)

Best steakhouse in New York but it can be a really long wait regardless of a reservation. It can be a very long wait. The bacon is amazing. The porterhouses are to die for. I would go. Also remember this is in Brooklyn and it can take an hour to get over from Mannhatan sometimes.
The food is an experience. The steak is amazing. Sides are like stand alone meals. Good drink selection. Bring friends and an appetite! Hard to get a table without a reservation.

Prime. Rib. For. Two. Legendary and epic. Two words I hate using but definitely apply to this New York City institution. It is definitely not cheap, only takes cash, but is a must-have if visiting New York City. Been here many times over the years and is consistently impressive. Life hack is to go for lunch get their burger and a side of bacon.

Came here with friends during our trip to New York. The steak was delicious, nicely seasoned and still sizzling when served. Cooked to medium rare as requested. The service was excellent and they were even accommodating to kids. Also order the millionaire bacon as appetizer!

A friend was in town and made a reservation 2 months in advance. I'd highly recommend it cause it's quite a popular place. We had a reservation for Sunday lunch and when we got there a few minutes before opening, there were 2 lines already formed, one for those with reservations and one for those without. With our reservation, we were seated right away. We had 2 servers through our meal and both were hilarious. They cracked jokes with us throughout the meal and were a lot of fun. Food was excellent. Get at least a slice of the thick cut bacon. I put some in between the bread for a tasty bacon sandwich and dipped it into the sauce they give you on the side. Bacon and bread, so tasty. Between 4 people we shared the steak for 2 and a burger and a side of fries, German potatoes, and creamed spinach. It was definitely plenty of food for 4 of us and left us with room for dessert. The best part of the meal has got to be the steak that is sitting in a tiny pool of butter. The meat was tender, juicy, and buttery. It has me wishing for more as I'm writing this review. Everyone else loved the burger, and while it is a good deal, the steak is the way to go. The sundae to end the meal was good but nothing too special. Seriously, go and get a steak.
Impossible to get a reservation quickly, but worth it. Went here twice this year. Their line is busy a lot, but I see why. Really good food. HUGE portions. Nice area. Fun to just walk around outside.

Made a reservation the day of for lunch on a weekday and was easily accommodated, so absolutely no complains there. The ambiance had a cool old-school German grandparent's house kind of vibe, not that I'd have any idea how that'd feel (I'm Filipino). My group of 3, consisting of 2 omnivores and 1 vegan, ordered the "Steak for Two" and a slice of bacon. The steak was skillfully cooked, so rich and buttery, and everything you could ask for in a plain, good 'ol steak. It wasn't the best piece of steak I ever had, but it was damn good, as was the bacon. Every bite melted in your mouth Â and you appreciate the care and expertise put into serving quality meat on your plate. Overall, I can't give this establishment anything less than 5 stars, because they're just simply great at what they do. My only quirk is that we had to pay an extra $10 for the vegan just sitting there. I'm guessing they added that extra charge because they were expecting the "Steak for Two" to be split by three. Nonetheless, the food and service was awesome enough to overshadow the fact that our vegan friend was charged $10 to breathe the filet mignon marinated air. Definitely would come back, just vegan-less.

I have tried many steak houses and chop houses. This has been my favorite steak place hands down from start to finish. I have spent hours enjoying great food, friends, drinks and atmosphere. The steak has always been high quality and prepared perfect. Great Irish coffee too.
The steak was amazing and perfectly cooked. No steak sauce required. Definitely worth the trip.

The best steak I've ever had. The steak here is seasoned to perfection. It's not salty like most of the steaks I've had. Â Every time I come back to NY, I have to stop by here. Â It totally lives up to the hype.
Finally made it out to Williamsburg. Not very impressed. Service was great but food was just ok. I'm a steak lover and expected big things. Nothing special

Service was efficient. The Peter Luger Sauce was tasty, not an A1 type of flavor. Ordered the steak for two, creamed spinach and for me, the Holy Cow sundae was the best thing on the menu. Their house Cabernet was smooth, $14 is not bad for a glass in the city. About the steak for two, it's pricey. The filet was like buttah. The sirloin side was chewy. Next time we will order a filet and rib eye. The creamed spinach was different. Not creamy per se with heavy cream, it was intense and flavorful.
Excellent service and AMAZING food! Our entire group was more than pleased with the professionalism of service and quality of all our dishes. Fabulous ambience!
Very good steak house. The steak sauce was amazing. Will definitely be returning in the near future.

The steak is fine, but not good enough to justify the long wait to get a reservation nor the brusqueness of the waitstaff. I was very disappointed, and hope I'm never in a position where I'm forced to go back there.

Great place, staff is abrupt, but that is what's expected there and food is really good, but not my favorite steakhouse. This is my second time here and I think my first was much better. The steak was good, but not great. I love theirs bacon appetizer and their sauce. Those are amazing. I just wish the steak was better seasoned.

Let's start with no one ever answers the phone so it's like impossible to make a reservation after a week trying to get a hold of someone i made the reservations for Â April 12 @8pm for my husbands bday along with my two children Â , let me say that the service was awesome the food was great but for the price $$$ I paid I expected to have a nice quiet dinner . I was totally disappointed in the atmosphere Â there was a table with a bunch of guys who kept going to a 1 person bathroom 3 guys at a time , nonetheless there was about 10 of them Â at the table and they were carrying on like no one else was there .slamming their hands on the table yelling and screaming .I couldnt believe the place I've only heard wonderful things about tolerated that kind of behavior. Â I'm sure I wasnt the only one who expected a nice low key dinner Â that turned into party .

You know when something get hyped up so much you expect the best. This is was what happened and I was not impressed. The service was a 2 star a best, we we arrived the hosts were talking football with each other right in front of our face without even a hello or recognizing we were there. Our server was very rude and short with us Â too but I'm think gunna blame the service on culture if New York. I will be spending my $400 elsewhere NEXT TIME and bring cash it's cash only.

I always bring my friend to this place if they visit me from far distance. This is one of my favorite steakhouse in nyc. Every time i visit there i am mostly satisfied. Only sad part is that they do not accept credit card(debit is fine)

Totally worth the wait! We had to make reservations over two months ahead of time and after our experience there, it definitely makes sense. The service is great. The food is amazing. For drinks, I prefer sweet wines, so I can't really speak to that. My husband did enjoy his red wine though. Either way, we started with the thick cut bacon, which should be required whenever you eat here. It is so tasty! We then got the steak for 2 - it was cooked perfectly and well-seasoned. Extra sauce was not necessary. We also got a side of spinach which was good. We were super full, but since it was my husband's birthday, I ordered a cheesecake for him to end the meal. It was an amazing choice. It came with a bowl of homemade whipped cream which was so light, fluffy and not too sweet. The cheesecake itself was still one of my favorite cheesecakes ever. Best decision ever!

What can I say about Peter Luger- only that it is by far the best steakhouse in the 52 states. We received excellent service, from the doorman, thru the bartender plus a waiter who went out of his way to give a blow by blow description of all on the menu. Did I say I made another reservation, well you can count on it.

Expensive! Â But one of the best places in all of New York yo get a steak. This is seriously one of the best steakhouses int he country, I would bet anything on it. I made reservations here and we were sat within 5 minutes of showing up. The waiters were very polite, fast. The food was served warm, didnt need sauce. This was my first time here, won't be my last. Like I said, one of the best steaks I've ever had.
Completely overrated and overhyped. Â Simply, it's a tourist destination. Â Will not go back.

Forgot how good the steak and the burgers are here. Â Reservations are pretty hard to come by and you still need to go to the ATM before you dine here as its cash only, but the steak is awesome (better than Wolfgang's, which is a good option, but just not the same). Â The burgers are only available for lunch (and is a steal for the price). Â Get it with bacon and cheese.

I would give it 0 stars if I could. Tried going here twice and denied service both times. Impossible to get anyone on the phone. Website is inaccurate regarding burgers being served at the bar. Apparently you can only get a burger at the bar between when they open and 2:30. Tried going here twice. So strike 3 already and Peter Luger is out. I'll get my burger or steak elsewhere. A steakhouse that only takes cash???? It's 2018, get with the program. With your prices, you can't afford the small fee to allow people to use a card but instead you charge over $4 to use your ATM outside the restaurant! I recommend going here if you don't want to eat and want to get ripped off at the ATM because it's a great place for both.

Floored by the burger. Floored. Had that and prime rib with a friend for lunch on a Friday. It was the best burger I have ever had. Period. And I am old. The lemon meringue pie was delicious and the schlage memorable. Can't wait to go back, but will wait because I don't want to ruin it.

Love the environment here! I laughed when the waiter forced my boyfriend to take his hat off since thats how they do things there and my boyfriend was so mad because he loves wearing hats. Their bacon is so delicious and its super thick and juicy. The steak was even better Stole some lamb chops from my boyfriends plate as well :) The price is very good and the quality is even better. Outstanding service and beautiful place. Definitely coming back!

There is a reason that everyone says that Peter Luger has the best steak in NYC and that's because it does. Their meat is perfectly cooked and treated. I don't go here often but when i do it's always a treat. Tip for dessert you must get the Holy Cow with extra shlaag and a slice of the Pecan Pie.

Love this place! Went in for lunch and we were in and out in an hour with a 12:30 reservation. The steak was juicy and omg the bacon!!!! I'm seriously so asian where I'd be completely satisfied with a bowl of white rice and 4 bacon strips!!! I def think this place lives up to the hype.
The hype is real great meat great sauces great service It's amazing for me not to say something bad but there's really nothing bad to say

From the time I heard about this steakhouse I knew it was gonna be a place I would have to visit somehow. Luckily enough while in NY we had time to hop an Uber over to Brooklyn. As we walked in we were greeted with a nice welcome to Peter Lugers. This steakhouse is awesome. So humble in looks so amazing in service and food. We were served a yummy basket a variety of bread. We ordered the bacon appetizer. The sauce was brought out. We then 44oz Porterhouse and amazing doesn't begin to describe it. When served rare as we ordered, it was set on an upside down plate so the juices and drippings gathered at the end of the plate. The waiter placed a piece of sirloin on each plate and then two pieces of fillet. He then took a large spoon and dripped the juices from the other plate on top of the meat. This was a super great dinner, now time for New York Cheesecake for dessert. Everything was great and very very tasty.
