If we lived closer I would have to have a second job to be here at least once a week. Thanks for the awesome time and great food.

Full disclosure I only went here because a friend from out of town wanted to go. Even though the place was packed I have to say the service was good from the bartender to the host to the waiter. However they had trouble controlling a very loud birthday party of middle aged men who decided it was a good idea to go out a door that clearly had a fire alarm. The food was underwhelming & very expensive. I really don't get why people like this place.

I often get the burgers with my father during lunch. The burger comes essentially naked: one huge sliced onion, lettuce and burger on bun. The fries are steak fries. The burgers are tender and you taste the quality of the meat.

This celebrated steakhouse meets all expectations. It completely transforms the expectations of a Michelin starred restaurant with a more than friendly and knowledgeable staff, bright and open atmosphere, and location. I adored this experience and hope to be back.

Peter Lugers is an absoluteâ joke. Overpriced. Rude, pretentious, and rushed service. Underwhelminglyâ average food and steak. Hosts and whoever answers the phone have delusions of grandeur and need to rememberâ that they're working at a steakhouse, not the pearly gates of heaven. Unless you're a tourist who also thinks that Times Square is the #1 spot for sightseeing the best of NYC, I don't see who in their right mind would think it a good idea to come here.

Had great time here with 6 of my boys order 3 large porterhouse steaks with of course the cream of spinach , Peter Luger home fries and onion ring all was cooked perfect and taste was even better the bacon and tomato with onions to start with a bitt draft beer was on point it's truly steak heaven

I come here on the regular, never need to look at the menu are usually know what I want. But hands-down one of the best Porter houses you can get in all of New York City. Usually accompanied my steak with the cream of spinach and potatoes you won't be disappointed.

So, I want to start my very first yelp review with Peter Luger's in Brooklyn. I've been here a few times over winter break before and I have to say, it gets better with every visit. Â I'm a huge fan of steak, and this one is by far my favorite. The porterhouse is juicy and crispy at the same time, is that possible? The thick bacon is way better than anything I have for breakfast - it could be a main dish in my opinion. Â The best part? The huge bowl of home made whipped cream which comes with pecan pie. If you are a steak and potatoes kind of person, you'll love Peter Lugers!!
The best steak house I've ever been to. I make it a point to eat at Peter Luger every time I'm in the city.

Great food and service. The steak was like butter and you don't even need to chew! The rib eye was more flavorful and also very good. The bacon is a must have! Creamed spinach was not too creamy and tasty.

We ordered steak for two and the German fried potatoes, best steak I have ever had. Came out perfectly cooked as requested, medium rare. The servers were as aspected, known for their macho man service. The bread and butter was even delicious, cold but delicious. Great place.

Came here on 06/12/16. Â We had 2:45pm reservations and we were called for our table at exactly 2:45pm (good start). Â  The decor and ambiance is of an old style steak house (its been open 100+ years), which adds to the "experience" of an authentic steak house. Â They start you off with a complimentary basket of 3 different types of bread which were all good. Â We then started with a Cosmo ($15), which was made perfectly. Â We then ordered the steak for 2 cooked medium (which was cooked perfectly and delicious $103), 2 slabs of bacon (YUMMY, definitely a MUST $5.95 each) and the apple strudel with their famous Shlag (probably the best apple strudel and whipped cream I have ever had $11.95). Â To top off the meal, they give you complimentary chocolate coins! Â This is a fantastic steak house and everything tastes delicious.

The decor was old and outdated and they only accept cash. The store itself is very old fashioned but the highlight of a steakhouse is it's steak and it didn't disappoint at all. Got the rib eye and enjoyed every bite
Definitely an experience - very memorable one. If you like steak, old school ambiance and a great time with friends. Come here!

Where do I start? The food was good but I was not impressed. My overall experience made me write this review. Â I made a phone reservation in advance like everyone else since they do not do online reservations. Not the smartest way to do business, I guess it is working for them since they have been doing it for more than one hundred yrs. When I arrived they were not able to find my reservation ( with first name or last name or phone number ). I was super disappointed. He gave me a look and said he would see what he could do for me. One hour and a few drinks later we were able to get a table. Â It would have been devastating if we wouldn't get a table since we planned ahead and were visiting from LA. FYI: They do not accept credit cards but No online reservations really? Come on!

Heard great things about this place. But greatness is not what we experienced when we went last night. We ordered the bacon and it arrived almost instantly like a fast food restaurant. The potatoes were dry and the Shrimp from the shrimp cocktail was super chewy. Onion rings were good and steak was great. But overall I think this place is past their prime and just lost their quality touch they once may have had.
Love this place I love the burgers. Anyone coming to Williamsburg has got to try this !

Steak lovers rejoice. My brother and I were lucky to get squeezed in a dinner reservation by Amex Platinum Concierge with a day's notice. We ordered the Peter Luger bacon, porterhouse for two, creamed spinach, and cheesecake. No matter how much you think the porterhouse will fill you, order the bacon because it's one-of-a-kind, mouthwatering amazingness. To put it in perspective, I usually steer away from pork because "pigs are empathetic" but, holy crap(!), so worth shattering my moral foundation. Now to the porterhouse. Served on a center plate, the waiter places pieces on our plates and drizzles some excess fat from the plate over our slices. The filet section tasted like foie gras...we both agreed. If you want to ensure your arteries clog, the cheesecake is a solid choice; it's rich and comes with a plate full of homemade whipped cream. Next time, I'll dip into the alcoholic beverage selection. Also, note that they do accept debit cards as well as cash.
My boyfriend brought me here for my birthday. The experience, food, and service was spectacular. It was the perfect dinner on my day. I loved everything about it. I was a happy camper

Food was great. Table service was great. The restaurant is as much fun for couples as it is for large groups. The bartenders are notoriously crabby and the bar options are limited. Overall I think it's slightly overrated but still an enjoyable, quintessential NYC experience.

Totally the best steak we have ever eaten! The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because there's no background music . Sitting at the bar for a while before we were seated was weird. Â No real ambiance with loads of people just talking. Â Music would have been perfect. Â Otherwise I'll definitely be back.
If you want to not just have a steak dinner, but to have an experience like no other, you go to Peter Luger.

Definitely the best steak I've ever had. It's a late review, but this is the place I never miss on my visit to NY city. My first was by a co-worker's recommendation but definitely won't be the last. My recommendation is porterhouse for two along with tomatoes and onions and a cab if you are in the mood. You will be satisfied !

When a restaurant hand picks, self butchers and ages all there meats, you only expect amazing. The porterhouse is unmeasurable incomparable, I am sorry, expensive, but worth every penny. Service was as expected. Not a fan of ordering a meat and side dishes, but there was not one complaint. Could have done without the bacon, but I will be back.
We have yet to find a better steak and lamb chops. Sides are good too and the burgers are great. Try the homemade Schlag on a slice of pecan pie. Pretty pricey though.
Great steaks. Expensive and great steaks. Good service although a bit on the gruff side. Still it's expensive, cash only and a hassle to make a rezzy nine weeks in advance. I exaggerate, or do i?

My friends and I consider Peter Luger the holy grail of steak houses, so I had to go. Â You need to make reservations WAY ahead. For memorial day weekend, I started calling on April1st. Â  It is sometimes tough to get through to make a reservation, so please be advised. Â The meal was everything I expected. Let's start with the bread. They have an onion roll that is to die for. Â  Got the steak for two (porterhouse) creamed spinach, and German potatoes. There were NO LEFTOVERS...... everything was delicious. Kire was our waiter and Nigel was the bartender..... Â  He made me the best bloody mary I have ever had. You have to give it a shot if you know you'll be in time....... Â  You WILL be putting this in your diary.......

We ordered a 3 person steak medium and came out very rare. Â The Waiter, bacon and atmosphere made the experience a 5 star. Â Pretty pricey but it was worth it. Â Our waiter, who we learned had been there for over 30 years, made ordering easy and took very good care of us!

Been there couple months ago but now I had time to write the review. The steak I got was ok but to be honest nothing really special that you expect from this place since it is pricey. My friend asked his steak cooked medium rare but it came totally black. More than well done. So this made him so annoyed and upset. He called the server and he said he had to tell this to the manager because he told us he can't order another one. So we spoke the manager. I really don't remember the name of him. We explained in details after couple of minutes so they brought him another steak. We were totally pissed of. BecUse of this. Won't be back again.

Definitely one of the top steakhouses in NYC, so my advice is to go and experience it yourself if you haven't already.. but it's pretty pricey, not to mention a bit out of the way if you're in Manhattan. They age their meat on-site, and it's incredibly flavorful; also, you've gotta try their signature cocktail sauce.. but honestly, I felt as though the steaks from Wolfgang's (get the porterhouse at the Park Ave location) and even Mastro's (get the tomahawk ribeye at the 6th Ave location) were comparable and much better priced.. but mine is just one opinion of many for this legendary establishment. I have buddies that swear PL's steaks are hands-down the best in town, judge for yourself.

Fantastic and traditional steakhouse in New York, worth a long trip in a chilly winter day. Service is very good. 6 people ordered Steak for 4, bacon, Fresh Broccoli and Luger's Special German Fried Potatoes but won't recommend the beers. Take reservations only at non-busy time.

Love Love Love this place!, stopped by while shopping and I was very impressed. The restaurant was really jumping, lots of up and coming professionals, families, and business dinners were going on around me, I tried the bacon appetizer, it was pretty good, I do wish it would've been cooked a bit longer though, I also had the potatoes, spinach, and steak. My server was extremely professional, skilled, and down to earth, everything was delicious, DELICIOUS! Everything was poked perfectly, was expertly seasoned, and had great texture. The sides really shined! It shows that they really care about the quality of everything served, I had a wonderful experience and look forward to visiting them again!

Many years ago, before taxis were willing to take you to Brooklyn, my family and I went to Peter Luger's on a trip to NYC. We fell in love. We rated all other steaks with Peter Luger's as the best. This summer, we went back and....it was just a magical except now Brooklyn is so different. No big surprise there, since this happened years ago, but I hadn't been to Brooklyn in 10 years. It was birthday and Peter Luger's knows how to celebrate a b-day. That whipped cream....oh man.
Yes of course the steak. But the burger too. Wow oh wow that burger! Lunch time reservations on a weekend for that burger was well worth it.
The Steak for 2 was perfect, we also enjoyed the side, cream spinach and dessert, holy cow sundae!

Visiting NYC from Detroit, MI and heard that Peter Luger Steak House was the place to check out of you wanted the best steak in the city. I was not disappointed. This was one of the best steaks I have ever eaten!! We started with the Caesar salad which was delicious. Then we each had a slice of bacon- must try!!! The bacon was the best bacon I have ever tried, it melts in your mouth. Next was the porterhouse for 2. It was everything I hoped for and then some. The presentation and flavor of the meat were both top notch. You get the best of both worlds with the filet on one side and the sirloin on the other. You might be full at this point, but the meal isn't over just yet. You must try a dessert. I tried the cheesecake with "Schlag" or their in house whipped cream. It was a perfect ending to the meal. Overall I was extremely impressed with the food and service and I will be back.
A great and classic restaurant - a core part of NYC! Â Everyone should dine here at one point in their life. Â Nearly everything is very good!

Quite overrated, and I'm only talking about the food. Service can be mixed, depending on who you get. The dry aged porterhouse for two we ordered was surprisingly flavorless (*gasp* blasphemy!), over-charred, unevenly cooked, and overpriced with a very small filet. I thought we got "lucky", but while cooking was inconsistent across the 3 tables of couples next to us (ordered with the same medium-rare doneness), filets were similarly sized. The fame alone will probably distort reality for many visitors. However, I couldn't help but imagine that the money would buy better steaks elsewhere.

Every time I come here I forget what a great meal and dining experience it is. Â It starts with a bread basket better than everyone else's. Â From the amazing tasting steak and all the great sides. Â The best shrimp cocktail anywhere and let's not ever forget the Schlag.
Taste so so. A little bit expansive. Two for $175 after tips. Attitudes of guide and waiters of the bar are really bad!!
Hands down the best steakhouse in New York. They dry age and cook the steak so perfectly... It's a bit pricy but soooooooo worth it.

Went here last night for my birthday and was not disappointed. I've been hearing about the bacon for years and it was just as good as I anticipated. The Cesar salad was one of the best that I've ever had. The creamed spinach and fried potatoes were incredibly delicious as well. We also ordered the steak for two. This place definitely knows what they are doing when it comes to steak. Maybe it has something to do with the fact they've been in business for 125 years. I thought the chocolate coins at the end of the meal were quite a nice touch as well.
Fries are average but steak, OMG, is the best! Order medium rare. A very masculine restaurant. All male waiters. Extremely popular. You may need to wait even when you have a reservation.
One of the best steak houses. Â The steak and garlic mash potatoes were great. Â Love the Peter Luger sauce. Â A bit pricey and maybe cash only still.

I tried to get reservations at the Brooklyn location but no one answers their phone. Called at 630pm. Understand that dinner is busy but how does one make a reservation when the phone goes unanswered? Called 4 times.

I have been going to this steakhouse on & off for well over 25 years, so it's about time for a review. What can I say???? This place is awesome!!!!! The availability & prices are probably a turnoff for many, but I don't care about that....I love this place. It's been crowded every time I've been there, but we always manage to get a seat right away or wait for a few minutes. Making a reservation definitely helps. The waiters are top notch. They definitely know what they're doing & have a good sense of humor. Also, the food is to die for. My family & I went last month for my son's birthday, and we again had an amazing time. We were able to find free street parking right around the corner, and enjoyed the meal of a lifetime. How can I not recommend this outstanding restaurant????!!!!
Steak was good & the serving portion was huge but the Luger Special German Fried Potatoes was nothing special.

Great food, if their wait wasn't so long and so next to impossible to get a table..... it would be 5 Stars. They need to open another location in nyc. Also they need to stop acting like they are the only 5 Star steak house in nyc with dry aged steak. Managers act stuck up. There's enough of those donkeys in nyc already, when you go to a restaurant, you want to get away from that, not pay for it.
Extremely overrated, IMO. I've had much better steaks elsewhere. Go for the nostalgia, but don't expect to be blown away. I do love their sauce though! Also, CASH ONLY.

With all of the hoopla surrounding this restaurant, I expected more. I wanted a filet which is not on the menu so I ended up getting salmon. I do however LOVE their sauce which I now buy at my local Shoprite.
The service was good but the ambiance wasn't amazing. Felt a little casual. Food was presented nicely but taste was overrated. I could go somewhere else for half the price and have a better time.

Night started a little rough with a not so nice bartender but our wait staff exceeded our expectations. Alouicious (hope I spelled his name correctly) was a true joy and so welcoming and kind. Dessert on the house to make up for the rough start and then smiles and jokes all night long- made sure we would be coming back here again and asking to have him assist us! He really made the bday dinner so special- felt like family. Ordered a bottle of Chianti, steak for two, creamed spinach, and German potatoes (hash browns). All wonderful- the steak tender and savory. Don't forget the pecan pie with ice cream, and apple strudel with light as air schlag- ended the night on a nice note. Schlag in your coffee was yummy too!

The original world famous Peter Luger is absolutely amazing! This place has been around since 1887! The building is so cool and original. Incredible steaks! So juicy and tasty. It comes out still sizzling on the plate. They make their own sauce which they bottle and sell at stores. Pretty big inside, plenty of rooms and seating, but that doesn't change the fact that you need to make reservations 6 weeks in advance! The place is always packed.

Still deserves 5 stars for its Steak and Peter Lugar sauce. Â The service is still old school witty and Brooklyn styled. Â Not at its best, but still a solid must for those celebrations or just "a man's night out." Â Don't sleep on the burger too!
If you have 100 bucks it's really worth but don't go if you plan to spend less. It's a icon for Steaks in Brooklyn android are better off making a reservation ahead.

Nobody told us is a NO CREDIT CARD restaurant. We thought it was a joke when the waiter told us because he had been so friendly (which by the way excellent service) he said they normally say it when you book. But this was not the case. There was a sign above the cashier that says "No Mayor credit cards Accepted" (which as a lawyer that is debatable lol) which we saw going out after going to ask for cash to the ATM wich obviously "DIDN't have money" I thought we where going to wash dishes or something. Anyway food was great, bacon incredible, meat very good (had better but very good) the wine was delicious. Service great. Just bring Cash, like a 100per head! Oh yea expensive lol.
Service was great but the steak was good but not worth was hype. Their best dish is probably the bacon. Make a reservation ahead of time before you plan on going.
The best steak Iv ever had. No salt needed. Sat next to Paul Giamatti. He's a dick. The waiters were dicks. Loved every minute of it!
Food was bad. Service was fast but trash. Waiter was rude and not helpful. I don't suggest you go here unless you want fat in ur steak

Hands down best steak I have ever had! Not once but a multiple time goer .. and with that I will say I have tried multiple steakhouses that are well known and they may be very good but Peter lugars is by far excellent and never a let down. From the steak to the sides to dessert. Perfect!

We just had my brother's birthday dinner here. Amazing service. The food was great but the steaks were maybe abit too fatty. All in all I would highly recommend this establishment. It's great reputation is valid.
There are lots place better than this. And people there are so rude. Overated by tourist

Very busy place. The barâ is always packed. Bartenders are âup to the task friendly and knowledgeableâ.â Mozzarella/Onion basic. Porterhouse makes this place worthy of the hype. Service well let'sâ just say not the nicest and not the best.
Been here many times. I prefer this location over the Nassau County one simply for the Old World Williamsburg feel. The steaks here are very good but not the best Ive ever had.

The best of the best. Â The king of steaks. Most well known spot in the world....get the bacon appetizer, Porterhouse for Two, and the Holy Cow Sundae. Make a reservation as far in advance as possible, or go for lunch and sit at the bar.

I love steak and we tried out Peter Lugers and I must say it's not all of the hype they make it out to be. I don't like that they do not accept credit cards. The bill does run high and you will need a lot of cash in your pocket which I don't feel safe carrying. Everything for the most part is a la cart. For The price you pay for the steak, I had eaten better steak at other steakhouses.

This place is the BEST place for steak! Â I've heard about it for many years & finally brought my partner for his birthday & it was AMAZING! Â The staff, managers, setting, etc are all top notch. Â I highly recommend!!!

I think people over hype it honestly, not crazy expensive. The fish was huge and too much for a female to finish Â and my family liked the steak- better than STK that's for sure. Well actually it's two different atmospheres. STK is more classy steak house and Peter Luger is Family style

Visiting New York, I made reservations for my family and i for my birthday dinner. Since we walked in the host in the front was very rude with no smile or expression on his face . Once we were seated upstairs, our waiter, which he never introduced himself appropriately so I don't know his name was also very dry and seemed like he hated his job. They had no options for kids and not a big selection on the menu, but we were recommended the steak for two which we ordered along with a baked potato and Cesar salad. We ordered our filet medium and it came rare, the bake potato cake with a huge bowl of sour cream and no other sides not even butter! The waiter checked on our table maybe twice. Our water was always empty and the service was horrible to say the least. Now, what put the icing on the cake, i was told after dinner, my husband mentioned to the host to do something special since it was my birthday... do you think anything was done? Of course not. Horrible service, horrible food and waste of money! Don't waste your time!

The hype was real before arriving seeing thousands of rave reviews. Made reservations 3 months in advance which took FOREVER to get through the phone line. We were a bit disappointed with the food though. Steak is really great quality but doesn't have a lot of seasoning or flavor. Staff isn't the friendliest and ended up sitting next to a group of about 20 men who were loud and obnoxious. Hard to decipher whether Buffalo food spoils us or the food was mediocre. Either way we won't be back.

I came here in 2014 and made a reservation for two on a Friday night. Absolutely wonderful experience and the best steak I've ever had. You really can't go wrong with any of their steaks, I had the steak for two with a friend and a side of creamed spinach with a bottle of wine. Easily racked up to $200 but the best steak I've ever had

We come to Peter Luger every year for my husband's birthday and it's always great as expected. Here's the thing- this isn't a fancy, luxurious, upscale type steak house that you expect to be in a luxury hotel restaurant. It's a no jokes, straight to the point, casual steak house. It's old school like the fine people who work there. We go in with the right mind set- here for great steak and that's it. We always leave full and happy. Our usual order consists of the porterhouse for 2- it's a lot of steak! Fried potatoes, Bacon- cause who doesn't love bacon, salad- don't judge me, I'm trying to justify the bacon, some wine and that's enough to make your belly roll.
We got a steak for 3, two slices of bacon, the German potatoes and creamed spinach. Perfect amount of food for 3 hungry people. Steak is perfect!

Oh yes. Â Just an absolute yes. Â Everything a yes. Â The steak for 3 was sooooo juice and we had plenty left over - the baked potatoes were cooked perfectly - and the bacon, ohhhh the bacon, thick and juicy and so flavorful, worth every penny - now for dessert, the apple pie and the home made schlaq was to die for!!!! I want it all all over again!!!! I'll be back very soon!!

My husband and I try to come here at least once a month. The food especially the steak as it is a steakhouse is top notch the best I've ever had. The waiters are nice enough but we don't come here for stellar table service

Very good steaks. But the problem here is that they try to "kick you out" in 40 minutes, as they are trying to serve as many people as they can. You feel rushed. It is very expensive and they should let you enjoy the food.

The steak was obviously amazing (some of the best i've ever had), but what was the most outstanding was Peter Luger's service. Â I did not catch my waiter's name, but he was the sweetest gentleman and took care of my boyfriend and I. Â While the steak was great, most of the sides were pretty plain.
Great atmosphere and steaks we especially loved the big thick bacon as an appetizer. Had a great time here celebrating my husband's birthday.

One of the best steakhouses in New York City! Must try! We were very impressed with food and service. The restaurant was not full at all but there was a really long wait to get seated. And it seemed like our reservation was lost? For Appetizers, we ordered the famous thick cut bacon. For mains, we ordered Steak for 3 and the Filet of Sole. The steak was so tender and the filet not overcooked. Everything was well timed. There was so much old world charm in this place. Be sure to bring cash! They don't take plastic!

Second night in NYC and my son takes me to dinner and he picks the perfect restaurant! He's been here many times before but my first time and it was amazing! We had a reservation at 645pm. Got there and it was pretty crowded. Â Waited about 10min for us to be seated. Waiter was super friendly and helpful with our coat, jacket and umbrella. Â We ordered the thick sliced bacon for appetizer and let me tell you the slice was enormous and tasty. Â  Then got the steak for two and a side if steamed broccoli and fried potatoes. Â Everything was cooked to perfection and flavored well. Â I like my steak medium well and they did not disappoint. Â Soft, juicy, flavorful pieces of USDA prime steak! The brocolli was cooked and still crunchy just how I like it and the fried potatoes were browned and delicious and perfect like everything else. Â I wish I could've gone back for another dinner before I left but I guess I just need to make another trip back to this beautiful Â state!

I finally made it! I've been lusting over Peter Luger's since I became aware of it's existence (years and years). My husband doesn't eat red meat (tragic, I know) and I knew I would not (should not) be able to tackle the "steak for 2", so I enlisted my quasi-veterinarian sister to assist, lol. We grabbed a pre-dinner cocktail at the bar (scotch for the ladies, beer for the hubs), as we were a few min early. A few min later we were led up a staircase then to the back of the room where our table was already furnished with their delicious steak sauce (that I wanted to put on everything) and menus. Onion rolls soon followed and didn't have a chance, so good. We went simple, green salad with Russian dressing (when in Rome), tomato and onion side for the fresh crunch, steak for 2 medium rare, salmon (for the hubs), and creamed spinach fort the table. The steak is so good it's criminal! After my first bite I started to think we should have gone with steak for 3 despite there only being on real meat eater (me). Everything complimented each other perfectly. Even my husband's salmon was to die for. We closed it out with a little fernet for digestion. I'm literally planning my next trip later this year. A few tips: cash only, make a reservation or be prepared to slip the host a $100 (at least) and wear comfortable eating attire, lol.

Very pricey. Service is okay but quite slow, wait is very very long. You need to make a reservation way beforehand in order to get a table. Their thick bacon was the best thing on the menu. Steak was good but nothing extraordinary.

One technique mastered is better than one thousand mediocre techniques. The porterhouse creamed spinach and German fried potatoes make the perfect three amigos. After the first bite of steak I was summoning the invisible horseman like farleyfarleyfarleyfarleyhafaaaaarl!

This place 100% lives up to the hype. Service.. impeccable - atmosphere, friendly & energetic. My recommendation: go for lunch. Burger is THE BEST. This is tied for first place with au cheval in Chicago - but you really cannot compare the two because this is a thick patty and made from porterhouse trimmings. Just try to wrap your mind around it. We also had steak for 2 and it was impeccable. On my way out I told the guy, best steak of my life, and he said "see you tomorrow!" and tbh I do want to go back tomorrow and also the next day.

Today was the day, time to head over to Williamsburg Brooklyn, from Farmingdale Long Island for some porterhouse. It was ok, a little tough, but ok. I wanted their German hash brown, but they only have it for dinner only So i settled for mashed potatoes. Service was ok. After I went to Baked bakery in Red Hook for Goodness. Then my day got a lot better.
finally got to eat at Peter Luger. It's def. vintage style and love the bacons. the steaks are cooked perfectly.
Very good steak. I like to order schlog for dessert. Very tasty

Over rated, I know people that sware by this place and I can tell you from experience it is not all that. Crappy location, only takes cash (or Lugers Card), waiters are rude as can be, bar is small and dumpy and the overall restaurant needs a huge makeover. There are so many good steakhouses around that I see no reason to treck to the middle of nowhere to get good steak in a crappy environment.
Had dinner here on a weeknight. Great ambiance and food. Upscale crowd. Will come back.

Loved my experience at Peter Luger's! Â Great food and excellent service. Â Steak was cooked just right; crispy outside and tender inside. Â Place has a great old-timey feel with waiters that know how to treat their customers.
Great steak.. Cooked just the way you ask the kitchen to cook it. Make rsure to make reservations way in advanced.

Outstanding. The ambiance, the staff and more importantly the food. The steak comes to the table sizzling. It is pricey but after you eat their food you know why. It is an "all the time" spot when going to NYC. I wish I would of gone there when I first went to NYC back in 2004!

Love how they make the meats crispy on the outside n yet so juicy n soft on the inside!!! Have tried loving other steakhouses like the Morton's, Smith&wollensky, Ruth Chris, Wolfgang n many more BUT after trying those places, i ALWAYS end up coming back to my Peter Luger! No other place makes me feel satisfied the way they cook their steaks like Peter Lugers does! I ONLY give it a 4-star though bc their service in Great Neck is not how it should be, esp for a decently priced steakhouse like Peter Lugers... Brooklyn location is better in service. Also wish they updated their plates.... its way too old n outdated....

Overpriced... the steak is decent but I've certainly had better. Their meat is more textured than what I expected for a medium rare. I wish the outside of the steak had more interesting flavors to add a little complexity.

column3: Long Island City, New York, NY
column6: It didn't live up to the expectations, poor service, ok food, not very welcoming and very expensive.

We waited ONE HOUR for our table. Steak was good but reservations here clearly mean dog poop. Wouldn't recommend. Go to Wolfgangs instead. They honor reservations. Same food. The photo is of all of us sadly waiting.

I have tried this place three times. I thought the first time was a fluke, the second I had convinced myself it wasn't that bad, the third - I've written it off all together. Their attitude makes the food crappy. Limited options and a bossy server with an attitude of take it or leave it. I knew what I was walking into and what to expect but overall, dissatisfied. They cooked the steak perfectly but I will not return.

I was here a few weeks ago for lunch and I ordered the Luger burger (medium) and two slices of bacon and all I can say is the food is absolutely amazing. This place never fails to do well with their service and the quality of the food. The price may be a little up there for some people but the food is absolutely worth it. I will continue to get my burgers from Peter Lugers because it's just that damn good!
Very good steak. I like the steak at Wolfgang's abut more, but at this level of quality it's a matter of taste and mood. My only complaint is it's always sold out reservation-wise.
Excellent never disappointed..worth the wait..service was perfect..sad that they stopped serving Peter Lugar Beer

The quintessential manly steak house has it all. Great waiters, fabulous steaks and all the great steakhouse sides. The bacon slab is a must as is the sautÃ©ed mushrooms and creamed spinach. Â I found the steak for 2 perfect for 3 or more people so order accordingly depending on your appetites. Save room for the cheesecake and DONT forget the Schloog( whip cream a MUST). Place is old so watch for critters (yes, saw a roach or 2 on a few occasions). Â Overall a good steakhouse experience but it's Brooklyn , not Manhattan

This is one of the best steakhouses in New York City. Great steaks, great sides, great atmosphere, great service and it's a historical landmark as one of the oldest continuously operated restaurants in the city (since the late 1800's). Â The only reason I give it 4 stars is because they do not take credit card; either cash (let's be real most people born after 1980 don't walk around with wads of cash in their pockets) or you can sign up for their own charge card (I assume to avoid banking fees and make more money). That and the fact that the service is very rushed (The food is basically thrown on the table and taken away before you take your 5th bite) so be prepared as a table for two to spend less than an hour there. Â That's probably the only two negatives and why they lost 1 star for me. Everything else though is amazing.

My first experience at Peter Luger was unforgettable! We started the meal off with drinks. The vodka gimlet was so good with having just the right amount of sweetness and lime flavor. The appetizer rolls are fresh and soft with a variety of different breads. The onion roll is filled with pieces of onion. The onion and tomato salad was fresh and came in a huge portion. It was great topped with the Peter Luger sauce! The bacon pieces are thick and crispy on the outside, but tender in the middle. Not to mention, they are huge! The creamed spinach and hash browns were good, but not the best part of the meal. The hash browns are very crispy. Now onto the steak...the amazing tender steak! It comes out on a pipping hot plate that continues to cook the steak while it sits there. The servers put your food on your plate for you. The apple tart dessert was pretty good also. Lastly, the chocolate coins are a perfect small treat after the big meal, Overall, not in my budget for frequent visits, but a great spot for a special occasion!
Steak itself was decent as it was on point. However, the meat itself was not prime quality and the fries were very soggy! Not the place it used to be...

Peter Luger is one of the best, if not the best, steakhouses in NYC. Having visited this place since I was kid, I like the fact that nothing changed much. The food, interior, certain waiters, coin chocolates, and even the long wait despite making a reservation are just about the same. The must-order items on the menu are 2 caesar salads, shrimp cocktail, bacon (top it with their steak sauce), and cheesecake or holy cow. Of course, the steak is not to be forgotten; the porterhouse for 2 is our choice for a group of up to 4. I'd advise to avoid getting the porterhouse for 2 to split between 2 people unless you've starved for a couple days or not ordering anything but the steak. Â I go for one of their draft beers most of the time and have tried the lunchtime burger to my disappointment. But I do suggest going there when the doors open (11:45am if I'm not mistaken?) to wait the least amount of time for your reservation. I like the cool mannerism of the waiters but also wonder why I haven't seen any waitresses. Anyway, I enjoy going here but only on special occasions because it's now too commercialized to frequent casually. I have their overpriced Peter Luger t-shirt so maybe I'll wear that next time and see how they react.

Wish I could give Lugers 10 stars. I have been coming here for over 50 years. It is the best steakhouse I have ever gone to along with being a wonderful memory for me from my childhood when we could just walk in and get a table. I have handed down this tradition to our family and even though we now only get here once a year around Christmas, Luger's never disappoint. We had such a wonderful waiter, as we usually do, but this year our waiter Cat was the absolute best. Cat could not have been more accommodating. Â Service was impeccable. Bacon, steak potatoes and creamed spinach, the best. We will be there again next year same time and hope we get Cat again. Hey NYTimes guy, go peddle your fake news elsewhere.
Wonderful steak best I've had. Service is excellent. Â Drinks are not in need of a second. I definitely would return.

Rude service as you'd expect with a steakhouse stuck in the past - but they make a damn good burger and for under 20 bucks it is the best lunch possible. Â Steak is great too, but for the price have had better. Â Also the bacon is possibly the best bacon I have had in my life

Taking my parents and my parents fiancÃ© here tomorrow for a meal to get together. Called to check the time as a i do not recall. When i called a month ago, i guess no one bothered to write it down since it's not on their "books". What kind of booking system is this?

Could be the best steak you've ever had if you are lucky to get the right cut of meat. If not it still will be memorable. Don't forget to order the shrimp as an appetizer. Bring plenty of cash or you'll be washing dishes.

What else can I say, i've been to most of the top steakhouses in NYC and this fits right in with the top bunch in terms of beef quality, price, and overall taste. I really like how much more unpretentious this place is in comparison to most of the manhattan steakhouses. You kind of feel at home going there with the big german tables and casual attire. The thick bacon and spinach were great. We got steak for two medium-rare and it was just phenominal. The butter that sits in the serving plate when you dip the steak in is the best, even better than the Luger's sauce they give you. I can't wait to come back at some point

This place gets so much hype. I've been to the one in Brooklyn as well as the one in Queens. I have to say, it's a bit over-rated. They serve large shrimp cocktails and huge slices of onion and tomatoes. The shrimp were overcooked when I ordered them, and there isn't anything new or innovative about tomato slices except for when you smother it in their famous steak sauce. For the price, I was expecting an extremely tender, juicy, and flavorful steak. The steak was kind of chewy. I ordered medium-rare. It wasn't as flavorful as I hoped and it was definitely not worth the price. It is group friendly and feels very homey, but there are much better places to go in the city for much less.

I mean who doesnt love peter luger steakhouse? It's a staple and it's the brand. The staff are grumpy old men who arent so friendly but i guess you're really going there for the food. The portions are decent for the prices they charge. I'm not a fan of their signature steak sauce because its on the sweet side. I also wished they had mashed potatoes as a side dish.
Absolutely hands down the best steakhouse in NYC. The porterhouse steaks are fantastic, the creamed spinach is delicious and the service is impeccable. I highly recommend it.
Amazing service! Amazing food! When in NYC, visit Peter Luger for their famous steak!

My husband has heard about this steakhouse for a long time and wanted to try it. Â Reservations for the weekend was hard to come by so we settled for having lunch on Monday. Â We had the porterhouse and a side of broccoli. Â The vegetable was fresh and cooked perfectly. Â The steak was ... phenomenal. Â We ordered it medium rare and that was what we got. Â The steak was crusty on the outside; the inside was tender and juicy. Â We could have cut it with a fork. Â It was worth the subway ride to Brooklyn for this meal. Â We'll definitely be back the next time we are in NY. Â Be reminded that they only accept cash or debit at this location.

First time here. I had heard a lot about this place and was excited to finally try it. They bring you out a bread basket which is very tasty. We ordered the thick slice of bacon, which was was very tasty. The cream of spinach was delicious also. We ordered the porterhouse steak for 2. Maybe it wasn't cooked enough, but I just didn't really like it. We ordered it medium rare-medium. But it was very very red. The waiter didn't do a great job at explaining the way it would be cooked. I enjoyed the steak at Uncle Jacks Steakhouse wayyy better. I would probably go back here for another occasion but I would make sure to ask for it to be cooked medium WELL. The juice from the steak was ehh.

Oh. My. Goodness. The steak tastes like butter! For a Wednesday brunch my bf and I ordered bacon, steak for two, and creamed spinach. I thought one bacon was a good size to share Â (given that I didn't want a whole one for myself). The famous steak sauce tastes to me like a mix of steak sauce with cocktail sauce. I saw a few people ordering burgers but most were ordering the heavenly steak, even at 12:45pm in the afternoon. We were tempted to order more at the beginning, but I'm glad that we didn't because the meal was very filling and we were content for the rest of the day! Truly a great experience. A must-try restaurant for the meat lovers.

After more than ten years of pining for this place, I was finally able to experience one of the most long standing and reveled steakhouses in the country. I've been to mastros, mortons, Ruth Chris, Flemings, etc etc but my steak at Peter lugers was one of the best I've ever had. The old school ambiance and the old school staff made the experience very memorable. Â The steak was cooked perfectly med rare and it was like butter. If you are in NY and you love steak as much as I do, this is a must try. Obviously the steak was the star of the show but we ordered the thick cut bacon for an appetizer, Â which was a nice start to get your palette ready for the protein. Â Our server saw how excited I was and very sweet about it.

Great steak. Cash only was a bit much for a party of 7 but the food was fantastic. Found it entertaining that they hung your leftovers in a plastic bag on the wall but makes sense. The bacon appetizer was delish and the whipped cream dessert was also fantastic
Going to Brooklyn is a pain, getting a table is a pain, service isn't the best. But the steaks are the best you'll get.

I love this place. The thrill of waiting for your table. The smoke permeating in the air. The fact that everyone around you is paying good money for this experience. The MEAT! I've now experienced my 3rd visit to Peter Luger's and well, it was good and sour. In my heart this place is a solid 4, but it was a 3 star enterprise today. Arrived at PL at around at 1:48 pm. I got 2 friends to join me for their luncheon special as I'd been longing for it since forever. It's a cheaper way to get to their food and there are daily specials. We were given a quote time of 30-45 min. We were sat in half hour. Painless. Table just about in the middle of the room. Stoic servers walking all around me. Our stoic server was about the business. No smile. No thank you. No eye contact. A Sprite, Coke, and Ginger Ale all in seemingly 8 oz. bottles with a small glass starved of ice. We settled to start with the onion rings and finish with 2 well-done(I know, shoot us!) bacon cheeseburgers and a chopped steak medium well. The burgers came with semi-medium cut fries and slice of raw onion. The steak came with a side of caramelized onions and mash. But before we move on, something happened prior to our food arriving. My friend was approached by a man who was chewing food and asked if he had a jacket or long-sleeved shirt. Of course he didn't. He came as is, a hooded cut off shirt whilst exposing some tatooes. Welcome to Brooklyn. Even now I don't know if it was the shirt, the tatooes or both. I do get the fact that we were at a steakhouse and that there's an underlying dress code but as I stated to the whoever, this should have all been taken cared of before we got to the table. He told us that this is not a lecture and it better not have been as he was talking to grown, professionals who entered a steakhouse not a schoolhouse! The individual came back to the table with a blue long sleeved collared shirt and placed it behind my friend's chair. It was thankfully only a option. So, my burger was fabulous. Juicy, flavorful, plentiful, simple, tasty and I didn't want it to end. The BACON and the BEEF were fighting to be the star of the show. Although the burger was well done, I squeezed it a few times and the juices were seering out. The bacon was so thick and salty and added so much to the burger or alone. The fries were a nice touch. Our onion rings came first though. A sharable bed of lightly breaded edible circular ribbons. Greasy but great start. My other friend mentioned that her chopped steak was alright. It did look like a chopped up burger. Nothing was said more than that. We were offered dessert but in so many ways we had had our fill. I will never rule out PL. Actually, I can't wait to go again! And to whomever I may invite to join me, I might have to mention our "cover-up" story beforehand.

Steaks are top notch quality and it comes out with the plate sizzling hot! however the downside is that its Williamsburg location are super jammed even with appointment. Expect to wait around 30 minute for a table. Canadian Bacon(appetizer) was very lackluster and bland. service was Ok. I almost feel like the waiter was acting very snobby. Not the most friendly atmosphere.

We have been visiting NYC every year for the past 15. Â FINALLY we made it to Peter Lugers. Â Calling way in advance, still could only get 5:45pm. Â Well that turned out to be perfect because the big rush came afterward. Â I honestly, despite all the great reviews, did not have high expectations. Â My expectations were vastly exceeded. Â We shared a wedge salad - with some of their famous bacon on it - and it was delicious. Â Our steak cooked to perfection even though one of us eats Med and one Med-Rare, they accommodated that. Â We ate every bite and my only regret was that I didn't know you could request the bone in a doggie bag until too late! Â We had martinis that were filled to the tip top of the glass. Â The only thing to complain about honestly,, was the creamed spinach everyone on here recommends. Â It was the worst I've ever had, and I wish we had ordered a baked potato or something. Â We had nice service, and it isn't anywhere near as pricey as some places we have been. Â Are there fancier steakhouses. Most definitely. Â Some with more options? Absolutely. Â Don't care - it was great and we would love to come back. Â Forgot to take photos! Â Even bought a bottle of their steak sauce - it's so unique and quite tasty. Â Worth the hype, give it a go! Â And we ubered - yes more $$ than the train but door to door so worth it!

I don't know how good the food is there because I didn't get a chance to give it a try. I made a reservation one month earlier for my friend's and my birthday. The staff told me the reservation has been confirmed on Dec. 11 at 12:45pm. She even took down my phone number. However, when we went there, the staff said our name is not on the list and gave me a bad attitude and even didn't apologize. They pretty much ruined our birthday meals and we didn't get a apology we deserved. I understand sometimes ppl messed up the reservation. However, instead of apologizing, they gave us a bad attitude and asked us to wait by the bar and even didn't take down my full name and my phone number. We ended up leaving. As a well-know restaurant, they should train their staff better instead of being cocky and not giving customers appropriate attitude

Wow what an experience this place was awesome very proud they open at 12:45 the line was already down the street when we got there they do take reservations but there about a month out if you plan to go to the New York area I highly advise go here for steak but get there early or make reservations early they have several other options on the menu most of them consist obese the German potatoes were awesome have the cream spinach and you have to have the tomatoes and onions is not cheap but it is well worth the experience

I have to say, this steakhouse is everything you read online. A reservation a couple weeks ahead of time is a must, no way you'll get sat on a Friday or Saturday night without a reservation. Next food was amazing, GET THE BACON! Super thick and delicious, the wife and I had also tried the German potato fries and they were also good. The steak for two was perfectly cooked, best cooked steak ever. Do not skip dessert, try at least one of their many options. Will definitely come back but keep in mind, no cards, only cash!
How many heart eyes can you give a steakhouse? I've been coming here for years and they never ever disappoint! Porterhouse medium rare, thank me later!

Honestly, the best steak I ever had in my life. Nothing else compared to it. Every steak I eat right now, does not compare. This saddens me because the price is so exorbitant, however, it is worth it. The dryaged steak is perfection. Despite how full you are, you will want to keep eating.
Peter lugers 1 of the best if not theee best Â porterhouse steak for 2 is the way to go if u go to this place yummy yum yum
The best steakhouse in New York City. One Michelin star. If you like steaks, this is your home.

I love steaks and I knew that Peter Luger's is a NYC/Brooklyn staple and had to go! The waiters were super friendly and the atmosphere was like I was in The Godfather film. However, the steak did not live up to its hype.. It was quite dry (even though I ordered a medium rare) and was not really seasoned, even with the sauce the steak comes with. Maybe it is the restaurant keeping to its tradition but I was a little disappointed.

Seriously Amazing. Definitely book your reservation ASAP; we ended up having to eat giant steaks at 11:45am on a Monday! Servers are great, loved their Brooklyn accents and humor. The steak came out exactly as we ordered it, sizzling and smelling delicious. Every bite was as good as the first one, crunchy on the outside but mouth-wateringly melty on the inside! Probably the BEST steak I've ever had in my life and totally worth the time/money/drive over!

Amazing food however it depends on the day and time. We were on a crazy steak crave that we went to Peter Lugers 4 times in 2 weeks. 3 our of the 4 times it was great and of course the menu was limited so we always ordered the best steak. One of the times we went was just absolutely terrible bc it was just not the same as the other time we been there. Overall it's an excellent quality steaks.

A steak lover's paradise. If you like steaks, you need to come here at least once. The steaks here are the best. I've probably been here half a dozen times over the last few years and I haven't been disappointed once. You don't even really need a menu. They have some sides, a la carte, mashed potatoes, spinach, etc. The way the steaks are marinated is a big reason why their steaks are so good.

This is not one of my go to steakhouses, only because I feel like the hype for Peter Luger is overrated. The steaks are good, but it is really the sauce that makes up for the meal. There are other options that I would recommend before going back to Peter Luger and getting that gold coin again
Nice place. I'd go back if I'm in the area. Food was great. Service good. Old world decor. We had a good time and overall we enjoyed it.

Luger's is a true gem. Without a doubt a must visit for any true steak lover. Make sure you call a month ahead of time for a reservation. The staff can be a little rough around the edges, but dont let that sway you - Luger's is worth the trip. Order the porterhouse with a side of bacon and mashed potatoes and you will be in the fast lane to heaven.

I didn't find this place to be worth the hype. Things were definitely overpriced, and I didn't find the steak to be that impressive. The atmosphere is really what you're paying for, old-school and professional.
I really think there is no better place to have a steak in NY, but get your wallet ready! Worth it:):):) We will come back.
I've only been here once, because it's quite expensive, but if you ask me, it's honestly as good as they say. Definitely a must!!!

I'd give the steak a solid 5 as well as the bacon, the service on the other hand was horrible. Sides were just okay. I've been to many upscale steakhouses and this was by far the worst service I've ever had. Honestly, I wouldn't recommend going all the way to Brooklyn for the type of service we received, great steak or not. As the Yelp star won't let me give a half I'll round down to two instead of up to three.
I'm not a meat person. the best meat for me is chicken. The only place I order a steak is Peter Luger. From ordering a table for dinner to the restaurant energy this is number one steak house in NY.

honestly, its not worth the price point. get a good quality steak for a little too much money, served to you by an older than old school server who frantically scans your party for a man to tell the specials to. Sorry guy, Dad's been dead 10 years and you're gonna have to speak directly to a woman tonight.

Bad bar service; the bartender was being a smartass. Very mediocre meat source of which we don't even get to know because they don't volunteer the info. Meat wasn't edible without the sugar pumped mediocre steak sauce. The reservationist was rude to us trying to change the time. On a positive note, the bathrooms were above new york average which is not a high bar to begin with.

Funny - I had big expectations. Steak was ok - probably not worth the extra time leaving Manhattan. Staff was ok - not super friendly but also not stand offish. The overall experience was just OK. neither bad nor great.

I have been to this steakhouse twice and the service is very nice. They feed you well with good size portions and the steaks are prepared perfectly. Definitely a great destination when you are in the area.

By FAR my favorite Steak house in NYC! The Bacon is on another level of deliciousness!! Also had a mouth watering Porter house Steak paired with a bottle of Lynch Bages Bordeaux. Just a heads up they only take cash, we didn't know that and had to take out cash. Besides that we had an amazing Dinner, highly recommend going.
One of the best!! A very traditional steak house. Must have the bacon w the giant beefsteak tomatoes. Of course the steak too!!

Maybe it's because I'm from the west coast but this feel short. I've only been there one time. I'm not sure is go back, at least not if I was paying. The meal was good but not a prime steakhouse caliber. The bacon appetizer and the steak were both charred on the outside despite having a medium rare interior. It gave the steak more of a burned flavor than I care for. Maybe this suits others preference. The price doesn't match the quality. None of the sides were overly impressive. The key lime pie was pretty tasty. I'd do that again for sure.
It was ok. Meat quality was good, but nothing special. I've had better at several other places and it was not as expensive. Cream spinach was good though.
This steakhouse is one of the best I've visited. My boss took my coworkers and I here for a celebration and it was fantastic. Will definitely revisit. Try the bacon
The best steak house where I usually take my friends that Â are visiting NY. Service is also great!
Someone who pick up the phone is super rude and disrespectful to customer who wants to make a reservation. He just hung up the phone without saying nothing. Hell

Fantastic. Steaks are perfection. Great atomosphere. Staff are well, part of the experience. They are well trained and knowledgeable. Â Porterhouse is amazing. German potatoes. Creamed spinach, yum. Don't forget to try some bacon. Â Desserts delish. An elite place. Reserve table well in advance. Free parking, walking distance. Validated parking. Don't miss out on this experience.

This restaurant staffs were very rude. I made a reservation over the phone. She asked me for my phone number, and I answered, but in an annoying way she said she didn't need it, and then hung up. The next day I went to the restaurant on time and did not have a reservation. The first problem is their attitude. The employee was not in the attitude of confirming my reservation. Another male employee urged me to make a quick decision. If I wanted to wait, I had to wait an hour. We needed time to discuss this situation , and asked for a moment to wait. I decided to wait an hour and told them. But They said I can't book any more. Wtf . They are liers. Even if I was wrong, it's very wrong to treat customers in this manner. I think a well-known restaurant should have proper etiquette for such restaurants.

Really nice location with friendly and attentive staff. The steak was well worth the price and perfectly cooked and the sides were all very tasty especially the bacon and the desserts are amazing if you have any room left.

I call exactly a month ahead to get reservations on a Fri/Sat. This is some legit steak and the Bacon appetizer is even better. I love how simple everything is and yet so delicious. We also got the tomato and onions which goes great with the meat. Apparently they have their own parking, but I didn't notice it until I was leaving as this was my first time driving to Peter's. I did notice the comments about some waiters being emotionless lol, but I think it is just the one guy that gets you water and bread in the beginning. We was stone cold and all business. Our actual waiters were interesting and fun. I recommend this place to everyone especially if you're only in town for a short while.

Amazing! Not too much fluff and grill but very delicious! Service is quick and staff is friendly. Had the steak for three with two very hungry guys and myself and I.T was the perfect amount. The side of potatoes were also delicious. The bacon is thick cut and if you like bacon at all you should definitely try this side. For dessert we ordered ice cream and strawberries and I.T comes with their house made whipped cream- everything tasted so fresh with few ingredients and truly delicious flavor. It's a bit pricey but expected for a Michelin starred steak house. Would come back again and again.

You'd be lucky if you make a reservation for the week of. I was one of those lucky ones. Service is high end, top notch. The food is obviously served a la carte, might seem a little when you order but somehow those steaks get you really darn full. The porterhouse steaks come sizzling to the table with lots of fat & oil (the good kinds). I recommend the sides of spinach & cheese and onion rings.

This restaurant has been on my to-dine list for a few years now after seeing it on the Food Network and Travel Channel. Usually places I see on TV never live up to the expectations that I've built up in my head, but Peter Luger's did. The steak was perfectly cooked (medium rare) and did not need sauce. Speaking of the sauce, it was also amazing (an excellent blend of tangy and sweet) and went perfectly with the onion rings. The German fried potatoes were another great side. This is probably the best steak I've ever had; the only place that comes to mind that may even be close was Malone's in Lexington, Kentucky. I highly recommend Peter Luger's if you're in New York.

If u are a meat eater. U cant go wrong at PeterL for their best make steaks and bacons; must have!!! One of the best spot out of others besides Wolfg and Del f I went to so far. PERIOD. So far havent try much any of other their dishes but cocktail shrimps as appet. People all here for steak of course, and the server knows right on the spot. Very old school operated; $$$$ cash only, decor, call reservation.

This review is for those who have been to Peter Lugers for dinner. Â I have been there for dinner, and of course the steak is out of this world, best steakhouse. Â Then I went for lunch... Amazing. The burger was the best burger I ever had, perfect size, perfect texture, it fell apart and was juicy. Â They still have their amazing menu for lunch, just with the burger option. I got the bacon with my burger which made it that much better. Â Reservations are not needed for lunch, but reccomended and lunch ends at 4pm. The lunch menu is less expensive, burgers were about $15. Also tried the Holy Cow sundae, which was HUGE, definitely should not have ordered it after our huge meal, but it was delicious.

Needless to say they this is an institution so my review won't mean much but still. Got here pretty early on the weekend, was seated right away. Rustic ambiance, wooden tables, no table clothes, huge bread basket (wish bread was warm) but it was tasty. We shared a Porterhouse for 2 and onion rings. Originally they brought our steak medium rare white we ordered medium well, that was corrected in a minute. This steak was cooked to perfection, juicy and their sauce was a nice touch. Real onion rings. My friend had their bacon for appetizer and I only heard positive things. Shared a cheesecake and since it was my belated bday dinner it came with surprise Happy Bday song and improvised "cake" of homemade whipped cream with a candle. The Cake was pretty good as was the whipped cream, take a bite even if you watch your calories. The place is not cheap but worth every penny. Worth mentioning that place is very airy no crammed with tables.

Always my favorite. Consistently excellent. Many high end steak houses come very very close, but to me this is still top of the top. I always stuff myself with the best steak in the country and finish off with my favorite chocolate cake and schlag. Basic surroundings, almost primitive, the real deal.

I've wanted to try this place for years and finally made it to come here! We had a reservation at 11:30, so as soon as the restaurant was open, we got seated. We saw a very long line, so the best time to come here is at opening with reservation. The bacon was so thick and tasty, the sliced onion and tomato was interesting. Wish they serve warm bread! We didn't want to fill up before the steak, so we could not try potatoes this time, but it looked yummy! The rib eye.... it was so good! We were so stuffed, but it was lunch, so we had a plenty of time to walk around after a big meal to burn it off. We loved every bite of it!
Good food, tasty, the steaks were juicy and good color. Cooked just right and can definitely be called amazing steak!

Make a reservation maybe a week and a half before or more? I made my reservation a week before I intended to go and there were only two slots open! I came here for my boyfriend's birthday. There was a parking lot available so that was great. We had the steak for 2, the bacon, creamed spinach, and fries. The whole meal was amazing. The steak was cooked perfectly, honestly one of the best steaks we had. The bacon is a must-try! So thick and crispy! It is definitely worth coming here. Just remember it's either cash or debit card. I ended up paying around $220 with tip for the two of us? That was my only minor issue with Peter Luger's. Just be prepared to pay in cash. But the food is so good you'll forget about it.
Apparently this location is too busy to pick up a phone to lb take reservations. Nor do they take reservations online. #FAIL. I'll take my business elsewhere.

The service was really awesome. My party and I were seated upstairs and our waiter was the best. We didn't have to ask for anything. He was on top of everything. We had bacon for the appetizer. Delicious. Cooked to perfection. The bacon was crispy yet soft, melting in your mouth. Juicy and tender. The perfect bacon. We had steak for 3 cooked medium/medium plus and sure enough it came out that way. Usually at other steakhouses it's over cooked but the guys over here always seem to get it right. I was happy with the excellent service provided as well as how tasty the food was. I highly recommend this place. Will come again when I'm back in New York. Â Also I highly suggest to make reservations for your visit

ABSOLUTELY disappointed!!! I was treat like second class citizen, they gave me 3 different waiters because apparently the first two didn't want to wait on me and my family for asking him about the wine. My family and I were offended and completely turned off. Will never eat there again if that's how they treat their customers.
Amazing establishment,extremely satisfying service and food. One of the best steaks I have ever had. This was the best birthday dinner gift I received from the love of my life. Â I will go again .

The service is very good. We were in 4 adults and 1 child and shared a steak for four and a French fries. The couvert bread would be better if served warm. The steak was good, cooked as requested. I found it too expensive considering the overall.

Peter Luger has won best steakhouse in New York for almost three decades running now, and I don't think they're going to let up any time soon. When the steak of your dreams comes running through your mind, does it smell like heaven and chew like butter? Because that's exactly how Peter Luger's porterhouse is. It comes sliced and perfectly medium rare on a hot sizzling plate with its own juices. The plate itself is tilted to give the juices a better flowing angle and you easier access to all of the steak's meaty goodness (currently $108 for a steak for two). You start off with a complimentary bread basket of lukewarm dough and some hard butter, but whatever. You're here for the meat. Maybe you want some greens? Do the creamed spinach and some delectable fries. Skip the tomato salad, which is literally just sliced tomatoes. Do finish with the amazingly crisp and perfectly sweet apple streusel, accompanied by their own house whipped cream. You'll thank me later. Cash or debit card only. Grab a drink while you wait.

Delicious steak, bacon and experience. I took my fiancÃ© last year for his birthday. He enjoyed every bite of his steak. The waiter was very attentive and we had a wonderful time. Will be returning soon.

Well what can you say about this place that hasn't been already said.. AMAZAZING pretty nuch sums it up.. Yes that is correct AMAZAZING.. Not just amazing but AMAZAZING!! Now thats about the food.. The staff on the other hand needs a little work but whoever the chefs are preparing the food are simply the best!!

Had high expectations, but it came up short. The sundae was my favorite part. Steak was mediocre. I come from a land where it's an insult to add sauce after it's cooked, and this steak needed all the help it could get. Bacon was amazing, definitely worth trying. Waiter never asked for a drink, which my coworker and I were going to get a bottle of wine, so saved me $70 there. It was a good experience but not great and definitely not valued more than 3 stars.
The steak was amazing definitely a super old school type of spot. Sides were on point as well as the service. When in New York you have to hit Peter Lugers Steak House
Absolutley great steak.........thats about it. Besides the above average steak the place is overhyped. Its very simple straight forward food and decor.
Just get the burger you can only get on the lunch menu and they don't serve at night - skip the cheese -this thing is amazing without any extra fixins

We came here for a work meeting & had an amazing experience. There was 4 of us. Ordered the Steak for 2, Bacon, Burger & a few sides to share everything. We left full & very happy with the quality of food. Thank you!

#1- only 5 stars cause i'm not a tourist and it seems hard to avoid what has become a very touristy spot which - the burger is great - hash browns are worth the trip alone - that and Coney island only thing good about Brooklyn.

I love Peter Luger. I try to come here every time I'm in NYC. This place is NY in my opinion. It's just perfect the way it is. I get annoyed when I read the occasional lackluster reviews. The style is dated, in a good way. The service is prompt and a bit blunt, in a good way. Â The food is always good. It's just a classic place worth visiting. If you're going there to be completely blown away and with some chip on your shoulder it's not gonna live up to whatever that is. The first time I went to NY we went to this place called Roberta's. I didn't like anything about it because I didn't get the city. By the end of trip it all made sense and I've been back to Roberta's and love it. Same goes for Luger in my opinion. In it's true form this place is absolutely perfect NY.

Truly a NY institution. I had not been to Luger's in a few years, opting for other more convenient steakhouses on the rare occasion that I would want some red meat, but there is no denying that Luger's is great. While the atmosphere is old school as are the waiters, the place is full of character. There is really no need for a menu - steak for for, shrimp cocktail, tomatoes and onions, German style has browns, schlag and a sundae as well as a slice if some really tasty pecan pie. Delicious!

This is the way meat is supposed to be. Â The restaurant is curious and quirky, definitely not a fine dining establishment. Â But the steak makes it worth it. Â Top five steakhouses I have ever been to.

Definitely worth the trip from Manhattan. The waiters were exceptional, and the steak was out of this world- I ordered the steak for two, along with spinach and potatoes for sides. My mouth is watering just remembering this meal. The wine recommendation was wonderful as well!

I'm visiting from Los Angeles and someone recommended the steakhouse .. It was very difficult to get reservations but somehow they were able to squeeze us in around lunchtime .. First impression this place looks old needs remodeling.. Apparently they have no dinner reservations available until January.. The food was good the service was excellent ... We had a good time .. Oh did I mention it's cash only.. Yup cash only ...

I do love the legendary Peter Luger's, but I can not give it 5 stars. The sides are a bit bland for my taste and in my opinion there are quite a few steakhouses in the New York area that are a little better now. If you haven't been, it does remain a must go for the whole experience. It's like walking into old New York City and will always remain a staple in the resturant community. They only accept cash and make sure you bring a lot of it.

OMG the bacon was amazing...and that was just the beginning. Â Perfectly cooked steak and fabulous sides made the meal perfect. Â The staff was attentive to our every need. Â Thank you for taking such good care of our group. Â I'm coming back!

I cannot help but give them a 5. Â  Best. Â Steakhouse. Â Anywhere! Â The only issue is that it can be very difficult to make a reservation as they only accept them by phone, and they don't always answer the phone! Â  But it is worth it! Â  Great cocktails. Â  Nice wine list. Â And the steaks! Â  Also really engaging service. Â Nicely done! Â I will say that this isn't really a good place to plan drinks beforehand as the bar is small and right in the entryway crowded with people waiting for tables. Â  Whatever you are thinking, this place is worth it!!!

Fantastic. We had the porterhouse for two, Â country fries, Â a slice of bacon and cream spinach. Â This place is old school. Â Excellent steak cooked just the way we wanted. Â  Rare. Â  Martin our server was also very attentive to our needs

This place is a great landmark. The food is fantastic. The steak was cooked to perfection and melted like butter. Come hungry, leave full and satisfied. Reservations are a must or you will have a wait.

Prob the best steak I've ever eaten. Ordered it medium rare and it was perfect, so soft. Bacon is a must for starters. Service was good, decor is a bit "classic", but I guess that's part of the charm. Def worth crossing a bridge or two to get to.

Saw Peter Luger on the food network 5 Best Steaks in America. We were able to get reservations for lunch without the usual 3 week wait! Claimed the porterhouse for 2 was the #1 best steak in America. Started with the highly-touted bacon appetizer. Thick slices of bacon full of fat and flavor. Tasted like fried ham. Make sure you dip it in the Peter Luger steak sauce as recommended. For our entrÃ©e we had the porterhouse for 3! The quality, preperation and presentation were spot on. We thought the steak needed a bit more salt. We also had the delicious creamed spinach and german potatoes. You could pass on the potatoes, really nothing special about them. For dessert we had keylime pie and a chocolate sunday with tons of homemade whip cream. All in all a classic american steakhouse with a historic background.

What bad can I say. Massive buttery steak for two, a must. Thick cut bacon, a must. Thick cut tomatoes, a must. Solid steak house if you're lucky enough to get a reservation. Without ample notice you'll be eating a late lunch or a midnight snack. There are other great steakhouses in NYC but... Lugers is Lugers enough said.

The worst customer service I had ever experienced! We came in on a Friday noon. I waited outside in line for no reservation over half an hour without anyone telling me there will be no table available for us. When we got into the restaurant, the manager told us that the waiting time will be in another hour and half. And the guy is very arrogant and shows no caring for his customers. I asked if we could sit separately or we could come tonight (we asked for any time we can come) He said: " the restaurant is fully booked till the end of this month.... can you move over for other groups..." the restaurant shows no respect nor basic understanding of its customers. Other people behind us also had the same response. We really think the restaurant should TELL US THE SITUATION before we wasted the 30min waiting in their so called "No reservation" line!!!!!! I came with my parents who travelled all the way from China and I expected to show them the American food. But the very last word we heard from the manager was to ask us "MOVING OVER" I will never come visit this place anymore and will tell all my friends that this restaurant does not worth their time and money.
Still my favorite place for a steak anywhere in New York City. I dream of that porterhouse. Not cheap so a great place to trick your friends into taking you for your birthday ;)
This place is amazing! Â They are strict to the menu though. Â They will not make any changes. Â Cash only. Â Trying the Schlag is a must!!

So so steak, was not worth all the rave or cost. Â Not sure what all the hype is that I hear about this place. Â The steak had a little too much fat on it to suite me and didn't have any flavor unless I used the Peter Luger sauce. Â I paid a lot of money for this steak, shouldn't have to use sauce to enjoy a steak. Â As for the fat, I want some for flavor but there is a fine line between flavor and I paid for steak, not fat. Â Glad I checked the box but won't be back. The sides were limited, no wedge salad on the menu, ordered a salad for 18 which was good but the price is ridiculous. Â Berns steakhouse in Tampa still remains at the top of the list for me.

Visited this classic steakhouse for my birthday last week. Without a doubt, it was the best steak I've ever had in my life. When you visit, be sure to go all the way and have their dessert. The whipped cream was absolutely amazing.

I come here every time I'm in the city. I should try other steaks in the city, but when I have limited budget for good steak, I come here because I know it is good every time. I've tried other recommended places, it is good, but it is more a fine dining style with a smaller portion. This place is much more laid back and I enjoy it a lot for its casual ambiance. I heard the daily specials are good, but since I come all the way here, I always only get their house steak with sides.

Steak heaven! Â  Steaks are dry-aged for thirty days and the quality and juiciness shows as the meat melts in your mouth. Â We ordered the steak medium and it was delicious, burned outside but pink on the inside... awesome.... great service as well. Â food comes in fast.

Was not offered more bread. Â Did not get extra plates for shared salads. Steak is charred in spots. Â Still good not great but awful atmisphere and neighborhood. Â Has become very touristy and cash only is still outrageous.
Amazing chops, steak and fish. Nothing is better than PL's. They are a Brooklyn institution with good reason!

Peter Luger's is a steakhouse staple and a must go if you're visiting New York. Is it over rated in certain aspects, sure. But what I do know is that the steak is tasty. Grab an order of creamed spinach, German potatoes, bacon, and finish off with a Holy cow hot fudge sundae.
Hands down my favorite steakhouse I've ever been to. Great wine selection as well as a very cool atmosphere.

Went here for valentines day. There was a wait as expected even though we had a reservation. Food was great. The spinach i didn't like as much, it wasn't as great as the other reviews said. The steak was awesome!
