Well where does one begin on a restaurant that truly needs no review. I posted on my fb a picture of the front of the restaurant with the quotation "if you k ow you know", and that is the absolute truth. Peter Lugers steaks are by far the most delicious steak you could possibly eat. The service was exceptional and atmosphere genuine. The melt in your mouth steak is the main attraction with I accompanied with the German potatoes and spinach. I also started with the bacon which I recommend to get your pallet ready for what's next to come! Like I said there's not much to be said that hasn't been said about this place I just wanted to add another 5 star rating because they deserve it
So I have no complaints about the meal or service all That was really delicious but I got to tell ya when you pay that kind of money you should have a clean bathroom.

Food was fantastic! No doubt. However, service was not like before. Too bossy and rude. Maybe my server had bad day or something? I don't know it was not like before. Highly disappointed and Not professional.
Amazing! From the bacon, steak, creamed spinach . Everything was great! Will def come back
Steak was rubbery & gross...they put their creamed spinach in a blender with no seasoning, & their potatoes were hash browns.....LIKE WHAT??? Definitely 1800's styled steakhouse

Maybe the food is great. I will never know. The people that answer phones are beyond rude. When I tried to confirm a reservation on my husband's behalf I was told that I could not confirm the reservation without the exact time. I explained my husband was in the hospital and she was still a total snot, insisting she couldn't help me without an exact time. I will be calling back all right. To cancel. Great food or not, this is NYC and there is great food AND great staff to be found at countless other excellent places.
Tried it with a friend but not overly impressed? I mean it's delicious and I understand it's famous because of its history/ old fashioned style...Or maybe I don't have an eye for steak
There is no better piece of steak. Cook to perfection. The bacon, the side dishes, the hot fudge. I love this place and every time we are in NY we try to go.

Best steak and hamburgers! I've been to several steakhouses in NYC like STK, Morton's but Peter Luger far outdoes these restaurants. I went to Peter Luger for lunch to celebrate Father's Day with my family. My dad had the ribeye and my mom and I ordered the cheeseburgers. SO GOOD! I highly recommend Peter Luger; the reputation is well deserved.
Thank you for a great experience and tasty steak. Everything from the drinks from the bar to the salad, bacon, spinach, and the masterpiece dry aged t bone cooked to perfection.

The best steak anywhere!! Please indulge yourself here. The portions are gigantic and delicious. Â The steak is perfectly cooked and wonderful!! Bring your appetite and eat!! Â  Love the NYC service! Classic place. You'll be amazed by the efficiency and the food!
Been here a couple times over the years and still trying to figure out what the fuss is all about! Have had better steak than PL at many other places for less $$$ in the city!

Giving them a one star because they did me wrong. After going through all the trouble to make a reservation a month out, they didn't put it down in the system. My bad for not taking down the name of the not-so-nice guy who took it. I'm not from New York so it's not like i can just go another day, yet they didn't even attempt to accommodate us. I've been to Peter Luger and it is good. But, because of this mess up we found a wonderful steakhouse in Brooklyn called DeStefano's and we loved it! Comparable to Peter Luger and without the drama. Great quality steaks, delicious sides and wonderful service.

Great steak, wine, and bacon! The salads are nothing off the charts, but definitely needed a little something fresh with all the meat. Only loses are a star because the service was nothing outstanding, and made my reservation three months in advance. Cash only, and convenient parking lot across the way if you're driving in!

This is a legend amongst steakhouses and it didn't disappoint. I've had some great steaks in my time from around the US (would love to try international) and this was by far the best I've ever had. My favorite cut is the ribeye so of course I got that. I prefer medium and she likes rare. Both of our steaks were delicious and cooked to perfection. My partner and I had the cream spinach as a side and our steaks and that alone was very filling. We also ate a lot of the great breads they brought out before. That, along with two glasses of wine ran $165, not bad! I usually crave steak once every week to 2 weeks and I haven't felt the need since eating Peter Luger. I've seen others criticize the service. Ours was top notch and our waiter was very funny. We had a reservation for 5pm and it was buzzing but by the time we left the place was packed. Do any early dinner it's worth not waiting forever and you will be full for the rest of the night, trust me! Â If you are a "steak person" this place is a must try.

If there's a place that lives up to its name this is it. Peter Lugers is a place my best friend and I have always talked about going to but just have never made it there. Needless to say it was well worth the wait. Had the steak for 4 and fries. The steak was perfect and having the Luger sauce sends you into space it's out of this world. It was his birthday and it was definitely one of his favorites. Will def return because we didn't get to try the bacon everyone raves about. If you can dine here I absolutely recommend it!
Great Steak and selections of wines. Staff is a little snooty but the food makes up for it...
Steak is ok! A little bit over rated as there are better and cheaper steak houses around town

When I knew I was going to NYC I called to try to make a reservation even before I bought my plane ticket. Â The line was busy then I tried back in a bit and go through and made the reservation with no issues. Â I even called a few days before my reservation to confirm and it got through easily. Â Lucky me I guess. Â Took about 30 minutes to get there from lower east side of manhattan. Â Not bad. Â It was like a 5 minute walk from the station (with it was closer since it was so cold outside). Â Got there 30 minutes before the reservation time and they called my name 30 minutes later. Â The wait staff were all very nice. Â A basket of bread is brought to the table immediately and I was expecting them to be fresh and warm but they weren't so that was kind of disappointing. Â But they were fresh - just not warm. Â Ordered the steak for two (there was me, my husband and my ten year old), one strip of bacon, creamed spinach and a caesar salad. Â The steak took maybe about 20 minutes or so and came at the same time as the spinach. Â The server served us a few pieces each to start. Â The first bite of that steak was amazing. Â So soft and tender. Â I don't remember eating a steak of that texture. Â I'm not a huge steak person but it was good steak. Â Everything else was good. Â At the end I had to unbutton my pants. Â Ordered slice of cheesecake to go and enjoyed it in our hotel room later that night. Â Would definitely come back.

Simply exquisite steak with impersonal service. This people know how to prepare a steak. As simple as that. Home made fries are delicious too. Their steak sauce is to die for. Complimentary bread and butter are just perfect. I wish the service would have been more welcoming.

I like the atmosphere here - a true steakhouse, a bit old school and classy, nothing too fancy, and very American. This is why it makes a perfect spot to treat your out of country friends, who are interested in trying real "American food". Steak was cooked to perfect. I can see the sophisticated techniques in my meat. However, flavor is so so. Not the best steak I've had in my life. The bacon, on the other hand was a pleasant surprise. Eat it with raw onion and tomato, it makes a delicious appetizer. Dessert was good too.

We had to wait a little bit to get seated but was well worth the wait! The steak was excellent and cooked to perfection. Another in my party got a burger which they thoroughly enjoyed. The service was great as well with well mannered polite waitstaff.
Delicious! Got both the steak and a burger. Probably the best burger I've ever had. The steak was delicious and the dessert was great! Put this on your list!
Excellent steak. One of my favorites was the porterhouse. The steak is a bit pricey, but you need to visit this place at least once in your life.
Best Steak house ive been to so far. We had the steak for two, a baked potatoe and a 1/8" piece of bacon. I was blown away with how delicious and tender Â the meat was.

Peter Luger is overrated,Ruth Chris is better!! They are selling an image. The steaks are okay but they are not the best steak restaurant in NY!!! Â The bald headed guy at the front is rude and he is on this power kick.

Peter Lugers is super good period! Booking your reservation weeks in advanced was kinda lame but understandable. Make sure to get the bacon it was really good def is a must. We were a group of five and had lots of food brought our way and love every bit of it. I'm not sure if they have stop doing this but remember to bring cash since it was cash only last time I went.

It was seriously one of the best steaks I've ever had! They're known for their dry aged steak, and you can order the serving size by how many people you have in your group. So my boyfriend and I ordered the "dry aged steak for two" and the potatoes, both which were AWESOME!! I think the steak for two was $100-110ish which isn't too bad since its for TWO people, and the portion is HUGEEEEE!! We couldn't finish it (nor the potatoes) and so we had to take it togo. It made the perfect snack for drunken munchies that night in our hotel room :) We also ordered a bacon on the side because our friend recommended us to get it. It's one of those thick cut bacons that you eat alone, but it really didn't taste amazing or anything. I would say that you can skip that $5 bacon haha.
Good prime steaks. Best steak sauce ever. Bring plenty of cash !!

Had Luger's on the to do list for years and it didn't disappoint. Loved the old school atmosphere and bar area. Professional waiters, we didn't even read the menus, he asked a few questions, made recommendations and nailed it. The steaks are out of this world. However the apps and sides are just OK, so if I could I'd go with 4.5 stars.

AMAZING STEAK. Went with friends for a birthday dinner and really had the best meal and service. Friendly and professional. They even sang and put. Candle in our friends dessert and got the whole 2nd floor to sing to our birthday guest! Great place

We came for lunch to try the burgers and were not disappointed. Â Took the subway from Manhattan, very easy to get to. Â Burgers were a good size and so delicious. Â The fries were great as well. Â For dessert we had the key lime pie and chocolate cake, and they came with this big bowl of my favorite food item - schlag (aka whipped cream). Â Loved the whole experience, the gruff but friendly service, and the ambiance. Â Had to wait about 15 minutes for a table at noon on a weekday. Â I don't think they take reservations for lunch.

Ordered the bacon appetizer which was crispy tender and juicy with just the right amount of salt sweet flavor. Â Loved it. Â Ordered the Porterhouse for 3 persons - medium rare. Â It came on a very hot plate which unfortunately made the steak medium well done during the final stage of the meal. Â Also had the fries cooked in tallow - nice crisp outside and tender interior. Â Spinach was bland. Â $300 for 3 persons, which included tax and tip.

The steak is delicious, and I guess it's not a bad price for what you get, but still, eating in the city sucks. Â Everything is way overpriced, and you can find a much better deal just going elsewhere. Â So unless you are John D. Rockefeller, or enjoy paying over 5 times what you should be paying, I would avoid this place. Â You know what they say "A fool and his money are easily parted". Â Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me. Â Don't be a fool. Â Save money, eat on the other side of the river.

Competes with the best steakhouses in the world. The lack of credit card is annoying but not enough to take away from the quality of the meal. Not above people who prefer sauce on their steak (guilty) but this is actually one of the few places I prefer the steak on its own! Go family style you won't be disappointed.
I would defiantly come back. I love porterhouse steak. This is by far the best one I've had yet. Reasonably priced. The cream spinach, bacon, and French fries are also good picks!

Expensive, but probably the best steak I have ever eaten. Service is fantastic and the atmosphere really can't be matched. They offer a service that's hard to beat anywhere. If I have any criticism it's that the tomato appetizer just isn't worth the money.

Can you say steak! Lol Took my son here for his 13th birthday and man did he love it! Great spot over the Willie-B with an old school feel! Get the Sunday after you've stuffed your face! You won't regret it!

Still the best steakhouse I have ever been to. The steak literally melts in your mouth and doesn't sit in your stomach. The rustic atmosphere detracts somewhat but the food is top notch! Just remember to bring your wallet and be ready to spend!

My favorite place locally for great steak. The waiters are friendly and always have great suggestions if you're stuck in choosing your meal. If you're a steak eater this is your place! A little rough looking atmosphere but well worth the month long reservation!
Very good. Took my boyfriend here as a surprise for Â his bday. He loved it. Everything is really good starting from the bread.
Excellent steak house! Everything is alacarte, so although it is expensive it is well worth it! Wonderful service, outstanding tasting food just super delicious.

In the late 1980's, for about five years, I lived about ten blocks from this restaurant. Those were my salad days and hundred dollar steak dinners were not in the offing. Now I live in the country a good eighty miles away and I finally arrived!! For a foodie... Peter Luger's is something you have to experience once. Is it the best meal ever? Not even close. Is it the best steak house experience ever? Close but no cigar (that award goes to DelFrisco's in Dallas). It IS a New York experience. It IS an incredible piece of meat. It is, contrary to what I had heard, about a great, friendly, knowledgeable waitstaff. Its is ridiculously over priced... $520. for four people... but you know that going in! You better know it and you better have cash because they don't take credit cards!
The best steakhouse in New York? I will prob be convinced if it was the third best. Lol
No words. Greatest steak ever. Everything is amazing. Service is fabulous and I have never been disappointed. Probably my favorite place in the city.
The bread is cold. The sauce is cold. Â Good quality of steak. But the way they cook. Â The outside Is burn and dry. Â Sorry not my cup of tea

Food was great, service not so much. Manny our server was not very friendly but all of the other patrons were very friendly and we had a great time with them. Very old school service mentality, thanks for the experience
Honestly whilst it was good I think it's over rated. Too many other steakhouse to choose from. Over hyped imo.

Everyone said this was the best steak place in NYC. It did not disappoint! Everything was fresh and very well cooked. Steak was perfectly done medium rare, and had a nice crust on the outside. It's not the hippest/newest place out there and I love that. Restaurants with old character and amazing food are hard to come by. Great job!

NO QUESTION 5 STAR..............I love this place. Â Top notch. Â Their menu has some variety especially compared to the old days of salad, pot and steak only......................Shrimp cocktail are like small animals they are so large, bacon appetizer is .......well, you just have to try. Â  Be SURE to get German potato's as that's signature and the tomato/onion salad withe Peter Lugers' sauce.............so good, we got some sauce to go

I expected the best. This place is so drastically over-hyped. Their steak was unseasoned and tasteless. I ordered Medium Rare and it came out medium well. My dad's steak on the grill is about 8,000 times better.

A must-go restaurant whenever I visit the east coast. They were very accommodating with the temperature of the steak as I am pregnant and everyone else loves their steak medium rare. They cooked a portion where it was temperature safe for a pregnant woman such as myself. It was mouth-watering, buttery, soft, and delicious even in the higher temperature. Wow!

Coasting on reputation but not worth the expense. Had lunch there 2 days ago. Service good but prime rib special was weak: thin piece of meat, not hot, and peas were right out of the can. Would not go back for dinner. If back for lunch would get the burger which looks good and more reasonably priced. This place not up to other big steakhouses. Has history but that's about it.

It's good, but so much food for two people. I ordered steak for two and a caesar salad and I had such a hard time finishing the food and had to take home But the food was good. Reservation is a must and have a sizzling bacon as well. But their bread wasnt the best that I have had before the meal, but who cares about the bread when steaks taste good.
Their phone doesn't work and don't reply to reservation requests through email. Arrogance at its finest.

If I were to have one last meal before I died, Peter Luger would be the spot. There is no better steakhouse on this planet. Start with a bang with some tomato/onion and some bacon slices, go strong into the Steak for however many people at the table, and then end with a bang with the Holy Cow... Best meal ever!

Lives up to the hype. Steak was phenomenal. The side dish could have been a main dish with the quality. The beer was amazing and the service provided an excellent all around experience. I was amazed. Worth it 10/10

This is my favorite place in the world to eat. Â Great old school steak with the highest quality meat. Â Aged in house and amazing. Â The tomato onion salad is crazy good. Â Wonderful service and cash only, just like when they opened in the 1800's. Â Must try, but don't forget to make your reservation a month out. You most likely won't be served otherwise. Â 10 stars if I could
Glad we checked it off our NY bucket list, but didn't live up to the hype. Steak was just ok. Nothing special..

Great place to have steak. But noise level is high. As usual since this is a popular place, you need to make reservations ahead of time if you want to dine here on Fridays, Saturdays or Sundays. You can try.
I long to go back there to blow a few thousand calories. Â  Yes, it's the best steakhouse in town. Â  Yes, it is an awesome place. Â  Yes, everyone should visit it once.
It really is a cut above the rest. It is THAT good. And thank god they now take debit cards.

I'm absolutely baffled by the reviews this place gets. First off, the impression given by the staff - bartenders, Maitre D', servers etc., is that they know their reputation and act like as patrons, we're lucky to be there. Â From the lobby, to the dining rooms, it was so noisy, and so rushed. We were a party of 4, two couples. On to the food, I mean REALLY? This is NY's best steak dinner?? Shrimp cocktail appetizer was fine. Â We had the famed German Style hash potatoes, creamed spinach, and steak for 2. I've had better potatoes at the diner, and better steak in my own kitchen. For dessert we had the chocolate cake. Eh. Nothing to write home about. We each had one drink a piece (party of 4) and somehow....we racked up a $400 bill. As New Yorkers, living in Tampa, I'll tell you, that for $400, Berns Steakhouse blows this place AWAY. From the experience to the food, Lugar's was a HUGE disappointment. Take your money to Ruth Chris and you'll do better all around.

4 stars because the steak is good,3 stars for their bad service. Â We came here on a Wednesday evening not very crowded they took a minute finding our reservation and we almost thought they hadn't kept it, but luckily found it. Â Sat at the bar to wait for the rest of our party, the bartenders were so rude I mean I didn't even get a napkin with my very strong cranberry and vodka which they plopped In front of me. Â They were more into conversing with themselves than with dealing with their paying customers and we saw this a lot all over the steak house were small groups of servers having conversations with each other? Â We were seated and got the rudest waiter who barely answered our questions and had no suggestions on anything. Â After almost finishing my very strong drink I was quick to tell my husband that our waiters attitude sucked (and maybe a bit too loud, could he have heard me?) because when he returned he was mr comedian!! Â His attitude changed completely and he was quite pleasant for the rest of our meal which was very good! Â Steak was awesome ( and I'm not a steak fan). Â German potatoes, filet of sole, the bacon, dessert all very good and cooked perfectly. Â All that said will I be back? Â No, there are other steak houses out there with good food and I'm sure way better service!! Â Peter Lugers, yes your steak is good but people still want a pleasant dining experience as well and you need to remind your employees of this!!!!

We made reservations for 10:45 for party of 4. My friends were few minutes late, so the waiter tells me to call them and find out what they want, really. So after everything was ordered we felt rushed in a terrible way, it felt very uncomfortable. We were told the kitchen is closing literally like 10 times. My point is then do not take 10:45 reservations, and don not harass you patrons this way. At 11:30 they close the blinds. At 12:00 they blast the air conditioner to the max, to get us and another party out, we literally seen the waiter pressing the controller.

I had high expectations of this place since it was consistently voted one of the best steak house in US. Â Went there with my family and got the porterhouse for 4 and asked for medium end up having it nearly well done. Â The service was from average to unfriendly, hardly understand how being snobby is an acceptable attitude in the service industry. Â At their price range and still only accept cash payment is just unbelievable. Â In my opinion this place is over hyped. Â If you are a steak lover, this place will leave you underwhelm. Â Plenty of other places in the NYC that are better.
We had the best steak we ever ate last Friday night. The steak for 2 was cooked to perfection! Service was great. The place is quite dated, but that added to the experience.
Enjoyed their beer and wine selection and would be so frustrated if I gave up on such a delicious steak.

If your one of those ppl who always sees Peter Lugers on TV (like I did) then try this place out. Just to see what all the hype is about. Steak was good , not anything crazy , and not anything I'd go back for. There are many many mannnnnny other steak houses that are a lot better. Their steak is cooked in the oven not over a grill. Huge taste difference. Just go to say you've been there since its sort of an iconic NYC establishment.

One of the best steaks I have ever had! Service was great and the food delicious!! Went for a late lunch during the week and was very calm and easy to get a table (free parking). The bacon, spinach and the house sauce are very good. Had the steak medium and was amazing!! Recommend the cheesecake for dessert!!

Best steak in the world. This restaurant has stayed true to its roots for more than 100 years. Be aware that they do not accept credit card so bring cash. This place is world famous - Ansel Ponce Diama

I made a reservation for my husband's birthday. THIS IS KEY. I thought when we walked in that despite having reservations we would have to wait because there were sooooo many people waiting on a line for a table. We arrived a few minutes early (Sunday 2ish) gave my name and waited. We were seated promptly. Staff was super friendly. We opted for the steak for two, fries but started off with the bacon. WOW if meat had candy it would be this bacon: absolute meat candy. Slightly sweet but super savory. DELISH. Our steak was cooked perfectly medium (I think next time we will opt for medium rare) tender juicy and YUM. Fries were crunchy you can taste the freshness in all the food. The only disappointment I experienced was the extremely cold bread that was served in the very beginning of the meal. It was so cold to the touch and spreading butter on it didn't help it was like eating refrigerated bread. BUT overall a delicious experience would totally go back for some more steak!

I like Peter Luger. To be honest it's kind of hyped up in my opinion. Any establishment that's been in business as long as them is going to get the "Einstein" branding effect - as if that's the biggest genius in the history because we all need one person/thing to be the best. Yes they're steaks are top quality. But venue is old and you get that: "here's your steak, you're one of a billion people who came and will come, thank you goodbye." Not that service is bad, just it's became a famous stake factory at this point. I give it 4.5/5 for good quality. 3/5 for venue. 4/5 for service. All around solid steakhouse but there are so many comparable places in NYC that don't have the "Peter Luger" reputation and name, that it's worth noting the place is slightly over hyped up.

The best steakhouse in nyc!!!!! What you need is to book a table in advance. Let's say about a month in advance. I love the steak and bacon here. I would say Peter Luger is the place that i would like all my visiting friends to visit at least once in a lifetime!

Places like this piss me off - the ones that are just living off their legacy. It was good, but obviously not grass fed and the quality in no way reached that of Puck, which is particularly where they went wrong, trying to say they were better. I probably would have given a better review had they not been so boastful beforehand. This place is the average man's splurge. But not too bad. Personally I'm going to stick to grass fed higher quality in future.

Worth the wait for the reservation. Â Waiter a little snarky but that's part of it. Â Great food. Tomato and onion salad with their sauce great. Â Lots to take home. Â Sorry I waited so long to go. Will be back

Not in Brooklyn very often, but this is THE place for fabulous porterhouse beef & delicious sides. Â For me & my friends always steak for 3, medium rare, potatoes, spinach & dessert with "schlag." Great dinner

Peter Luger is a staple in Williamsburg, and for good reason. Â The steaks remain among the best in NYC. Â I've eaten there on a number of occasions, and the side dishes really make the meal, along with the desserts. Â I recommend ordering the steak for two + creamed spinach and apple strudel for dessert. Â It aint cheap, and they still don't take cards BUT it's worth it.

Im sorry, but i didnt have a great experience there. I was there for my dad's bday celebration. We chose this ace cause he likes steaks. Well, for me personally the menu was very limited, for entrees only steak, grilled salmon or lamb. And each of them has no sides, you have to order it separately. The bread came cold. Grilled salmon was not cooked well, it was a bit rare. The steak was supposed to be well done also, but it was like medium. I dont know, not my cup of tea. Our server was nice, however the host was not attentive to us. Â I think there are better steak houses in nyc then this one.

It was a great steak. We ordered steak for two with fries. The steak was great. I would still not rate is as the best steak in NY but it was great. I liked it a lot. The only thing that was surprising was that they are charging 16 USD for a sliced tomato (they don't even put olive oil on it). I saw it on the next table and thought and asked for it but I was surprised to see that they are charging 16 bucks for one sliced tomato on a small plate.
One of my favorite steak houses in the city. Go with friends since the portions are HUGE. Leave room for dessert and get the schlag!

column1: I Review UW Plaza Food S.

column6: Steak Perfection. Get the bacon appetizer and the creamed spinach. This place is that good. They now take debit cards.

This place should be a meat lover's mecca. Â It's my second time coming here. Â Some may not agree it's worth the travel, but I live in the opposite coast and I'd trek my ass to come here. Â Best piece of meat you'll have and go rare and don't add the steak sauce to get the full flavor. Â Go for the bacon appetizer, accompany your meat with the best cream of spinach, and wash it down with a drink from Chris at the bar; just don't get the old fashioned unless you're, according to Chris, "a trendy hipster." Â This place is top notch in terms of food and service. Â I'll make it a tradition to come here whenever I visit NYC. Â Book in advance. Â I booked mine 3 months ago and looked forward everyday for the last three months.
Steak was Delicious so good i def def would suggest people to go here especially if you're looking for a good juicy steak

I like all the steak ,and bacon ,is good! Â but I hate the service .i been this location 3 times,Long Island 2times,same thing,service bad yo me,maybe I am Chinese ,maybe ur guys don't like Chinese go there.everytime I paid the tips at lest 30%,I don't know why Everytime give me the bad face,and bad service.! I will not come back again .
I'm not a big meat eater but this was a steak I could eat regularly. It was so large I had lunch the next day with my leftovers. It was well worth the price.
We went here for my fiancÃ©'s birthday and everything was absolutely amazing. The steak was perfection and our waiter was incredible. A steakhouse that everyone must try!

The steak is decent, not worth all the praise it always receives. Â Customer service was very friendly, just don't order a steak here well done or you'll definitely be looked at weirdly. Â The creamed spinach is very good here.

This place goes down as my all time favorite steakhouse. I decided to take my boyfriend for his birthday due to a recommendation. I'm going to be honest it's really hard to get reservation on short notice but we got lucky and I was able to find a spot. Once we got there the ambience was great and the hostess was very welcoming. We decided to grab a drink by the bar and waited at most 10 mins to be seated. I decided to try the luger burger which is only served during lunch and my boyfriend got the rib eye steak, amazing! I can't wait to go again

It was a great experience to go especially when you have somebody who been there. Â The bacon was amazing (would eat that alone for breakfast, lunch, and dinner). Â The steak sliced and served. Â That is nice - do not need to battle knife and fork off the meat off bone. Â The desert was not made in-house, but "schlag" was and it was good. Â The atmosphere is roomy and homey. Â The is a German feel. Â  The wait staff were "tough" looking, but they are kind and helpful.

Staple Brooklyn Steakhouse Can't Go Wrong. If you're a bacon lover must have the thick slab of bacon!!! Of course a steak of your choice but for dessert TRY THE APPLE STRUDEL IT'S A WHIP CREAM LOVER'S DREAM!!!

We came on a rainy sunday afternoon for a family members 50th birthday lunch, only to be told that they dont have room for 5 people but only 4 or less. When we said we will wait we were told they wont have room for 5 people until monday. The guy was very rude and pretty much just told us we cant be there after he looked us over. We were looking forward to enjoy a nice lunch only to be really let down by what is supposed to be a very reputable restaurant. I will return one day and hopefully they get extra chairs so they can accomodate 5 people.

Overall best steakhouse. I love steak and have tried many others, but nothing compares to me like Peter Luger's steaks. There steak sauce is one of a kind and I eat it on everything besides steak. Not to forget there amazing creamed spinach and save room for dessert because there ice scream sundae with a chocolate cow on top is to die for. One Down side is its cash only or you have to use there cc. Other then that I recommend Peter Lugers hands down.
The steak was nothing special, I've been to better steak houses which were cheaper. The service was good though and the place was nice and clean.
We went there especially for that food, it didn't make me disappoint. That is one of the best steak house I have ever seen.

A must for every steak enthusiast visiting NYC, this Brooklyn staple will blow your mind. Yes the place is not cheap but it is well worth it so be ready for it. Obviously get the porterhouse and as a side I totally recommend the spinach and French fries!

Ok I just don't get this place. The steak isn't cooked on a grill, it's broiled, which to me is not the best way to cook steak. Second, it's unevenly cooked so that one side is burnt and the other side is almost raw - yet people are saying omg this is perfectly done. Third, some of the pieces I ate were chewy "marbled" to the point of gross I gotta spit this out. The side dishes are "meh" the service is good but with such a limited menu how could the service be bad? I guess I prefer my steaks cooked evenly and prefer some seasoning on the steak and I also prefer fillets over porter house but that doesn't exist here. So to me I wouldn't come back but it is personal preference

My husband made a reservation to celebrate my birthday. July 9th. When we arrived the host informed us there was no table or reservation for us. Â We were told that the reservation was for a different month and day. Instead of apologizing and admitting that Peter Luger's reservations Â had made a mistake with the entry, the host was very unfriendly and unkind. Â We were treated very badly. No apology, a kind word, or even offer us a drink. We were told that there was no availability. Clearly we were bumped off the reservation list. My husband did not make a mistake when he made the reservation. Â July 9th is very different from August 6th.

Delicious. That's all you need to know. The steak is to die for, the atmosphere is great and the staff are super nice. Make sure you have a reservation because this place is so popular it gets crowded but it is worth the wait. One huge tip - they only accept cash or their own credit card so make sure you bring enough to cover your bill.

Called a month in advance to make a reservation but the lady seemed very rude on the phone. Very short with her words. Ok whatever, everyone has different personalities won't judge by the tone of her voice. They called back to confirm the reservation but we decided to cancel because of travel complications. When I told them we would like to cancel she just hung up on me! So freakin rude.

I went back again after two months since my first visit. The steak there is sooooo good!! We tired holy cow hot fudge sundae this time. It's very creamy and rich. I enjoyed it but felt a bit greasy after several spoons.

Rude, snobby employees. So-so burger. Horrible atmosphere. I felt like I was in an MCL cafeteria. Seated next to a table of 50 something ladies talking about their sexual exploits at an ear piercing level. Dropped $300 (cash only!!) for a crappy experience. Do yourself a favor, skip this over-hyped Â place and go to Shake Shack. You'll get a better burger and pay a fraction of the cost!

It's not bad, but I wouldn't say it's the best either. I've tried other places that were much more worth the price since this was quite expensive. I liked it but I don't know how often I'd go. The steak was pretty good but a bit burnt on the outside. The servers were great and the sides were huge but there are definitely better places. Please bring cash, I was thanking the Gods that I brought cash since that's all they accepted and I didn't check Yelp before hand LOL.

First off steak portions are dinosaur sized!!! Steak flavor and temp is on point!!! That's as far as I'd say was amazing. It's all about the steak and ONLY the steak cause nothing else here is great. Sides were nothing to write home about however I will say the best Caesar salad dressing and salad ever!!!! Awesome flavor. Rest...including atmosphere...meh.

This is by far the best steak I have ever had. My friend who lives there made reservations weeks in advance before our visit since this place is that popular. We got the steak for 4 and that was indeed a lot of steak. Everything we had was amazing from the potatoes to the creamed spinach. Our waiter was very nice and professional as well. It was a great experience and I recommend giving this place a try.

Had early dinner reservations at Peter Luger last night for my aunt and uncle's anniversary. This place was definitely everything I hoped for. They bring you out complimentary bread and butter (the onion rolls are fantastic). For an appetizer we started out with the thick cut bacon which was amazing!!! My girlfriend and I split the steak for two which was cooked to a perfect medium rare. The steak sauce kind of resembled cocktail sauce which was different but very delicious. For the sides we ordered german fried potatoes and creamed spinach which were both very good. I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for an unforgettable steak dinner.

Really great table service and food - the porterhouse for two and the thick-cut bacon are must-tries, but the reservationists dampened our experience there. We were supposed to be seated at 7:45, and had a completely full and ready-to-go party, and we sat at 8:45. At 7:15, we kindly notified the lead reservationist that we had not been seated yet (this guy thinks he's some slick, sarcastic old-school New Yorker), and he said "give me two minutes. We sat 30 minutes later after a sturdier reminder. Save your wallet for St. Anselm or a place that will cater to better hospitality.

After visiting and trying the food here I left feeling like the experience and food was lacking. Â With all the hype this place gets I expected more overall especially when it came to the food, particularly the steaks. Â I've eaten at almost every single steak house in Manhattan including palm, galagher's, club A, wolfgangs, benjamin, empire, porter house, sparks, keens, etc.. so my palate knows what a good steak tastes like and what a bad steak tastes like. Â At Luger I wouldn't say you get a bad tasting steak but for me after eating it I didn't say wow. Â It was more like, eh...I had ordered the porterhouse and it tasted like a steak I could get anywhere for half the money or make in my kitchen. Â Also, the service seemed rushed and the ambiance was not as comfortable as other steak houses I've been too unless you like sitting on plain wooden chairs which I feel should be more comfortable when it comes to a high end restaurant like a steakhouse. Â I think if you're into trying different steakhouses or a tourist and haven't tried it here then for the sake of trying it I would say come, but if you're not into trying all the steakhouses like me and just want a really good tasting steak with comfortable surroundings then I would pass on it.

Absolutely terrible customer service ever! The food is good, but the person taking reservations is soooooooo fucking nasty I feel sad and sorry for her. What have her been though in life to be this bitter, is beyond me. Will never return to this place again.

Wow. This place is extremely overrated. We had reservations and waited over 30 minutes to be seated. We were seated at the equivalent of a wooden picnic table. The food was average at best. The baked potato had no salt on it whatsoever. It was as if they just pulled it out of the over and plopped it on the plate. I've been to several of the other steak houses in New York and the steaks at Peter Lugar's were no different. The service wasn't great either. I'm not one to complain about price at restaurants in New York City because I expect to see a high number. With that said, I expect the foods be a certain caliber. I did not think this place came even close to average.

It just doesn't get better. Love Peter Lugers, for the steak and the vibe. Definitely the best quality steak I've ever had. I love the old school ambiance, and think it's pretty funny that it's cash or PL credit card. Definitely a classic NY staple.
Get the bacon - You won't regret it! My family loves this place - definitely a favorite of ours!

Hands down, I've been around searching for the best steak, yes I just found the game changer! Its the best steak out there! We had the bacon and the steak for two and they were both outstanding! for the side we had the cream of spinach and house potatoes. Steak and spinach just compliment each other and the steak just melt in your mouth! And yes they have a parking lot across the street and its complimentary so what else can you ask for?!

This was fantastic, the steak had no seasoning but still really hit a spot. The steak sauce was really good, but it tasted like store bought sauce so I was a little disappointed. The service was awesome, everything was very clean and organized. I ate in the upstairs area, the manager on shift was very kind and asked us how our meal was on the way out. Everything was expensive, but it was worth it. Overall great place and ill probably go back!

By far, the worst experience I have had anywhere.. not just in NYC. The service was absolutely terrible , the dinner rolls were freezing cold, the menu is extremely limited. The steak we ordered came out cooked medium as we requested and was so extremely chewy and hard and mind you that is with the entire cup of butter dumped on it. The "sauce" in the plate is straight oil and butter mixed with the flavorless steak. We were rushed to order the second we got there for our reservation and had "5 minutes before the kitchen closes". My boyfriend took me for my birthday which he mentioned to them several times and I didn't get a single note of acknowledgement. We were recommended the German potatoes which were similar to IHOP potatoes but that would give them way too much credit as they were so crunchy I couldn't even chew it! There is no drink menu or wine list but you won't need any specialty wine to go with this steak. I have never had worse service in my entire experience. Retrain your servers on customer service, stop serving burnt potatoes, lower your prices as they aren't remotely close to the quality of the product, and don't allow reservations past 10:45pm if the guest will only have 5 minutes to order the second they arrive.

Have been here twice. Porterhouse cuts are fantastic and cooked to perfection. But... flavorless without their steak sauce. Old school yes, great ambiance, no. Attentive and friendly service, makes the visit great. Bacon appetizer is amazing. The veggies are good, not amazing. There are other options for a great steak meal.

RSVP only, cash and Debit card only. Phone line is always busy so you feel like you won a lottery if someone answers your phone. Service is great when in person. Very old school steak house. Price is reasonable as a well known restaurant. Menu is simple and don't expect anything creative or fancy like the modern restaurant. Food definitely meets the expectation. I don't know about being the best but certainly very top quality and worth the price. The sauce is the BEST out of all and can go with literally EVERYTHING. Sliced tomato....I think it'll be better with mozzarella cheese but not available here. Overall, you gotta experience one of the best if it's not the best! You feel very lucky to be taken in and taken care of by PL.

So I've heard of this place for years and years and I finally got a chance to eat here it was by far the best steak I've ever had in my entire life it was wonderful juicy succulent moist perfectly medium rare the best awesome great beautiful tasty by far hands-down the best steak of my life!! You can't go wrong with aged meat,The waiting staff was also super attentive Peter Lugar is a very expensive restaurant steakhouse but it's worth every single penny even the bread was delicious and the cream spinach just a great experience
Hands down! Â The best Steak House in the world!!! Â Cash only, unless you have a Peter Luger credit card.

Wanted to give 3 1/2 stars but that option is unavailable. Â Let me tell you why...NO SEASONING AT ALL ON THE MEAT. Â Salt, pepper, and garlic powder goes a long way on a piece of quality meat. Â Creamed spinach was ok, the thick cut bacon was really good. Â Pappas Bros in Houston is way better flavor wise, Churchkey in LA has a strip that puts Luger's to shame. Â I respect the history/legacy, but this place is vastly overrated.

Top of the food chain here. Staple in NY steakhouses. I like this one much better than their other on in great neck LI. The creamed spinach is great. That slice of bacon is the best thing ever. I get my steak medium rare. It was perfect. Even the ice cream sundae was amazing.

Totally overrated. I know this review won't make an ounce of difference to their status as the best steakhouse in the region, but still reviews are there to be written and I was very unimpressed. Had this been any other steakhouse I would rate them 3 stars, but being as they're priced like they are exceptional and being that there is so much hype about them, it's knocked down to a 2 star. My review is based on the food, specifically the ribeye, the creamed spinach and the bacon appetizer. I can get far FAR better for half the price at nicer places with better ambience and less wait. On the other hand, the service which I was lead to believe would be terrible was instead spot on, very good service.

Today was my second time going there the first time I was afraid it was all going to be hype I ended up with a window table and my car parked out front I went with my son who love the ice cream but I must say I was surprised that he ate as much steak as he did he's very picky like I am thank you again and I'll see you next time I'm in town

Well, sad to say that as the years go by the quality of the steak isn't what it used to be. Found the steak for 3 to be overpriced as the veins of fat were through out the rib eye. Cheese cake was fair, Ferrara's is the place for deserts. For the $300 we paid, not worth going back.

The food was really good. The steak for 2 did not disappoint. I am a Chicago girl and to be honest my steak heart belongs to Gibson's or Hugos Frog Bar (same owners) and always will. But, this was really good and great portions. Prices are about the same as any high end steak house. Parking is FREE ( I did tip) and it is across the street (get there early). We made our reservations for an early Saturday afternoon and thank goodness we made reservations. They had a line in front of the door before even opening and will only take those who have reservations first (so, yes make reservations - being rude and walking in before others just won't work - yes, some tried it). Now, the reason I did not give 5 stars is really no fault of Peter Luger. As you know New York is extremely over-crowded and horrendous to drive through. We came from another State on the East Coast. When we got to China Town (which we had to drive through according to GPS) it was like a scene from the movies Contagion or Outbreak. There were so many Chinese people wearing Mask it was creepy and almost made me not want to eat just get the heck out. Then we got over the Williamsburg Bridge and parked. Luger is right over the Bridge in Brooklyn just a bit beyond China Town. There was a line already outside of the restaurant and yes even in the line there were a lot with those masks on. Again creepy and made you not want to eat. A few folks behind us in line were whispering how they wished the Chinese patrons would take the mask off because it made them feel uncomfortable. But, I guess with the Coronavirus they feel it necessary to do (not really sure the rationale and I was not asking - and its on the street so they can do what they want). And, the staff at Luger is certainly not going to say anything to them - the customer base in the Brooklyn restaurant is highly Chinese (and, that is no exaggeration). Again, good food!!!!
You can't beat the service or the atmosphere, and you definitely can't beat the food.

Peter Luger is totally overrated and living off an old reputation. Not sure why it remains in city guides as a place to go but everything besides a big expensive steak is below average and the setting is old but not in a charming way, it is outdated and uninviting.
the best in the whole united states of america need i say more!?!?!

Step inside Peter Luger Steakhouse and you will immediately feel as if you have stepped into a classic New York steakhouse. From the wood paneling on the walls to the rustic charm of the wood tables and chairs, the historic ambience rounds out your dining experience at this Brooklyn landmark since 1887. Still, the star of the show is the USDA Prime Beef, dry aged on-site. Fresh baked breads and other sides compliment their delicious, hand-selected steaks. While they are quite popular, the German style potatoes seemed a little charred and somewhat of an oversight when paired with the high-end dry aged beef. Steak was also a bit charred. But if you're looking for an old-school steakhouse experience, look no further than Peter Luger Steakhouse

been to many steak houses in NY and found this place to be lacking both in service and food. went here for lunch and there were many open tables, yet service still felt rushed. If you're paying $200 for lunch, I expected better service. as far as their steak, mediocre... not something that'll make me want to come back. I guess Peter Luger is just a famous brand, more hype than what it really is. I'm going to say it.... a tourist trap.

Let me start off with, I am not a steak person. I don't mind it but I wouldn't be devastated if I never ate it. My fiancÃ© however, is obsessed with steak. He has been wanting to come for some time and I finally surprised him with reservation (had to be booked 2 months in advance). I have never ever ever had steak as delicious as the one here. It was so mouth watering that now I make it my goal to come at least a few times a year. It was about $100 pp but money well spent.

How steak should be done. Will be a while before I get over the fact that I've eaten melt in your mouth, buttery and perfectly charred steak for $105 for two people. Coming from Southeast Asia where this is what we typically pay if not more for a steak and the quality isnt just as great.
Great Place and a lot of people even in weekday. Â wine was little over price. Â Napa Valley house wine is over 50$.

Surprisingly, and contrary to popular belief that Peter Luger's waiters are curt and gruff, our waiter was very nice! Â The sides were very good. Â My issue is with the porterhouse steak for two. Â We ordered it medium. Â When the waiter delivered the steak to our table he noticed before we did that the steak was rare - very rare. Â Before we could say something, he volunteered to take the steak back. Â I didn't say anything but assumed that we would be getting a new steak done as we ordered it. Â Instead and to our surprise, the steak that our waiter brought back was the same steak! Â In case you didn't know, once the steak is sliced, if it is returned to the broiler Â it becomes ruined. Â What a shame! Â A $100 dollar steak over-done and very dried out. Â We had to literally struggle through it. Â If it wasn't my daughter's birthday, I would have raised my complaint right on the spot. Â Within that week, I wrote a very nice letter to Peter Luger's management explaining what happened. Â Months have gone by now with no response. Â I am so disappointed. Â With so many quality steak houses in New York

Please make reservations prior, otherwise, you most likely will not get a seat. Also, nefore coming to Luger's, it is recommended that you read reviews, and research so you know what to expect. Peter Luger is a classic New York steakhouse. The service at Luger's is definitely not what you would expect when paying for such a meal, but it works, very efficiently. The sides, are mediocre at best, but that is not the reason you should come to Luger's. There is only one reason why anyone should come, their signature Porterhouse Steak (please order it medium rare). It has been aged to perfection and melts in your mouth.

We visited an old war buddy recently, and he brought us here knowing I am a huge steak lover. This place is nothing compared to the steakhouses we have in West Texas, no this is a completely different experience. Everything we had, the sides, the drinks, the main courses, all had unique flavoring to them. My advice to anyone who visits, take small bites and enjoy it for as long as possible. It's pretty expensive but I cannot stress enough how much it is worth it!!

There was a cancellation on 6/22 so we took it. I'm not a big steak person, but this steak was amazing! We were a party of 8 and ordered two steak for three as recommended by our server Jose. He was right, it was more than enough. The creamed spinach and potatoes were just okay. The bacon - OMG!! And the steak! The pecan pie with the schlagg was the perfect dessert to cap off the dinner. On my next visit, I would skip the sides to make room for more bacon and steak!

This probably the only 5 star rating I will ever give to a steak house. I have been to most of the big name high end steak houses in Los Angeles and Chicago and Peter Lugers is on a whole different level of a playing field. When you strip away the butter and spices and want to talk about the pure quality of beef, nothing beats Peter Lugers in picking a beef and aging it in house. My dining experience reminded me of a prior experience I had on a race track. I was riding along with an amateur weekend racer in a Porsche GT3, which I thought was really fast. The following weekend I got to ride along in another slower Porsche with a professional race car driver who used to run Le Mans, and my whole idea of fast was blown out of the water! So bringing it back to steaks, I thought I had some good steaks in my life which I have paid handsomely for, but until you try Peter Lugers all other contenders will fail to compare. Peter Lugers is some ways has ruined my steak dining experience because now it is pointless to go and pay $80 for a porterhouse steak when I know with absolute certainty that it will not compare to Peter Lugers. I know it sounds like I am hyping it up, which I unusually try to avoid because I want people to go in with a neutral point of view to make their own assessments, but it really is that good. They are a minority of a minority of a minority because they are one of the few steakhouses that sell prime grade, they have someone hand select their cows, and they age their own beef in house directly downstairs of the kitchen. When you order your meal it comes from downstairs directly to the kitchen through an elevator.

Can you say tourist trap. So rude in the Williamsburg one. Go to the long Island one the staffs nice and welcomes your business. This one practically seems annoyed by your presence. And you know what their steaks not even that great. I only go there for their bacon. Go Â to uncle Jacks and Wolfgang for amazing steak and service.

High quality steak house with classic, Williamsburg waterside vibes. Â Knowledgeable staff and delicious side dishes. Family style, make your reservations far in advance and save room for the apple turnover.

Went with a fairly large group, which I think is the way to go. We ordered a bunch of different cuts and sides and just shared everything. The rib eye was my favorite followed closely by the T bone, but everything was delicious.
I don't normally eat steak ever so ordered salmon (which was incredible!) however tried a bite of my table's order of steak and immediately loved. Highly recommend.

Once you get past the utter lack of ambiance and rather gruff clientele, you'll find a steakhouse who's reputation vastly outperforms the actual quality. Steak was fine, if under-seasoned, and the sides were just there. Sure, you can check this one off the famous New York restaurant bucket list, but other than that, there's better steakhouses in the city.

What can I say. Simple, old fashion and yet delicious steak I have ever had. I had the single steak medium well, onion rings, & popular whip cream. I loved it! Next on the list is the porter steak and burger with bacon!

My fiancÃ© and I are both quite the carnivores. The last time I checked our blood tests came back medium rare. Peter Lugers is a great place that delivers a quality steak that the meat speaks for itself. The thick cut bacon is quite the artery blocker but so so worth it. We don't come often but when we do we leave stuffed and happy.

Came here on 11/20 with family for a birthday celebration. Great steak house with a limited menu because it's obviously all about the MEAT! They even have a $6.00 SLICE of bacon as an appetizer. I'm not into huge slabs of beef so I ordered Salmon which was enough for two meals. The side orders will feed two to four people. Very expensive so now that I've been there I can cross it off the bucket list.

Not the best steak I have ever had.. Not even top 5 but your there for the brand name. Â The creamy spinach in the other hand outstanding best I've had. Â There's perception and reality and at Peter Lugers perception take first place!
I walked into the back room where the butcher all the dogs they serve highly recommend 10 of 5 stars.
Place is great, been to multiple locations that they have awesome steaks, great fish options, waiters are top class and the atmosphere is hard to beat.

My coat and my husband's coat were stolen while eating dinner. Nobody who worked here cared. The manager said "This happens all the time." No steak is worth my coat. Peter Luger's is filled with crooks and criminals

My first and hopefully not last visit to Peter Luger was to celebrate my 24th birthday and my parents 30th anniversary. After reading a lot of mixed reviews I was a little apprehensive. Thankfully it was beyond my expectations. We ordered the porterhouse for 4, the creamed spinach, onion rings, apple strudel with schlag, and the key lime pie. The porterhouse was beautiful perfectly medium rare and delicious without anything on it. The creamed spinach was surprisingly delicious and I thoroughly enjoyed dipping my steak in it. The schlag could make anything taste good but the strudel was delicious and my father enjoyed the key lime pie. I cannot wait to go back!

I enjoyed my Peter Luger experience. It wasn't epic though.... Maybe because everyone had hyped it up so much. We started with the onion and tomato which was just that a simple onion and tomato but that was good especially with the "Luger sauce". Great rolls / bread. We split a steak for two which came out steaming and sizzling sort of like when you get a fajita at a Mexican place. We got cream spinach on the side with this. Typical cream spinach , solid / good though. Decor was sort of old school. Clientele was "middle of the road" no one was dressed particularly nice. For a steak house and a meal like this generally I dress up and enjoy that element of the meal, but clearly other people did not get the memo. The waiters were friendly but towards the end, they rushed us out. We went at 8:15 which I guess was on the later side, but that's when they had a reservation. In hospitality there's a certain way to do something and the way the waiters kept being like "can I pack that for you?" Irritated me. Besides that, overall good experience though!
Not the cheapest place but the food is good. To be honest was expecting something better, but it is definitely worth a try.

Our first stop in NY. Â My husband almost wanted to order a second Sizzling Bacon after our first order. Â Then, we thought we better wait to see how big the Steak for 2 is. Â Luckily, we saved room for the steak, it was more than enough for the 3 of us! Â We also liked the German Fried Potatos.

Peter Luger isn't a restaurant....it's an institution. Â My family ate at Peter Luger's for the first time last Christmas Eve (it was my Xmas present), and the memory will be with us forever. Â Throwback style and wait staff immediately set the tone, and you simply have to love the fact that you order your Porterhouse by the number of people in your party.

I've been to Peter Luger a handful of times but I really don't know what the hype is about. The steak is pretty bland without their famous sauce. It isn't well seasoned. The only reason I keep coming back is because their BACON is absolutely delicious!! It's so thick and juicy,so succulent ! I would come here just for the bacon. It is THAT GOOD.
A classic. Make your reservation as early in advance as humanly possible. Great for groups, portions are massive.
Peer Luger is Peter Luger. Enough said. Â Only thing is to make sure to get a reservation for holidays.

Unbelievable. Best cooked steak, better than Chicago steak houses. Service was amazing. Super attentive and knowledgeable. Made us feel like regulars, which we will be from this point forward. Â Steak for 2 was perfect. Wedge salad was just how we like it. I cannot say enough about Peter Lugers. Worth the trip.
Have been coming here for years and there is no place like it. Atmosphere, waiters and food are outstanding. best steak around

Took my fiancÃ© here for his birthday. Surprisingly, I was able to snag a 9:30pm reservation on short notice. Soooo not likely!! From the very beginning the staff was welcoming, a true family feel. This was both of our first time dining here, and we were pleased. We ordered the highly recommended bacon, steak for 2, mixed green salad, baked potato, soda for me (not a huge drinker) and cognac for him. All in all- pre gratuity was $179. Our waiter... awesome I wish I remembered his name. Will absolutely return. Not a cheap restaurant, but I don't dine out to penny pinch, I dine out for the experience.
I have had plenty of steak houses that have less flare and more taste. Maybe they need to focus on cooking and or advertising.

Would I eat here again? Yes, if someone else was paying. Â Its very expensive and you need to come with plenty of cash. Â My wife and got the steak for two with creamed spinach and french fried potatoes. Â The steak was prepared exactly as requested. Â However, the creamed spinach didn't taste good. Â We enjoyed the potatoes. Â The food came out fast and the service was fine. However, I wouldn't rush back. Its very old school which is great but we didn't feel it was worth the expense.

I really wanted this to be the best steak I have ever eaten, but unfortunately it wasn't. It was bland, and tough (Porterhouse steak for two). I've also had better creamed spinach. Â My son was turned off when he opened his menu and it was dirty, with leftover food and all. Â Don't believe the hype.

Went to Lugers for lunch, my girlfriend and I got steak for two, Porterhouse, and the german fried potatoes. The steak was a sublime experience, we both really enjoyed it. Yes, it is expensive, it'll also be on my go to list every time we go to NYC.
Great food and service! A bit out of the way for many but totally worth it.
Anything less then 5 stars and you don't have taste buds. Â Make sure to make reservations way ahead of time!

Great old school steak house. Service took a lot of time but it was good service regardless. Their bacon is delicious! We had the porter house for 2 (which we split between 4 people) and the cream spinach. Cooked very well and their barbecue sauce was great. I wanted the sundae but I don't think I could have fit it in with all the steak! I would return.

This is one of the best meals I've ever had. If this is what steak is supposed to taste like, then I've been eating the wrong kind of steaks. We started off the meal with the bacon. It was a good chunk of meat and it was so delicious, not too salty. Then the steak came out. We ordered the steak medium rare for two, German potatoes, and creamed spinach. I never had steak medium rare before since I'm terrified of a bloody steak. After taking one bit, I couldn't stop eating it. The steak sauce it comes with is delicious; it compliments well with the steak. The oil they put the steak is so good yet so bad for your body; it's worth it to dip your steak into the oil at least once. The German potatoes and the creamed spinach tasted great. We ordered the apple streusel. It wasn't too sweet; it was just right with the huge bowl of whip cream that came with it. The servers were very nice and friendly here. They made us feel welcome and made the experience enjoyable. I'd definitely come back. It's not too far from the train. Cash only here or if you have a Peter Lugers credit card, you can use that too. It's best to make a reservation just in case.

The meat is impressive!I can't say much about the sides or our waiter.Your not coming here for either.Make a reservation you won't wait. I enjoyed my filet mignon, rare as possible. No qualms about giving you what you wanted. I had a wonderful full bodied red which sang chorus to the meat. I can't say anything about desserts or sides this was all we ate and found it very satisfying.

Pure greatness! Â Love everything on their menu. The atmosphere is also great - very old school. Â I wish the wait could be shorter and I wish they answered their phones more often but they are busy and an institution for a reason! Â Will definitely be back!
Amazing! Just freKing MZing! Steak for two w. creamed spinach and A bottle of merlot all followed by a bowl of whip cream w. a side op pecan pie = 2 hours of bliss

i love this place. Â Family style steaks and wonderful creamed spinach... served by gruff waiters in a traditional setting. Â What more could you ask for? The steak was cooked perfectly and tasted devine. Â It almost melted in your mouth and was cut off the bone by the waiter and served to me and my colleagues. Â It was strange not being able to use credit cards but we had come prepared. Â Certainly something you need to experience at least once but you will want more. Â The apple strudel just topped it off perfectly and the cream...yum. Â I must get back there...it certainly was one of the best steaks i have ever eaten...now I need to try the bacon.
Good place for a special occasion. I'm a steak n sides guy, so naturally this place works for me.

I am not a meat lover but i had to try something from this restaurant since it is my neighborhood. I tried the burger and omg it was delicious! Meat is full of flavor on its own, juices dripping out of the meat patty. It comes in a small bun and side of fries. it might look small but it is sastifying enough for a person with a big appetite. Also the onion they put in the burger is so tasty, sweet and crunchy. Ingredients are fresh and ready to enjoy. By the way, they dont have it on the menu. If you get the chance try caramel cone ice and the bacon :-)

This place has changed my life..no bs. How can I ever enjoy a steak anywhere else, ever again?! I totally get the hype..the quality is outstanding..and the bacon...bacon never needed help tasting good but their bacon is like no other bacon I've ever experienced.

How can anyone give this less then 5 stars? I've eaten at top steak houses all over planet earth. Sure the waiters are awesomely gruff..I love them. They are like German hit men and very professional. True prime beef represents only 3% of all beef in the U.S.. Most places that tell you its prime...it's not. Luger girls get first pick every week in the meat packing district before anyone else. They buy 10'000 pounds a week effectively wiping everyone else out of the cut they use. It's a T-Bone or a Ribeye, "forget the ribeye" and that's it. you get no other choice. Their menu gives you four choices for steak. Steak for 1,2,3, or 4 and that's it folks. So if you got the "cash only or Luger card" to drop on the worlds best steak, better than true Japanese Kobe which I've had many times and trust me Luger's is better....go there and prepare to be amazed.

The best steakhouse I've been to! Peter Lugers is known for every New Yorker. My friend took me here for my bday and she reserved one month in advance. There system is a lil bit old fashioned but I guess that's why they've been there for 125 years. We had a couple of beers at the bar. Once we got seated we ordered the bacon strips and they gave us some delicious bread with butter. We ordered the prime steak for two with the potatoes and creamed spinach. Everything was to die for. For desert we ordered the fresh strawberries with their homemade whipped cream. Â Everything was delicious and we had plenty to take home. Even the whippet cream!

Damn another spot in NYC that did not live to the hype. Â I ordered the single porterhouse steak, the sis had the Luger burger and the bro in law had the prime rib. We all gave it an A-OK. Â I like that they give you an assortment of breads to start with. Â I was expecting melt in your mouth steak but it wasn't close to that. Â  We went for lunch and was disappointed that the Luger fried potatoes were not available. Â The waiter said the German guy doesn't come in until 4pm and I was like huh? With these waiters not sure to take it as a joke or wha. Â I guess they don't do cross training here like they do at my work, lol.

One of the best steaks I've ever had . It's fair to say this place meets the hype . Focus on the beef and dessert , you won't go wrong . Had the steak for 2 and the cheese cake . Both unforgettable ! when I come back I look forward to ordering the same .
Though it may seem cliche; there really is no comparison when it comes to NYC steakhouses. Some say it's over rated, I'm calling bullshit.

What is there not to love about one of the best steak houses in Brooklyn. So we had a steak for two with their famous petter Luger sauce with a very large side of shrimp cocktail delicious. And of course the creamy spinach that I really enjoy every time I come.
Nothing anywhere ever said anything about reservations. Â Fair enough but the guy working the front door was an ASSHOLE

Reservations highly recommended!! Beautiful, small but perfect, great service, amazing food! Delicious steak sauce, tomatoes and bacon out of this world and of course the steak it is simply delicious! great experience we had an amazing evening and left satisfied with everything.
Love the charm of the building and location. Â Service was great. Â Bacon amazing. Â Steak was not what I expected for the reviews and recommendations from friends.

what a horrible birthday my son had last night at peter luger!! Â i was also with my 79yr old mother and Â my daughter. the service was horrible to say the least. Â  our waiter looked like the dawn of dead.. not friendly at all borderline mean!!! Â we waited over an hour for our steak/ meal while everyone around us were getting served that was seated well after us.. Â our waiter or anyone came over to us to say anything i.e something happened sorry nothing! Â my son walked out and told the waiter after an hour of watching everyone get served, to cancel his meal... we'll after that the sides arrived and the waiter said sorry the plate broke everyone makes mistakes!!!! Â it was a horrible first experience and we will never return. Â  Â overrated with terrible Â service.. Â never again my son's birthday was ruined didn't even have a chance to sing happy birthday!!! you should be ashamed of yourself peteri!!!

Don't believe the hype. This place is not at all as good as they say it is. First off, you wait to be seated 20-30 minutes after your reservation, have to fight through a crowd of people to get to the host, and then THE FOOD IS NOT GOOD! The steak tasted like it was basted in vegetable oil. Four of us are high end steak house regulars, going out every year for our birthdays, and it was a huge disappointment. The best part, in my opinion, were the potatoes on the side and the dessert. But even that wasn't very memorable.
The quintessential NYC steak house. Great steak good salad and good old world service. Expensive but it's a great experience. Also good wine and beer.

My first time here and I must say it was one of the best steaks I have ever had! Â Full of flavor! Â I had steaks for three for 5 of us along with some German potatoes and we really enjoyed it! Â Definitely would come back again in the future
Very loud. Very bright dining room. Not much ambience. Very rigid "rules" on ordering and paying. Food was good but not great.

Went for my birthday with a party of 8, needless to say I was expecting to spend alot of money, actually wasn't as pricey as you would think. Service was great and the rustic old school Brooklyn ambience really added to the experience. Â Great place for a classic Ribeye while in the heart of Brooklyn.

As a walk in solo diner I was treated well. While waiting at bar I accidentally knocked my almost empty drink over, it was quickly cleaned up and without asking or need the bartender fixed me a new drink! Something I didn't expect since it was near empty. Table waiters gave me excellent service. Food was great NY strip, creamed spinach and German potatoes. Desert was superb apple strudel and coffee. Worth the wait.

column3: St John's Wood, London, United Kingdom

column6: My review is long over due, as we dined here near the beginning of the year. Â Lived up to its reputation. Â Slab of bacon was delicious. Â Steak was cooked perfectly. Â Wife and I will be back next time we're in NYC. Â We ate an early dinner, 5:30pm. Â No wait, no crowd. Â Perfect time.

First time here and it was a great experience. Everything was excellent from the service to the food. Celebrate my boyfriends birthday here. Everyone was so friendly. Pricey but worth every penny. Really recommend it.

Known as one of the best steakhouses in New York, I think this place is overrated. Certainly there are better food options in Williamsburg that have emerged in recent years - some of the best food in New York, in fact. Â  It's not like the early days when Peter Luger was an outpost in an otherwise off the map hood.

I have been going to this iconic steakhouse for over 15 years. The best plain and simple. Â This is a place for a guy like me, a hungry guy with a knot of cash . Great steaks , great scotch, and great service.

Our meal at Peter Luger might be one of the best steak experiences we've had. We had a 4:45pm reservation and we're running late due to NYC rush hour traffic, but were seated right away. Our server was a straight shooter, not overly nice or kind, but efficient. He recommended the steak for two after my dad and I ordered individual steaks for one. He explained the steak for two is sirloin and filet, whereas the steak for one is just sirloin. We ordered the PL Cabernet which was the perfect compliment. Our meal which included the steak for two, prime rib, bottle of wine, two martinis, a glass of wine and three baked potatoes was just shy of $400. I have no problem spending good money for an amazing meal, but I truly think everything was overpriced. However, you're paying for an experience at NY's best steakhouse for 30 years running. Not to mention, the steak could be cut with a fork... impressive.

Save your money. You'll save a lot of it. This place is a total fraud. Ok, they make a nice steak. Maybe even better, slightly, than most other steakhouses. But the prices are insane, and every dish other than the steak was sub-mediocre. Greasy fries, tasteless spinach, sundaes are better at Friendly's. They can't (won't) make a decent cocktail. Wines by the glass? Choose your grape and take what you get. I was born in NYC, have lived here my whole life - the last 20 yrs in Brooklyn - and I HATE when places like this stay so popular, when dozens of interesting, diverse, reasonably-priced, modestly-run places struggle to survive. Peter Luger is the Disney of restaurants. I can't stand that people fall for it. I went once - probably 15 years ago - and again tonight because my 10 yo son loves steak and was desperate to try it. I will never go back.
My favorite steak-house in the world. Nowhere else can touch Peter Luger's quality and attention to detail.

Okay so I didn't GO to Peter Luger's - I ordered it online for an Anniversary dinner....it.was.perfect! Â They really have delicious steaks. Â The sauce reminds me of shrimp sauce at first but then steak sauce. Â They include silver ice packs-I thought it was like marinade or something-luckily I called to ask! Â They should label those! Â Lol. Â It was a little pricey but worth every penny. Â It was a bucket list item and cheaper than a plane ticket! Â We were both completely happy. Â The gold coins are a nice touch. Â Can't wait to try the bacon :)

When you spend the prices they get for Porterhouse steak for two, salad, a bottle of wine, creamed spinach and a hot fudge sundae you expect to be blown away. Suppose you could say I was disappointed. Medium rare came out a bit too rare and a little chewy. Maybe if I didn't make an awesome steak of my own on a charcoal grill I would be less critical. I'm tough to wow I guess. At least the company was good.

This place should be rated $$$, not $$$$. Porterhouse steak costs about similar everywhere. Every penny was worth it. I was skeptical of recommendation of bacon, but bacon was so good! Now the steak... Speechless.. I am not a steak sauce guy, but their house steak sauce was really good. Inly downside was that they only take cash. But, I am looking forward to my next reservation!

The quality of Peter Lugers has been going down hill. I went recently for an anniversary dinner and the steak was very greasy. I was disappointed to say the least since my first experience here was so good. Overall I will probably try a different steak house next time.

Great steakhouse. Make sure you bring your cash. We got the tomato and onion salad. The PL sauce makes it a good salad. So simple yet so good. Then shared the porterhouse steak. Perfectly cooked medium rare plus. I wish I took pics but pics wouldn't do it justice. Thoroughly enjoyed the meal didn't have room for dessert.

Lugers crushes all. Â It had been a few years since my last visit to the meat cave, but I went with a group of fellow men last Thursday, to be nothing but completely smothered in the heart stopping soul reviving meat extravaganza. Â Sure it cost us 100 a head, but sometimes you've gotta do it. Â  From the cold mugs of Brooklyn lager to the tomatoes & onions, bread and luger sauce, well done bacon strips, steak for 6 w/ sides of potatoes and creamed spinach, more lugar sauce, bottles of wine, and some great laughs with good friends like old barbarians roaring over a fire after a long day of hunting, it was a meal and a memory for the ages.

This is an old fashioned steak house with the best aged steaks in the NYC area, in my opinion. Â The dining room is kind of old fashioned, but then again one comes here for the great company and the steak, both of which are in abundance.
