Â Be sure to make reservations well in advance, and be prepared to wait about 15-30 minutes for your seat since it is always busy here.

This is the OG steakhouse that is still the yardstick to measure all other steakhouses. Â Consistently the best steaks in the USA (sorry Argentina has better beef). Â Sides are good but can be inconsistent. Â Order a plate of Lamb chops and bacon as appetizer. Â Don't fill up on bread or the tomato/onion apps. Â It's all about the steak.

Went there for lunch on a Friday without a reservation and arrived there at 11:45AM. Already there was a long line of people in front of the restaurant, waiting to be entered without reservations just like us. We could enter the bar area sooner, but had to wait for another 50 minutes until finally seated. Our table was on the 2nd floor, which doesn't look as good as tables on the 1st floor. If you want to be seated on the 1st floor, be sure to make a reservation. Steak and side dishes (cream of spinach, german potatoes) were just fine, but not superb. Personally I don't think it worths visiting here, unless you love to wait. Service was okay, but wasn't that good either. My waiter brought me a cup of tea with lemon when I asked with milk, and brought our check when I asked for a dessert menu. Menus have stains, no table cloths. I have once been to another famous steak house in midtown east on 3rd Ave, and everything was just wonderful there. If all you want to do is just eat some meat, Peter Lugers is a place to go. If you value other things like nice atomosphere, professional service, go somewhere else in Manhattan. In addition, ladies rest room on the 2nd floor wasn't clean.
The server was friendly. The food (except caesar salad which was too salty to eat) was good also. Definitely worth waiting.
Overall experience was pretty good. Had the steak and a bunch of sides. The German potatoes are a must have.

Had a great night sharing meat and dining at a fancy place. Â Like many others was seeking the ultimate NY steak. Â Sadly like some others have said this wasnt it. Â Meat is tough even medium as compared to Flemings or Ruth Chris in California. Â Ive tried Maestros and Mortons and a ton of other places and so far I like Flemings in newport based on seasoning and consistency. Â Im sure even area to area chains vary based on meat supplier and chefs. Â Ruths chris in pasadena i stopped going because a couple times bad cuts ( chunks of fat ), once very very over salted, and another time well done. Â Once ok, but multiple times and $$$, i still do like the sides at ruth chris. Ok anyways if you do go to PL, share the steaks, if you are light eaters "steak for two 100+$" share for 3 people. Â The rib steak50+$ definitely more tasty but maybe for 1-2 light eaters. Â I would recommend the rib steak vs other. Â All the steaks they pre-cut into chunks and serve on big plates. Â House steak sauce as a side aka shrimp cocktail sauce. Â Its like a meatfest, i almost wanted to throw up, but i think it was the drink i had. Â Another tip dont order sides, not worth trying, ordinary and doesnt add to experience. Â And dont order drinks here. Â 46 bucks with tip for 3 drinks made very strong, bartender was a rude old guy. Â The one cool thing, waiters are qwerky, kind of fun; service I thought was great. Â We had damian, arms with big veins, looked like a james bond type, but fun expressions haha; Â i felt like i was in a english play!! Sad to say dont eat here :( if you are looking for tender tasty steak. Â Lack of seasoning/crust, and meat is tough. Â Ps dont order the bacon unless you like eating pure fat. Â Thats not my thing, ended up just spitting it out after trying a bite. Â I do like crispy bacon once in a while, but this was just seared fat.

Food is OK. Not to die for and not something you can eat in the city so why go all the way to Brooklyn. I think their no major credit cards policy is absolutely RIDICULOUS and when I asked the maitre d' about it he gave me attitude. Maybe go just so u can check it off the list but otherwise I am not sure why I would go back
Ok, service okay. food okay. Steak suck

After having an apartment in Manhattan for 1-1/2 years, I finally made it out to Peter Luger's. I'm a Chicagoan who's enjoyed many excellent aged steaks, so my expectations weren't as high as the hype, but I have to admit that the hype is well deserved. Rather than rehash what other reviewers have already said, I'll mention a couple of things that I found to be different. First, instead of indifferent or rude service, we enjoyed excellent, personable service from Felipe. Second, cash and the Peter Luger credit card are not the only accepted forms of payment; they also accept debit cards. If yelp* would allow it, I would have given a rating of 4-1-2 stars for the excellent porterhouse, but probably would have given five stars if the porterhouse had been a ribeye, instead. Oh, and coffee with a side of schlag is a fantastic way to finish your meal.
The corrupt, pompous "maitre d" is about the rudest person ever encountered in NYC. With so many choices, how they are still around with that service level is incredible. That was my last time.

I cannot believe I waited so long to come here. Â We were seated half hour after our reservation time. Â The steak did not live up to the hype. Highly disappointed. Â The only reason why I would go back is to buy the SLAB BACON. Â That was the highlight of my dinner.

When people tell you to try this restaurant they are not asking they are telling. After eating at this particular restaurant you feel like you've been transported back to New York City where every leader delivered your meal with a white shirt yet it was still comfortable. Be on the delicious, wonderful meat that is served! Make sure you get a side or two because it is enough for me to fill a need to go container as well

I was looking forward to going to the original at the foot of the Williamsburg Bridge in Brooklyn for years and finally I did so tonight. The restaurant is very simply decorated and packed with unassuming people waiting for a table that's taken weeks to get a reservation for a Saturday night prime time. Â We were 5 Â and the bill was $ 535 w/o tip but we gorged wanting to taste everything. The waiters were outstanding !! The Shrimp cocktail had 6 jumbo shrimp that were very good, the onion rings and French fries were abundant and delicious. The creamed spinach was the only disappointment of the evening. I had the bone in Rib Eye steak at $56. It was absolutely fabulous. The meat was so soft I could cut it with a fork. I had it rare and I am very picky with my steak and in my opinion it was as good as it gets. The desert was shared and it was the decadent cow with lots of "schlag" whipped cream. This is a must dine when you have the chance. Cheers!!

I want to start by saying the food was phenomenal. Steak was perfect, sides were amazing. The reason I am only giving 3 stars is because my experience with the waiters was extremely negative. We had a group of 5 people and made reservations very far in advance. We were sat at a 4 top table with a 5th chair placed very awkwardly at one side. This chair was also located in an isle which people/servers constantly were walking by. I was repeatedly shoved or elbowed by waiters as they walked by. I would look at them after they bumped me to see if they would excuse or apologize, but none of them even turned to look at me. This went on all night so I ended up leaning awkwardly in my chair to avoid the elbowing on my back. Additionally, at the end of the night when the check came around the waiter asked how much we wanted to tip which i feel is very unprofessional. We asked if we had to say it now and he told us we had to tell him. It was uncomfortable the way he rushed us to tell him the tip. To come to a nice restaurant and pay a LOT of money and receive this kind of treatment is really bad.
The lunch burger is the best burger I've had in my entire life. And I've had a LOT of burgers.

This was a damn good place, although I have to say it didnt blow me away. Â I mean I appreciate how irritable the waiters were, how basic the atmosphere was, the whole ritual from no menus to 3 steak options to gold coins...but for some reason, the food wasn't the best I've had. Â I feel like I've had a better steak than what I got from Peter Luger's; maybe I played the expectations game too much, and I will give it another shot once I actually have that kind of money, but the food wasn't mind-blowing in my opinion

For my very first eat and visit to BK, my bff Â and cousin Prissy Prius brought me to the German steakhouse, Peter Lugers, for my birthday dinner. Before tasting every savory meat selection, I immediately fixated on the thickest BACON I've ever had in my life. I literally could only consume a third lol. What an amazing experience for a very old and grounded steakhouse. Expensive, but definitely worth the experience and menu. And what a treat... the schlaaag was too amazing, you can actually put on anything lol What a wonderful word... SchhlAAaaaAAagGGgG.

This place is awesome. As they say, it's not the steak, it's the sizzle. The steak is pretty damn good though. The porterhouse medium rare is great! Go at lunch to get a cheeseburger as a side in addition to your steak. One of the best burgers I've had. No need for ketchup. Bacon appetizer is a must. The whipped cream schlag at dessert is amazing. Service and German beer hall atmosphere are awesome. Â I'm ready to go back tomorrow!

I had always wanted to try Peter Luger's but was so disappointed. This place is so over-rated. The staff act like its privilege for us to be dining there. I had a lunch reservation for 12:45PM and when we got there, there was a long line, tons of empty tables and we still had to wait. Very chaotic. The steak (had the steak for 2 cooked medium), although a good cut, was very fatty and greasy. The cocktail sauce was good but the steak should've held its own and had its own flavors. I definitely prefer Benjamins in the city (the chef supposedly used to work at Peter Lugers) and Uncle Jacks. The creamed spinach was inedible, it was way overcooked and smelled awful.
The Steak for two is the best nuff said. ... Order it medium well & let the platter the steak comes on, cook the steak piece by piece as u indulge w/ your date.

Guys! Hype is real! If you value fu-fu decoration and all that bullshit that has nothing to do with the food, don't come here. But if you are in it for the mere orgasmic steak experience, this is the spot. I have been in to so many steakhouses and Peter Luger's is the -by far- best steak I've ever had. It's a very old school New York institution. The nuttiness of the dry-aged steak is very strong( the best way possible). I am drooling as I am writing. Maybe I should call'em and make an other reservation right now :)
What more could you ask for? Great food albeit at a high price. If you're down to really enjoy your steak, have fun
Steak is amazing and juicy. I love the sides. It really lives up to the hype. But it's best to make reservations in advance

They stopped including this place in the ratings becuase it was first for so long. Â Unbelievable, unique, old fashion, fun. Â The menu is "steak for one, steak for two, ... steak for more." Â the salad is a slice of tomato. Â This place is fantastic.

I would have given this place a 5 star if they accepted credit cards. Thank god we had a debit card. Â It's either cash or debit card. Â Certainly not convenient if you are out on business. This would have been embarrassing if we weren't all friends. Â Accept credit cards. I'll pay the extra 3 percent!!! The food is absolutely outstanding! Â Best porterhouse ever!!!!!

What a disappointment! Â I was there this evening with three friends and was hoping to show them a good time. Â The steak they brought us was not even eatable!!! Â The wait staff didn't seem to care as did his Manager. Â They just want to get you in and then get you out. Â Poor food quality and very poor service!

Nothing to say here that hasn't already been said. I challenge anyone to find a better steakhouse. This place is world class and the steaks are absolutely incredible. Anybody who puts less that 5 stars is delusional and probably considers Olive Garden to be excellent Italian food. A++

An institution. You come for the steak not the ambiance. It's obnoxiously loud in here. Reservations are booked up in advance and when you show up you still have to wait. They make you get a drink first before they seat you. The bacon is really good here and we usually order 2 of those to share. The giant cocktail shrimp is also good. Porterhouse for 2 is usually sufficient for a party of 4 since we order other stuff to go with it. My gripe with them is that my steak comes too burnt and I'm not about burnt food. You usually have to scrape off the burnt parts before eat. Dessert for us is usually the key lime or the pecan pie. You get a huge piece so def food to share. The service is a bit abrupt and pushy. They only take cash or their lugers credit card which is a bit sketchy in my opinion but they've been around a long time so perhaps there's some kinda loophole or they have really good accountants. Because of that I prefer places like Del Friscos or Wolfgang or Mastros where you get good steak, good service and better ambiance.

Best. Steak. Ever. Me and my wife shared the porterhouse for 2 and once I saw it on the plate sizzling I knew I was in for a treat. The steak was so tender and perfectly cooked and seasoned. The fat was delicious too...melted like butter in my mouth.

By far the best place to have steak in Brooklyn or LI. I have been to both locations which each have a very different feel. The Brooklyn location is more old school style, while LI was more on the fancier side and probably better for going with my whole family. Interestingly enough, the porter house was better at the LI location than Brooklyn; the meat had less fat but this definitely could have been a one off. Either location the must haves are: bacon, steak of two, etc, creamed spinach and potato's. If you're not stuffed to the brim after all of that then go for the ice cream sunday. It's to DIE for. Just seals the deal for a food baby.

The best never changes. Â Ribeye was the best beef I have had in years. Â Onion rings were on point, crispy but light and flavorful. Last star only for lack of any change for sides (throw me some Brussels or some rabe) and the seat next to the kitchen door. Â I love 800 degree plates buzzing past me. Â Karl was awesome and we got rowdy Â  A good time was had by all. Amazing South African red blend starts with a T

This place only takes cash and wants you to order without a menu. The steak is pretty good--not the best I've had though. The sides are OK. I think this place is a bit over-rated. Might as well stay in the city.

column3: La Jolla Shores, San Diego, CA
column6: You guys who gave Peter Luger just one or two stars are nuts -- I won't bother reading any of your other reviews because your taste buds are obviously fried. I've had a LOT of steaks in my life, and the porterhouse I shared with a friend at Peter Luger was definitely among the top five I've EVER had. Sure, there are other places that can cook a great steak, but very few of them (and definitely not the chains like Morton's and Ruth's) have one of the owners visiting the meat market EARLY every morning looking for the very best cuts for the restaurant. And very few of them do the extensive dry aging that Luger does. Some steaks may get close to this good, but -- honestly -- none are better.

Dear god, if I have to dream about steak, I dream of nothing but Peter Luger. Would love to go back there every week and happily have a heart attack each time. If I didn't live in the bay area. Whenever people ask about the best steak house in America, I say, "Have you been to Peter Luger Steak House?" The servers are also quite characters. Steak, Burgers, heart attack inducing but who cares if the steak is THAT good. Why can't they have the same kind of steak elsewhere? I would not order tomatoes there. Sort of expensive for a slide of tomato.
Steak flavor is fantastics but not the best. Service is not good, all waiters has attitude just because is an iconic restaurant. cash only made it worst.

After hearing so much about this restaurant we decided to go on our next trip to NY. Â We must of come on an off night because our server seemed a little disturbed. Â The food was decent but fell short of our expectation given that this was supposed to be one of the best steak houses in NY.
We have been coming here for over 40 years and it's never change if it's not broke don't fix it love this place great food good service .....

The short wait after our initial reservation was unbelievably worth it. Peter Luger is a well oiled machine that puts out amazing food effortlessly. Not to mention the charismatic staff that produces an entertaining experience. Great time

In America (in comparison to Europe), I think the steak here is as good as it gets. We made a reservation here and were promptly seated. Service was great and the side dish of broccoli that we ordered was actually decent. The juices that flowed from one side of the steak to the other as the waiter cut the steak (we ordered steak for 3) really gave the steak that extra boost of flavor without overcooking the sizzling T-bone. Make a reservation and try it out! But like others have mentioned, bring cash unless you have a Peter Luger credit card.
Beat lunch burger in the entire city. Been coming here for years. Makes me want to spend more time in Brooklyn. Johnny Carson says he's had the best meal of his life at Lugers, I concur.

I love their thick bacons as they are the most delicious bacons I have ever tried. I ordered a T-bone steak which was median to well done. It tastes good but I think median raw steak maybe better. The service is good. The waiters passionately greeted us and friendly took photos for us.

We went last Saturday to Peter Luger and had a reservation for 2 at 7:45pm. We got a drink (note they are made like doubles) at the bar, but we're seated at our table within 5 minutes of the reservation on a super busy night. We didn't order appetizers as we knew the portions were going to be really big, and that was a good choice. The steak for two and a side was plenty enough. The steak was cooked to perfection, we ordered medium and it was up fairly quick. It had a tender center while still being crispy and having a peppercorn like crunch on the outside. The German potato side, which is like has browns were a good complement to the meal. For wine we had their house Cabernet which I'd compare to a Beringer or other mid-level Cab. They have an extensive selection if you are looking for a bottle. Overall, a great steakhouse experience and probably the best steak we've ever had.

Wow, ok lemme start by saying I live in Manhattan and I'm lucky enough to eat at all the mediocre spots as well as the best steakhouses in the city. I've waited 6 years to come to this spot and the only reason I didn't come sooner was bc it takes 2 months to get a res and it's in BK. I'm lucky enough to eat at Bowery meat, sparks, Wolfgang's, Keens, delmonico's, etc and was incredibly excited for this NYC staple. Total tourist trap. 45 mins to get seated so that you order drinks at the bar. Mediocre service at best. Steak legitimately comparable to a Capital grille at best. Baked potato dry as could be. Waiter had no idea where the single option Pinot Noir wine was from. Dessert was probably the best part which isn't saying much. Listen, this isn't a tourist review... we eat at every good restaurant in NYC from the best to the average. This place just isn't worth the hype. Seriously. Trust me.

This place serves a fantastic porterhouse, which I don't think will surprise you given the reputation and the reviews. Â The wines were a heavy pour, which I appreciated, and I'd agree with all of the reviews about the bacon being awesome! Â  I don't get what the hype is with the tomato and onion appetizer - more than $10 for a couple slices of raw tomatoes and onions seems a bit strange, and the steak sides were good but not excellent (creamed spinach and German potatoes). Â All in all though, the steak made the meal, and the sundae after wasn't bad either! Â If it weren't so darn difficult to get a reservation - we dined at 4:45 PM on a Sunday with three weeks advance notice on our reservation, we'd be back soon. Â As is, well keep it on the list for a future special occasion, and book with lots of notice!

The reference point for all great steakhouses. Â Not fancy, not complicated, just good. Â Bacon is amazing, steak is amazing, drinks are great, and at the end of the night you'll still have money in your wallet.
My favorite steakhouse house on the planet! Served family style, no need for any sauce. Always cooked perfectly medium rare and they age it themselves! Â I go every year for my bday

Everything we expected. Â Went there for lunch on a fairly busy Wednesday. We were seated within 5 minutes of our reservation. Â Steak for 3, legendary cream spinach and thick cut onion rings were brought out quickly. Best. Steak. Ever. $$$, but worth it. Â Finished with apple strudel and pecan pie, with about a quart of fresh whipped cream "Schlag". Awesome. This is a special occasion type of place, with Davidoff Cigar store conveniently located a couple doors down. Â Quite a few tourists as well. A lively, friendly, but down to business New York atmosphere.

Not sure what else can be said about the legendary Peter Luger Steak House in Brooklyn. This is a good as it gets folks for a steak dinner. I went with a group of 4 and found the prices to be extremely reasonable for the amount of food we ordered and the quality. We had reservations in advance and were seated promptly. Our waiter was outstanding, funny & charming he made the meal that much better although I do not recall his name but he had been there for many years. I cannot wait to go back, as this is the perfect steakhouse for a grand night out with friends & family. Long live the king Peter Luger

My husband had the porterhouse steak and I had the Salmon. I love the non stop attention from the waiters, they are all on the ball and good at what they do. I love the spinach that is served with the meal. Enjoyed my first time here

One of, if not the best steak i have ever had. Â dry aged goodness! Â bread basket was great, salad rocked, onion rings perfect, and the hamburger with bacon was a great burger. Â Got the key lime pie and it was great. Â all good here

One of the best. The perfect place to enjoy a great steak alongside terrific sides while being tended to by funny and graceful waitstaff. Part of the meal is the old-world no table-cloth German beerhall feel you'll get as you enjoy your steak.
Wonderful meal. Â Wonderful, professional servers. Â Ambience *meh*

I wish I could eat here everyday. The steak melts in my mouth and the creamed spinach is to die for. So is the schlag, and I don't really have a sweet tooth! I've stopped by for lunch and the burger is pretty decent too, although not the best.

It's not bad. It's even worth the experience at least once because of the brand's reputation and history. However, it's far from living up to the hype. Food and drinks were average for a steakhouse at this price. Service had a unique character to it. No need to dress up: shorts, sandals and suitcases in tow are okay. They don't take credit cards.
This place was amazing ! Food was top of the line . Service is outstanding . I will recommend you make reservations before hand .

Great steak! Service is fast. Simple menu. Just no down side. Good house sauce. Steak for two is a bargain and well worth it. Creamed spinach is a hit. Very good for groups too. They make it a great atmosphere and focus on great food.

Horrible steak that had no flavor. Given cold, crusty bread. They don't offer mashed potatoes with steak. Steak itself was bland and flavorless. They also don't take credit cards. I've had better experiences at Outback. Would not recommend. Go to Del Frisco's instead.
porter house is out of this world but thats about it, everything else was average. But you go to a steak house for steak. No their sides

This was a late birthday lunch. We ordered the steak for two, thick cut bacon, and German fried potatoes. Everything was excellent! We ordered the steak medium rare and it was cocked to perfection. The German potatoes were sautÃ©ed with onions and toasted nicely. The thick cut bacon was both meaty Â and fatty with a hint of smokiness.
What can I say... Awesome, but muy expensivo!!!!! Expect to spend $100 per person. Service, a C+, decor D, prices D-, BUT "la carne", the meat, the steak, the beef, the reason you go there: A+

Wow! I am not even a real fan of red meat (maybe have red meat 4 or 5 times a year) but I had an exceptional dining experience! You don't come here for the ambiance or romance or to hold hands - it's all about you and your steak and there's no need to be shy about it and the folks working here will do their best to make it memorable for you - great service.

You know a place is special if it comes off as overhyped yet still lives up to it. Peter Luger's fits that rare category. Which is good because it's not cheap and requires a hike. Steak for three was great! And just right for 3 grown men to enjoy. They do cook it a little on the rarer side so keep that in mind. I ordered medium which came out medium rare and was perfect. Onion ring sides and pecan pie desert were delicious. But the best item is the special homemade steak sauce. So good I had to take some home w me.

I had been looking forward to visiting Peter Lugars for months. I planned it being the highlight of our trip to New York. I have to say I wasn't overly impressed. The side items were really good. The bacon is something to experience. The potatoes were really good and the desert was out of this world. Once we were seated the service was fantastic. Now as far as the main entree. I have to say I was really disappointed with our porterhouse for 3. It looked absolutely delicious. However when I tasted it I have to say it was a little tough and extremely bland. Their must be a shortage of salt and pepper in Brooklyn. For the time you wait and the heavy price tag you pay for the meal, I wouldn't recommend it. I'm sorry to say, there are better steaks out there. Wayyyy better. The atmosphere was really good but the food average. I won't go back if I'm ever in the area.

I tried steak for two, and it tasted good. However, their service, compared to the price which was 140, (including beverages I ordered) wasn't as good as the taste. I ordered 2 cokes, and waiter confirmed it by saying "I'll bring two cokes", but brought two sprite instead. Also, it took awhile for me to call him to the table, (He didn't actually come because I called, he came when it was ready to serve the steak) even when I was keep saying excuse me to order something more. Â His gaze was only occupied with 2 tables away. Â I still gave waiters 20 percent tip though.
The steak for two with creamed spinach and onion rings is all you'll ever needed. Order it medium rare, and cover it in the hot butter that's served with the porterhouse. Thank me later.

The steaks are absolutely amazing. When. My family and I went here after hearing so much about it, Peter Luger's lived up to the hype. The steaks are huge, juicy, and flavorful. I would highly recommend to all steak lovers.

The best in nyc still. The steak is still the best around sorry all you lugers haters who are popping up its still rocks and shines. If you are ever around for lunch make sure you have the lugers bacon cheeseburger. Bring lots of cash only no credit cards and for dinner call way in advance. Best steakhouse in nyc still!
It was a guys night out and what better dinner than steak?! Well let's say we all enjoyed our steak dinners. Service was great, food was great. First visit for some of us but won't be the last.

Have I really not written up Peter Luger? I guess it goes without saying, to a degree. In any event, bar none, this is the best steak anywhere (for the love of everything, do not order it beyond medium rare and, honestly, rare is not necessary). Â It is also the best burger. Â The shrimp cocktail and wedge will delight. Am not one for desserts, but you do need to get something with their homemade whipped cream. Â I never totally got the appeal of the bacon, but it's quite good with Luger sauce or in the wedge (unclear why they've never done a BLT, other than their general attitude towards tomato and lettuce), just don't put it on your burger.

After coming here for over 35 years this place is getting played out. The dining room is mainly filled with tourists and first timers. The steak is always good, but not great. Last 2 times I had to send the steak back because it was way too bloody and I asked for rare closer to medium. After not wanting to order the steak anymore I've discovered their lamb chops is something out of this world. Must try lamb chops when you're there. Don't forget the shlog!!!
Best steakhouse in the world. Â The gruff service is all part of the charm. Â Do yourself a favor and get 1 or 2 pieces of bacon as an appetizer.

This meal was built up in my mind for 3 months prior to our visit to NYC... I was a little worried it would not live up to our expectations. Â As you can tell by my rating, it did. Â We started with a slice of bacon then the porterhouse for two with creamed spinach & German potatoes... all very delicious but the steak was the true star. Â Drinks were strong and service was great. Â If you are wondering if the hype is worth the trip... it definitely is.

I never understand why they are rated as high as they are. The food is better than average for a steak but not the best. Â I hate the service there and I know that's why people go but I don't need attitude when I go out to eat. Â If you have not been you should go, but I only go when dragged.
The bacon was really good. The service not so much. The waiter only smiled and asked what we need when they getting tipper.
Reservation extremely bad. Took 20 minutes for someone to answer the phone and made me wait for another 20 minutes without answering any questions.
Steak was fantastic tender and cooked to absolute perfection. Â The waiter was a bit pushy at first but hey were in NYC he's just being himself lol. Â I would go back again so that's that.

A legend. Y'all are a matriarch. Love it's in the family and y'all prepare the same way as my ancestors have dined. Old school is appreciated. Thank you for keeping books! Porterhouse is the way to go! Worth the ride

Went there for my birthday. Â 9 people. Â  Ordered steak for 11. DELICIOUS!!!!!! steak was soooooo good. Melted in my mouth. Excellent excellent service. Â These are the professionals that make a great restaurant. Â Sides were amazing. Â I will definitely go back. Â Prices were typical of a great steak house. I have been there before but this time I was blown off my feet with the service. Â Absolutely the best. Â Must try. Â Won't be disappointed.

We didn't have to make a reservation when we came in a group of 5. We got there around 3pm on a weekday and seating was instant. It's pretty much going to come out to $65 per person. The steak is definitely worth hype and you should definitely make the trip to try once if your into steaks.

Steak! It's all about the porterhouse. The bacon appetizer rivals the steak - it's a must try. Make sure you come hungry and bring cash, no credit cards here. I've been to Lugers many times and have yet to be disappointed.
Well what can I say. First off make your reservation early as possible Â then ready your self for greatness

We came we conquered and we will never dine so fine. Â The dining experience was next level stuff. Â Came with a group of 8 and were taken care of from the bacon appetizers to the cream spinach to finally the porterhouse. Â It was a feast like no other and service tgat kept us enteryained all night. Â Exceeded all my expectations. Â The cost was not an issue. Â As they say the juice was worth the squeeze.

We were told this was the best steakhouse in the world and the porterhouse with creamed spinach was awesome. Â We had the tomatoes and onions with a strip of the bacon and sauce. Â The best spinach we ever had...
I don't normally eat beef but I would return to this place in a heartbeat. Dining is casual, service is quick, you really have time to enjoy the huge slices of perfectly cooked steak!

Not sure what all the hype about this place is. Their menu is limited and the food was average - had the steak for one and salmon. The service was very good but I was hoping for better tasting food for the price.
the Steak here is so good! lives up to the hype

Does this place even need a review??! This is hands down THE king of the porterhouse. Yes, the service is gruff...but just sit down, order a porterhouse for 2, shut up and proceed to chew your buttery aged steak (preferably bloody) and experience multiple portgasms. 5 STARS. THE END. PERIOD.
loveqdddd, Â try the schlaagggg its the best. Â Steak is good, but the cheesecake is amazzzzing
Sometimes I like to stand by the window and imagine it was me eating at this restaurant...
Excellent, tender steak. Easily worth the price and deserves best steakhouse in NYC. Our waiter was great. Really enjoyed the bacon, baked potato, broccoli, strawberries and homemade whipped cream.

Finally made it here after hesitating for so long. Not the best steak I've had, but it is cooked very well. I think you are paying more for the service and experience here. The quality of the food itself was excellent, very fresh and tasty. The baked potato was creamy and hot, the porterhouse was well-prepared (yet in my opinion lacked flavor and personality), the creamed spinach was nicely prepared and complemented the meat and potatoes. The steak was very tender, but again, I prefer something more unique. The ends were nicely charred, which added another dimension, if only the rest of if had texture and flare.

Server was average, steak was good, but not $50 pp good. I'd recommend a filet a Benjamin's steak house if you're looking to drop $50 on a steak. For all the hype, I left disappointed. One positive thing: the drinks were STRONG so I was able to mask my disappointment with the lackluster steak.

So we have gone to the one in great neck a few times and love it but some of my husband's friends have been bragging about the Brooklyn location so we decided to give it a try for his Birthday. .....what a mistake (it does not even compare) the only reservation I could get was 12:45 on Sunday we arrived on time and had to wait on a very long line just to get up to the hostess and then had to wait to be seated even though there were plenty of open tables (annoying) the tables were all warped butcher block (don't know if that's on purpose or not but dumb) we started with some cocktails and a bottle of flat pellagrino which was replaced immediately Â and a very nice bread basket which was ruined by the sloppy sliced off a Â block pieces of butter they put on the table (seriously )....I ordered a wedge salad that came out as a 1 inch slice of lettuce (not a wedge) w crumbled blue cheese bacon and tomatos...no dressing....Really? ( $15.95 by the way) also got the shrimp cocktail and that was okay but the cocktail sauce was terrible Â and a few shrimp tasted dirty also we got a slice of bacon which was excellent Â .... for entree we chose the porterhouse for 2 done medium well at first sight it looked over cooked but was raw in the middle the outside was way over seared (crunchy) and it went from well done to raw some parts were very chewy and dry this was because .....and I don't know what the chef was thinking.....after they already sliced our steak they decided to put it back in the oven (Gross) cmon that's just cooking 101 that's how u ruin a piece of meat .....also baked potato was very dry ....but I will say this our server was amazingly cheerful and pleasant and we never had to try and find him when we needed something ....there should be more like him he gave me a giant bag of bones for my dogs which I thought was very nice .....so needless to say we will not be returning to this location ...there will not be any second chances (too many rookie mistakes for me) I will however continue to go to the great neck location where the food was worth the money

Was a very old school experience with warm service and properly prepared delicious food. Sorry about the late review. But I'm guessing the prior reviews prove this place is worth the drive to Brooklyn.

Freakin Steak is effin amazing! I haven;t been here since 2004/2005 but i still remember the taste of that steak in my mouth right now as I type this review. You know what I need to go back there lol!!

Been coming here for years. Always great. I'm having the porterhouse tonight but love to come for the cheeseburger at lunch. I can always get in and out fast for lunch. Â The creamed spinach is also great. Not for the faint of heart. They do open heart here.
Best bacon ever! The steak was good too but the bacon is defiantly the number one you could almost only have bacon and do without steak but both are great!

If I could give this restaurant a negative 5 stars I would. My husband and I planned a trip to get away for Christmas and decided to come to NYC. We started scouting out steakhouses. I saw great reviews for this restaurant so decided to give it a try. They don't take reservations online so I called them. The girl that answered the phone seemed to be in a rush to get me off the phone, but I got a reservation. We had made the reservation 2 weeks prior to the trip. We arrived in NYC and we still hadn't received a confirmation email or call. I started calling the restaurant 3 days prior to confirm our reservation. No answer....I probably called over 20 times over the following 2 days with NO ANSWER! Finally 4 hours before our reservation I got through and guess what.....they didn't have a reservation for us. They even told us we don't take reservations after 9:00. Our reservation was at 9:30. My husband talked to one of the staff and was able to get us a table for that evening. We where so excited to get in after all the raving reviews. We where also bringing our family members that flew in from South Carolina to try this awesome steakhouse. We arrived a bit early and they where able to get us right in. We where seated and given menus. The waiter asked us how we liked our steaks prepared, we told him. He seemed very pushy and not really interested in any questions we had about the menu. He didn't even ask about drinks or starters. To our surprise we didn't get to select what steak we wanted. You order for how many people are at the table. So we got a steak for 4. We where each given a slice of there famous bacon. I was so excited to try this. I love bacon! It was thick, greasy and tasted like bad ham. The steaks came out and it was a porterhouse. It was covered in a greasy butter that was spooned over the top. You don't get a choice of sides either. It's dried chopped up potatoes and soggy cream less spinach. The steak was not good at all and I felt sick after eating it. The potatoes where flavorless and I couldn't make myself even try the spinach. At the end of the meal you are given cheap milk chocolate coins that look like something left over from St. Patrick's day. Overall it was a terrible experience and terrible food. I really don't get how this restaurant gets such great reviews. My husband and I have traveled all over the world and have eaten at some of the best steakhouses in the country. This was by far one of the worst we have been too. If you want bad service and food this is your place. We walked out of there confused and feeling sick from the whole experience. Plus the place smelled bad. Don't waste your time or money

This place lives up to its name as being one of the best steakhouses in NYC. My family and I got medium rare steak and well done. Typically, I order medium rare because I don't like tough meat. However, the well done steak was actually very moist and tasty. The medium rare was more red than expected. I personally would go for medium well or well done at this place. The bacon was also very delicious. Expect to spend a lot of money though.
Delicious, the porterhouse for 3 was delicious, a bit pricey but worth it. The hamburgers are great, good size and value, very juicy. Reservations highly recommended.
The steak was fresh and juicy. The sauce was delicious as were the German Fried Potatoes. The waiter was great. Decor is simple but the feel is Very Old New York. The bar area was packed!!!
Pretty good steak and the prices are reasonable. The service is excellent they cater to your every need and make recommendations for first timers.

So disappointing. I went there with my family for my birthday dinner. The waiter came over immediately with some steak sauce and asked what we wanted to drink we ordered one of 4 and we're taking to long for him so he said he'll get the first drink and come back( mind you he gave us 20 seconds to decide on the drinks). Then he came back with the drink we ordered and some bread, then took the other drink orders. He then asked us do you guys want menus- we said yes and he put them on the table... didn't pass them around. He came back quickly with the other drinks and asked us for our order. After he left he took the menus, and we took a bite of bread that was cold and stale. So needless to say we didn't eat it. That's when we noticed the sauce dish that contained the steak sauce was chipped. The steak was cooked perfectly and came out in a timely manner but was not impressed with the service or the side dishes. The steaks were very delicious but not with anything else. Very disappointed with the experience especially Â due to the high price tag (which I don't mind paying if it's good).

I have been going to Peter Luger Steak House for years. It is, hands down, the best porterhouse I've ever had (and I love steakhouses). However, the attitude, the customer service and the general demeanor of every single person I've come across (waiter, reservationist, manager) is absolutely deplorable. Yes, you have a good product, but no, it doesn't mean you can treat people who are spending big money like crap.

I went here a month ago .. and I'm still daydreaming about how the steak melted in my mouth and coupled with the oh so delish peter lugers red wine..what a meal! I'm personally a fan of white wine but wow, their red wine is so yum that we couldn't stop at just one bottle! we started off with apps: bacon tomatoes and onions.. i'm not a fan of tomatoes but surprisingly very delish along with the sauce drippled on top! the food was just amazing. and the service was really great, they were attentive, they basically tell you what to order and they aren't your typical stiffy waiters that you expect at steakhouses.. and i like how accommodating they were esp with such a large group of people.. overall, one of the best dining experiences i've ever had at a steakhouse!

I came to NY thinking only of 1 thing, be able to come here & eat steak! I was GREATLY satisfied! My family of6 ordered Steak for 4, lamb chops & sides. This is Steak at its best. The meat was over an inch thick, but tender to the bite.
So so so so good. Highly recommend the creamed spinach to go with your steak and try the steak sauce with your rolls strange but really good!!

Old school 131 your old tradition with the take it or leave it attitude and I love it. There is a reason it takes a month to get a table and you take what you can get and you smile. This place is bomb!

Let's be real, everyone has heard of PL. If you haven't I'm sorry for your taste buds and lack of enjoyment they have received. You MUST correct this at once and head over there, right now! I don't have slightest clue where to begin... If you don't have a reservation it's generally not a problem.They usually put you by the bar have a drink and relax. Once seated I go straight for the porterhouse, creamed spinach, onion rings & German fried potatoes. (you're welcome) The service is undeniably great. The meat is aged to perfection. The drinks are always prepared properly. Is it pricey? Sure, is it worth it? F*CK YES!

Yum yum yum yum!!!!! The steak was amaze balls!!! The dessert was delicious. I love the homey feeling you get. Everything seems so vintage and old school. I don't think it was that pricey either!!! The only thing is that you have make reservations three months in advance, which is a bit nuts. But I will definitely be going back. Peter lugar is a must visit restaurant.
Steaks are aged 24 days in their basement fridge. That makes them taste so good. The sides are good too. This place has been here since the late 1800's. Bring cash. They don't take credit cards!

Popped in for lunch today. They've raised the price of the burger so it's no longer one of the best bargains in NY, but it's definitely STILL THE BEST BURGER IN NEW YORK. (Only available at lunch.) It's mid-June now, might be the best thing I've tasted so far this year. Oh, and get one slice of bacon on the side!

Amaaaazing steak. It's a must try. The only issue is the line if you have no reservation it will take a while but totally worth it. Always go for what they recommend and try it with their sauce, I don't know what it is made from but it's just amazing.

The other night my family and I ate at Peter Lugers for the first time. Food was out of this world. Martin was our server. What a professional, made our experience a wonderful one. Offered up suggestions off the menu, couldn't say enough good things. Can't wait to go again.
Ordered medium rare steak for 2...the top side was seared well, the bottom side had barely a grill mark on it =/ disappointed. Barely seasoned.

Celebrated our 27th anniversary here on the 9th. What can I say that hasn't been said by other patrons?? FANTASTIC PIECE OF MEAT! Onion and tomato app, bread basket with crusty warm bread, medium rare steak for two with french fries, two glasses of wine, one beer, chocolate mousse, pecan pie with a TON of schlag on the side. The price, to us, is justified on account that 1) it was a perfect piece of steak 2) filet mignon 3) enough food to feed MORE that two people 4) Michelin star rating deserved. The service was great. We had reservations and were sat within five minutes. Our server was attentive and sweet. The only reason I give it four stars is because decor and bathrooms need updating. Doesn't have to be a drastic change but certainly an updated antique look is in order?? Just don't change the steaks! That is perfection.

Steak was on point. I ordered the steak for 2. 10/10. Sides were honestly trash. The creamed spinach was terrible. At a table of 6 not one person enjoyed it. The potatoes were pretty basic, nothing special in my opinion. Onion rings were good but cold. Honestly did not think it lived up to the hype. I would most definitely prefer every other steak house I've been to over Peter Lugers.

We had the steak for two, german potatoes, cream of spinach and thick cut bacon. Â  Service was good, food was just ok , good portions. Â  We have had way better steak though. Â Glad we went for the experience since this is a famous old school steak house but doubt we will go back.

As good as you've heard, and I loved the experience. Â Note: this place is all about the steak and efficiency, so not a place with lots of plush interior decorating, and your server is going to be polite but probably not too chatty. Â I admire a truly efficient experience, so loved that we were in, fed, and finished in an hour. Â The quality of the steak was outstanding, really tender and perfectly cooked. Â My manhattan was delicious with a perfect ratio of ingredients. Â We also had a slice of bacon as an appetizer--it's more like pork belly than "bacon," but also delicious. Â A must go for any steak lover.

Dining at Peter Luger is definitely an event. One that is very enjoyable when shared with a group of food-loving friends. The anticipation grows as the smell of steak hits you from a couple of blocks away. Once you walk in you will find a lively, fun bar ambiance. After hanging out at the bar for a few minutes we were escorted to our table upstairs. Once there, we were greeted by our server who reminded me of one of my drunk uncles: honest, not afraid to hurt your feelings, but funny and a good time. He quickly some good recommendations (in a "Trust me, I know what I"m talking about" kind of way) and took our orders. The bread basket that was placed before us was enough to feed a small nation and had a very nice variety of carbs. Now on to the meat of the matter (hee hee). The American fries were my favorite side. The cream spinach was just ok. The steak itself was good. One of the better one's I've had but I wouldn't say it changed my life. Once again one of those cases where the hype didn't live up to the expectations. Desert, however, was my favorite part of the meal. The apple strudel at first looked a little funny, but was ridiculously good...especially when topped with that bomb schlag. The cheesecake was sweet, creamy, and dense. Overall, a very fun dining experience that should be tried at least once.
Decent steak but does not deserve the hype. I wouldn't put it in the top 10 steakhouses in New York City. The bacon is awesome though!

Had to call several times before I managed to make a reservations. Steak was pretty good but less flavourful than expected. Lamb chop was excellent though and stole the show. Totally outshined the steak. Service was poor - waiter was extremely rude. All in all, food's good but given the poor service and price, I would think twice about coming again.
Had another good time, although it bothers me that getting a table with a reservation again required a 15 minute wait. Oh well, I saw JYP there. If he had to wait, then I won't fuss.
Awesomeness all round! Bacon a must have...the steak was perfect(listen to the recommendations and order it medium rare only way to have it!). Â It is pricey but worth it for special occasions!

This restaurant is very good with server thinking they know more than chefs. As a client I always try to bring out the best of the staff but some of then think they know it all. Steak talking now was very good. Not likely I couldn't forget to talk about for a week. Surprised but true. Not that memorable. Will come more for lunch since I live 4 blocks away.

Tonight I took my husband out for his birthday here, as we entered the lovely man in front was very nice to us from the start. We sat down and from the start our waiter was very rude, we ordered all our food, got everything has we ordered. The food was delicious as we began eating we decided on getting a bottle of wine, we tried to get our waiters attention he ignored us. We also tried to get a hold on two other waiters and same thing. No one even came to check on us until we were done eating and ready for the check. Everyone around us was getting checked on 2-3 times. I've been coming here since a little girl my father always took me and my whole family for every event we had. I feel like the waiter thought just because it was just my husband & I and not a big party of people, he wasn't going to get a big tip. Well he screwed himself. Very disappointed my husband never wants to go back. Once was my favorite place.

Horrible service. Asian families has to wait for seating longer than American families. I find that a bit strange. My mother and I had to wait 40 minutes ++ just to get seated. Meanwhile other people (party of 2) can get seated right away. Food was good though.

I actually had dinner her early March (treated my guy, who is a man's man) for his birthday) and again on Mother's Day. Both visits were exceptional. Â The service is excellent, food delicious and we weren't rushed out of the door after we finished our meals. Â Didn't hurt that I had a birds eye view of Micheal Strahan the first time I went. Â Whew!!! Â Glad my guy didn't feel disrespected as I stared across the room just about the entire time. Â Ok, enough with the jokes. I can't wait to go back to Peter Luger. Â They cut out all the frilly stuff and give the best service and quality food anyone can ask for. Thanks you guys!!!

Our party of four descended to Brooklyn to try this fantastical steakhouse ranked one of the best in NYC- if not the world. Â Starting with the good, the restaurant is on a really cute street and the decor was clean and minimal while still honoring its past with lots of bric and bracs throughout the restaurant. Â We went on a Monday night with reservations and still waited about 15 minutes in a crowded bar with very limited seating. Once seated, our waiter was an older gentlemen who you can tell is bit jaded by it all and has grown weary of saying the same old thing over and over again to wide-eyed patrons- understandable, but still shitty. Â The menu itself lacks description and the prices makes you wonder what the hell is in an $18 salad (turns out not much). The cuts of meat were also not stated, and instead listed as steak for 1, 2, 3, or 4. We eventually figured out that the steak was a bone-in ribeye, so you get a larger piece if your table all like the steak to be done at the same wellness. Â Well done is frowned upon despite it being a cultural thing for one of my friends from El Salvador (she backed away and ordered medium well for one while the rest of us got a larger steak at medium rare). Â The steak came out hot and precut- this is the main reason for my 3 star rating. Â The first slice was impressive- a buttery and silky piece of beef that rivals wagyu due to their proprietary aging process. Â However, because the steak is pre-sliced- each bite is colder than the last, and the last bite is not appetizing at all as you're staring at a white plate splatter with oil and a bone. The $18 salad turned out to be the same portion of a regular side salad. Â I also thought the creamed spinach, fries, and potatoes were bland and overpriced. Â The free bread was extremely densed and served with a cold stick of butter that was unspreadable. Â The signature Luger steak sauce was tasty but nearly identical to Memphis bbq sauce. Â Overall, I am glad I finally went to see what all the fuss is about, and I think reading all the Yelp reviews in the world would still not be a substitute for trying it yourself. Â However, Peter Luger seems to want to it both ways- by offering limited frills yet gouging prices. Â Gouge away, but at least give me a superior experience. Â I would rename this now as Peter "No F given" Luger.

I've been coming to Lugers for 25 years. Â The best steak and shrimp cocktail in Brooklyn. The steak's reputation precedes itself and the shrimp are gigantic, fresh & succulent. Â We love the old favorites: creamed spinach, tomato & onion w/Lugar sauce and the potatoes. The drinks are good and strong! Â We usually take the delicious apple turnover w/homemade schlagg to go as we are too full to eat it right away. Â If we're not too full we have the "Holy Cow" (hot fudge Sunday.). The rolls they put on the table are also very good, the salty one is my favorite. Â Oh, let's not forget the chocolate coins at the end of the meal. The only down side is that the service varies from friendly to rushed so we inform the waiters upon seating that we will be dining leisurely. Â It's an expensive meal and we will not be rushed. Also, they only take their own credit card.
Wow!!! Â I will never go to Perry's and Morton again! Â Peter Luger is just in another league. Â It's like major vs minor league. Â No comparison!
Ahhhhh I have to say, medium rare is just not my thing. It's too oily and rare.

We had reservations yesterday for 6 people. We had called a month in advance to book these reservations and made it clear that it was to celebrate my sisters anniversary. In addition, on the day of the actual reservation, I called to reconfirm that they knew that it was going to be for my sisters anniversary. The said they had it already written down. When we got there we saw that another couple was celebrating their anniversary and that it was acknowledged by the servers. Therefore, I didn't feel the need to remind them a third time that it was my sisters anniversary. The servers were great, the food was great but unfortunately, the end of the dinner came and nothing happened. I didn't want to have get up and tell them but I did. Â I told our server who replied "no one told me" and pointed towards a manager. I now go to the manager and tell him the situation and he just shrugs his shoulders completely uninterested and says "Sorry, what do u want me to do about it..." I am completely disappointed with his reaction and his lack of concern. We paid almost $700 for dinner and this is the way you show you value your customers?
we went with the classics - steak for two, german potatoes, spinach and apple strudel - and did not disappoint! everything was amazing.

Peter Luger Steak House was everything that I expected when I went for an early dinner with my girlfriend for my birthday. Â The thick cut bacon was very good and my girlfriend's caesar salad was also good. Â The steak for two was very delicious, one of the best steaks I have had in New York City. Â It was almost $100 dollars for the steak but very much worth it. Â I would highly recommend this place to anybody but make sure to reserve your seat 2-4 weeks ahead of time. Â Overall, this is a true steak lover's paradise.

Still some of the best steak you can find in NYC. Savor the decadent buttery goodness as they pour over the hot drippings of your steak back onto the meat to add that extra cholesterol boosting deliciousness. Get the porterhouse. And instead of taking a picture of the food, why don't you try to eat it while it's still hot. Sides are good too, but the steak is the star of the show. Classy no-frills waiters and wooden stylings maintain the old school vibe at Luger's.

It was a horrible experience. Â We ordered steak for two, cream spinach, and a coffee. Â Our bill came out to $170. Â The check did not indicate tips and so we thought it was $170 plus tips and ended up paying $200. Â Later we realized they already added tips on the hand written check when you actually do the calculation on each dish. Â We paid double tips!

Slightly bewildered at the rave reviews this attracts. Particularly as to why such emphasis is placed on the reputed quality of the meat. I'm a big steakhouse fan and was really looking forward to giving this a try. The steak is pretty poor. If you want a big slab of meat this is for u. If you want a quality cut I would look elsewhere. I probably left half of my steak on the plate. The best part of the meal was the bread which in fairness was quite good. There's clearly a tourist crowd here and perhaps over time thats impacted the quality. I would rate this as a NY version of London's Angus steakhouse chain.

Can you give a place Six -Stars? Bucket list, Last meal on Earth type of Steak here. Coming all the way from Hawai'i, I can brag and share that I ate at the best Steakhouse in the World. We ordered our Steak, Medium rare and that was just Heavenly. We had wonderful service as a few waiters had some form of connections to the Islands. Thank You Peter Luger and Staff for a Wonderful, Unforgettable evening.
Great steak, great spinach, great bacon. Â I highly recommend.

I can go anywhere in the world to eat any cuisine I like but truth be told there's no place else in the world I would rather go to impress my own palette more than Peter Luger Steakhouse and my boy Tommy runs the place and keeps it sharp as a tack not to mention aside from their steak they have the best lamb chops money can buy and the most impressive wine list outside of France this place is a true goal mind and my favorite restaurant.

First time here!! AMAZING STEAK, amazing sides, the German home fries were to die for! The service was absolute perfection! Mike from Turkey was an absolute gem!! He definitely made our visit fun and enjoyable!! He was very attentive and so welcoming!! His sense of humor made our visit more than just a meal!! Definitely ask for him when u make your reservation for the best steakhouse in town!!! We r from Vegas and have had some great food and service but this experience was over the top!!!
The best. Tomatoes and Onions with the Peter Luger Sauce, followed by thick cut bacon. Steak for 2, creamed spinach, hashed browned potatoes, pecan pie with Schlag. Outstanding every time

Peter Lugers is an American Classic steakhouse and if you haven't been you should go just for the experience. That being said, your hometown steakhouse does an admirably just as good job. To be perfectly honest, the creamed spinach was the best part of the meal. The steak (porterhouse) was delicious but it didn't make the journey worth it. What made it worth the 2 stars was the service. Don't expect 5 star service. Think more of a middle of nowhere restaurant with decent service. It wasn't above and beyond. Steak knives weren't sharp. Plates were thrown down. Tomatoes and onions for $14.95 with the Luger sauce was fantastic. But it's $14.95 for a tomato and onion. I will say this. The sizzling bacon was out of this world and you need to go for that. Without a doubt it was worth it and should be ordered with every meal. 2 of 5 stars for a decent experience but not something a buddy traveled 4 hours for.
Amazing stake house! Very good service, clean place. I highly recommended for people who love stake.

One of the best steak houses in NYC. Be prepared to drop some bills and feel like you just ate an entire cow. Food and service is top notch. One of those places you go once in a while to treat yourself.

Horrible experience, I had a party of 10 people visiting, I set my reservation in person 1.5 months in advance. Â I called to confirm and they lost my reservation and would not fit us in. Â I will tell everyone I know to not go to this restaurant.
Steak for 2 was good as usual. Service was good. Only semi negative comment would be the person taking reservations. Not impolite but no where near friendly as I would expect.

It's my second time coming back here. One of my favorite steakhouses because the quality and environment is just lovely. I've had the steak for two, medium rare. It was juicy and tender. There's also the Luger's sizzling bacon and onion rings for appetizer. The bacon's fat to meat ratio was perfect. It went well with the Peter Lugers house sauce. The waiters were enthusiastic and friendly. Although it's a little pricey, it's still always packed and remember to make reservations. It's definitely worth a try for the experience for those who hasn't.

Great food, steak is remarkable- Â price is fair for the food. Â Would almost give - 1 star due to staff being neutral to unfriendly (during lunch), friendlier during dinner and hard to get reservations to eat at a decent time. Â But food trumps service if nothing else have to try steak.

terrible terrible atmosphere and service. For someone who has never been here- the server couldn't be bothered to explain the menu and just basically told us what we HAD to order. We were still deciding on the order/drinks and basically was rushed to put one in- when we asked if he could come back to finish the drink order he straight up said "no, you have to place now"...what? we also ordered a steak md-md well and like an arrogant steakhouse that they were- they made it med rare and told us that's the way steak should be eaten. When we told the server it wasn't the correct temperature he basically took a slice of steak and "seared" it on both sides on the hot plate..i didn't know whether that was an actual joke. this place is like a overpriced steakhouse DINER, with diner service to come along with it. you're in NYC and this place is not worth the trip- there's plenty other choices. not to mention, i am a server at a steakhouse..i know what a good steak is- not some dry ass flavorless porterhouse i was basically told i HAD to.

Yes is expensive (cash only) and yes without reservations they will not sit you (make the reservations wth time cause the place is fully booked almost every Night. The bacon is to die for! Its a must. If you love steak and you are in NYC, make this trip to brooklyn and you'll love it. The place have been there forever so you get the old fashion NYC atmosphere. It's is totally an Â experience!
They are okay! I mean it's always good to try but not something as you highly expected....
Overrated. Rude hosts and waiters. Will not be coming back. Stay away from the bacon - extremely fatty and covered in oil. Also make sure to bring cash!

This place is legendary and iconic and it was good do not get me wrong but a bit pricey. It is def worth a trip to see what all the fuss is all about. The staff at the restaurant is super friendly and welcoming at least by NY standards and the food is good to great but not amazing. Still a good choice to take a date if you want to impress her or you have a birthday or special occasion to celebrate.

Good steak! They like to keep their originality for the restaurant. Everything is old but it's got its history. The steaks melt in your mouth and so juicy. Need to make a reservation way beforehand (2-3 weeks?). Minus one star for the fact that they only take cash or debit card. No credit card.
I was worried that this would be a tourist trap. I was so wrong- everything was perfect and so memorable. Can't wait to go back, it's definitely somewhere I'd like to take out of town guests.

We were going there thinking to order "Steak for two" (because there were two of us). Lucky that we decided to order the Small Steak for each of us, because we can't even finish the small steak (it was 500g) It was VERY DELICIOUS, probably best steak I have ever had. But it was too big and fatty for me. Love the creamed spinach too!

Came back again on the lunch hour to rock the signature porter house. Â As good as any steak I've ever had. Â Epic bacon. Â German potatoes. Â Hot fudge sundae. Â Everything rocking very hard. Great service, relaxed atmosphere, plenty of space. Â Forget about coming here for dinner. Â The lunch is where it is at.

Simply the best steakhouse. Â Perfect for big events, conventions, or before a sporting event. Â Do not miss the bacon appetizer, and the porterhouse. Â The waiters, and atmosphere are part of the experience. Â A true New York landmark. Â Contrary to others I truly love all of their sides. Â I always have the German fried potatoes, sliced tomatoes & onions, and the creamed spinach. Â When I am hungry I also love the shrimp cocktail.

Awesome! Porterhouse was excellent. Pecan Pie was divine with the schlaag. Peter Luger lager wasn't bad either. Service was great and quick too. It is a lot of money, but once in awhile its worth it. Â These are real men portions unlike some other New York restaurant. Â Steak for two was enough and it was still sizzling. We went with the broccoli and tomato and onion and the Luger sauce. A few drinks and bill was $180 with tip. Â If we are ever back in town, we would go again.

Steak's good but i must say it's a little over rated. Heard it was hard to get a table for dinner that you need months for a reservation so we opted to go in for lunch on a weekday, it was about a 20 min wait. Considering it's in the charming area of brooklyn (the train travel to get there was an experience) and Â it's long history- it's a must try to those visiting New York. The only down side was waiters were in a rush that you can't sit and take the time to appreciate the interiors nor savor your steaks. Oh yeah, it's a little pricey for what it is! The bacon tho was on a different level; get the holy cow for dessert-sinfully delish.

There is no where else for the best steaks on Earth! The location in Great Neck is also excellent! The onion tomato salad is a must. Rib eye is my favorite. Lamb chops are excelelnt and porterhouse to die for! Sides are all sublime! Call for Rezzies!
Preceded reputation and superseded expectation, from the Brooklyn Lager to the baker. The salmon was perfection along with the porterhouse steak. Â Just perfection!!
I ate by myself at the bar. I cried because it was so delicious and I didn't give a damn who saw me.
Terrific steaks! Â Still the best in town! Â Don't forget the home fries.

Everyone has heard of Peter Luger right? So the steak is suppose to be one of the best in New York.. finally got a chance to see what all the hype is about. Got reservations for Friday lunch because they have a burger only available during lunch. Burger was a winner in my eyes, but the steak... hmm questionable. I've had better. Not so much a fan of bacon but please order a piece! It's pretty delicious. Don't forget cash, it's cash or debit card only.

People working at that restaurant apparently got an attitude problem. A woman from the restaurant called me to confirm the reservation, instead of talking, she was littlely screaming at me on the phone and nothing but being rude. So after the phone call, I just didn't feel like going there to spend $500 on dinner anymore. I cancelled the reservation and made another reservation with SW. I don't care how good their steak is. Their service sucks, and I will never ever spend a penny at a such shitty restaurant.
Easily my favorite steakhouse in NY. Fell in love with the Peter Luger sauce. Highly recommend eating here when in New York
Every now and then I have a severe steak craving. When I do, I think of this place. Pricey, but worth the portion and quality of steak!

Dat steak do... A vast juicy joyous slab of beef. I barely remember the sides, The onion bread was delicious though. And oh god the schlag! So much schlag! With strudel.... And little chocolate coins to finish. Amazing experience. We, a group of 4 very big eaters, we're so full rolling out of this place I thought we'd never eat again. I'm not sure I need to go back, there are many steaks to try in this city, but this place is an absolute blast from the past, and a fantastic experience.
You want to blow a ridiculous amount of cash. You want to see the real New York. You can't deal with the new Williamsburg. This is the steak for you. Old world New York still rocks it here.

I am a steakhouse enthusiast and have eaten some of the best cuts in the states. Peter Luger is the leader in style, service and culinary excellence. The temperature of each steak was done to perfection. It could slice like butter, I promise you. Service was outstanding, I trusted my server enough to order for the table and not one of us was disappointed.

For a long time, the best steak I ever had was at Peter Luger. I was really young, but the memories of searing hot slices of steak doused in butter stayed with me for years. I've been back once before, and while the actual meal wasn't as good as the memory, it was still damn good. My most recent visit was not as enjoyable. Perhaps it's because we got the last seating, but I'd still expect a restaurant with a reputation to keep their meals consistent regardless of what time it is. Why even bother seating people if you're going to offer a worse experience, but charge the same amount of money? We had to wait around 15 minutes after our reservation time, even though this was the final seating. The onion bread was delicious, the others lacked flavor. I really wish they would at least warm it up a bit. Cold bread is not the most appetizing, even when you're starving. We ordered the steak for four, creamed spinach, and french fries. The steak was cooked perfectly, but lacked flavor despite being doused in butter. I'm guessing we got the worst cuts due to it being the end of the night. Even still, I'd expect their worst cut to be at least on par with what I can get at the local butcher. Our beef had as much flavor as the manager's special at the grocery store. The sides were good, but the steak is supposed to be the star. It was a disappointment instead.

Don't waste your time!! The petal on this rose bloomed long ago. Very poor selection of choices, ambience is less than mediocre, service a little snooty, and absolutely nothing whatsoever special about this restaurant!! Been there, done that, no need to go (or go back). Choices are basically steak for one, steak for two, steak for three, or steak for four. Â Side choices were pathetic and bread and bread was stale. Thought we would try this place after so many years of hearing it was the best in New York City. It's probably not the worst in New York City, but it's Â very, very, very, mediocre. Also, they only take cash which is curious. I knew this going in so it was expected, but it makes me wonder if there is an another motive (can you say tax evasion). Â To the ownership, try getting into the 1990s. People have been taking credit cards for a very long time. I can only assume you're resisting this because you want to make it an all cash business to siphon off the government. Â As for the food, if you want to call yourself a steakhouse you should have more than one cut as a selection. Not everybody wants the same cut of steak. Â If I were in New York, this would not be my first or even second or third choice of steak places. The hype is absolutely not worth it! Â While everything did tasted good, there are many other far better places to eat in the city!!

The Porter House for two is very filling, however this time around I was a bit disappointed. Â The steak was ok and the baked potato was overcooked. Â Was disappointed to be honest. Â Service could have been better also.

Without peer for over 100 years the best steak house on the planet. It is everything that real New Yorkers expect in a steak house. Incomparable aged prime beef, perfectly prepared. Traditional wait staff who know their jobs and how to serve their customers without the condescending attitude so prevalent in today's high end restaurants.The original with many imitators but still the best by far. Be sure to save room for the apple strudel mit schlog for dessert. Also, less expensive than most of it's imitators. Well worth the trip to Brooklyn and the wait.

Exceeded expectations. I booked ahead for Sunday lunch, so we got a beautiful corner table in the quieter room with all the windows. Our waiter had just the right amount of charm and cheek. Ordered the steak for 2 cooked BETWEEN medium and medium-rare (ideal), spinach (wow), special potatoes, and the cheesecake for dessert - which was the best cheesecake I've had in New York - even better than Juniors. The waiter put a candle in it for my partner's bday. I liked the Merlot by the glass better than the Malbec. Such a treat - can't wait to go back.

We have been wanting to come here for a while, and finally ventured out to Brooklyn. Â I must say their peter Luger sauce was like delicious, I swear I could eat it alone! My husband loves steak, and really loved it. I'm a vegetarian, but they had pretty good fish for a steakhouse, of course the onion rings was really our favorite-- a must have when coming here!

Very good, but it wasn't the revelation I thought it would be. Expect a classic, perfectly executed, right down the middle steak - but not one to push boundaries or bring new flavors you haven't experience before.

Decent steakhouse, but not 1 michellin star worthy. Steak was good, avoid the sides, service and experience were lacking/non existent. Cash only is another negative, who carries cash in 2017? Alexanders in the bay is miles ahead.
Top of the top steak but 3 months reservation is quite much service was so so but the place over all says classy

Love their steak and burgers! Steak is perfectly seasoned and cooked and the hot juicy liquid it swims in (butter?) makes the steak taste magical. Their creamed spinach and bacon are really good, too. Â Service is great and ambience is laid back.
Legendary steakhouse. The service is great. The food is good, but you're definitely paying for the history and atmosphere of this old fashioned steakhouse.
Best porterhouse in NY. Other great steaks but this is the best. Get the bacon. Spinach porterhouse and a holy cow sundae for dessert!
The food was delicious and the staff was so friendly and helpful. Â I thoroughly enjoyed the food and am anxious to go back.
Really good.. better prices compared to manhattan steak houses.. simple menu... make sure to get the bacon and sundae... free parking across the street is a definite plus.
I'm not used to sharing a steak, but the porterhouse is their signature cut, and something you need to experience! Bring cash they don't take credit cards, but they do take Debit Card!

Simply put THE BEST STEAK I HAVE EVER HAD..as someone who tries steakhouses often there are many but Lugers with their sometimes grumpy waiters is the king..been all around nyc ..the one that comes right behind is Wolfgang and that's because he started in Lugers so he has an inside .capital grille on 42 although can be classified as "chain" is excellent...but no one in my opinion has knocked Peter Lugers from the top.even the one on Long Island is excellent and easier to get a reservation

So I am only giving 4 stars bc if service...BUT if you're a regular like I am then you know to expect an ill mannered server...probably a hiring requirement lol. Needless to say best steak you will ever have the pleasure to devour!! Get the shrimp and fresh mozzarella and tomatoes as well. Also I prefer the Brooklyn location...

This place is really overrated for all the hype.. Steak for 2 was just ok, but I've had better steak for much cheaper elsewhere. The Luger's Sizzling Bacon is pretty good though. Luger's Special German Fried Potatoes was really just normal home fries. Nothing special about it and I wouldn't recommend getting that. Not sure why people used to say the staff here was rude, our waiter and hostess were friendly and prompt.
simply put: the best steak in NYC and probably the world. Â there is nothing that can compare to this place.
Went here with coworkers and had a great time. We ordered steak for 4 and it was fast and delicious and fabulous. Less stars for the noise but had a great time!
Top notch steak. Both locations are great but this one is certainly closer to the city. Good atmosphere. Cool people. Good food!
Steak cooked to perfection every time! The bacon and shrimp appetizers are great to start off with. I couldn't stop eating the basket of bread they put out.

Made a reservation for a birthday celebration. Took 3 phone calls- waited on hold the first 2 times for so long I had to hang up. 3rd attempt I made sure I had time and it took 17 minutes, but i made the res. Called back one week later to add another person to the party AND THEY DON'T HAVE MY RESERVATION. And they are booked now. Barely an apology either. So glad you have enough customers to not really care about this dramatic error on you part, Peter Luger! Gone forever. You'll see us at Keens.

After reading all the reviews, well most of it-in the hundreds, I was a bit worry about my experience. My friend made reservations a couple of weeks in advance and during this time I was contemplating on canceling because of some of the reviews. Instead I went ahead and decided to see it for myself.
