This is my conclusion: Came in for lunch on a Saturday afternoon. Staff at the entrance smiled and made eye contact. Not too busy so I had time to ask the manager for a friendly server(saw some of the reviews so threw caution to the wind). Davor was our server with a great sense of humor. We tried the steak, cream spinach, and German potato. All was delicious, but I would say the service was the best! Davor took care of us and made our first time a memorable one. He was friendly and quick.

Steak lovers paradise! Â This is my favorite steakhouse in New York. Â Excellent every time, never fails. Â Forget the creamed spinach or iceberg wedge salad, just enjoy the steaks. Â Bring cash (and lots of it) or your debit card. Â Credit cards are only accepted for online orders which is strange. Â But with steaks this good, you won't mind paying up. Only complaint, waiters are the nastiest sons of b----es you'll ever come in contact with. Â It's amazing they still have jobs with their attitudes.

Went here a few weeks ago because many friends have been urging me to go... ordered the steak for two and it was very good. Only reason I gave four stars was because of the difficulty getting a reservation and also the value/location.
Great steak. Â Karl was great. Water always filled and good side salad. Highly recommend

Went here for my wife's birthday. The steak was great and was pretty much what I expected from such a famous steakhouse. I give 4 stars and not 5 because it was great but it didn't necessarily exceed my expectations. We got the sliced tomatoes and onions, caesar salad, creamed spinach, and steak for 2. I have had pretty much the same exact dishes at other well known steakhouses such as Wolfgang, and The Strip House and it was very similar. Don't get me wrong. The food was great, but just as good as the other good steakhouses.

One of the best steakhouses around. They cook the steaks in butter (among other things). Butter! Not cheap but good value for what you are getting. Service is usually good (with a few exceptions). Note, cash only!

Best steak in the world hands down. While I've never tried the famous bacon app, it's not worth it. You need to save room for the sunday! It is the best desert in NY. I love Peter Lugers and can't wait until my return.

Made reservations three weeks ago. Â Came all the way out there for a special birthday dinner and they were closed. Â No phone call, no nothing. Â Just a poor sap at the door turning everyone away. Â They said it was because of snow. Â Fine. Â How about a phone call? Â Really disappointed.

They make a good steak. A really good one. But that's just about it. Service is way below average, it's like a large noisy dining room, there is no fun vibe to the place - or any vibe really, pretty pricey and bland menu. Plus, it's not near any other fun places to go, so you're really going for the meat and right back home.

Wasn't really impressed. Made reservations more than a month in advance and the only opening they had was 9:45 on a weeknight after Christmas. Ok fine, but from the moment we walked in it was clear we were the last seating time and they wanted us out ASAP. Our apps came out eerily fast and half way through us actively eating them our server was swapping out our plates and silverware... mid bite. Our steak quality was good, got the porterhouse for 2, but was incredibly under seasoned- like no salt used whatsoever. When we came in a party of 8 was finishing their entree course and our server rushed us so much that we left at the same time they did. I'm glad I finally was able to try Peter Luger but I can't say I'm that impressed. Keens was way better food and the waitstaff was way more professional.
porterhouse is very good. creamed spinach is okay. Â burger was awesome. don't get the strawberries, complete rip off

Finally had lunch here ! The bacon is a MUST, it is so delicious. I may go for just the bacon next time. The steak was very tender but I think it lacked flavor. I used tons of their steak sauce. I also had the tomatoes and creamed spinach, both were excellent.

Old school NY restaurant. Â Cash only, saw dust on the floors. Â Lots of butter on the steaks. Â Always order medium rare, tomato salad is to die for with their steak sauce. Â Engage the wait staff, they all understand food and they will make sure you have the best experience possible.
This place is not cheap. But if you love steak at its basic best, this is definitely the place. my favorite is the T bone ! Great place to bring your date if she is a carnivore.

I have been to so many good restaurants in Brooklyn and NYC in general. Went to pl tonight on a business dinner and it was a complete disappointment. From the arrogant attitude that both the host and waiter had to the absolutely average to below average food, I don't understand why any person would wait in line for this place, or really even go there. The infamous pl steak sauce is basically ketchup with a little spice, the shrimp appetizer was chewy, and I'll say it as plainly as can be the steak sucked. No real flavor to speak of and just poorly cooked. It's a testament to how a place can take on a life of it's own in NYC without having to really produce a good meal. So many better places to go and I hope as an institution it makes some changes or just goes away.

Ok. Â You might have heard of this place, and chances are my review will probably not push you into going, but if for some reason you are looking for some reassurance, just go. Â It might be the best steak you've ever eaten. Â Get the porterhouse, I actually prefer it medium, and savor every month watering bite.

I mean is it really a question of where the best steak in New York City is and has been for over 100 years the food is phenomenal From the bacon appetizer to the porterhouse for two very old-school style just like the way it should be we should have a Peter Lugar's and every large city in the country but no one could do it like Peter Lugar's dose..... If you're in the area and you can get a table it's a must you'll never regret

I don't find myself in Brooklyn very much to be honest, but Peter Luger certainly makes a very convincing reason to cross the bridge. Now, of course, PL is widely considered to be the pinnacle New York steakhouse, with its deep heritage as rich as its ribeyes. It certainly is an old and timeless establishment with an heir of old time class, seen in both the atmosphere as well as the service. Very old school New York, which I really love. When it comes to steakhouses, my order is simple: thick cut bacon to start, ribeye (medium), and creamed spinach. The bacon appetizer is delectable, and the creamed spinach was also very nice. As for the steak, it was very good, but not quite the best I've had. The porterhouse certainly was tender and tasty, but I much prefer a nice marbled ribeye (I happen to love the steak at Wolfgang's on Park). The whole experience though is over the top and quite a treat. I'm told the lunch time-only burger is legendary, which is next on my list.
Steak is cooked to perfection! Kind of pricey but a girl can treat herself once and awhile! I try to make it often as it is located around the corner from my house!

Had been looking forward to coming to peter lugers for years. Â disappointing, to say the least. Â our reservation was lost initially and when we called to confirm, the hostess was very rude. Â surprise, one day later they found it. Â Lack of appetizer choices, no option for filet only and sub-par sides. Â Creamed spinach was the only thing that was ok. Â There are far more better steakhouse to spend that amount of money on, won't be back.

One visit is all it takes and you will be addicted to this Brooklyn New York Location gives you more than what you expect there tomato and onion salad is to die for the Porterhouse is worth every penny and if your lucky enough to get some dessert in you will be back over and over again they also have an excellent lunch menu and it's very affordable
Service was great. atmosphere nice , bacon out of this world but the steak was tough...not really anything special.
The best steak I've ever have in my life. And believe me, I've had my share of good steaks!

Ambiance was comfortable. The steak was juicy and not chewy, the taste was good. The orders are huge! The order for 2 could really feed 3. The bacon was a must try but honestly I was expecting more (Not a big steak fan but id definitely would go back)
I just called for a reservation. A person who got a phone was so rude. I don't wanna visit again.

Go no further for your meat cravings than this 125 year Brooklyn staple. Don't be discouraged by the small menu, as this top of the line steak restaurant manages to do its showstopping with just one menu item - their mouthwatering, melt in your mouth, seared to perfection porterhouse. Order one steak for two, three, or four, and prepare yourself for a treat as the server comes out and dishes a bit of each half of the steak onto each person's plate along with some of the delicious juices that come with it. I'm very traditional with my steaks and normally refuse steak sauce, but their house made sauce made it onto about half of what I ate, pleasing the palette with a tangy flavor and a bit of horseradish, it is definitely an acceptable sauce for even the best normally standalone cuts. The service was perfect, the wait staff is straight forward, attentive, but not bothersome, and the portions are perfect. And even with all of this, the price only comes to an extremely reasonable 60$ per person.

I have to say, I was a little disappointed with my meal at Peter Luger's after hearing rave reviews about it. The bread was okay and the service was satisfactory. I ordered the small steak, it came out a little overcooked, so maybe I should have ordered a temperature down. There really isn't anything special about the steak, it basically just came out sizzling with butter, somewhat bland in flavor and not that tender. The steak sauce is came with was sweet, I usually prefer more of a tangy steak sauce. I probably wouldn't come back again, this place is pretty overrated and I was disappointed.

When I'm paying more than $80 per person, I don't expect to be told that my credit card is not a welcome form of payment. Sure, the idea is to be a "classic" steakhouse, but in 2016, accepting a Visa card as a form of payment isn't such a departure from the intended experience. With that said, the steak was excellent. All of the food was well above average and exceeded my expectations. I'll definitely visit this place again and when I do, I hope they have a credit card machine.

Ended up getting a early evening reservation on a Monday for my wedding anniversary while we were in NYC. The service wasn't the friendliest but was very efficient which I find more appealing. Bacon appetizer was great! Steak for two was a lot of food but cooked perfectly. The German potatoes were ok while the creamed spinach was perfect. Had to get dessert to try the homemade whipped cream. Have to give it 5!
5 stars. Anyone rating Peter Luger less than five stars either must be vegan or have no ability to taste. Probably the easiest 5 stars I could ever leave on Yelp.

My wife and I went to this restaurant some years ago in order to experience its wonderful ambience. I am a vegetarian and my wife keeps kosher so there was very little we could eat. We ordered a couple of appetizers only. The waiters could not help but laugh when they received these order requests - they asked us to complete our orders and we told them that they were complete! - but they were very professional and eating here turned out to be a fun experience!

I've had a lot of steak in my life and their porterhouse was probably one of the best, if not the best, that I've ever had. Two huge negatives are that getting a reservation is extremely tiring and it's cash only. Come on, get with the times already and stop frustrating your patrons! Get online reservations going and take my credit card!!! But,really, the food is so good that I won't knock any stars for that. Can't wait to go back... if we can ever get reservations.
This is an old school quintessential NYC steak house! The steak is to die for and the bacon is even better. Â My mouth waters for this stuff. Can't wait to go back.

This is a brilliant New York family steak establishment, we went to celebrate my dear friend David's bar mitzvah. We got in early and had a few drinks at the bar Thomas a friend who recently became homeless got a rum and coke and i got a beer which came up to 20$ to be expected restaurant drinking pricing. Â As we were seated our dear friend adan whose new to New York was so amazed how this reminded him of Germany, the waiter was great and full of jokes as we ordered the bacon and shrimp salad appetizer which were both amazing, unfortunate our dinner was interrupted as somebody decided to use the fire escape door which the alarm sounded off! Staff were quickly on site and stopped the noise after the appetizers the dinner was followed by the porterhouse steak feast which included sides of creamed spinach and potato hash which made for a very spicy affair! As we got into a food coma, after what was an amazing dinner we enjoyed easily one of the best desserts I have had in a long time the "Holy Cow" think if your visiting or if you are a New Yorker you should definitely pay a visit here!

Went here and after being there I asked myself what is the hype about . I understand that Lugers is the Mecca of Porterhouses , however I would not put it in my top ten of steakhouses I have been to . Quite frankly after all the hype I would not return .

The bacon! The bacon!! The bacon!!!! I can't stress enough how delicious the bacon is. I'd suggest getting more than one slice. I've always come here with groups where we get the steak for the table. Absolutely delicious! As for sides, I've only ever had the creamed spinach which is pretty good

All I can say is amazing, this would be my last meal! The key to their success? Perfect meat, cooked to perfection. Its all in the meat! Dry aging bring out the best in their Porterhouse. Let me tell you how good the steaks are... We forced my aunt, who eats well done steak, to order a medium steak and she preferred out rare steak more than her's! Its a little pricey and you need to make reservations, but its well worth it!
Paper in the cream Â spinach, service is poor, if I can, I will give them negative start, for the price they charge and the quality of food is poor

Steak was very good but for the price it should have been great. The service was outstanding Â and bathroom was spotless. Just the steak didnt knock my socks off like the bill said it should have. Once a year I might go

Best aged Porterhouse steak I ever have eaten. Â The bacon appetizer was to die for. Â It is 1/4 inch thick, and like pork belly heaven. Â Great bread basket selection. Â Creamed spinach was tasty and balanced. Â Good wine and Long Island iced tea. Â Dessert was the Holy Cow, a vanilla sundae with chocolate and the works. Â Superb ice cream quality. Â Friendly service and helpful waiters.

the broiled steak here lives up to its hype. Â i salivated many nights watching youtube videos of this global landmark. Â i finally got to try it instead of imagining it...it did not dissapoint. Â would travel across the world to eat this delicious steak. Â eat it while its ultra hot though, once it starts to cool down the deliciousness fades with the temp! Â don't forget a side of hashbrowns.

When I first moved to NYC everyone said to go to Peter Luger so my expectations were high. The meat was perfectly cooked but the sides aren't great. We ordered crÃ©ame spinach, which I wouldn't recommend, and the German potatoes. The services is great but don't expect it to be fancy, it's as old school as it can get.

Peter Lugers is OK but to be honest, it's mostly hype at this point. Â The steaks are good but you can get much better in NYC. Â The cash only policy is ridiculous and the mean waiter schtick is silly. Â Ultimately, you will get a better steak AND experience at one of the many other steakhouses in NYC.

I have been here a few times over the years and every time I go I always have a good experience. The food is always good and fresh and the service is relatively quick. I would have definitely given 5 stars but the cash only part is what led me to leave 4 stars, I had to use the atm machine the last time we went because it was a last minute stop and we did not have enough cash on us. The ambiance is nice, it has that nice old school rustic theme inside. Something's could use an update but overall a very nice establishment. If I was able to use my credit card I would definitely give 5 stars.

What can I say? I'm a huge fan! I loved everything about my experience at Peter Luger's. The steak was cooked perfectly. The bacon was also amazing!! I have seriously recommended this place to almost everyone I know who plans to visit NY! That's how much I love this place!

I had high expectations for this place; I had heard such great things. However, although the bacon is amazing, it's the only thing worthwhile at this place. I've had much better steak for half the price & the sides (onion rings, German potatoes & French fries) were mediocre. The bartender in the waiting area was extremely rude but out table server was amazing. It was nice to try something new but I was not impressed and would not go back. Everything is overpriced.

Favorite steak house EVER! Â Just try it and you will not be disappointed. Â The burgers are good to if you can sneak away Â for lunch. Â My go to steak house if I want a sure thing to satisfy my beef cravings. Â Look forward to going again soon.

Great food and staff. Â Definitely going back. Â Steak is awesome. Â Server was friendly and made the meal even more enjoyable. Â  Loved the Â ambience of the restaurant. Very inviting. Â  Desert was delicious Â .
5 of us shared a porterhouse for 4. Medium rare was perfectly done. Service was great. Will definitely come back. Get the bacon and spinach.

Absolutely amazing experience. From our first drinks to dessert, everything was perfection. The bacon should not be missed. The cuts of meat were fantastic and delicious. Our servers were great. For a group of 8, he never forgot a thing. Don't forget to bring cash! Worth every penny.

We come here every year around Father's Day because my dad likes to eat steak and it's like 8 of us, and the food is amazing, no doubt. Â HOWEVER, the waiter that served us was a complete @ss. Â Seriously, man, when 7 of the 8 people order steak and I get something else and you tell me to eat steak even when I tell you I'm vegetarian, you're being an @ss.
very goodãThe best food is steak. The environment is very good.You need to book a long time, but it was worth it.

The aroma when you walk in is unrivaled. So pungent, so forceful, you can almost taste the steak in the air and the salivation process begins before you are even seated. We ordered steak for 4, their famous bacon and Â few sides and the rest is history. I don't have to say much in this review as the name and history speak for it self. I just wanted to write and confirm to you that this is the best steakhouse in New York, and certainly the best steak I've ever had anywhere. Although Wolfgang's in Tribeca is a close second.

The steaks and appetizers are always great! Only been to Peter Lugers twice and both time have been relatively satisfied. The service of the waiters are pretty good compared to most places. I really enjoyed the shrimp cocktail, spinach dish they offer, and the steak sauce they provide! I tried their onion and tomatoes dish and was surprised as to how much I enjoyed those as well. Definitely recommend using the Peter Luger sauce as it masks the raw onion taste. The steaks are cooked perfectly to your preferences. The drinks here are also very good and they don't get cheap with the amount of alcohol in the beverages either. The bacon they have is also very tasty and crispy! Their home made whipped cream is pretty great as well, I suggest adding some on top of your cup of coffee just to add to it.
Nice decor. Juicy and high quality steak. I would definitely come back. Just remember, no cards. Dolla dolla bills yall!

Extremely disappointed! Â Had been looking forward to a memorable experience and ended up with hardly mediocre. Â On vacation for a week and chose Peter Luger's for our friend's birthday dinner. Â The atmosphere, waiter and most importantly, our meal was less than desired. Â The room we were seated in was cold and looked like the back of a sports bar. Â Nothing elegant or comforting at all. Â Our waiter was curt and unpleasant from beginning to end. Â You could tell it was a chore for him to explain the menu and rushed us throughout the whole meal. Â Our steaks were certainly not prime meat and were very chewy with little flavor. Â I make a much better steak at home with prime beef from Costco. Â This certainly was no treat. Â The only highlight was the onion rolls. Â Then to top it off, when we were ready to leave and ordering an Uber to take us back to our condo, the gentleman taking care of parking for the steakhouse said there was a driver for the steakhouse that would take us for the same price as an Uber would. Â That was truly a lie as he charged us $38 plus tip when Uber would have only been $15. To travel over to Brooklyn for an experience like that was the true low point of an otherwise beautiful vacation. Â I would highly recommend staying in Manhattan and going to Sparks Steakhouse, Benjamin Prime or The Grill. Save your time and money and stay away from Peter Luger's.

One of the greatest gifts I've ever given my mouth. Don't skip the bacon or the wedge. Obviously if you don't order the steak you are so dumb.... The servers are awesome. Lots of tourist from the east come now days. Â But what a beautiful experience. Take leftovers home. If the table next to you doesn't take theirs. Consider taking theirs also. Is that weird?

We bought and had a gift certificate mailed and unfortunately thru no fault of Peter Luger Steak House it was improperly delivered. The restaurant handled this immediately and with great customer attention. We had a replacement mailed out within a day. Peter Luger staff is excellent.

This is my favorite steak of all time. It's a New York City classic and is a must-have. The history is undeniable. The classic is the bacon + tomatoes and onions to start. Porterhouse for x people + German potatoes & creamed spinach for main. Dessert is apple crisp + slog. Chocolate coins are a great addition at the end. Peter Luger house wine is delicious and reasonably priced.

It's pretty pointless to write a review of Peter Lugar because everyone already knows it's the best. Over the years I've been to all of the steakhouses in NYC and this is the only one that has never let me down even once.

Awesome place if you can get in. Â Call weeks ahead to get your spot - well worth time. Its a short subway ride form downtown then a short walk. Â Well worth it, it will help make sure your appetite is ready.
I literally will refrain from eating steal unless it's here. The aged porterhouse is pure culinary bliss fir your taste buds and after coming here for over a decade it has never disappointed.
Steak wasn't cooked the way I ordered it (medium rare), it was overcooked. I've had better steak at outback, not impressed with their steak, at all.

They say the waiters are rude here. Â Service is bad. Â Pff, I came for the steak Â "then the rest is just whatever". Â Place is loud and busy. Â Decor is Â rustic German but most servers seem Italians. Â We had Â a reservation for 2:45pm on a Sunday and the place was brimming with people waiting to be seated. Â It felt like you were in the way of everybody walking to and fro - exciting! Â We ordered Steak for Two, burgers for the kids, and salmon for my mother. Â They serve coke in a classic bottle. Â Creamed spinach complemented the steak but really the steak can stand alone and probably for most carnivore it is best eaten as served. Â Succulent, tender and tasty. However for me, their homemade sauce elevates the steak into another level. They served it family style, tilted on another upside down small bowl to pool the juices down. Â  I am smiling just thinking of it now. Â Medium rare or rarer. Â Vegetarians need not come.

I was a little disappointed the last time I came here. The quality of the steaks has gone down a bit. The spinach was great, as were the potatoes. The holy cow is a must for dessert. Hopefully they get back to where they were, it is a staple for steak lovers.

My friends really hyped up this restaurant and unfortunately it did not live up to expectations. Â I have definitely had better steaks in Chicago and SF. Â My first several bites had this tough white fibrous fatty stuff that I had to spit out because no amount of chewing would've broken it down. Â So much for 'hand picked' steaks! Â At least the tomato/onion dish was really good, and the bacon and fried onion rings. Â I was very disappointed about the steaks though. Â Peter Luger is only 'meh' in my book.

This was my first trip to Peter Luger's. Â Luckily I had enough sense to make a reservation because even at 12:45 on a Saturday the place was bustling and patrons were waiting to be seated at the bar. Â Meal was started with thick slab bacon and shrimp cocktail. The bacon was out of this world, even when you knew you should stop eating I couldn't help but go back for another taste. Â Shrimp was fresh, tremendous and delicious. Â Our entree consisted of a steak for three and a side of German Fried potatoes. Â The steak was amazing and every so often you couldn't help but let escape the "oh my god this is so good" as stuffed as we were we continued into dessert which included the apple strudel (yes more yummy noises being made) and the fudge Sunday. Â There is not one thing I could say even slightly bad or negative. Â Service was attentive and on point. Decor was old school darkly paneled walls with a nice collection of beer steins. Â We ate like kings ohh and I drank the house Merlot which even that gets a thumbs up. Â Will definitely return!!!!

This steak house lives up to the hype. The bacon as an app is the way to go. Make sure you try the sauce they make in house. It's delish!! Â Remember to go by the ATM before you get there. They only accept cash. It's so worth it!

Service was fantastic ,, however too expensive,, If you want to celebrate your day, I would highly recommend this place as a best steak house in NYC. Food is amazing as hell. But, Do not get in if you can't afford the money.

The steak was good. I like that a lot. However, their service was terrible. My server did not care so much about my dining experience at their restaurant. I told them it was a first time visiting their restaurant, so I was expecting some descriptive words for what I got for my dinner. But the server just put the dish on the table and gave what he got to say in very short and fast and left, rudely. I felt so bad about the way I was treated.

Quintessential New York establishment. Surly waiters, old school decor, simple drinks (try Bloody Mary or martini- both standouts). Food: no menu required, steak for two, sides, put the Peter Luger sauce on everything except the steak. The tomato and onion side with Peter Luger sauce is spot on, must try the bacon also- will Blow your mind, steak is obviously the star of the table, and it's presentation is second to none. It's not cheap, bring cash, its all worth every penny.

Very good steakhouse and I can't believe I am saying this but one of my favorite things is the hot fudge Sunday which is the best I have ever had. Â Homemade whip cream. Â My parents came from California to visit me and liked it so much they sent steaks home to friends and family for Christmas gifts.

The bacon. Â There really isn't anything else to say besides GET THE BACON! Â Our party of five ordered the bacon before our meal and then we all decided to order bacon again after our meal! Â  I will expand a bit and say I was pleasantly surprised with the friendly service since I was expecting there to be some aloofness. Â The porterhouse was good and so was the shrimp cocktail. Â I was, however, disappointed with the burger.
Possibly the most overrated restaurant in the world. Â What was so amazing 20 years ago is now readily available elsewhere with better service, atmosphere, crowd and a credit card machine.
Love this place I've been going here for at least 20 years. Â I don't get to go much it is expensive but it is worth it. Â Steaks melt in your mouth and you get exectly Â what you ask for.

One order of their steak was good for the three of us. The steak is aged and cooked to perfection. This place is good because of that, they do it right. Simplicity is key for me when cooking steak. I want to taste the purity of the meat. Every bite was how it is suppose to taste. Medium rare please.
This is what happens when great management and culinary skills are combined. When in town for business, I always swing by here. I always got dessert from my dates afterwards;).

Finally got to try this place after four years of hearing rave reviews from other people. I ordered the steak for two cooked medium rare, creamed spinach and slice of bacon. They really do need a bigger waiting area as waiters with hot plates come and go quickly, but those waiting for seats can't really move out of the way because there is no space. The waiters seemed a bit rude as they walked through crowds of people instead of around, but I guess they're trying their best to be efficient. We got a basket of bread right of the bat, and they had some pretty good variety with the best being the onion bread that was also filled with onions on the inside as well. Their steak sauce is so good and really complimented the steak. The steak is half part filet mignon and half part sirloin. I preferred the sirloin part because it seemed more smokey and flavorful, but overall, it was a pretty good steak. The first few bites were amazing but after that, the steak seemed pretty mediocre especially considering the price. I really liked the bacon and was definitely one of my favorites. The creamed spinach was good too but nothing too special or amazing. The waiters were very nice and friendly, and were open to joke with us. Overall, a good experience, but I don't think the steak lived up to all its hype.
I went here after eating at Morton's. It was a significant downgrade. The steak was sooooooooo dry and their food selection is minimal at best... not worth it...
Great steak, but if you want a good Filet, I'd still suggest Old Homestead.

Well, the repautuaion is not for nothing. I can say that i had here one of the best steaks i ever had. I noticed a contradiction between what the place try to present, like high class restaurateur with top level food, but at the same time, i kind of felt rushed to finish the food and leave the table. Maybe i made i mistake visiting on a weekend, or maybe this is the summer, i dont know. But that did not affect the steak which was really memorable one.

Was here for a late dinner, before which we had a enjoyably blunt conversation with the bar staff. The Porterhouse for 2 came quickly, the side of bacon was excellent. The steak itself was solid. A fine cut of meat and a perfect medium rare. Still a great place if you're looking for a no-frills, Old New York steak/steakhouse experience. Service was what one should expect at place like this. If you're expecting white glove service and a fancifully treated steak, you shouldn't be here.

Overall the visit was just okay. Everyone talked about how great Peter Luger was going to be. The sides were okay, nothing fantastic. We ordered our steak for 2 medium rare; the steak was cooked/prepared very well. However, there was no flavor... added their special steak sauce and didn't care for that either. Â My girlfriends salmon was very good I will give them that. Our server was very rude.. maybe because we were a younger group of people? When we got our check he said very rudely just so you guys know this price does NOT include the tip. Â On the way out as we were paying our server asked the cashier to make sure that we left a tip - she said yes. He then asked how much? I feel that's unprofessional maybe it is a NY thing I don't know. Next time I'm in NY I will not be coming back.

omg, hands far the best steak i've had in my life. I don't give many 5 star reviews, but this is probably one of the most deserving. I think you'll find it obviously clear that the ambiance of this place isn't why this its legendary, you go for the steak and more specifically the porterhouse. Â  Let me make it clear, the 5 stars is just for the porterhouse, nothing else. The sides are good but not extraordinary and as for the ambiance, just expect an old pub like atmosphere. Â Don't recommend taking your prom date here. Â  Gotta thank my a big thanks go my big bro Phil for taking me here for my bday. Â As long as you realize that you're going for one thing only, the divine porterhouse, you won't be disappointed.
the german bacon is fantastic. love the steaks and the wine list, limited as it may be.

I'm not sure of many things except... Luger's serves the very best steaks on Earth. Â In the 61 years I've been going here (I'm 64), I've never had anything but the best time, best food and best service.

It saddens me to write this review. Luger's was my happy place. It's where I had my first OMG I love Steak moment. It's where my family and I celebrated me getting accepted into my first choice college. It's where I went with my then girlfriend, now wife, for my 30th birthday. And it's gone down hill. No denying it. It's not what it was. The steak was lazily cooked, with true crust only on one side, the other side gray and dull. The porterhouse had little of the dry aged funk that I crave. Same for the rib steak. The highlights of the meal were the bacon, enjoyed with Luger sauce alongside the tomato and onion, and the creamed spinach. Hard to mess up that bacon and the creamed spinach hasn't changed, thankfully. Not what you want the highlights to be at what was the best steakhouse in the world. Nowadays, steaks at non-steakhouses have been far superior. I'd rather plunk down my steak money at places like Minetta Tavern, the Breslin, and Osteria Morini for their monthly 120 day dry aged ribeye.

We've been going here for years, consistently fabulous! Nothing else to be said. There's a reason they've been there 125 years. DELICIOUS!! Â The only credit card they take is their own. Get it before you go, because you will be going back. Otherwise bring a lot of cash.

You must get a thick cut of bacon, shrimp cocktail and a medium rare steak (for 2) with German potatoes and creamed spinach on the side. Â One of the best steaks I've ever had. Make sure you dip it in their famous sauce too!

Before I went to Peter Lugers this past weekend, I carefully read some of their negative reviews and I had to laugh inside. If you're looking to wine and dine in a romantic setting, then this is not the place to go. Lugers is an institution and have been making their Porterhouse the same way they always have. This is by far the best Porterhouse you can get in the tri-state area. The wait staff are not going to give you the warm fuzzy feeling you may want when dropping down your hard earned cash, but if you want the best steak for your dollar and one of the best eating experiences, then get there early and enjoy. In addition to their great Porterhouse, I highly recommend the Pecan Pie. It's the best I've ever had and I always look forward to this dessert at the end of my meal. Along with a nice helping of Shlag. Their bar staff are also very talented. Great Bloody Marys and White Russians! Solid beer choices and always on point. This is why I go back year after year. Can you get a better steak elsewhere? Maybe....Especially if you want a ribeye or a different cut. But this is and will remain one of the best steak houses in my opinion for years to come. They just do it right! Period! So read the negatives with a grain of salt and throw it over your shoulder.

Been here a few times as a kid. I recommend the steak (of course), the bacon, and tomato w/ white onions and put the red sauce on everything! It may be important to note that I am writing this review while hungry and...someone take me there please.
Amazing! Afraid this was going to be all hype like many steakhouses in NY. Order the steak medium rare, no need for the tabletop sauce!

****review from a high quality steak lover**** I'm from Los Angeles and dine at restaurants like mastros, stk, wolfgangs, and Ruth Chris all on a regularly basis (any high end steak house, you name it and I've more than likely had it). Having said that, this is the best place by FAR. Extremely simple menu that leaves you only picking a stater and your sides. The steak is aged to perfection and is cooked perfectly with the best seasoning that will make your mouth water. It truly is the perfect steak. Staff was very attentive and the atmosphere has a very old school vibe. If your try and walk in without a reservation I think people will just start laughing at you, so plan WAY AHEAD.
The standard all steak houses emulate. Been a patron since I was a kid when my father took me there and schooled me on steak. Was hooked ever since YESSSSSSSSSS.

It is everything that one would expect from the name Peter Luger. Place was packed wall to wall. We had to wait about 45 min for a table so we had a drink at the bar. Bartender was nice and polite while being very busy. We got sat down and the waiter come up and asked if we have ever been here before. It was our first time. He told us what most ppl order and took our drinks. We had a tomato and onion salad to start. Very delicious. For main course was steak for 2 and cream spinach. Steak was good but for the name a reputation I think it should have been better. At least we weren't rushed. Â All and all a very good dining experience. Will return.
The Porterhouse for two was delicious. Very flavorful and cooked perfectly. The creamed spinach was very tasty as well. Definitely coming back for more

I'm going to give this place 5 stars because the bacon appetizer is genius! It's the best thing ever! I'd come just for the bacon appetizer. I can't believe no one else has thought about serving a slice of bacon an inch thick... it's the fattiest and most amazing thing! I'm not the biggest fan of porterhouse steak (the only kind they serve), but their porterhouse was pretty darn good as well. They also have some pretty darn good bread. Overall, this place is awesome and worth it. Reservations are a must!

It was my first time eating here so the porter house steak for two was recommended. It was cooked to perfection. I wish I could say that this was the best steak I've ever had, but it wasn't. It probably comes in second on my list. If you love bacon like I do the bacon strips are recommend. The service was great and I'd definitely come back

Unbeatable steak at a classic New York institution. Order the steak rare! Anything else would be an abomination! Pricey but worth it... The steak absolutely melts in your mouth and the German potatoes and thick cut bacon are amazing! Definitely one of the spots I love to go to for a birthday or anniversary!

If you love steak and want to eat at the best place in New York City then make your reservation. It was the absolute best! We were treated like family and the environment is incredible. The restaurant is filled with warmth and laughter which makes an unforgettable experience.

Well, I've been here several times. I really like the steak here. It's so soft and juicy (I always get the medium rare). the food has no decoration (but well, who cares :P) . The downside is that it's so hard to make a reservation for dinner (so most of the times I go there during the lunch time). Their steak is worth 5 stars. To give you an idea, my girlfriend doesn't eat beef so every time I go with her I finish the porterhouse for 2 alone (yum!).
Just booked a table for July 4th for my birthday. :) so happy to try the best steak house!!! See you soon! ^^

Love their thick-cut bacon slices, hand-whipped cream, creamed spinach, and their dry-aged steaks! The price is definitely high though, and sadly they don't accept credit cards, which were the major drawbacks for me. Luckily they have an ATM outside, although the fee for cash withdrawals is pretty high!
Expensive as hell, worth every penny! Â Peter Luger's is one of the best I've had in the US!

Steak was awesome but what is up with these waiters. Â I heard they are a bit standoffish but cmon now. Â I'm a paying customer. Â Mind you yes, steak was great...porterhouse for FOUR hit the spot. Â Think I deserve better treatment. Â This place could've been a five but service...ehhh

It really is just OK here. This is certainly not the best steak or steak house in NYC. It's very old school which is somewhat charming if your into that. But the steak was just ok and that's what I came for. I would have given three stars but the people on the phone when making reservations are incredibly rude. There are so many other really wonderful steak options in NYC like Costata and Quality Meats.

The steak choice is simple, you just order by number of people. Unlike some other steakhouse, it doesn't ask you to choose dry aged or wet aged, parts of the cow. We ordered steak for two plus an appetizer and a side dish, which is enough for four of us to share. The steak has a good combination of texture, chewy, tender, fatty, and juicy. Our waiter kindly advised us against ordering the tomato slice, which I thought was rare. If you want good steak, forget about those big names like Smith Wollensky. This is the best in town.
Great meal. Everything was so good. The porterhouse steak was the finest I have ever eaten.

This steak is REAL! I have come on numerous occasions (birthays, anniversary's). And every time that I go, I feel like it gets better and better! They give you the steak on a piping hot tray, so hot that you cook the steak on it. Their desserts are good and so is about everything they make. Food is expensive but good. Must go!

Old-school, great steaks, generous portions, legit waiters, first-class service, one of the most solid choices for dinner in this fine city. You'll want to fast before arriving. Tomato/onion, Shrimp Cocktail, Bacon (to start), followed by Steak for 2-4-6, etc, Creamed Spinach, Hash Browns. Dessert: hot fudge sundae (asked for Caramel Cone ice cream). Then a generous dollop of Schlag in your coffee. One of my favorite spots in the city, particularly for the warmth and great energy of its staff.

I really enjoyed the meal here, it wasn't Â cheap but it was worth Â it the waitstaff was very attentive and this made the whole experience worth it. I was once a waitress and I know that the staff adds to the meal and ambiance. Best grilled Salmon I've ever eaten, I also had some of the best steak I've eaten to date and I've had steak just about everywhere. Make reservations,well in advance and enjoy.

Unbelievable Steak done Soft and Perfectly Medium-Rare. Â Other places like Del Frisco seem to have firmer and more cooked steaks even though I always order it Medium-Rare, but Peter Luger's Does it Right. Â The Canadian Bacon was awesome as well.

The beef at Peter Luger is seriously and literally like none other I have ever had before in my life. Â You can tell the cow was raised the old fashioned way on corn. Â The creamed spinach was the best side followed by the German fries. The service was unlike that I have ever had at any other steak house; they serve everything from the common plate onto your individual plate. Â However, I didn't think they beef was that good. Â Maybe I just prefer the all natural, hormone free grass fed beef that is so of the moment? Â The thick cut bacon probably was the pork belly before pork belly showed up on every menu in the country. Â I am very glad I went to Peter Luger and think the experience is worthy of five stars but for what was on my plate I can only give this landmark three stars. Â Cash only.

My best friend as been going here and telling me about it for years. Its a family tradition for him dating back 30+ years, so going in there was a lot of hype to meet. We were in a party of 5, got tomatoes and shrimp to start, a triple, double, 2 spinach and 2 potatoes. The shrimp were HUGE and delicious, then the steak. Being honest, it wasnt the most flavorful steak i have ever had, BUT it melted in your mouth, was incredibility tender and you could tell it was of the highest quality. I cant wait to come back again.

Steak is awesome!!!Bacon's wonderful!!!Creamed spinach...can't find a word to describe, just go and try and then you'll have a glimpse of my feeling!!!The waiter is in my grandfather's age and he really treated us as his granddaughters!!So kind!!!Need reservation, and can do takeouts!!!

We'd the steak for two with german potatoes and spinach and I've to say that the steak is a bit better here but the potatoes as well as the spinach is much better at Wolfgang's (who formerly worked at Peter Luger's before he opened a own restaurant). Also the waiters are more professional and more friendly than at Peter Luger. At Peter Luger they behave as if you were eating in a truck stop or a cheap diner.

One of the best, if not the best, steakhouses in New York. Â No need to fool around ordering anything but the bacon for appetizers, the porterhouse for main, and the creamed spinach and potatoes for sides. Â If you still have room, feel free to order dessert but do not expect anything mind-blowing as you are not there for dessert.

The is the best steak house on the planet! Â The ambience is old school and simple. The staff were very professional and attentive without being obtrusive. The star of the show is the steak. Perfectly aged tender and nutty served with sizzling butter. Â Perfect and every bite brought a slightly different taste profile. Delicious. The sides were great as well. The bacon was flavorful and unctuous. The iceberg salad was served properly, cold with blue cheese tomatoes and bacon. Â Refreshing and satisfying. Â The bread basket was just right as well. Lastly the strudel dessert with house made whipped cream with a sturdy cup of coffee topped off a perfect meal. Rarely does something live up to expectations; Peter Luger's exceeded it. Long live the King!

The steak was great! Â The German potatoes were great! Â Was disappointed in the creamed spinach. Â The waiter was attentive Â and the service was good. If you want a quiet atmosphere you may be disappointed...it was loud. Â Overall, a good experience.

The best steakhouse in New York City and probably the world. It is a legend and Ive been a loyal patron for 15 years and counting. Porterhouse is the best i have ever had. Spinach. Home-fries. Tomatoes. And JUMBO shrimp. They have a solid beer selection and pecan pie for desert is a must. Schlag on the side. Coffee is excellent. This is the Valhalla of carnivores.

Bad Service. I called on 5/28/2014 at 2:20pm to ask about some menu questions- because I wanted to come with a group. They need to GET RID of the rude girl on the phone!! I asked about the fact that it says they only take "Peter Luger" credit cards, and I asked if they take anything else she said in a snippy voice "Clearly if it says it on the web-site then this is how it is" RUDE!! then I asked about a price for the steak for 2...she said, "(Made an "ugh" sound then said "every meal is about 85 per person- ok) Because of this rude girl, I will not be making ANY reservations for this place that cant even put a person who you can understand on the phone, and who is RUDE RUDE RUDE... what does this say about the service once I get there?? Perhaps you need to put someone who is much more friendly on the phone, so you don't deter customers before they even walk in Peter Luger.
I can never say no to a giant steak, even if it's shared with a couple of friends because of.. how giant it is. Â It's just so perfect!!! I've been coming here alot, and it never disappointed me!

Been the first time more than 15 years ago, and made a point of coming back every time that I came to NYC. Peter Luger steak is superb, restaurant is overly popular so do not expect the super-duper friendly service that you might get elsewhere in the States, but if you are in for some serious food you came to the right place!
Steak was very good. Bartenders upfront were horrible and arrogant. Our waiter was very friendly and attentive. Take the subway Â for the whole experience. Steak was very good.

Second time here. Definitely one of the best steak place in NY. Â  Â The meat is just perfectly cooked. Â Love it. Â Gave 4 stars. Bcz we made reservation at 7:45 pm but still waited 30 more mins to get seated.

Great food, I had the NY Strip and the wife had the filet sandwich. Â My steak was perfect, the wife's sandwich was not great, average at best. Â Appetizers were fantastic, wine list was great. Â Overall it was a great experience and would definitely be back.

The steak doesn't disappoint -- but the service is terrible. Â I had a mid-afternoon reservation on a weekday, definitely the quietest you'll ever find this place, so there was no reason for the complete lack of service. Â My party of 4 was seated 20 minutes after our reservation time and then sat around waiting for bread and water. Â We ordered a salad and bacon, which came out on time. Â After finishing, we sat before an empty table and waited 30 more minutes for the steak. Â After the steaks we again sat around as the dining room emptied. Â Our server was nowhere to be found and we had to ask a different server for the check. Â Decided not to waste even more time with dessert. Â Even after we asked for the check no one brought it so we went to the counter to pay. Â The service ruined what would otherwise have been a great meal.

Great service and best steak around. Can to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and the food was incredible. On top of the porterhouse for two, the dessert is also amazing. We ordered the cheesecake and it was the best around. Can't wait to go back. I see why this was my pop pops favorite restaurant.

Waited for twenty years to visit Peter Luger's. Wasn't a conscious decision to wait. There are so many great restaurants in NYC. It's in Brooklyn, rather than Manhattan. We stay in Manhattan. I just forgot about it. I have taken my three sons to NYC several times. I have not taken them. After my first visit to PL, I feel terrible they missed it. I may bring them back, just for Peter Luger's. I have seen it mentioned on the Travel Channel for twenty years as one the top steak places in the US. I am a steak connoisseur and grill a damn fine one myself. I went in with high expectations. Peter Luger's is the absolute, hands-down best steak of my life! The other best places, not even close. My wife had the Caesar salad and said it was the best she's ever had. Despite being a bit of a pain to get there, $120 in UBER charges, it is well worth the effort! I love NYC and go about once a year. I'll be back to PL on every trip!
The representive's attitude is really bad. I called for reservation. He just said nothing is available then hang off the phone. What makes ur so worse attitude in calling service at Friday night?

I was trying to make a reservation for dinner, they said that they have only one table which is at 10:45 pm. There is a conflict during that time and I asked for another day and time. They just hang up my call not even until I finish my sentence.

I've long heard about the infamous Peter Lugar, and it did not disappoint one little bit. This review will be straightforward, because that is what the experience is. You're going in to get a great piece of meat, and PL delivers. The sides are all delicious as well - baked potatoes perfectly cooked, spinach masterly wilted, wine wonderfully poured. The waiters and staff are all happy, jolly and helpful! The overall dining experience was amazing and I can't wait to return in the future.

Born and raised in Brooklyn. Took me only 54 years to go to Lugers. Bunch of us ran up a $623 bill. The porterhouse Â steak was indeed good. For $121 it should be. Sides were nothing to scream about. The huge slice of bacon was unique but pricy. Would I go again? No, I'd rather go to the butcher and get my own monster steak and save a few bucks. I'm not cheap but your paying for the name here. "Twas not worth the bother.

Look, if you are in NYC you gotta visit this place once. Its got some really great old school charm. The waiters are fantastic. And of course the steak is really good. I wouldn't go so far as calling it amazing, I've had my fair share of amazing steaks. But we got the steak for 3 that was $99. A few sides, a few beers and a few laughs. So I think its worth it. Would I take a Tinder date there? No. Would I take my cousin Danny there who has told me he will visit one day from Cali? Yeah I would because Danny likes steak.

Could be my favorite steakhouse...toss up with Prime 112. Beefsteak tomatoes and onions with Lugar sauce a must! Onion rolls, steak for 4.. doesn't get any better. Cash or Lugar card only. Make reservations.

Best steak dinner I have ever had. Bacon is a must have. Like must. I would pass on the tomato and onion platter. There's nothing to it but literally tomatoes and onion. German potatoes were delicious and of course their creamed spinach. All beverages especially wine was unreasonably overpriced. The $15 glass of wine tasted no different than my $7 bottle of Corbet Canyon merlot. Desserts: oh my gosh the cheesecake. It was the best I've ever tasted. The holy cow sundae is also a must. Apple strudel was okay. Finish off with German brandy coffee and your set! Would do it all again in a heartbeat.

So my guy had been dyin to come here and try the steak that he had heard so many rave reviews about. So i suprised him and mad reservations for us the past friday nite. Well its not much to say about ambience because there isnt any. It has wodden tables and uncomfortable chairs. It has some things on the wall and shelves but thats about it. Definitely not a place for a romantic dinner wit the honey. Any who the service was great. Our watier came over as soon as we were comfortable asked us wht we would like to drink, suggested some wines, and told us about wht was on the menu. We decided to get the 20inch thick steak which shares for two ppl. It came out sizzling hot and i must say it was a fine cut of meat. It jus didnt live up to all the hype. It had no flavor it was jus cooked meat. We had the spinach Â and the fries on the side. The spinach was supposed to share for two but the bowl was very small. It was alright. Extra mushy even. Ive had better. The fries came out fresh and hot. They were great! They have a steak sause tht they give u tht kinda taste like cocktail sauce. ..it gave the meat some flavor tho so i ate it. The watiers are funny . They crack jokes and engage with u as much as they can. We decided to have dessert since we had room because we didn't eat all of our food. We had a chocolate mouse pie with their homemade whipped cream. It was too die for!!! Other then tht this place and it s food was jus okay nothing special

This institution has a special place in my heart (not just from all of the saturated fats and cholesterol I ingested that night). This was my first experience with professionally dry-aged beef. Absolutely the best steak I have ever had in my entire life. I shared the porterhouse for 2 cooked medium with a friend. The filet mignon was the most tender slice of meat. It melts in your mouth. You don't even really need to chew and it just releases its beefy juices readily. The strip steak part is great in its own way as well. Not as tender obviously but so much flavor. They serve you free bread with your meal, which is great for using to dipping into the fat for ultra-gluttony deliciousness. You don't really need much else other than the steak, as the creamed spinach we got served just as an afterthought. We were also too full at that point anyway. Their chocolate sundae called "Holy Cow" is a great way to end the meal if you want to go the extra mile
Totally overrated. Crowded with tourists and people who believe the hype. Wolfgang's steakhouse is way better in terms of meat, service and atmosphere.
have only been for dinner. yes, the steak was the best i've ever had. yes, the waiters were d*cks. yes, it was worth it.
Thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Steak was on point and cooked perfectly. Â We had great interactions with the waiter top-notch service.

We made reservations way in advance for what turned out to be a perfect anniversary date. Good thing too because the front lobby was packed with people waiting. We had steak with bacon and creamed spinach on the side. Definitely recommend!

Was taken here by my parents to celebrate my graduation,the menu choices were great but my food came back cold,after complaining it was warmed up but I had to wait at least twenty minutes. For how pricey it is maybe the service should be better! I must say though the place is very elegant

Not sure why this place is continually hyped as the best for slabs of meat in the city. Sure, it's traditional and the waiters and service all live up to that (including the part where the waits and the service are incredibly slow for everything, from a glass of water to the bathroom). The porterhouse was dry, and the portions were so huge that we had to bring the rest home - and things rarely taste good the next day. The rack of lamb was the highlight - was pleasantly surprised. Overall a decent meal - just expected things to be a little more juicy and tender, and left with more to be desired.

For years I was put off by what I thought was waaaay too much to pay for a steak. Finally, I was invited to go along as part of a party of 10. I was pleasantly surprised! Sure its an arm and a leg to pay, but the standard porterhouse will feed several hungry mouths. And clearly its ALL about the steak, if you want lots of options for sides, an extensive wine list, a fancy presentation, or a vegetarian option, this is probably not for you. But if you want the gold standard for a USDA Prime aged steak. You need to experience this place! Oh yeah, bring cash--no credit cards accepted, other than their own.

Absolutely incredible. Took my bf here for his birthday and a few months later for my dad's. We love the old school style atmosphere and service and the staff is always friendly and professional. The steak is by far, the best we have ever had, and we always leave happy and wanting to come back again.

If you're looking for simply the best steak in town (and don't mind paying the premium), Peter Luger's is where you must go. Â Go with a group and share the steak for 2/3/4 (big porter house cut which is seared crispy on the outside, but tender and juicy in the inside).

I'm a "well done" kind of person when it comes to steaks- decided to go "medium" Â in this case since their beef is supposed to be top quality. Â Dang! I'm happy I did b/c this is the best steak I have ever had! Â Creamed spinach was great too. Â Table service was great- food came out quickly and the waiters were nice.

This is definitely a steak house you need to visit! Whether it's lunch or dinner the food is great. For lunch, if you don't want the steak, then you have the option of the burger (which is out of this world and only available during lunch). For dinner I recommend the steak for two but obviously that depends on how many people you're with, although the steak for two usually feeds 4 people. The creamed spinach is great, as if the potato pie. Dessert is also top notch. If your celebrating a birthday make sure you tell someone because you literally will have 12 guys singing happy birthday at your table with a candle in the schlog or however you spell that wonderful whipped cream they make. But for dessert def get as much as you can feasibly eat. We usually do the cheesecake, holy cow, Â apple strudel (which is magically delicious), and the chocolate mouse cake. On top of dessert they give you chocolate coins to take home as if you haven't ate enough already lol.... Nevertheless service is great, and they even have their own Peter Luger wine if your feeling adventurous!

I've eaten here about a dozen times now and I can honestly say they have the best steak in NYC. I've eaten at all the others, but Peter Lugers is still the best by a good foot. Unless someone comes up with a steak covered with truffles and gold leaf and comes with a hand job, Peter's Lugers will stay king.

The ideal treat-yourself venue. Much better to go as a group, so you can order a huge porterhouse along with tons of sides without anyone worrying about ordering too much. The bacon really is special, but don't forget the other classics like onion rings, creamed spinach, and sliced tomatoes/mozzarella. Bring cash!
Awful and rude service, and to add the staff tends to stereotype the CUSTOMER the moment they walk in.

it is a crime that lugers is only rated 4 starts. The tomato and onion are the best in NYC! The porterhouse is stupendous. Make sure you get the creamed spinach and the hash browns. But then you have to leave room for dessert - cheesecake and apple strudel. Of course you can't forget the schlag - massive order of whipped cream included with all desserts. Absolutely yummy!

I've had better, much better. Peter Luger isn't worth the hype but as a beef afficionado I had to try this steakhouse everyone raves about. If you have a favorite steak house and have been to anything nicer than Sizzler , you probably Â won't be that impressed. I wasn't , and I wouldn't return . Then again, I'm not impressed with places like smith and wollensky or Ruth's Chris either . I prefer a barbecued style steak cooked over a wood fire .
The steak was fantastic! Lugers red skin potatoes was the best side dish! The host was a bit arrogant and made us feel uncomfortable.

This is probably the best steak I have ever had. The atmosphere was ok- it seemed that there were 9 birthdays that night and the sang for every one of them. It's tough to get a reservation so plan in advance.
